name: Let's Go to Mars
description:
The game usually lasts up to 30 minutes, up to 6 players can participate, with the possibility of an additional seventh who runs the bank and takes care of reading the questions and dealing the cards.

At the start of the game, all players get 8 cards from their country, which determine how much money they get and how much they move at the start of the game. This starts in the selected rocket on the planet Earth, on the starting part of the game board, divided into 4 stages of the journey to the red planet.. Earth - Moon - International Space Station - Mars.

Each stage has an initial set of 60 quiz questions on the history of space and the history of space exploration, astronomy, chemistry and physics, and space programs, missions and vessels. The player moves the rocket around the designated fields of the stage by throwing a dedicated rocket game gadget called Lucky Star. A successful throw gives the rocket momentum and gives the player a number from 1 to 5. The player is then asked a question. If the answer is correct, the number drawn is doubled, if the answer is incorrect, it remains the same. The player then moves the rocket by the number of squares gained. Players then move their rockets around the playing surface by squirming. If they manage to land on the moon, they can buy extra tickets there for booster or rocket safety, and if they successfully land on the International Space Station, they get the option to buy a private space station. This comes in handy when competing rockets collide, because without a collision safety card or mentioned station, the rocket returns to the stage's starting point. When the rockets reach Mars, they have four landing sites available. When a rocket occupies one of these, it only needs the last minimum frc to land on Mars, which must be exactly 1. Whoever lands on Mars first wins the game!

-description from publisher

name: 怪盗カプリッチョ (Capriccio the Phantom Thief)
description:
怪盗カプリッチョ (Capriccio the Phantom Thief) is a deduction game from Japan.

A group of phantom thieves sneak into a millionaire’s mansion on a desert island. However, it turns out to be a cursed mansion!

The house layout constantly changes and, to open each door, you need to clear the child's prank-like mission! Meanwhile, a thief must not forget to steal at all times! Get out of the mansion and escape the island by boat while stealing jewels from the resident's room! What? Before you know, the resident is dead!

It's utterly insane to be on the boat with the murderer! So it's time to vote on who took the advantage of the confusion and killed the resident, and get that person off the boat!
description by publisher

name: SPYSPIN
description:
スパイスピン (SPYSPIN) is a two player game from Japan. The Cold War has begun, and Eastern and Western spies roam the city, trying to outwit and capture each other.

The players have four spies, with each tile showing an innocuous, innocent side and a revealed spy side. The tiles each have different patterns of movement, and these are also varied on the flipside. So the fashion shopper Karin moves 2 places left or right, but flips to spy Karin to move 2 places up or down. Likewise, other spies move orthogonally and then diagonally, and so on. An icon in the corner shows the flipside movement.

Players start by deploying their spies on the 5x5 board, and then take turns moving a spy, which must be flipped after moving. The first player to catch all the opponents spies is the winner.

The game is packaged in a DVD case.
user summary

The publisher says:
・Competitive puzzles with different movements between front and back sides
・A battle between spies who can read each other's targets until the end.
・Children can play with it, and adults can worry about it too. A brain game that the whole family can play

・表と裏で動きが変わる対戦パズル
・先の先まで狙いを読み合うスパイたちの戦い
・子供も遊べて大人も悩む。家族で遊べる頭脳戦
description by publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Square Grid, Static Capture, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: 【閲覧注意】実録！ほんとにあった呪いの神経衰弱【最恐ホラー】 (【Eturanntyuui】Zituroku！Hontoniatta noroino sinnkeisuizyaku【Saikyouhora】)
description:
【閲覧注意】実録！ほんとにあった呪いの神経衰弱【最恐ホラー】 (【Eturanntyuui】Zituroku！Hontoniatta noroino sinnkeisuizyaku【Saikyouhora】) ([Warning] True Story! A Cursed Memory Game That Really Happened [Scariest Horror]!) is a disturbingly dark horror themed memo game from Japan.

In this game, players are turning cards and looking for matching images. If they find a matching image, they take the pair of cards out of the game. But if they find an unmatched pair, they draw a new card, look at it in secret, and place it face down with the rest.

However, there are two cards showing a weeping doll which is cursed. If a player turns up the cursed doll, all the players must immediately use their protective talisman, a votive prayer sheet, by slamming it down on the doll. The last player to do this receives a candle, meaning they are one step closer to death. If another player is then too slow, the candle moves on. But if the player with the candle fails a second time, they are killed by the curse and eliminated from the game. There is a terrible demon card too, which immediately kills the player with the candle.

All the cards depict very disturbing photographs of normal locations such as a bathroom or a cable car, but showing ghosts in the mirror, or shadowy figures, or bloody handprints. Further, some cards carry penalty instructions, such as requiring the player to cover one eye, making it harder for them to react when the cursed doll appears.

The last player to survive the increasing horror is the winner.

The game is produced in a DVD case.
user summary

The publisher says:
・Nervous breakdown due to ghost photos
・My hands can't move due to a curse! ? A board game of fear and laughter
・From children to adults. Simple rules for playing with your family

・心霊写真で神経衰弱
・呪いで手が動かない！？恐怖と笑いのボードゲーム
・子供から大人まで。家族で遊べる簡単ルール
description by publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Horror, Humor, Memory, Religious
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Speed Matching, Sudden Death Ending

name: Famous Dead Dudes Vol 2
description:
Object of the Game: To win the most cards to add to your collection. Each player should play the game on his own (One, Two, etc).
Preparation: Players should shuffle their cards and then stack them in a pile in front of them with the faces upward.
Each player then gets two card stands and must place the two top cards of his deck into the card stands with the printed side facing him.
Play: Any player can now challenge any other player by moving one of his two cards toward the player he wishes to challenge. The person challenged must respond by moving one of his two cards toward the attacking card. The winner of each challenge picks up the two cards just played, and puts them on the bottom of his pile. Each player then puts a new card from his pile into the empty card holder and resumes play.
Winning: The winner of each challenge is determined by colors as follows:

Cards printed in red (Authors) beat green (Artists)
Cards printed in green (Artists) beat blue (Ambizmags)
Cards printed in blue (Ambizmags) beat red (Authors)
Cards printed in orange (Supers) beat red, green or blue
The card printed in purple beats any other color
In case of a tie, the highest numbered card wins


Ending: The game ends when all players agree to quit.
Keeping cards: Winners get to keep the cards they win.

name: Dragon's Pride: Ambition Against Korea, 645
description:
Historical Background
In 618, the Tang Dynasty unified China, which had been in turmoil following the fall of the Sui Dynasty. Unlike the Sui Dynasty, they maintained peace with neighboring states. However, one of the emperor's sons, the ambitious Li Shimin, despite his role in unifying China under the Tang Dynasty, when his father refused to name him heir to the throne, he staged a coup d'état, killing his two brothers at the "Xuanwu Gate" and removing his father from the throne. Upon his ascension to the throne, he invaded neighboring states and destroyed the mighty nomadic empire, the Eastern Turkic Khaganate, and grown to become the sole hegemon of East Asia.

Meanwhile, with a new king on the throne, Goguryeo wanted to maintain good relations with the Tang dynasty and heal the wounds from the past war with the Sui dynasty. However, some nobles found this very humiliating. They thought that Goguryeo, which had defeated the Sui Dynasty's one million soldiers in the past, was now abandoning its pride and begging the Tang Dynasty for peace. In the end, the king tried to assassinate Yeon Gaesomun, who was at the center of it all, but Yeon Gaesomun found out and staged a coup, purging the old king and all the dissident nobles and installing a new king.

Li Shimin wanted to invade all the neighboring regional powers and bring them under his feet. After the fall of the Eastern Turkic Khaganate, the last one left was Goguryeo to the east. Eventually, in 645, despite the opposition of almost all his subjects, Li Shimin went to war, and 570,000 Tang soldiers launched a massive invasion of Goguryeo.

Whether this is the pride of a "Dragon" only history knows.

Game Description
Dragon's Pride: Ambition Against Korea, 645 is a 2-4 player historical-war strategy game that aims to be deep but not difficult. Players can choose between the Goguryeo and Tang Dynasty factions. The Goguryeo faction consists of Yeon Gaesomun, who came to power in a coup, and his opponent, Castellan of Ansi, who won the most important battle of this war. The Tang faction consists of Li Shizi, a central figure in the military who actively supported the war, and Zhang Liang, a central figure in the civil service who opposed the war, who led the naval forces and was responsible for key supplies. Li Shimin can be used in common by the Tang faction.

The game has three distinctive features

It's a team game, but you'll need to solve unique objectives hidden from the other players to score victory points. Depending on those objectives, your teammate won't necessarily cooperate with you. Always watch out your teammate.
Instead of just focusing on combat, the game focuses on operations, such as the morale and supply of your army, which makes for a unique experience. In particular, the Tang Dynasty will be under pressure to supply their 570,000 men at every turn, and this can only be solved by fast-paced battles and looting. Goguryeo must defend his castle to the end, but sometimes the need for a great field victory can lead to a dilemma of choice.
The historical theme is reflected throughout the game, implementing the various strategies employed by the Goguryeo and Tang dynasties. It also features unique illustrations that have never been seen before.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Negotiation, Order Counters, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: British Tank Ace 1940-1945
description:
British Tank Ace: 1940-45 is a solitaire, tactical-level game by Gregory M. Smith that places you in command of a British tank during World War II in North Africa, Italy, and the European Theaters of Operation. You will make the tactical decisions a tank commander faces and control the actions of your crew while trying to survive.

You will be assigned missions to attack, defend, or conduct movement-to-contact, depending on the current tactical situation. As time progresses and players survive, they may use the experience gained to improve their odds of success by purchasing skills. As their prestige increases, they may request improved versions of tanks when they suffer the loss of their previous tank. Awards and promotions help to narrate the player’s eventual goal – to survive the war and help defeat Fascist Italy and Nazi Germany.

Players will find it challenging to survive an entire tour from June 1940 to April 1945, although shorter games may be played involving just one theater of operations. You will start with one of the tank models available to the British Army at the start of the game, but as your fame and prestige rise, more advanced tanks will be available to choose from.

Game play moves quickly. Once you have your initial tank and commander, play proceeds by rolling for a mission and then conducting it. Enemy forces range from Penal units to SS or Fallschirmjäeger, all randomly generated, ensuring no two careers will ever be the same. Combat is swift and sometimes deadly, as many of the Axis tanks, SPGs, and AT guns can destroy your tank. Terrain and weather also have an impact on operations, as well as smoke. Players must pay attention to hull down status, the orientation of their hull and turret, and decide when it is prudent to “button up.” Artillery and mortar fire can sometimes support either side, and random events will add to the uncertainty of combat. Due to its streamlined play, a single mission can be completed in as little as 10 minutes.

When a mission is completed, assuming you have survived, you will ascertain if any awards have been earned or experience points gained. Promotion is also possible, which has the advantage of allowing for artillery and mortar support. You may also upgrade your tank if you have sufficient Prestige to get a better model; otherwise, you continue to fight in your starting tank until it is knocked out.

While British Tank Ace is designed as a solitaire gaming experience, additional options for play are provided for both multi-player cooperative and competitive gaming sessions.

Product Information:
Complexity: 4 out of 10 (Low/Moderate)
Playing time: 10-15 minutes (single mission), 4-5 hours (full career)
Solitaire Suitability: High; Designed for solitaire play
Players: One or more
Map Scale: Abstract
Time Scale: Semi-abstract (individual missions, 8 missions per month)
Unit Scale: Individual tanks, crewmen, enemy vehicles, anti-tank guns, and ammo

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Spanish-American War, 1898
description:
Spanish-American War, 1898 is a two-player game of the Spanish-American War of 1898 by Vance von Borries. It recreates the strategic naval and land campaign against Spanish forces in Cuba and Puerto Rico. One player controls the American and Cuban units, while the other controls the Spanish ones. The game is played in game turns, consisting of alternating player turns in which each player moves his pieces and resolves any resulting combat. When all the game turns have been completed, the game is over, and the winner is determined.

The game is divided into separate but closely related land and sea systems. A campaign game combines both of these into one strategic game. The introductory scenarios should be played before attempting the full Campaign Game. Some specially marked land and sea rules apply only to the Campaign Game. You can ignore them when you play introductory scenarios. The Campaign Game uses all the rules. Using separate land and sea commanders, up to four players can play the Campaign Game.

Product Information:

Complexity: Medium
Playing time: 3 to 6 hours
Solitaire Suitability: Medium
Players: Two to Four (suitable for solitaire play)
Map Scale: variable (for both areas and hexes based on map)
Time Scale: 1 Turn = 20 Minutes
Unit Scale: 1 Unit = 1 ship or battalion/regiment

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Typoquiz
description:
A card game quiz for "creative" people.
Answer questions about formatting, fonts, designers and more. For each question 4 possible answers are printed on the front, on the back the correct answer is written with a description.

name: Coloma: Deluxe Upgrade Pack
description:
Coloma: Deluxe Upgrade Pack includes all of the Coloma Deluxe Edition content not found in the retail edition.

This GameFound exclusive contains:


40 Poker Chips
30 custom Gold Nuggets
6 custom Score Markers
1 custom Round Marker
1 Metal First Player Marker
6 new Characters, each with a unique ability not found on characters from the base game, including:


Robber - You may spend 1 Wagon action (forgoing its usual movement Ability) to gain 3 Gold Nuggets from the Gold Cart (not the Gold Supply on the board!).

Homesteader - You may spend 1 Tent to build a Town Building card from your hand, paying the Saw cost on the card.

Renegade - Each time you add a Dude to your Graveyard, draw 3 cards.

Range Rider - Each time your Wagon moves over (or stops on) a vacant Horseshoe space on the Frontier Map, draw 1 card.

Maverick - Discard 1 card to gain either 1 Buck or 1 Dude.

Vigilante - Discard 1 used Barrel to place Dudes according to the usual rules.

[The custom components in the deluxe edition replace the standard components from the retail edition.]
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Rondel, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Take The Tower
description:
AWESOME STRATEGIC FUN FOR YOUR NEXT GAME NIGHT WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY. Get your competitive juices flowing with this super addictive game of planning your moves and obstructing your opponents'

LIMITLESS PATHS TO VICTORY AND WAYS TO RUIN YOUR OPPONENTS’ DAY. Place marbles 1 at a time on any level, try and get 4 in a row. Rotate a board if your foe is close to winning to change their strategy

HOURS OF CLASSIC FUN FOR UP TO 4 PLAYERS. Designed for anyone 6 or older with stacking, rotating playing surfaces. Be 1st to get 1 marble on each of 4 levels to line up in a straight or diagonal line

QUICK AND EASY SET UP AND CLEAN UP. Simply stack the boards together to play, then disassemble and pack back in the box when you’re done. Neatly stores away on shelves or storage bins
The game starts with the throw of a dice, the highest number starts and then the players take it in turns, clockwise from the player’s right.

Place beads/marble on any platform one at a time, one player at a time, in turn.
To Win Match (line up) 4 beads/marbles of the same color in a consecutive line either Across, Diagonal, Horizontal, or Vertical, but remembering the 3D nature of ROTATE it is easy to overlook a winning position.
Each player starts with 4 lives, (optional: - extra larger live marbles can be included in the game for each player matching the color of their beads/marbles) this can be recorded on the same paper as the outcome of each leg.

The lives can be used one at a time, at any time during the game to ROTATE any of the three platforms Second, Third, or Top platform to stop your opponent from winning, but not to put the players who ROTATE into a winning position, this is important as it will stop stalemates, the players who ROTATE then miss a turn.
The ROTATE can happen up to 4 times depending upon the number of lives left.


The game is played over an agreed amount of legs, 3, 7, 9, or 11 but an odd number either way, with each game lasting between 5 and 15 minutes.
The overall winner is the person who wins the most legs.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Enclosure, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Take That, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Point: 203
description:
This is a Japanese doujin game (fan-made) that was only available from Game shows in Japan, such as Tokyo Game Market. To get one you ordered in advance and reserved a copy, and then picked it up at the show.

Point: 203 is a game about the Russo-Japanese War 1904-05 and takes place near Port Arthur.

The game is about taking the heights of point 203. If the Japanese do this, they win the game, if not, the Russians win.

This game is a predecessor to the Houten 1905 game.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Realm of Eclipse
description:
Eliminate all enemies or capture the sacred stone to lead my chosen race to victory.

Choose the race to lead to victory.

Build your deck with a variety of hero units, regular units, and special skill cards from the chosen race.

Proceed with your turns in accordance with the 4 phases (Unifact, Flip, Control, Attack) and engage in battles to emerge victorious in the war!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Set-up

name: Rock-A-Spool
description:
This is a two person game that involves lifting a rocker arm up and down. As you do that you a spool will roll along the curved arm back and forth. The curved arm acts like a track for the spool to ride on. You and your opponent are working to make the spool land on the center support which is called the goal.

It is very much like the carnival game where you roll a ball to stop perfectly in the grooved section of the rail. The Spool has to exit the rocker arm at the perfect speed and position to land on the goal

Scoring: One point is given to the player that gets his spool to land on the goal. Once the spool lands on the goal, each player starts over and play continues until you reach 21 points

—user summary

name: Side Story 1: Twilight of the Free Planets Alliance – Operation Ragnarök
description:
This is a Japanese doujin (fan made) game that was made for sale at Japanese game shows, such as Tokyo Game Market. To get one, you had to order in advance and then pick up your copy at the show. It was not made for the general public.

War of the Galactic Empire - Imperial Conflict (Lippstadt) and Alliance Invasion is a game based on the anime Legends of the Galactic Heroes, which deals with two sides: the Empire and the Free Planets Alliance. Both sides have been fighting a war for over 150 years. In this game, Lord Reinhard takes on the Goldenbaum Monarchy, leading to a civil war within the Empire. While this is going on the Alliance takes advantage of the situation tom launch an invasion of Empire Territory.

The game has a eight-part map, two sheets of counters, One fleet organization sheet, One player aid, and rules. Assembly is required.

The game is based on the Kenshin Joraku rules from Game Journal no.46. They have been adapted and modified to simulate the nature of this space odyssey.

A second part to this game called Twilight of the Free Planets Alliance: Operation Ragnarök is also available. It adds the Alliance portion of the galaxy and two scenarios. The first scenario is the Empire Civil War (Lippstadt) and the second is the Alliance's invasion of the Empire.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Twilight of the Free Planet's Alliance: Operation Ragnarok
description:
This is a Japanese doujin (fan made) game that was made for sale at Japanese game shows, such as Tokyo Game Market. To get one, you had to order in advance and then pick up your copy at the show. It was not made for the general public.

Twilight of the Free Planet's Alliance is a game based on the anime Legends of the Galactic Heroes, which deals with two sides: the Empire and the Free Planets Alliance. Both sides have been fighting a war for over 150 years. In this game, Lord Reinhard invaded Alliance territory. In the anime, this leads to the destruction of the Alliance. This campaign is known as Operation Ragnarök.

The game has a very large six-part map that will fill any dining table, two sheets of counters, two fleet organization sheets, two player aids, and rules. Assembly is required.

The game is based on the Kenshin Joraku rules from Game Journal no.46. They have been adapted and modified to simulate the nature of this space odyssey.

A second part to this game, called War of the Galactic Empire - Imperial Conflict (Lippstadt) and Alliance Invasion, is also available. It adds the Empire portion of the galaxy and scenarios for the Empire's civil war and the invasion of its territory by the Free Planet's Alliance.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Sicilia 1943: Operation Husky
description:
Even before the surrender of the last Axis troops in Tunisia, the Allied governments had reached the controversial decision to invade Sicily as the next phase, to take the first step on the continent.

The amphibious invasion of Sicily, code-named “Operation Husky,” with a force of 3,000 ships, more than 3,000 aircraft, and 100,000 men landing on the first day was the largest amphibious operation of World War II. After 38 days of hard fighting, the Allied forces, composed of the 7th US Army and the 8th British Army, entered Messina, completing the conquest of the island.

Sicilia 1943 – Operation Husky reconstructs this important campaign, on a large map (… to maintain the right amount of simplicity and effectiveness. Game turns represent one day.

The system involves a very intense interaction between players, and is based on the uncertain moment of activation of their Formations, and on the type of operations they will be able to carry out following the directives received at the beginning of the turn.

The rugged terrain of much of Sicily affects operations throughout the game, from the logistical importance of the road network to the possibility of using armored vehicles, lethal in open terrain, but vulnerable on narrow mountain roads.

Air forces (of both sides) and naval forces (Allied only) can be very important... if activated at the right time.

The game includes two challenging campaign games, one historical and one hypothetical, and numerous minor scenarios that concern some individual phases of the campaign, such as landings and counterattacks, the battles of Primosole and Troina, and others.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Relay Blitz
description: Relay Blitz is a fast-paced 2-6 player track themed board game. Players navigate around a track through double dice rolling, using items, and the special baton abilities to take down opponents. You win by being the first player to get your relay of 4 runners around the track before any other player.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Sum It All Up
description:
Sum It All Up is a strategic yet simple mathematical game. The game is about collecting tiles that add up to a target number. In the default game, the target sum is ten. When dice are used, the target sum varies between 2-12.

COMPONENTS:

lasercut game board
49 two-sided tiles
pair of dice.


GOAL:
Collect the most points or tiles.

SETUP:

Randomly layout 49 tiles, your choice whether to use numbers or die faces.
Decide whether the winner will have the most points or the most tiles.


GAME MODES:

Tens: collect number that add up to 10.
Dice: collect numbers that add up to the dice roll.
Solo: try to get rid of all tiles in “Tens” mode.


‘TENS’ GAME PLAY:
On each turn, a player has 30 seconds to do the following:

Find two or more numbers that add up to 10.
Call out the tiles.
Collect the tiles.


‘DICE’ GAME PLAY:
On each turn, a player has 30 seconds to do the following:

Roll both dice.
Find two or more numbers that add up to the total of the dice roll.
Call out the tiles.
Collect the tiles.


ENDING THE GAME:
Keep playing until no one can collect any more tiles.

WINNING THE GAME:
The winner will have either the most tiles or most points.

COLLECTING NUMBERS:
To collect numbers, the tiles must be aligned in one of the following ways:

Adjacent: all collected tiles are touching in any direction.
Line of Sight: in a straight line ignoring empty space.

—description from the publisher

name: Ylandyss: Verkami promotional cards
description:
Pack of promotional cards given to those who participated in the Verkami crowdfunding. Includes the following 3 cards:

Issha, Pontífice
Thrissa, urdidora de planes
Jarvis, el cazador

name: Brandy Land: The Old Fashioned Game
description:
It's time for an Old Fashioned adventure! Muddle your way through Miltown and cool off in the Ice Cube Tundra. Beware of Hodags in the Swizzle Stick Forest and try to avoid a Wisconsin Goodbye as you end your inebriated expedition.

As you move down the game board, you will draw cards with various effects including the chance to trigger a classic dice drinking game such as Pig, Liar's Dice, Ship-Captain-Crew and 7-14-21. The first to the finish line (or last one standing) wins!

Perfect at the cabin, in the supper club, or anywhere you find yourself drinking Wisconsin's classic cocktail.

name: Four Horsemen: The Norse Expansion
description: The Norse heroes join the battle against the Apocalypse using powerful runes and permanent artifacts. The Norse expansion adds rules for archdemons, a 5-6 player mode, new events, and 4 brand new villains.

name: Four Horsemen: The Chinese Expansion
description: Four Horsemen: The Chinese Expansion builds on the core game with Chinese heroes, events, and relics. The Chinese heroes operate differently depending on whether Yin or Yang is in effect. The demonic horde also grows in power with the Four Perils and Vortexes, dangerous rifts in space that destroy followers who get too close.

name: Four Horsemen: The Egyptian Expansion
description: Four Horsemen: The Egyptian Expansion builds on the core game and adds heroes and villains from the Egyptian pantheon. The Egyptian expansion also adds wonders, powerful buildings that can be harnessed for additional divine benefits. Build the Colossus of Rhodes to kill demons. Construct the Hanging Gardens to manipulate the horsemen. The demons also get stronger with new demonic gates that spawn new minions each hour.

name: Word War One
description:
For the alphabet's great architects of cunning stratagems, Word War One is a card game that challenges players to use their vocabulary and strategic thinking to outplay opponents.

Each participant combines letter cards to form words and uses them as offensive or defensive moves on a quest to deplete their opponent's health points. Special cards introduce game-changing twists, ensuring no two battles are the same. Victory is achieved by being the last one standing, using all cards, or constructing a predetermined Boss Word.

Word War One is much more than making fancy words and all about making clever use of letters and timing to deliver devastating blows. Articulation and management of cards together with the unpredictability brought by the Special Cards guarantee no game is the same and keep you playing over and over. 

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Multi-Use Cards

name: Pest Friends: An Educational Pest Management Game
description:
Pest Friends is an educational strategy board game designed to help youth and adults understand the principles of Integrated Pest Management (IPM), an ecosystem-based approach for managing pests and the damage they cause within economic thresholds. The game is designed to allow players to explore the different facets of IPM and how they affect a crop and species living within it. This is done through a facilitator-led simulation where players make decisions that ultimately lead to a unique outcome based on their choices.
The facilitator carries out the effects of a player’s action within its scenario while players make decisions as pest managers contending with pests in an agricultural field or similar setting. Their role as managers is to keep pests in check and minimize the amount of damage done to a crop while using their time and money efficiently.
Each game consists of eight rounds. At the end of a game, players tally points based on their crop yield and the amount of money they have collected/earned. The game can be played with multiple scenarios, but this set only comes with Scenario 1: Lunar Wheat.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Монополія Знамениті місця Києва (Monopoly: Kyiv Famous Places)
description:
Monopoly Kyiv Famous Places is an exciting game that allows players to get to know different sights of Kyiv and develop their financial management skills. This game is suitable for both adults and children and can be a great way to spend time with family and friends. If you like games that combine strategy, luck and fun, then Monopoly Kyiv Famous Places is perfect for you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Rozum, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Havocville
description:
When gods play the game of life, humans pay the price.

The fate of the humans is already decided, but as gods you can still push them to do things that are benefitial for you, and not necessarily to themselves.

Havocville is a board game for 2 to 5 players where players, the gods, compete to shape the city and its people by controlling when and who does what. Strategic and fun, the game has several mechanics, like tableau building, hand management, action selection and even a bit of betting against the odds.
Each god tries to favor certain factions and aspects of Havocville during 3 Eras and win points if they are successful at the end of each Era. Still, who can definitely say what gods are doing? Perhaps the gods have a plan after all.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Japanese Infantry Regiment Commander
description:
This is a solitaire game.

You take on the role of captain of Japanese Regiment 236 (fictitious) and guide it through 10 scenarios.

The game is played with 60 terrain cards which are arranged in five rows of five cards each. You must guide your battalions through the perils that await you.

One additional feature is the satisfaction of your troops, morale plays an important part in how your troops function. Be a good commander and the troops will follow and act dutifully, if not, then there will be problems. Therefore, rotation of your troops is also important.

Comes with 60 cards, 110 counters, 2 dice and rules.

—user summary
mechanics: Pieces as Map, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Temple Punks
description:
Temple Punks is a solitaire roleplaying roll & write game.

At around 20-30 minutes of gameplay, Temple Punks aims to create an enticing solitaire experience with multiple possible gameplays with its character creation system offering a wide variety of abilities and play style.

Gameplay
You roll 4 dice, 2 white and 2 black and place these dice on action spaces between two boards that will trigger movements, spells, attacks and resource gathering. The black dice, though, when placed on the map board will trigger monsters moving in the ruins, which you will need to dodge until you have the necessary gathered resources to kill them.
It is a game about controlling when you trigger certain events by choosing the right special actions you have chosen while creating your character.

Winning the game
You win Temple Punks by successfully delivering a number of artifacts decided at the beginning of the game and killing two monsters of the right type, also decided at the beginning of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Shake Your Stories
description:
Listen to the sounds and travel with your imagination to create fantastic stories!

SHAKE THE SHAKER to hear a sound
Start CREATING a story starting from that sound
SHAKE AGAIN or PASS the shaker to another player to continue with the story.


Play with your friends for an evening of wacky stories or with your family, you will help the little ones develop their imagination thanks to the magic of sounds. Also playable by blind people.
More than 150 sounds available.

name: Stars of Akarios: Battles of Akarios
description: Battles of Akarios is an expansion for Stars of Akarios, introducing one-off space combat gameplay scenarios. Battles introduces the “Battle-Book” - an all new large-format scenario book to get you into the action quickly, and new streamlined rules to make space combat even more fast-paced.

name: Kuru Dynasty
description:
Kuru Dynasty is an immersive board game that transports players into the epic world of the Mahabharata and the legendary Kurukshetra war. In this strategic tabletop experience, players step into the shoes of the iconic Kaurava and Pandava armies, each vying for supremacy in the battle that shaped the destiny of a kingdom.

As you embark on this epic journey, you'll be faced with the pivotal decision of choosing a Hero, your faction's Leader, who wields unique abilities and commands an army of devoted allies. The game features asymmetric powers, ensuring that no two factions play the same way, and an asymmetrical starting deck that reflects the distinctive strengths and weaknesses of each side.

The heart of "Kuru Dynasty" lies in its combination of engaging game mechanisms. With card deck building, you'll craft and tailor your strategy as you gather and enhance your army's capabilities. The game also incorporates elements of area control, requiring players to plan and execute their tactics with precision to dominate key regions of the battlefield.

In this ever-evolving war-torn world, market manipulation adds a layer of intrigue and strategy as players can trade resources and cards to their forces or undermine their opponents. Engage in fierce combat, deploying your armies and unleashing powerful Hero abilities to secure your faction's place in history.

The ultimate goal is to lead your faction to victory by reducing the survivability of your rivals to zero. As you navigate the complex web of alliances, betrayals, and fierce battles that defined the Kurukshetra war, "Kuru Dynasty" immerses you in a world of strategy and legend, offering a unique and thrilling gaming experience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Market, Movement Points, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Courageous
description:
Courageous is a co-operative card game, where you and your fellow players are an alliance of Heroes who must protect the Realm from Monsters that roam the lands.

Players battle one Monster at a time, taking turns attacking it until it is vanquished. Each Monster has eight openings which the Heroes use to make their Attacks. Attacks are made by spending Courage Tokens and playing a set of cards from their hands that defeat a revealed value on Monster Tokens.

Heroes have special abilities that aid them in the Battle, whether it is enhancing Attacks, sharing cards with other Heroes, keeping Courage up, or helping other Heroes with their actions.

Time runs out when all Monster Tokens have been used and the Heroes must Retreat, (only to fight this Monster again in the Nemesis round). The Heroes then move on to the next Monster. If they must Retreat a second time, the Heroes lose, the Realm is lost and the game ends.

When Heroes have vanquished the four Monsters, including the Nemesis Monster (if there was one), the Heroes are Victorious and have saved the Realm, and the game is won!

name: Star Wars
description:
This licensed magnetic game is disguised as a cassette.

It has 2 game modes:

- game 1 (a new hope): 2 players. 7x4 lineal board with normal squares and explosions. The integrated roulette generates 1-6 results. The player who spins the highest number starts. Each player spins the roulette and advances the number of squares indicated in the result. When a player falls in an explosion marked square, the other player advances his victory bar 1 point. The first player who scores 10 points, wins.

- game 2 (the empire strikes back): 1 player. 9 squares lineal tug-of-war board. The player choses a red or blue pawn and place it in the start (S) in the middle of the board (with 4 squares at each side). The player spins the integrated roulette which generates random Vader (red) or R2 (blue) icons. If the result is of the same color of the player’s pawn, it advances one square, else it retrocedes one. When the player reach the final square, wins. If the player goes back to the opposite square, loses.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Tug of War

name: Mount Everest
description:
The aim of the game is to be the first to climb Mount Everest by rolling the dice and then dare to descend again. The fastest climber win.

Simple dice game packed in a cube

name: Sebastian Fitzek Killercruise: Das Würfelspiel – Die Meisterschaft
description:
Tired of hunting the psychopath together?
Play against each other in this competitive version.

Each player gets a different Plan and the player who finds the psychopath first is the winner.

The promo-expansion contains 4 plans (E - H) and was given away by moses at Spiel 2023.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based

name: Uri, Schwyz und Untergang: das DRS 3-Duell der Kantone
description: The DRS 3 cult game as a party game. Two teams compete against each other - each with a real Swiss wooden cow. Which team will succeed in driving the opposing cow to its doom with knowledge, skill, wit and luck? The entertaining and informative DRS 3 Duel of the Cantons is all about the 26 cantons, Switzerland and the people who live here.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Claimgames
description:
The goal is to grow your logical brain and have fun.

This is how it goes:
Build a world with segments, fill your ships with fuel and cargo, discover and visit all tradeposts, figure out the most clever routing. Exchanging cargo at a tradepost allows you to place a claim. The winner is the one who has claimed all tradeposts first.

Claimgames is a versatile logistic game, that allows you to invent new versions with newly arranged boards and changed rules. Up to now we ourselves have created more than 20 games, that you can find at our website www.claim.games

The base game is for two players and contains 5 ready to play games. The first extension has material for up to 4 players and 4 extra games. The last extension contains even more material for creativity and offers another 12 games with up to 24 segments.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Market, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Race

name: Iron Coffins
description:
Iron Coffins is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the German Kriegsmarine U-boat war against Allied shipping in the North Atlantic during World War II.

As the captain of a Type VII U-boat during 1940-1943, your ultimate goal is to locate and sink as many enemy Allied ships as possible, while at the same time bringing your U-boat and crew safely back to base after each patrol.
It won’t be easy due to persistent enemy aircraft and escorts continuously hunting your U-boat, but the German people are depending on you.
Don’t let the Fatherland down!

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization.
And with water depth rules, compressed air rules, oxygen rules, numerous crew skills, weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, Iron Coffins offers memorable experiences and high replay value.
Are you ready to serve the Fatherland and defend Germany against the onslaught of Allied shipping?

-Description from the publisher

name: The Nurts: Parenting Made Fun
description:
The Nurts: Parenting Made Fun game allows you to play and adopt different strategies based on your child's personality and what life throws at you!

Strive to raise the most fulfilled child by playing more actions of what they are good at while managing your time and cash. Play as many Actions and acquire as many Assets as your remaining resources allow. Each round, a Wild Card is drawn and rules apply to every player. This process continues until there are no more Wild Cards left in the game. The player with the most points wins the game.

This box will pack a punch! A highly strategic and fun game, where you raise the most fulfilled child and compete to out-parent each other! Suitable for adults of all ages. 90% of parenting is figuring things out. There was no playbook for this kind of thing before we came along – but we’re creating one.

name: Knock Knock! Yo Gabba Gabba!
description:
KNOCK KNOCK! Hello friends!
Let’s play and learn with our favourite characters in Knock Knock! Yo Gabba Gabba! - a colourful card game with 8 ways to play. Created for babies (yes, babies!), toddlers and up!

Knock on the door and see who's there, learn words, match cards and make sets (music, art, nature and sport) to develop language, observation, memory and more!
Illustrated by Parker Jacobs of Yo Gabba Gabba! fame. Playing games and having fun with family and friends is awesome!

Knock Knock! Yo Gabba Gabba! is part of the Small Fries Games range designed to grow with your family. The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

8 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players aged 0 to 4+. (6 are co-operative, 2 competitive.) The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made from FSC card in the UK. (Single use plastic free and Carbon Balanced with the World Land Trust.)

—description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Music
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Attack on Titan UVS
description: Attack on Titan UVS is a collectible card game using the UniVersus CCG game system that will let you bring the manga masterpiece to your tabletop with both original and reimagined artwork from the Attack on Titan manga.

name: Heartless!
description:
Heartless! is a solitare dungeon crawler featuring dark themes and difficult luck based gameplay.
The game is played with 4D6 and a deck of 54 playing cards. Heavily inspired by "Scoundrel" and other dungeon crawling solitare playing card games developed over the years.

In Heartless! you see your Character, a face card from the deck, face off against enemy after enemy in high risk, luck based dice combat. Using your regular dice pool of 3 dice, or 4 dice if you are fortunate enough to find a Weapon, represented by the diamond suit cards of the deck. This additonal die added to your pool is called the Slayer Die and is vital to finding sucess in this game. Companions you find strewn through the dungeon, non diamond/heart suit 2 and 3 cards, can also help you earn your way to the Slayer Die in combination with having a weapon.
Often times you will find your Character placed in a situation they are unlikely to win (like when they are paired against the almighty boss monsters of this realm, the Ace Foe cards!) And in cases like this your Character can Flee, taking only a Flesh Wound in the process! Or you can just Trip one of your companions you've gathered along the way to suffer the enemy's wrath instead (how cruel, utterly Heartless!)

Heartless! has a unique damage system surrounding the Hearts suit cards, specifically the Ace of Hearts. Shuffle up the hearts cards and put the 10 of Hearts on top. This is your LifePool. The most important card of the Health deck, the Ace of Hearts aka Your Beating Heart, is shuffled somewhere in that lifepool deck. When you take damage from enemies you simply take cards off the top of the Lifepool until you have a lesser value of health than when you started with. That means you could possibly go from being completely healthy to being right down to your Beating Heart in a single hit!When you die, you are Heartless!
Finally, this game makes use of Lord cards, the Jokers in the deck. These entities can heal you, give you the most powerful weapon in the game, the mythic Lord Sword, and even revive you after death! Forever maintain caution, traveler, for these deities are known to thirst for blood.

Slice, dice. Human Sacrifice!
Can you traverse the twisted depths with your Beating Heart in tact?
May the Lords be with you.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dogville
description:
Work... like a dog! Dogville is a tableau-building worker placement game with over 50 unique purebreds and mutts – each with custom, breed-specific traits. Dogs thrive on responsibility, so adopt the ideal pack and match each dog’s traits to activities and authentic dog careers that make their tails wag. Their Joy (VP) will be your key to victory!

Make Fetch Happen! The game is played over 3 Stretches, each consisting of 3 Rounds and followed by a Road Trip. Each Round
consists of 3 Phases. The main Phase consists of Players taking turns taking 1 Action at a time: Adopt (up to 4 dogs), Play, or Pass.

Once all players pass, the Round ends. After 3 Rounds is a Road Trip, and the game ends at the end of the third Road Trip.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Command Cards, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hidden Victory Points, Lose a Turn, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Resource Queue, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: YOUHUE
description:
YOUHUE is a multiplayer casual card game in which the Goal is to score the most points by mixing basic color cards to create a HUE.
Each player is dealt 5 cards, and players take turns drawing and playing or discarding cards.
If a player has all the base color cards in his hand that match the base color required by a HUE card, can play those cards to make a HUE.
If not, must discard one card from his hand and his turn ends.
Special combos and wild cards grant unexpected turns in game flow.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deck Construction, Matching, Memory

name: Coral: Tower Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack Druid from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Side A:
Set aside this card during setup, this side face-up. Ignore its effects until all pawns are placed on the reef. At the beginning of each player's turn, if that player's species has the most icons visible on the highest level of the reef, that player takes this card (if there's a tie, nothing happens). If that player already has this card, flip it over.

If you have this card during scoring, receive: 1 point

Side B:
At the beginning of each player's turn, if that player's species has the most icons visible on the highest level of the reef, that player takes this card and flips it. If that player already has this card, or there's a tie, nothing happens.

If you have this card during scoring, receive: 4 points

name: Oshi Push
description: Oshi Push is a collectible card game (CCG) based on VTubers, content creators who use virtual avatars to livestream and create content for platforms like Twitch and YouTube. In this game, you can collect cards and design decks based around your favorite Vtubers!

name: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre Board Game: Dice Tower 2023 Promo Death Cards
description:
Originally available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

3 new "You Are Dead" cards which you mix in with the other Death Cards from the base game.


Your skull has been turned into a dice tower.
Your death did not make the top ten list.
You're dead. At least you smell delicious on the grill.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fall of the Mountain King: Vaz-El Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Pack Cleric from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Vaz-El
His Will a Shield

Clan Flag: Tower Clan
Ability: Instant: Gain 1 Honour for every Troll of yours in a cavern where you are not in control.
Deck: III

name: Ragnarocks: Hati & Skoll Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Pack Cleric from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Hati & Skoll
Swallowed the Sun & Moon

Setup: Place two Vikings.

When Summoning: The target hex for your Runestone is not blocked by Vikings or Runestones. The target hex must still be a contested and unoccupied hex.

At the End of Any Turn: If an opponent's Viking is adjacent to both of your Vikings, you win immediately.

name: Naruto: The Chunin exam Sprint
description: Play with your favorite Naruto characters in this exciting board game. You must move around the board, which will be the battlefield, and pass the different tests to pass the exam and become the best Chunin (Medium Ninja). Once you have passed the first two stages, you will reach the end of the arena tournament, where you will have to play against other players. The last one to be eliminated will win and become a Chunin!
mechanics: Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Dice Tower 2023 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Hatter

Type: Gang
Attack: Melee 1 Green, 1 Blue, 1 Red
Health: 4
Rewards: 3 XP
Traits: Threat 2
Text Box: This enemy gains +X Health. X is the number of Gang enemy cards on its matching wasteland discard pile (max. 3). Fate: This enemy deals 2 Wounds.


Wits

Type: Gang
Attack: Melee 1 White, 1 Blue, 1 Red
Health: 4
Rewards: 2 XP and 2 Gear Cards
Traits: Threat 1, Armor Piercing
Text Box: Engagement: Break 1 weapon card you are equipped with. Fate: This enemy deals 1 Wound. Botch: Discard 1 chosen resource.


Damsel

Type: Gang
Attack: Ranged, 1 Green, 1 Blue
Health: 4
Rewards: 2 XP and 2 Water
Traits: Threat 1, Aquatic
Text Box: This enemy additionally rolls your Aid dice when attacking. Fate: This enemy deals 1 Wound.

name: Dwar7s Spring: Dice Tower 2023 Dragon Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Level 1

VP: 0
Ability: 1 axe
Train: 4 food


Level 2

VP: 1
Ability: 1 axe, 1 backpack
Train: 5 gold


Level 3

VP: 2
Ability: 2 axes, 1 backpack

name: Hot Shot Baseball Travel Edition
description:
Part of a collection of travel games including Hot Shot Basketball and Hot Shot Soccer. Hot Shot Baseball is similar in the game box and design as the others. You have to remove the parts which are stored underneath like the other games as well. The parts include; Game unit with storage area, Scoreboard, backstop, home run ramp, 3 plastic baseballs, 3 panel cage, bat, label sheet and instructions.

Set-up is simple and quick. This can be a two player game with one person doing the pitching and the other doing the batting. Or pitch and hit with both hands working the game.

The goal is to hit the most runs and you win!

name: UNO: WellieWishers
description:
The goal is to be the first to get rid of all your cards, and when there's one card to go, don't forget to yell "UNO!"

UNO WellieWishers comes with a special Kindness card, and when you play it, all your fellow players get to discard one card in the color that you choose!
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: ///MagLev>
description:
///MagLev> is a strategy game in which chance intervenes but in which you must use logic and negotiation to achieve our goal: to reach the destination before anyone else.

You can play individually or in teams, and in competitive or collaborative mode. With a board that supports infinite combinations, the games are always different and the final result of each can change at any time.

Will it be all against all or will alliances be created between the opponents? Will you get some help or will you be the one to boycott the rest? As the game progresses, situations arise in which it will be necessary to evaluate whether it is better to help another participant or to harm him, at which point we will have to use negotiation to reach our final goal: victory.

—description from the publisher







///MagLev> és un joc d'estratègia en què intervé l'atzar però en el qual cal fer servir la lògica i la negociació per aconseguir el nostre objectiu: arribar a la destinació abans que ningú.

Es pot jugar individualment o en equip, i en modalitat competitiva o col·laborativa. Amb un tauler que admet infinites combinacions, els jocs sempre són diferents i el resultat final de cadascun pot canviar en qualsevol moment.

Serà tot contra tots o es crearan aliances entre els oponents? Rebràs ajuda o seràs tu qui boicotejarà la resta? A mesura que avança el joc, sorgeixen situacions en què caldrà valorar si és millor ajudar a un altre participant o fer-li mal, moment en què haurem d'utilitzar la negociació per arribar al nostre objectiu final: la victòria.







///MagLev> es un juego de estrategia en el que interviene el azar pero en el que deberás utilizar la lógica y la negociación para conseguir nuestro objetivo: llegar al destino antes que nadie.

Puedes jugar individualmente o en equipos, y en modo competitivo o colaborativo. Con un tablero que admite infinitas combinaciones, las partidas son siempre diferentes y el resultado final de cada una puede cambiar en cualquier momento.

¿Será todos contra todos o se crearán alianzas entre los oponentes? ¿Recibirás ayuda o serás tú quien boicotee al resto? A medida que avanza el juego surgen situaciones en las que será necesario evaluar si es mejor ayudar a otro participante o hacerle daño, momento en el que tendremos que recurrir a la negociación para alcanzar nuestro objetivo final: la victoria.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Mega Knockdown
description:
You are a competitor in the Mega Knockdown Fighting Tournament, held each year in Greenville, USA. Using attacks, blocks and grappling techniques, you must overcome your opponent in single combat. Predicting your opponent's actions, controlling space and pressing the advantage are your keys to victory.

Play as iconic fighters such as Marinara Marv, M M Lewis, Big Billy, Nick Beardguy and Shotokan Artist Paul, each with their own special moves and abilities inspired by classic 2D fighting games.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Heart-To-Heart Card Game
description:
Build genuine bonding moments with Heart-To-Heart Cards. It's a wonderful way to make meaningful connections and break the ice when you don't know the person very well.

Getting to know someone doesn't have to be painful. Instead of talking about the weather and making small talk, you get to discuss things you're passionate about.

What's in the box:
30 x Reflection Cards
30 x Imagination Cards
30 x Memories Cards
22 x Wild Cards
8 x Bind Cards
1 x How To Play Cards

There are 2 ways of playing

i. Quality Time: Let’s Bond!
Choose a player to start & draw a card from the top of the deck.
Read the prompt aloud and answer the question.
If you draw a Wild Card, the prompt must be completed by all players in that round.
If you draw a Bind Card, you get to pick a player to complete the prompt.
The game ends when all cards have been drawn, or when your game time is over.

ii. Party Game: Impress The Judge!
Each player takes a turn becoming The Judge. As The Judge, draw a card from the deck and read the prompt aloud. The rest of the players answers the prompt as best they can. The Judge then decides who gave the best answer, and awards the card to the player. The player who first collects five cards wins the game.

name: MLB Slammin' Sluggers Baseball Game
description:
It's the bottom of the ninth, the bases are loaded, Sally takes the pitcher's mound while Jimmy steps up to plate. Pull back the pitching lever and release to send the metal ball rolling.
Moving with quick reflexes, Jimmy releases the switch on his side to swing the metal bat and send the ball rolling - But where will it go?

Land in the "Single" slot to move the runner peg to 1st base, "Double" to move to 2nd base, "Triple" for 3rd base, or if you're really lucky, you just might land a big Home Run.

But don't get your hopes up too high! Using the baseball lever, Sally shifts her players back and forth to try and block the ball - And if she does...YOU'RE OUT!

Keep playing your way through nine innings, switching places as batter and pitcher and using the dials to keep track of balls, strikes, outs, and points.

The player with the most points wins!

Contents: Baseball stadium, player pieces and billboards from all 30 MLB teams, stands, pitching chute, metal bat, metal balls, foul poles, outfield barriers, scoreboard, base runner markers, ball-strike-and-out marker, sticker sheet, detailed instructions and game rules

name: Irren ist tödlich
description:
Four players embody roles in a mystery crime dinner to solve puzzles, find the culprit among themselves and solve the murder.

Background
"How are you doing right now on a scale of 0 to 10?" - It all started with this question. Weeks have now passed and you are still in the psychiatric clinic Seelenheil in Wahnbüttel. Therapy, colourful pills and talk, talk, talk - that's the motto here. But a gruesome murder shatters your daily routine. The head of the clinic, Dr Vasel, is found dead in her office at the clinic. Why did she have to die? Which one of you is crazy enough to commit murder? Find out who has Dr Vasel on their conscience and try not to lose your mind.

name: House Of Cards
description:
Set within the world of war, War? WAR!!

You sit at the head of one of the families within the faction 'Houses Of The Red Mountains'. You must build the strongest House comprised of Royals and their Entourage whilst being a little sneaky and assassinating, blowing up or being a general pain to the other Houses.

With simple pick up and play mechanics, on your turn you will draw 1 card and play 1 card, easy, right? "You've drawn The Wise Old Empress, nice" Add that card to your House, increasing your points or "You have just drawn the Plague Emperor" throw it over into an opponents House and it will actively slay a Royal in their House.

With three types of characters, Royals will be used to increase your House hold strength by adding points, Entourage stay within your House and can deviously change the flow of power (whilst occasionally costing some points to do so) and then there are the others, general weird and wonderful workers - from Onion Smugglers to Crimson Witches.

The 38 character card deck is made up of 38 unique character portraits and once it is empty and you cannot draw the round immediately ends. Each player counts the points in their House, the highest one wins 1 Victory Point. The first to 3 is overall Monarch and winner of House Of Cards.

"Fast paced and easy to learn, but surprisingly strategic. Card art was charmingly grotesque. Politicking with other players was thematic and necessary. Really made me FEEL like a right royal b*st*rd" - J. Watson.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Unleeched
description:
Set within the world of war, War? WAR!!

Become the truest and purest Leech follower by praising the Leech Queen. Achieve greatness by other Leech Followers calling you a liar, then revealing your true and honest hand.

You are one of the followers within the faction of the United Marshes of Stienk (see war, War? WAR!!). Your job is to prove your worthness by telling the truth (well, not being found out to be lying) and becoming the Leech Magi.

Based on the card game 'Cheat', players must play to get rid of their cards by playing them face down and calling what they have assumed they have played. Opponents can then call 'Leech Liar' and expose the cards, hoping to find the wrong number of leeches on the cards.

Start with 6 leech cards, play as many as you think you can get rid of without being called out and then draw back up to 6.

The twist comes in two main areas, the Wild Leech, once exposed it becomes whatever the player called, giving them a 'get out of jail free card' and also allowing some hilariously 'wild' calls.

The second twist is the scoring, with each revealed truth that player turns the cards into a ladder, a ladder to the Leech Queen. The first to reach 6 steps wins the round and is awarded a Leech Queen card (the first to 3 wins the game and is announced Master Magi of the Queen Leech of the United Marshes of Stienk - that's right the title is that long!). Though if the reveal is shown to be a lie (the incorrect leeches are exposed), that player not only takes the stack of cards but the exposed leech cards and taken and score steps to the eternal marches, the first player that gets to 6 ends the round and are 'rewarded' a Stienk Marsh Card (you don't want these).

If every player is being a little cautious and cagey the round ends when a player empties cannot draw any cards and empties their hand, at that moment someone might as well call 'Leech Liar!'

A quick, language free card game for up to 6 players that love a little bluffing and are generally a little mischievous.

-description from publisher

name: Sea of Lies
description:
The Captain is gone!

You are the most infamous pirates on the ship, and now you must argue who deserves to be the next in command. Earn the support of the crew by sharing a Great Feat of yours, spreading a Foul Rumor about another pirate, or revealing a Creepy Secret from the deep sea. Anything goes to become the new captain!

Be ready to trick and deceive your comrades with pirate tales while building your reputation. And the most important thing: do not get caught lying!

Sea of Lies is a bluffing game for 3-7 players. Pick your character, learn their abilities, then decide whether you want to tell a tale or lie.

Since thieves have no honor, tall tales will be told to gather the necessary votes from the crew, and it is up to others to smell if something is fishy. Each character has special abilities and must pick one of the 3 types of story: a major feat of strength, a creepy story, or a hot gossip. You can either tell a story that matches the type you’ve got or simply make your rivals guess which card type you got. They can challenge your tale by betting their own crew members; if you win, the support is yours. Get caught, and you lose your turn.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Storytelling, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: O Grande Jogo Quiz
description:
Clementoni's "O Grande Jogo Quiz" is a fun board game with lots of quizzes to challenge friends and family. Various questions to test yourselves on the world's most extravagant curiosities. With original game mechanics: the other players have to bet on their opponent's answer.

—description from the publisher (translated)

O jogo “O Grande Jogo Quiz” da Clementoni é um divertido jogo de tabuleiro com muitos quizzes para desafiar amigos e familiares. Várias perguntas para se porem à prova sobre as curiosidades mais extravagantes do mundo. Com uma mecânica de jogo original: os outros jogadores deverão apostar na resposta do adversário

—description from the publisher

name: TEKAO
description:
Goal : Capture the opponent's flag.

Gameplay : Each player owns 9 pieces.
Each piece can make a quarter-turn or move forwards, backwards, left or right, as far as the corresponding weapon allows.
The Flag, Grapnel and Tower move 1 square at a time.
The Bow moves 1 or 2 squares at a time.
The Pistol moves 1, 2 or 3 squares a a time.

A piece is taken when an opposing piece lands in an adjacent square.
The Grapnel is stronger than the Tower and the Flag.
The Tower is stronger than the Bow, Pistol and Flag.
The Bow is stronger than the Grapnel and the Flag.
The Pistol is stronger than the Grapnel, Bow and Flag.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Escape Quest: Infiltration à Alcatraz
description:
Have an adventure!
Solve the puzzles!
Avoid the traps set!

Escape Quest is a series of unusual book-games. They combine elements of a scripted adventure with tasks such as "escape room".
Experience an amazing adventure in which you are the main character. You make decisions, solve tasks and try to get out of various traps that are set for you.
Alcatraz: Infiltration: 1963, San Francisco Bay. You play the role of an investigative journalist tasked with entering the infamous Alcatraz as a prisoner. An amazing adventure awaits you and the opportunity to learn the darkest secrets of the prison. But remember, there is no reduced fare for you. Can you escape the famous Alcatraz? What decisions will you make? The ending of this story is entirely up to you.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Egmont Polska, Ynnis Éditions

name: むずかしくない広辞苑かるた (Dictionary Karuta: Easy Kojien)
description:
There are countless entries in the dictionary. There are many words that you know. Let's find words you have seen!

One person reads the explanation card aloud, and the other person picks up the correct word card. Whoever gets the most wins.

—description from the designer

name: 政宗独眼竜：戦国合戦ゲーム (Date Sengoku Warlord Game)
description:
Date Sengoku Warlord is the same game as Sengoku Warlord, but with the theme of Date Masamune, a noted Daimyo from the Yonezawa area of Japan, nicknamed the "One-Eyed Dragon" due to his right eye being cut out due to a childhood disease.

Date conquered all of Mutsu, and was a rival to Hideyoshi, but he humbled himself and pledged himself to the Taiko in 1590. He later went on to serve the Tokugawa and fought against his former master during the Sekigahara campaign in 1600 and again at Osaka in 1614-15. He died in 1636.

The game has all the same components as the Sengoku Warlord Game but has different artwork.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Income

name: Lighthouses, Lighthouses, Lighthouses
description: A game of history, trivia, and fun, players take turns rolling and then moving up and down Maine's coastline from Calais, ME to Isles of Shoals, NH. Along the way players must collect cards at each lighthouse and avoid blue penalty squares. Players will also have the opportunity to answer lighthouse trivia questions at each lighthouse they visit. Correct answers gain valuable points. The game ends when one player has landed on all of the lighthouses or when all players agree to end the game.

name: Trench Tactics
description:
In Trench Tactics, players step into the gritty, strategic world of World War I. This roll-and-write solitaire board game plunges you into the chaos of no man's land. As the commander, your goal is to maneuver your units across the treacherous battlefield, navigating obstacles and enemy fire to reach and conquer the opposing trench while eliminating all enemy units. Choose your tactics wisely.

Gameplay revolves around strategic dice allocation. Each turn, the player rolls the Command dice and assigns them to actions: Advance, Artillery and Reserves. Every choice is crucial as you balance offense, defense, and maneuverability.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Reise durch die Großstadt
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 100 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Auf der Jagd
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On their way they get to shoot animals and gets points awarded according to the kind of animal they shot. When all players have completed their track, the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Medieval Conquerors
description:
You are a king of a small kingdom, but you want to expand it, you want everything.
Your goal is to conquer the whole map, but you have a rival.

This 2-player print-and-play game offers lots of fun.
Build catapults, train knights, move them across the map and attack oponent's cities. It uses grid movement mechanics and simple combat mechanics.

You can win by taking all of the oponent's cities.
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Pong Party
description:
Unique and exciting game with special cups to shoot ping pong balls.
Develop skills in aiming and shooting the cups to collect as many points as possible.
Requires dexterity and coordination.
Contains coasters as extra bats for more playing options and points.
Great activity for enjoyable evenings with friends and family, full of surprises.

name: Chat Noir
description:
Chat Noir is a card game that takes its root in the traditional, 4 suites - 52 playing cards game. It's a 2 to 4 players game, but can be played with more people by adding another deck. The same rules apply weather an additional deck is used or not.

It features illustrations in a vintage style, in the following themes: Clover features symbols of luck, Hearts features romantic imageries, Diamonds features symbols of bad luck, and Spades features only black cats in various decors.

Players choose a secret "lucky" card from their starting hand, and then they take turns drawing a card, and playing combinations from cards of their hand, if they can, and want, to score points. Any player can capture others' combos with Spades cards (Black cats) and steal the points.

Each player grows their own pile of "won" cards from combinations they played or captured until the game ends, when the draw pile empties. Players reveal their "lucky" card and score additional points that can totally reverse the outcome of the game. The player with the highest final score wins.

name: Повелители драконов (Dragon Lords)
description:
Dragon Lords is a fantasy wargame where the players are each trying to win the country back from the power of the dragons.

—user summary

A rich, fertile country stretches between mountain ranges and a warm sea. In the river valleys, cities grew rich, meadows turned green, wheat fields filled with gold. Among the snow-capped peaks, proud clan warriors guarded gem mines. But
once…

Dragons, embodied by the elements, descended on the country. There was no escape from their cunning and cruelty either in the cities, or in the forests, or among the rocks. Thousands of people died, the smoke of hundreds of fires smoked the sky, and in the wake of the atrocities followed the masters of the elements, the Lords of the Dragons.

And the country burst into flames, set on fire from four fronts. Cities are surrounded by rows of walls, destitute villagers and stern mountaineers take up arms, obeying the power of the Dragon Lords. Thousands of convicts bend their backs in the mines, driving rivers of gold and stones into the treasury of their Lord. Lines of iron-clad warriors are marching towards the enemy.

The four Dragon Lords are preparing for mortal combat, and the shadows of the four Dragon Towers loom over the once peaceful nations.

And the skies now completely belong to the Dragons. These formidable, ferocious creatures of incomprehensible magic,
for which there are no barriers, faithfully serve the Lords, destroying everything that stands in their way...

The game is played for six turns, each of four phases of five steps each. The steps are:


Alteration
Change
Enrichment
Development
Advancement


The game has six unit types: Dragons, horsemen, warriors, highlanders, archers, and militiamen, each with their own costs and abilities. With these you conquer and wage war.

The winner is the first to defeat all the other rivals and rule the land.

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Income

name: Space Hulk: White Dwarf #115
description: New command units rules, weapons, missions, and even a new tile in White Dwarf #115. Also contained are counters for crack grenades and plasma grenades, as well as a new mission: Delaying Action.

name: Звездная Армада (Star Armada)
description: A science fiction games were players build up their spaceships and stations in order to control the central star system at the end of the tenth round.

name: Боевые роботы 2 (Combat Robots 2)
description:
Combat Robots 2 is a game of Mech-to-Mech combat in the future, much like Battletech. The game includes:

2 playing maps
8 buildable robot figures with 8 stands
8 tech sheets
40 damage chips
4 memos
dice
game rules

The map is divided into hexes of a terrain type, each with different penalties and advantages for combat. Players maneuver on the map and try to get advantage over their opponents and destroy their mechs before theirs is destroyed.

During a turn a player performs an action with each robot.
It can move, fire, or attempts to repair. After a player has completed, then the other side does the same. This constitutes a turn.

Mechs have different stats, with some having benefits that others do not. Weapons have different ranges and arcs of fire. A mech must have line of sight in order to fire at a target. Fire is resolved with a die roll.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Territorium
description:
Reality and its two faces are intertwined in Territorium, the material plane and the other side are connected by a mysterious tunnel, located in the temple that demarcates the borders of the four lands that make up Territorium.
For eons, two powerful entities, the Phoenix and the Dragon, capable of passing through the tunnel, have maintained the balance between both planes, using the power of ancient magical gems.

The inhabitants of the four lands, inspired by the cult of the Dragon and the Phoenix, created two antagonistic clans. Both factions coexist in a tense calm.

The appearance of an extradimensional entity thirsty for fun, brought with it a great whirlwind, causing the great fracture, which relegated the Dragon and the Phoenix out of the material plane, breaking the balance of Territorium forever.
Without their leaders, the two clans engage in a bloody conflict for control of Territorium.

The war is here, choose your warriors, you are the leader of the clan. Carefully build your strategy to achieve Territorium dominance.

Four brave warriors who break borders, four gems under your control, opening the tunnel that will bring your exiled master from the other side, guarantee your dominance over Territorium.

—description from the designer

name: Find Divided Family
description:
In Find Divided Family you have to find family members they got lost in the Korean war. Each person has different characteristics based on which the characters had to be found as quickly as possible.

There is a display with 50 cards on the table. To start a searching card is revealed. Whoever is the quickest to find the matching person card receives the searching card. the first player how has five searching cards wins the game.

name: Две крепости (Two Fortresses)
description:
In Две крепости ("Two Fortresses"), both sides are trying to prevent the other side from completing their fortress.
