They do this by advancing their forces to attack the walls, but at the same time they build and protect the ones they have. Income is required to build armies and improvements to the walls.

The game is played in turns. During each turn a player does the following:


receive income
raise troops
movement
combat
construction


Combat is resolved by determining the strength of the attack versus the defense value of the armies and wall. Both sides can modify this by playing a card. Finally, both roll a die and compare the scores, with the loser losing the difference between the values. Sometimes this means destruction of the wall.

The first player to construct a fortress on the border of their capital, wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Multi-Use Cards

name: Roll Over, Rice Balls
description:
Taiwan is an island rich in culture and abundant with native foods. Making a rice ball is easy. Let's see how many different combinations of the flavours you can roll out, and if they are all delicious!

One player roll the dice. The other player have to find the cards they are matching with the symbols of the dice. The fastetst player get's the cards. The player with the mosts cards win the game.

name: Time Troopers
description:
New solo deck management campaign. Build a squad to travel back in time to find artifacts needed to save humanities future. Battle armies of past civilizations and sneak into ancient monuments. Manage Time as a resource and make choices which define the future timeline in this immersive solo campaign game.

Time Troopers

I don’t remember the exact year it happened. It wouldn’t matter anyway. Time is not the same… it’s more like a location to be entered into a GPS than a definite moment.

Project Infinity was created by the United Nations of Time to send us to these locations to bring back artifacts from the past. Specific precious gems, minerals, metals are all needed for the Gate to function. These artifacts have a life force of their own. Some energy the science guys get excited about. I don’t know how it works and I don’t care. We go in, we do what we need to do, and we get out. If we are lucky, we get a few days rack time and then reload in the armory with some new Stun Weapons. The rules of engagement are simple - We don’t kill or injure; we don’t leave anything or anyone behind. The UNT Infinity Infantry is the official name we are given but everyone calls us Time Troopers.

We aren’t the only ones with access to a Kobe-Nakamoto Gate. There is a faction out there who are looking for the same artifacts. The Scorpions. Mercenaries of power-hungry conglomerate groups set on destroying our way of life. Politics is not my thing, but I know enough that grabbing the artifacts first and getting them to the UNT we can starve these groups of life force material needed to run their gate. Of course, they can do the same to us if we fail.

The last functioning Gate will have full control of time. We must fight for the future….in the past.

-description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: 大转折：鏖战鲁西南 (The Great Turning: The Fierce Battles in Southwest Shandong)
description:
大转折：鏖战鲁西南 ("The Great Turning：The Fierce Battles in Southwest Shandong") is a strategic/operational level wargame set against the backdrop of the Southwest Shandong region during the Chinese People's Liberation War (The Second Chinese Civil War).

In order to achieve the strategic intention of capturing the Central China, the main force of the Jin Ji Lu Yu Field Army（晋冀鲁豫野战军）crossed the Yellow River on June 30, 1947. They launched the Second Southwest Shandong Campaign（第二次鲁西南战役）in a vast area starting from the south bank of the Yellow River in the north, reaching the Longhai Railway（陇海线）in the south, Heze（菏泽）in the west, and the Grand Canal in the east. At the cost of over 10000 casualties, the People's Liberation Army destroyed 9 and a half brigades of the National Revolutionary Army (PLA), totaling 56000 people (including 43000 prisoners).

The Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) player plays Liu Bocheng（刘伯承）& Deng Xiaoping（邓小平）, while the National Revolutionary Army (PLA) player plays Ku Chu-tung（顧祝同）.


Scale = 16 kilometers /hex (10 miles /hex);
Time = 4 days /GT;
Size = Division Size / unit.


Turn procedure
The Great Turning is played in turns called Game-turns. Each game turn is divided into several phases. The player which phase is in progress is called the phasing player. After the end of the last game turn, or when either player reaches an instant victory condition, the game ends. Exception: There are special procedures in the first turn.
1. Cards Phase
Both sides randomly draw 3 cards from the deck, and the NRA player draw first.
2. Recovery Phase of PLA
Roll 1D6 to each unit of PLA units marked with CP (up to 3 units). If the recovery is successful, the unit is -1CP. If it fails, it has no effect.
3. The First Movement Phase of PLA
Any number of PLA units can be moved.
4. The First Combat Phase of PLA
PLA player can use their units to attack adjacent NRA units.
5. NRA Reinforcement Activation Phase
NRA player roll 1D6 each according to the army to determine whether each division under the army can carry out actions in this turn. Non-reinforcement units (i.e. units that do not belong to the Second or Fourth Army) do not need to roll the dice, they are always active.
6. NRA Recovery Phase
Roll 1D6 (up to 3 units) to each unit of the NRA units marked with CP. If the recovery is successful, the unit is -1CP. If it fails, it has no effect.
7. The First Movement Phase of NRA
Any number of NRA units can be moved. Reinforcement units may enter at this time.
8. The First Combat Phase of NRA
NRA player can use their units to attack adjacent PLA units.
9. NRA Supply Phase
Determine the supply of NRA units. Rotate the Out of supply (OOS) unit 180 ° (i.e. invert); Return the units with supplies to its normal position. The supply will be maintained until the supply phase of the next turn.
10. The Second Movement Phase of PLA (skipping the last turn of the Scenario)
Same as the first movement phase.
11. The Second Movement Phase of NRA (skipping the last turn of the Scenario)
Same as the first movement phase.The reinforcement units may enter at this time.
12. The Administrative Phase
①Weather: Starting from the third turn, NRA player roll 1D6 to determine the weather for the next turn, and flip the turn marker based on the result (the first and second turn are fixed as clear, so there is no need to roll the dice to determine).
Note: If there is no change in weather for three consecutive turns, the weather will definitely change in the next turn. Refer to the weather table.
②Air Force: Place Air Force marker on the "2" (clear) or "0" (rainy) box of the Common Record Track.
③Turn: If this is not the last turn, push the game turn marker in the Common Record Track forward by 1 box, and then start a new turn. If it is the final turn, the game ends and the winner is determined.
Exception: The first turn of both Scenario s has a special procedure that does not follow the standard procedure. And neither side had a second movement phase in the last turn.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Zoo-Lógico
description: Welcome to the game that will take you through the exciting world of animal care. Create the best zoo and charge for visits to win. If you manage to have babies, you will earn more, but be careful with poachers, traps, predators or the feared coronavirus, which will delay you or you will lose what you have earned.
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Trading

name: tellitall
description:
A simple storytelling card game that's the size of a deck of cards. The gameplay is simple - someone selects a story prompt and everyone in the group shares a story based on that prompt. An example of a prompt is "your worst birthday." After everyone has shared, the person who drew the card awards it to the story they enjoyed the most.

First person to win 3 story prompt cards wins the game.

name: Addition & Subtraction Shapes T550
description:
Two sets of each 24 pieces, feature addition and Subtraction respectively. The two sets will be generally be used seperatly, each giving 36 selected examples and their answers, but they can be combined to make a much longer and more complicated game.

The game may be played by 2, 3 or 4 players or as a matching activity by a child working alone.

The shapes are placed face down on the playing surface and players select an equal number at random. Players take turns at playing the first piece to start the game and the following players, in turn, position any connecting piece matching the problem to answer or answer to the problem.

Aplayer unable to make a match misses tat turn and the winner is the first to match all his pieces correctly.

name: Kix Ball
description:
A dexterity game published on the back of Kix cereal boxes in 2022. Players flick pieces of cereal across the board and score based on where the piece lands on the baseball-themed board. First player to score 100 points wins.

Going off the board scores 0, so there is risk in going for the higher point values. The irregularity of Kix cereal pieces also adds challenge.

name: Zombie Horde
description:
Zombie Horde is a cooperative board game for 1 to 5 players. In Zombie Horde, survivors live in a colony, trying to survive the aftermath of the zombie apocalypse. The colony is the heart of the game.

GAMEPLAY
The game is divided into rounds, and one round is composed of 2 phases: the Colony phase, and the Exploration phase.

Each phase is divided into steps.

COLONY PHASE: the Colony Phase takes place on the Colony Board, and is played following 7 steps in order. These 7 steps form one phase.

EXPLORATION PHASE: The Exploration Phase takes place on the mission map tiles. During this phase, players activate their survivors in any order, even alternating them, and perform up to 3 actions. When the survivors finish their activation, the zombies activate. Players resolve the effects of zombie activation, then the phase is over.

When both phases have finished, that is 1 round. The next round starts from the first step in the Colony Phase.
The game ends when the cure is found, or all survivors are dead.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Атлантида (Atlantis)
description:
Atlantis is an economic game about becoming the wealthiest citizen of Atlantis. This is done by acquiring trade routes and merchants, building centers, Robbing, and bribery.

The turn sequence is as follows:
1. Travel
2. Supply
3. Construction
4. Obtain resources
5. Trade
6. Robbery

The player with the most resource tokens at the end of the game wins.

name: Convergence Alpha
description:
In Convergence Alpha you step into a deckbuliding cyberpunk dystopia. Dive into the gritty underbelly of Convergence Alpha, where every move is a calculated risk and every decision could reshape the destiny of this world.

Construct your unit deck wisely, comprising Infantry, Range, and Armor cards with numbers. Choose your strategic depth and pick your starting deck and units suitable for this mission.

Engage in the Actions to attack, move, conquer, and purchase units strategically. Roll the dice to determine the outcome of an attack, shift units across rows, and flip territories to your faction's side. Be mindful of your deck composition and choose the opportune moment to thin it, ensuring your draw deck remains finely tuned for the challenges ahead.

Convergence Alpha offers a dynamic blend of strategy, luck, and deck-building mastery. Will you seize control of the territories and emerge as the ultimate tactician? The battlefield awaits your command!

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Море Клинта (Clint's Sea)
description:
Море Клинта (Clint's Sea) is a pirate game of exploration, trade, and conquest. You must buy goods, take them away from other pirates, raid, and conquer other islands.

The player who conquers all the islands wins. In case of a tie, the most money wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Income, Player Elimination, Trading

name: Боевые роботы (Combat Robots)
description:
This is a lightweight wargame from Tehnolog that is similar to Oil War but deals with robot combat. It consists of only three pages of rules.

The game includes:


four playing boards
16 robots
dice
Robot data cards
rules of play


There are five types of robots:

Sniper
Missile carrier
Armadillo
Mortarman
Soldier


The game consists of a hex board with mountains, quagmire, clear, and river hexes. Each has a different cost to enter. A clear hex costs one, mountains are impassible, a river costs two turns to transverse, and if a robot gets caught in a quagmire, it cannot move for the rest of the game.

Each turn the players roll a die for initiative, with the high side going first. They then move their robots and fires them. Each robot can fire once, except for the missile bot, and each needs LOS, except for the mortar bot.

Firing is done by a die roll and comparing it to the number in a hex. If that number is rolled then the bot is hit and must retreat one hex back (done randomly). This could put it in a quagmire.

Optional rules allow each player to place four pillboxes for their defense.

The objective is capturing the spaceport on each map. Further instructions say that you are to "Conquer four planets," so I guess the best out of four games wins?

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Turn Order: Random

name: Чужой (Alien)
description:
Alien is a game of exploration in an alien environment. It is played by laying down tiles and moving on them with your soldiers. You may encounter a hostile Alien along the way.

The game includes model soldiers, wound and hatching markers, an alien counter, spaceship interior hexes, and "hole" counters.

The game is very similar to GW's Lost Patrol, but the rules are much simpler, only two pages!

Each turn you roll a die for the number of action points your trooper receives. With this, you can move, explore, and fight.

To move into a hex costs 1 action point, whereby you can explore the next hex for 2 action points--then draw a new tile and place it. Each hex is drawn is from a pile of 20.

You can also spend action points to open hatches. No more than two soldiers can be in a hex at a time.

A soldier can shoot once at the end of its move. A die is rolled to determine damage.

After all soldiers have moved, the alien gets a turn. The trick here is, that the alien can attack several times and it can move through the ventilation shaft. Each move and attack costs 1 action point.

To win the game the soldiers need to explore all spaces on the ship or kill eliminate the alien. The alien wins if it kills all the soldiers.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Fingagolf
description:
Like Golf. With Your Finger!

A dexterity game that allows you to hit all the shots from the world of golf on a smaller scale.

Players compete over 9 holes of stroke play or match play with a 7-iron, pitching wedge and putter. Each hole is designed by the players by arranging the tee box and green along with some obstacles. The player with the lowest score wins the hole. The player who loses the hole can choose who designs the next hole.

Stroke play: The player with the lowest total score wins
Match play: The player who won the most holes wins

—description from the designer

name: Arcade IT
description:
In this party game with a slightly videogame and slightly retro flavor you will play to send your "friends" into game over. In this fun game you will play as an 8-bit character and use all your cunning to stay on top!
Learn in 5 minutes, play for hours : This game is very easy to learn, each card has very intuitive symbols, and even explaining it will be very easy for you, learn it and explain it in a few minutes, and have fun for hours!

The aim of the game is to remain the last player in the game, during the game you will have access to various ways to eliminate your "friends", you decide how to eliminate them based no the way you prefer! There are those who prefer to slice them and those who prefer to shoot them from a spaceship, there is something for al tastes!

There are 2 ways to lose in ARCADE IT:


Game over, you've finished al your lives! Each character has 3 lives, if al lives are lost the player is eliminated from the game. During the game it may be possible to recover lives, however you can never have more than 3 lives.



if you run out of cards


Setup: each player chooses 1 character card, than shuffle the deck and place it in the center of the table and deal 10 cards to each player

The characters have unique abilities, we recommend playing without using these abilities at the beginning. Each character can only use his ability up to 3 times per game. Furthermore, he can only use his ability once between our current turn and the next one. Some characters require a specific time to use their ability, for example the character Lily can activate her ability only when it is targeted by a card, so as to transfer its effect to another player.
On the board it is possible to keep track of how many skills we have used and the remaining hearts.
mechanics: Action Points, Drawing, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Золото дракона (Dragon's Gold)
description:
Four nations of dwarves search for treasures hidden in Dragon Mountain. Tenacious dwarves tirelessly dig tunnels, trying to penetrate the cave, where a slumbering cunning dragon sits on a mountain of treasure. Dwarven mages, studying ancient tomes, create arcane amulets and open spells to deceive the cunning dragon and help the dwarves of their people.

Who will be the lord of the treasures of the mountain?

The fate of your dwarves depends on you!

The game comes with:

44 tiles
72 cards
43 tokens
1 dragon model
4 sets of 4 dwarves (16 total)
1 die
rules


This is a game where you are trying to get to the dragon and steal the treasure. There can be up to four teams trying to do this. It is also possible for players to attack one another. The map is modular and can change during the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pieces as Map

name: Orchard Plan
description:
オーチャードプラン (Orchard Plan) is a game from Japan. Players develop their own orchard farm by placing tiles to expand their production. After selling the crop to create income, players can then invest in better equipment to improve production.

Each player has their own board showing the orchard, and starts with one fruit tree tile. The fruit tree tiles show spaces for 0 to 4 cubes, which are cubes in three colours, red, blue, yellow, for each variety of apple. The player also has a small truck, that is moved about to harvest the crop. The truck and exit the player's board from one side and enter from any other side, but must pass over tiles to harvest fruit. Players can place fruit cubes but only on free spaces and not where their truck is placed.

The game has a marketplace, and a series of long thin tiles are placed under the market to indicate demand. Each demand tile shows a number of cubes in each colour wanted, and as contracts are completed, the tiles move up and fresh tiles are placed from the left.

Each player keeps their income hidden behind a screen and spends money to acquire new fruit tiles, seed their crop and harvest.

At the end of the game, the wealthiest player is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Red Dragon Inn: 2023 SlugCrew Minor Reward
description:
In the first few days of 2020, we eagerly announced new rewards for SlugCrew, our team of enthusiasts running SlugFest gaming sessions at game stores and conventions. Melvyn, the minotaur mage was the reward for folks who ran lots of games. We were all looking forward to a great year of gaming.

Then some stuff happened…

But now, in-person gaming is back, and so it’s finally time to put our minotaur friend out to pasture. Don’t worry—he’ll be back very soon in an upcoming retail release. In the meantime, we’re excited to finally announce new SlugCrew rewards!

We start off with the Minor Rewards. These three Red Dragon Inn promo cards are available for any SlugCrew member who earns 30 SlugCrew Points (about 6 hours of demos). But if you get 150 SlugCrew Points (about 30 hours of demos), you can earn the Major Reward – a sneak preview version of a future Red Dragon Inn character! Master of Ceremonies Jin!

- Description by the publisher

Contents:

Lucky’s Last Call (Drink card)
Battlin’ Baguettes (Prize card)
Hook Hand (Prize card)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Ice Tea Break
description:
アイスティーブレイク (Ice Tea Break) is a party game from Japan, themed on drinks, cakes and sweet dishes. Players combine two cards and ask a question, such as "If you want a pet, this is something scary." or "If you want a date, this is the country." The other players have to deduce the answer based upon the chosen cards.

The publisher says:
Iced Tea Break, a tea party chat communication game, is an exciting communication game with mysterious themes. Each player presents an answer to a sweets question that combines two cards, and the questioner chooses the answer they like. How about playing a game in your spare time?

お茶会雑談系コミュニケーションゲーム アイスティーブレイクは不思議なお題で盛り上がるコミュニケーションゲームです。2枚のカードを組み合わせたお菓子なお題について各プレイヤーが回答を発表し、出題者が気に入った回答を選びます。 ちょっとした空き時間におちゃをするようにゲームをするのは如何でしょうか？
description by publisher

name: Christmas Categories
description:
Players test their holiday spirit and creativity by coming up with valid answers to Christmas-themed category questions.

Turn over 5 "category" cards and 1 "letter" card. Then flip over the 1-minute timer. Players have until the timer runs out to come up with answers matching the "category" card that begin with the designated letter. For the first 4 categories, the goal is to be unique. For the 5th category, there is a twist! Players test how well they know their opponents by attempting to match their answers to earn points.

When the time is up, players share answers with the group, earning points if others agree that their answers are valid. If an answer is up for dispute, majority rules! Lobbying for your answer is an integral part of the fun of Christmas Categories.

A typical game lasts 3 rounds but can go longer if players are having fun.

name: Holiday Hijinks #9: The Marriage Mix-Up
description:
Your careers as wedding planners are on the line. Find out what went wrong, and fast!

The Marriage Mix-Up, title #9 in the Holiday Hijinks line, is an escape room style game in just 18 cards! As a group, you will solve a series of puzzles to unravel a mystery.

Puzzles may test your perception, wordplay, and lateral thinking. English language fluency is required.

This game is app-assisted. When you have solved a puzzle on the cards, you will enter the answer into the companion web app (compatible with all smart phones and computers) and it will check whether you are correct. If you are, the app will tell you which card or cards to take next. The app also contains a graduated hint system, so if you get stuck you can get just a small hint about the current puzzle to get moving again without giving too much away.

This system is non-desctructible: some groups may choose to write on cards, but this is not required. A group cannot re-play the game, but can pass it on to another group for their use.

This entry in the series takes about an hour to solve, and is rated 1 out of 3 in difficulty. You will need at least two players to solve the puzzles.

name: Turbo Servo
description:
There's always room for improvement on the Gear-Gum assembly line, and you're just the bot for the job!

In Turbo Servo, 2 players will compete to create the ultimate, assembly line machine. On their turns, each player will draft and place a dual-servo card in their pyramid-shaped machine, top to bottom, until they have completed all 5 rows.

Each dual-servo card has 2 different parts (6 total unique parts) which each score differently in the end game, depending on placement. As you play your servos, you can rotate previous servos to create chains, combos, and rearrange the parts in each row and column to maximize your machine's efficiency.

Player with the most points from their completed machine wins!

name: Торговый флот (Merchant Marine)
description:
The game field is represented by planets connected to each other by trade routes. The more trade routes lead to the planet, the more income they bring.

Players start the game with a single merchant ship and take control of trade zones and paths. The richer trading zones a player controls, the more income they receive.

They can spend this income to buy more ships for different purposes. Players not only place their merchant ships on the most profitable trade routes, but also hire pirates to blow up rival ships, police corvettes and stations to protect against pirates, and open new trade routes.

The first player to earn 20 Income Points wins.

name: Trench Knife
description:
Back to the front! You must cross no-man’s land and defeat the German Army, or all hope will be lost.

Trench Knife is a mint tin solo WWI game. You play as the Allies. Using a variable Action Point system, you must maneuver your squads, suppress the enemy, and assault the German trenches, in the attempt to take a vital point in the war. The Germans have the upper hand, with HMG nests and The Red Baron on their side.

Artillery rains bombs and chlorine gas from the skies tearing up the battlefield. As the Allied French and British soldiers, you have limited time to make your push through barbed wire, mud, and trenches, while angry bees of hot lead rip through the air.

Push the Germans back or die!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ярость Викингов (Viking Fury)
description:
From Tehnolog.ru:
Mini-games of the Europa series are a line of exciting board games with elements of strategy and magnificent figures of warriors. The theme of the games touches on the most important events in the history of Europe, and the figures correspond to historical eras.

From Tesera.ru:
General, your armies are ready for battle! Lead them through fields, forests, and mountains, conquer villages, and use the help of the local population wisely. Correct calculation and a little luck will lead you to the desired victory!

A mini-strategy game with miniature warriors for two players that will help you and your child develop strategic skills. Fight on the side of the Crusaders or the Russians to defeat the opponent's army and conquer the enemy castle, leaving the enemies out of work!

User:
Europe: the minigame series, is a selection of five games that are designed to be played by those as young as age 5, and in 10-30 minutes.

They deal with different historical subjects. The five are:

1. Crusades
2. Viking Fury
3. The Last Legion
4. Russian Valor
5. Knight Battles

Each set comes with:
-4 figures
-10 tokens
-1 game board
-1 die
-set of rules

The rules consist of four pages and have a very low complexity level.

The armies are plastic figures, and there are different varieties depending on the game being played. Figures include Barbarians, Romans, Vikings, Knights, Novgorodians, and Crusaders, each set having 4 poses and different strength for the game. It has not been determined if every game in the series has the same figure poses, so in this sense there may be some collectability with these games.

The goal of the game is to take over the player's capital. To do this they maneuver their forces and attacker each other.

Movement begins with a player rolling a die to determine the weather for the turn. On a clear day armies may move 2 hexes and on a rainy day they may move 1 hex.

Combat is determined by the attacker rolling a die and adding the strength of any tokens. This is compared against the defensive value of the targeted army for the result.

name: Крестовое нашествие (Crusade)
description:
Europe: the minigame series, is a selection of five games that are designed to be played by those as young as age 5, and in 10-30 minutes.

They deal with different historical subjects. The five are:


Crusades
Viking Fury
The Last Legion
Russian Valor
Knight Battles


Each set comes with:

4 figures
10 tokens
1 game board
1 die
set of rules


The rules consist of four pages and have a very low complexity level.

The armies are plastic figures, and there are different varieties depending on the game being played. Figures include Barbarians, Romans, Vikings, Knights, Novgorodians, and Crusaders, each set having 4 poses and different strength for the game. It has not been determined if every game in the series has the same figure poses, so in this sense there may be some collectability with these games.

The goal of the game is to take over the player's capital. To do this they maneuver their forces and attacker each other.

Movement begins with a player rolling a die to determine the weather for the turn. On a clear day armies may move 2 hexes and on a rainy day they may move 1 hex.

Combat is determined by the attacker rolling a die and adding the strength of any tokens. This is compared against the defensive value of the targeted army for the result.

—user summary

–user summary

Crusades
Viking Fury
The Last Legion

Each set comes with:

10 tokens
1 game board

Combat is determined by the attacker rolling a die and adding the strength of any tokens. This is compared against the defensive value of the targeted army for the result.

—user summary

name: Master Of Innuendo
description:
Master Of Innuendo is a fill-in-the-blank card game where players can flex their naughty bone by using words and phrases on the Innuendo Cards and Party Cards to make blush- and giggle-worthy versions of their favorite movie titles on the Title Cards. Players get 7 Innuendo Cards each per hand, and there are 3 Party Cards that are laid out in the center of the table for every player to use.

To start, the player with the longest name is the first Critic. The Critic reads the Title Card from the top of the pack, noting the blank(s) in the title. The other players use up to 3 of their Innuendo Cards and the Edit Cards to make a funnier version of the movie title. When everyone's ready, The Critic reads the Title Card with the blank, then each player gives their pitch for the new movie title, showing which Innuendo Cards and Edit Cards they're using. When everyone has gone, the Critic chooses their favorite and the winner gets 1 Critic's Choice Point. The Critic then asks the winner to name the real movie title for a bonus Encore Point. Acceptable answers are listed at the bottom of the Title Card. If the player knows another movie that fits that's not listed, they can still get the point if they can prove that it's a real movie. If the player doesn't know the real movie title, the Critic opens it up to all players and the first one to give the real title wins the Encore Point. The next player becomes the new Critic and another round begins after all players have replenished their hands so they have 7 Innuendo Cards each. Used Innuendo Cards are put aside or at the bottom of the stack. The used Title Card is set aside or at the bottom of the stack.

The length of the game can be based on a set time decided by all players or after every player has had a turn as the Critic. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins and is crowned Master Of Innuendo! They get bragging rights and can wear the Master Of Innuendo medal for the next hour, or until a new winner is crowned, whichever comes first.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Matching, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Score-and-Reset Game, Voting

name: Dice Spray
description: Dice Spray is a micro Roll-and-Write game in which players draft dice and attempt to fill in as many squares on a 6x6 grid as possible in 10 turns.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Император (Emperor)
description:
Emperor is a game inspired by the Tehnolog game "Mortal Combat," and is a game for kids. The game is part boardgame, part building, and part dexterity, as the players must maneuver the battlefield, build their fortification, and attack the enemy by melee and shooting. The game includes two shooting cannons.

The game comes with:
-2 firing cannon w/shells
-16 wall pieces
-8 gates
-16 warriors (8 per side)
-a playing field
-magic cards
-bank notes
-player aid
-rules

The first player to destroy all their opponent's warriors and castle, wins the game.

The game went on to inspire Emperor 2.

name: Airlift Stalingrad
description:
Airlift Stalingrad is a solitary wargame that in abstract way represents a failed operation to resupply the encircled 6th
German Army and save them from destruction in Stalingrad, during the World War II. In this game, player will have to
manage day-to-day airlift operations and also hold the front line against the Soviets, while working toward two
possible solutions – to breakthrough from the encirclement or to be relived by the Operation Winter Storm.

Game Components:
One large map (board) on which game is played
12 tan (or yellow ) wooden cubes representing Junkers transport planes
15 gray wooden cubes representing army groups of the 6th Army
36 Operational cards
4 Blizzard cards
4 Lull cards
1 Paulus Surrender! card
1 Disrupted token
3 Parachute supplies tokens
6 Fortification tokens
8 Soviet tokens
1 Anti-air token
4 Iron cross tokens
3 white and 1 black d6 dice
3 red d6 dice
4 yellow wooden cubes for tracking various effects
6 gray wooden cubes for tracking fuel for a Breakthrough operation
1 cloth bag (called Event bag)
Cubes that are used for the event bag:
4 red
2 gray
2 tan
6 white

How to win the game:
You can win the game in two ways. By doing a successful roll for the Operation Winter Storm, or the Breakthrough!
Order token must be either on the Operation Winter Storm or Breakthrough! Spot.
In both cases weather must be Clear.
In case of the Operation Winter Storm, your Fuel reserves must be 4 or higher, while for the Breakthrough! They
must be 5 or higher.
If all of this is true, at the end of your turn you roll 2 d6 dice. If their sum is lower than the sum of your current
Morale and Food reserves, you win the game, if not you lose the game. You can only perform this roll once, but if you
have any Iron cross tokens (re-rolls) you can use them, but any DRM bonus from the Operational card for that turn is
not applied to this roll.
Lose conditions:
1. If you don't have any planes in your Airlift pool at the end of your turn, your game is lost
2. If all of your army groups are destroyed or in Hospital, game is lost
3. If you draw Paulus Surrenders! card from the Operational deck, you immediately lose the game
4. If 3 or more of the areas of your pocket are under Soviet control, game is lost
5. If all of the Operational cards are in the discard pile and you haven't execute successful Operation Winter
Storm or a Breakthrough! roll at the end of that turn, game is over
6. If you fail a roll for Operation Winter Storm or a Breakthrough!; you immediately lose the game

Goring through one turn, following a turn sequence:
1. Draw one operational card
2. After you draw a card, if possible, use 2 actions from it.

On the card are usually 4 possible actions you can perform for that turn. Each action is connected to each other with a line. You can only use 2 out of 4 actions, and they must be connected in orthogonal manner. For instance, you can either use top 2 connected actions, or bottom 2 connected. Or two leftmost one under another, or 2 rightmost one under another, connected.

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Vanaheim: Weapons and Armour Expansion Pack
description:
Adds 18 new cards to the Vanaheim game, increasing your hero's chance of surviving with new equipment across all levels for all classes - and their animal companion.

Two new buildings dramatically change your Town; you can now search for specific equipment in the Alchemist and Smith and store excess items in your base of operations.

Adds unique item cards at level 2, 3 and 4 for mission rewards.

name: Vanaheim: Scrolls and Staffs Expansion Pack
description:
Adds 18 new cards to the Vanaheim game, increasing your hero's chance of surviving with new equipment across all levels for the Sage and other magic users.

Scrolls are high power one shot weapons that are used at range to smite your foes. Use the Hall of Words building to ensure you have copies of these scrolls so you can restock at the town.

New staffs, wands, potions and armour to bring more damage to the battlefield at all levels.

6 scrolls, 3 wands, 3 staves, 2 potions, 2 items of clothing and 2 buildings.

name: Hall of the Skinwalkers: Vanaheim Adventure
description:
In the first expansion to Vanaheim, players journey to the lair of the Skinwalkers, rescue powerful allies, find new silver weapons and destroy the Werewolf overseer before he builds an army!

In addition to a replayable level 2 adventure, this pack contains 4 new town cards, 10 items (including 2 Level 5 weapons), 8 treasure cards, 4 new monsters, 4 new spells and 3 new skills.

name: Fury of the Jotnar: Vanaheim Adventure
description:
The legendary Jotnar, monstrous elemental giants have ripped open fiery portals deep within the earth to Vanaheim. Will you sieze the opportunity to pass through the Rifts, explore a new realm, find new treasures, and possibly a quick but painful death?

This 50 card expansion adds new buildings, Jotnar of each level (and their elite versions), treasure, items, events and new decision map cards.

Decision map cards allow for risks, dangers and rewards. Jotnar Rifts allow access to their treasure rooms - if you survive. The Mine and the Temple expand your town, and bring a new companion: Vala, the travelling healer.

And of course, there's a giant slaying weapon - if you can find it before the Jotnar find you.

name: Through the Shimmering Portal: Vanaheim Adventure
description:
Piece together the mystery of opening the Vanir gates in a huge series of quests that will take you to new worlds, where you will face new threats and, if successful, gain incredible new powers.

New decision cards will give you moral dilemma that will offer rewards, at a price. Visit a familiar hut to recruit companions, new and old, who can be equipped with weapons and armour and support your adventures in new ways.

Adds above-ground map cards to explore, new monsters and wilderness creatures, items, treasures, Town buildings, and above-ground locations.

name: Bragging Rights
description:
It's time for the flashiest auction of the year. To play Bragging Rights you'll need foresight, bluffing, and big kahunas! Each of you must splash the cash and try to buy the most valuable items in the auction. But wait… any money you have left over turns into bragging points! Will you gain enough points to earn the envy of your opponents and win?

Phase One of the game is the auction, where players bid for job lots for a chance of securing valuable Item Cards, from private yachts to diamond rings! There are four types of
collectible with the Item Cards. They are: Watches, Transport, Antiques and Crypto. Crypto is a trump suit. Will you manage to get your hands on items that are worth bragging about or will your opponents outbid you?

In Phase Two, it's time for the drinks party, get ready to compare and show off about your items!
Everyone picks up the Item Cards they won at auction.
The person who has the most money puts down any one of their Item Cards – face up. Each player must then put down an Item Card. When possible, Item Cards should match the type of the original card. If you can’t match the type, you may play any card – including Crypto. After you’ve all played one Item Card, it makes up a trick. A Crypto Card beats all other cards – even if the other cards have a higher value. The only way to beat a Crypto Card is to play one with a higher value!
Finally, if you can’t match the type, or play a Crypto Card, you still have to play an Item Card. Put down whatever you can. Unfortunately, it means you immediately lose the hand.
Whoever plays the highest Crypto Card wins the trick. If no one plays a Crypto Card, the person who played the highest Item Card of the original type wins the trick.

Bragging Rights ends after 12 rounds, when you’ll have played all your Item Cards. The person with the most tricks wins.

name: Instant Karma
description:
Instant Karma is a party game that celebrates when the Universe, in the most fitting ways imaginable, has punished jerks for screwing over or being shady to others. In this game, which contains 300 hilarious real-life stories of poetic justice, players try to bluff each other by trying to think up just desserts that are more plausible than what really happened!

In Instant Karma, One player (the guru) reads out the start of a real-life story of a situation where instant karma occurred to the others. All other players then each write down a made-up, but believable ending to the story and hand it to the guru. The guru then reads out the real ending and all the made-up endings, in random order. The others must guess which is the correct one. You win a point for each player who is fooled into believing that your made-up ending is the real one, as well as for picking the real ending.

name: I'm Getting Too Old For This Sh*t
description:
When did Miley Cyrus twerk on stage with Robert Thicke at the VMAS? In this fun family game, you just have to answer one simple question - when did stuff happen? Delve in to recent history to find out if you are too old for this sh*t, or if you’ve still got it!

To start the game, one player takes the top card from the pack and reads out a question. All questions will be about events that have occurred in recent history. Players then shout out what they think is the correct answer.
One variation of this rule is to use pencils and paper to write down your answers instead and hand them in to the questioner. This way, no one can copy or be influenced by anyone else’s answer.
Players earn three points for guessing correctly, and one point for being one year out. The first player to reach 15 points is the winner!

name: Movie Madness
description:
A fun party game in which players pitch a movie remake from randomly generated genre, movie star, and setting cards to try to get their movie made!

To start a round of Movie Madness, each player is dealt 1 actor card. Then, one player is chosen to be the first Producer. The Producer deals out setting cards and three genre cards and announces them. Once the Producer shouts out ‘Action!’, players now grab a setting card from the display.

Each player pitches a film that’s a cross between two of the three genres, featuring their actor card and their setting card, preferably with a short title. The Producer divides the cards into the players' score piles between the pitches they like best. Whoever has the most cards in their score pile at the end of the game is the winner!

name: Pandora
description:
Embark on an epic journey into the enchanting realm of Pandora, a world teeming with adventure and strategy. Prepare to immerse yourself in a universe filled with excitement, where your destiny awaits, formidable challenges arise, and triumph is the ultimate goal in this captivating board game experience.

The game's heart lies in Secret Missions. Each player pursues their own path, striving to complete missions that unfurl throughout the game. As the game nears its conclusion, victory hinges on accumulating Victory Points.

Each turn includes the following actions, which can be performed in any order:

1. Movement: Navigate the board to the desired destination.

2. Build: Build bases to strengthen your character and gain advantages.

3. Fight: Engage in a battle for points among players or attack monsters where you team up with other players in the same territory to defeat enemies.

4. Train: Improve your skills and gain lasting benefits by training at a base. Ending your turn after training.

5. Gather: Obtain gold from the board or try to draw Pandora cards. Gold collection and Pandora card attempts are mutually exclusive.

6. Completing secret Missions: Try to complete secret missions to set you up towards the final scoring at the end of the game.

7. Character actions and resource trading: Use character-specific abilities and possibly exchange resources with other players.

The game continues until either the last card in the Pandora deck is revealed or a player reaches the indicated victory points on the VP (Victory Points) tracker. If any player would be defeated during the game, all players will lose the game all together.

After game reach it’s end the player's bonus points from secret missions are then tallied, and the player with the highest total emerges as the victor, etching their name among the legends of Pandora.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Negotiation, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Move Through Deck, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Negotiation, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Conviction
description:
Shortly after your “happily ever after,” the two of you, the stable stalwart and the free-spirited idealist, come to an impasse.

Cards have either your suit or your friend’s suit. Your deck’s dominant suit will decide where your convictions lie. Cards of your suit enable new actions, but you’ll also want to shift your
cards into your friend’s deck if you want to change their mind.

Can you cooperate towards a balanced resolution? If you are both stubborn you’ll separate.Although, you could dominate the narrative instead…

Gameplay consists of the two of you taking turns performing actions to shift cards between the two of you, the shared support deck, and the reject pile. Players can take special actions with cards of their own suit, or they can take the default "express" action to place cards from their hand into the other player's deck.

The game ends when one player concedes with the other player's cards, or when the support deck runs out. The resolution of the game depends on the make up of the players decks. If your deck has more cards of the other player's suit than your own suit, then you've changed your mind to favor your partner. If both players change their minds enough, they cooperate. If only one changes their mind, one player dominates the narrative. If neither changes their mind, they separate.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory, Negotiation, Prisoner's Dilemma, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Clue: WWII – Spies & Espionage
description:
Clue: WWII Spies & Espionage is a highstakes game where danger lurks in the shadows for six secret agents on a mission to carry out covert operations that will thwart the enemy and secure victory for the Allies!

Players will move around the European Theater of Operations to determine WHICH mission-critical item was taken, WHO is the fake agent, and WHERE is the imposter's base of operations.
categories: Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II

name: Bread
description:
The world’s resources are depleting at a critical time, and you need the right infrastructure to survive. Take turns burning cards to activate either the trucks ? or mills ? of your tableau. If you build enough bread ? to quell your unrest ? before the end ☢️, you survive. There’s more than enough bread for everyone… provided you work with each other rather than against.

? Activate your trucks to gather (or steal) cards, either for yourself or for others.
? Activate your mills to build infrastructure, adding cards to any player's tableau.

With these 2 actions and 5 different types of infrastructure,
the players are equipped with all the tools they need to:
• Search the deck for materials, like the pivotal bread .
• Build up a tableau to efficiently distribute bread .
• Give cards to a friend so they don’t burn through the deck.
• Steal cards from a greedy hoarding player.
• Build walls to stop a rampant thieving player.

The game finishes when the end event ☢️ appears, which is shuffled into the latter part of the deck. Unrest events ? along the way will set the players back, and force them to burn more cards to activate their infrastructure.

Can you hold a cooperative spirit, even as resources dwindle and you’re forced to contend with unexpected famine?

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Negotiation, Print & Play
mechanics: Events, Negotiation, Pick-up and Deliver, Prisoner's Dilemma, Resource to Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Spandau 1780
description:
In "Spandau 1780", players direct influential personalities and actively shape the development of the region around historic Spandau between 1780-1880.
The goal of each player is to fill his cabinet of wonders with all kinds of rare works of art and thus compete with the other players.
The player who has collected the most genuine works of art at the end of the game wins.

Spandau 1780 starts with each player selecting a character from 1780 represented on a player board.
The player then decides to play either with the standard income of resources or flips the board to choose the character specific income.

Spandau 1780 is played in turns where player earn coins and goods, play and draw cars as well as expand their influence on the game plan.

Each player is presented with a lot of options to choose from:

Expand influence now to gain more income later?
Invest in common wares or luxury goods?
Participate in a military campaign, gain influence with the crown or examine artworks?


Each round there is an auction of a new piece of art. The winning bet determines who starts the round.
For each genuine piece of art there is also a fake one. If a fake one is exposed, it is removed from the game.
At any time every player has to offer one piece of art to be exchanged by a piece from another player. This is a good way to get rid of fake art. But be aware, if exposed the fake art is removed and another piece of art has to be offered immediately.

As soon as a players art collection reaches twelve, the game ends. And only the player with the most genuine pieces wins in the end.

-

What do players like?

The combination of

turn based economy building,
short and long term strategy,
hard choices if to keep cards to play later or expand influence now
and all that just to collect art


Different winning strategies:

collect as many pieces of art as possible or invest resources to find genuine pieces?
expose and remove fakes or trade them secretly?


And last but not least he historical setting

played on a historic map, with many references to people, goods and iconic buildings


-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Set Collection, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Player Powers

name: Deck 'Em: Ancient Dynasties 1900-400 BC
description:
Deck 'Em: Ancient Dynasties is the second board game creation by designer and self-publisher Matthew Toellner. The game features a historically-accurate progression of civilizations and their rulers in the middle east and mediterranean sea regions during the late bronze age and early iron age (1900-400 BC). Game design is inspired by Britannia (board game), Age of Empires (PC games), and YouTube history videos.

FEATURES
Print and play.
Online play via 3rd party tools.
Rules for automated NPC (non-player-civilization) actions!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Area Movement, Network and Route Building, Resource to Move, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Phase Order

name: Захват Реганы (Capture Regana)
description:
Захват Реганы ("Capture Regana") is a game dealing with the invasion of the magical planet Regana by the Empire's "Polaris" troops. Defending the planet are the soldiers and mages of Regana who can use magic. The planet's palm trees help produce the necessary ingredients for their spells, which is why the Empire is invading.

The game comes with:

2 forces of 12 figures (24)
4 palm trees
3 fortifications
2 harvesters
30 cards
2 "checkboxes"
3 dice
playing field
rules


On the invading player's turn they roll the dice, with the number rolled being their total action points. These points are used to move, harvest, and attack. The defender does the same, but they can also use their points to play magic cards.

The objective of the defending forces is to either capture one of the flags from the enemy fortresses or eliminate all 12 invaders. The invaders win if they harvest three palm trees, or size control of the tower of mages, or eliminate all 12 defenders.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Adventure Realms: Solo Mode
description:
It is finally here...SOLO MODE! The player will face off against the Shadow who is trying to collect points, the elemental stones, and spread Darkness throughout the Realms. The Solo Mode is extremely low upkeep while also being quite difficult to beat.

The Shadow will be spreading darkness throughout the realms while also racing through the dungeon to collect the Elemental Stones. If darkness spreads into each realm, the player immediately loses. However, if the player is able to defeat the Shadow's Final Form, then the player immediately wins.
The Solo Mode is only played with the Base Game of Adventure Realms. This only utilizes the base game board and should not be played with the expansion boards.

—description from the publisher

The solo mode is part of "The time trigger" expansion but also sold separately.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Сталинград (Stalingrad)
description: Stalingrad was to be one of Tehnolog's first true wargames. It contained no plastic figures and was a typical hex-and-counter wargame, but with standees instead of counters.

name: Penguin Expedition Team
description:
ペンギンかんそくたい (Penguin Expedition Team) is a co-operative memory game from Japan. Players must identify 8 different kinds of penguins.

The player is a member of an expedition to observe penguins, and studies penguin ecology in Antarctica. But in order to find penguins, observation is only possible in summer. If the player can find all the penguins within the specified number of times, the player wins. Since it is a cooperative game, you can advance the game while consulting with others.

このゲームは協力型の神経衰弱です。
プレイヤーはペンギンを観測する探検隊の一員となり、ペンギンを見つけるため南極大陸でペンギン観測を行います。
規定回数内にすべてのペンギンを見つけることができれば、プレイヤーの勝ちとなります。
協力ゲームなので相談しながら、ゲームを進めることができます。
description by publisher
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Властелин Галактики (Lords of the Galaxy)
description:
Once upon a time, in a galaxy far, far away, raged... no, not Star Wars, but quite ordinary trade showdowns. The galaxy was very tiny (only 4 star systems), the only useful resource was energy, which was used both as fuel for ships and as money.

But there were all kinds of entrepreneurs, adventurers, galactic swindlers and star bandits! And they all offered their services (far from free of charge) to every trading magnate, and when asked “Who are you?”, they modestly lowered their eyes and quietly answered: “Hero!”

The game comes with:

16 Hero Cards
21 Item cards
4 Base Cards
48 Ship mats:
24 Fighters
8 Raiders
8 Transports
8 Cruiser

1 Game Board
2 Dice
2 Sheets of money counters


Players play on a board that is Monopoly-like. However, payers are not restricted to this level, and they may go across the board using the "space" areas in between. Players that land on another player's spot must engage them. They can try their strength, or if they are not so strong, they can try their wit. Players engage in trade and smuggling, have bar encounters, hire sidekicks, attack bases and each other, all in an attempt to accomplish their goal.

To win the game you must do one of the following:

Eliminate all other enemy Heroes
Capture all enemy ships
Have the most money


The game is played for a number of turns decided by the players beforehand, with 8-12 being the norm.
categories: Economic, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Rocket Company
description:
ロケットカンパニー (Rocket Company) is a children's game game from Japan, with simple set collection.

The publisher says:

Flip the cards and complete the rocket!
Flip the cards and let lots of rockets fly.
A rocket is made up of three parts: a top, a tank, and an engine. If the number of tank parts is large, a long rocket can be made. The player who sends the most rockets wins.

The winner is the player who connects rocket parts of different thickness and fires as many rockets as possible. The rules are simple, so even small children can play.

カードをめくってロケットを完成させよう！
カードをめくって、たくさんのロケットを飛ばしましょう。
ロケットは「トップ」「タンク」「エンジン」の３種類からできています。タンク部分の枚数が多いと長いロケットができます。
多くのロケットを飛ばしたプレイヤーが勝ちです。

太さの異なるロケットのパーツを繋げ、なるべくたくさんのロケットを発射させたプレイヤーの勝ちです。
簡単なルールなので、小さいお子さんから遊ぶことができます。
description by publisher
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Darklands: Second Edition
description:
Fight as your ancestors once did to create your own myths and legends!

Darklands is a tabletop skirmish wargame in which YOU command the hosts of man and beast that your ancestors once did for glory, power or simple survival. Fight breathtaking battles on your tabletop with some of the most finest resin miniatures ever created!

What if dragons really flew, in those ancient times, and giants really walked the earth? What if berserkers actually were bear-men, man and bear joined together? What if all of the myths and legends we take for granted were real and our ancestors fought against - and with - creatures and beings and realms we thought were nothing more than the fantasies of our uncivilised selves?

Darklands answers all of those questions for you and more, so take a deep breath and re-create the true history of our world with the Darklands: Second Edition Rules found within this hardback book!
The second edition of Darklands plays much faster than the first edition rules but loses none of the immersiveness and atmosphere of the original. Combat, shooting and sorcery is greatly streamlined but the game's structure is roughly the same - players alternate the activations of their units, performing actions and reactions with them until each unit on the battlefield has activated, at which point the battle hour (what we call a turn) ends and the units that are left steel themselves for another round of combat, shooting and sorcery!
categories: Book, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Ordering, Re-rolling and Locking, Secret Unit Deployment, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Die Crew: Family
description: Die Crew: Family crossed the gameplay of The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine with the setting of The Swiss Family Robinson. Players find themselves stranded on a deserted island and have to find their way around together. Eating, sleeping, making decisions — how will the adventure end?
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trick-taking

name: Dodo Ahoi!
description:
In Dodo, you had to land a wobbly dodo egg safely in a boat — and in Dodo Ahoi! this boat is now setting off on a great journey...but unfortunately no one has secured the load, and now the egg is rolling dangerously fast towards the edge of the boat. Can you save the egg before it hits the water?

Communicate with other players to place the right cards and steer the boat through the open ocean until you find the right island to serve as a resting place for this precious egg.

name: Eナリ (E nari)
description:
Eナリ (E nari) is a party game from japan.

The publisher says:

A rude card game in which the loser of a game of Janken (rock-paper-scissors) carries out the instruction cards on the deck! A big hit during school holidays and after school! Great fun at parties and mixers!

じゃんけんで負けた人が山札に書かれた指示カードを実行する無礼講カードゲーム！学校の休み時間や放課後で大盛り上がり！パーティーや合コンで大爆笑！
description by publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Team-Based Game

name: Einfach Genial 3D
description:
In Einfach Genial 3D, players take turns placing colored domino-style tiles on a game board, scoring for each line of colored symbols that they enlarge. The trick, however, is that a player's score is equal to their worst-scoring color, not their best, so they need to score for all colors instead of specializing in only one or two.

That description will be familiar to anyone who has played the original Ingenious, but Einfach Genial 3D features three-dimensional building blocks that can be stacked, which means you can now place these tiles on one another, opening up a whole new level to the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Safari Roulette
description:
Learn shapes and colours. Choose your animal and try to be the first player to fill all the spaces, by spinning the roulette spinner.

—description from the publisher

name: Chunky Fighters: Akitaku Pelkiki
description: French version of the black ninja. Adds a new character one can pick, who uses various swords and throwing knives to do battle.

name: Chunky Fighters: Josie Paldir
description: Adds a new character one can play, who, in true mime fashion, pantomimes the use of various weapons.

name: Chunky Fighters: Pepita Gore
description: An alien disguised as a school teacher. Adds a new character one can play, who uses school supplies (rulers, pencils) until finally she gives up the facade and whips out her laser gun.

name: Chunky Fighters: Richard Hognard
description: Adds a new character one can play. Mostly a biter, it also uses random junk or pieces of its last meal as weapons.

name: Agents Without a Clue
description:
“Agents without a Clue” is a strategic deduction card game for 3 to 8 players. Players take on the roles of secret Agents trying to find and kill the Ace Agent among them to keep top secret information from getting leaked. The catch is that nobody knows who the Ace Agent is, including the Ace themselves!

The game starts by each player choosing a character to be their secret Agent; the characters that are available are random each game, as there are a total of 17 but each player only gets to choose from two and will discard one. Each character's envelope contains a unique Rank card, a unique Signature Ability card, and a Signature Gun card. The player with the highest Rank will, at the end of the game, be the Ace Agent; but which character has the highest Rank is random each game! Higher ranked Agents will also have more powerful abilities, but are more likely to be the Ace Agent! Any player who is not the Ace Agent will instead be a Rookie. The deck of equipment cards is then drafted amongst all players to give them a starting hand, but do they not play them right away. They must be careful which cards they keep, because they'll have to use them all before the game ends!

With game setup complete, players then take turns, one at a time, playing a single card's effect from their hand. These can be guns for shooting each other or other utility items for defense, deduction, or even adjusting the Rank of other players. Most cards have more than one effect, but you must choose one to play out. Players only have a single hit point, so they must be careful to keep enough defense cards on them! If a player dies from being shot, their turns are skipped unless they are revived. Players will use the cards at their disposal to figure out or influence who the Ace Agent is and act accordingly to achieve their goal. While characters' Signature Ability cards are super powerful, they also give away a player's identity and should be held onto until the right time.

The goal of the game for the Ace Agent is to have either the highest ranking Rookie be dead or more than one Rookie be dead (even if the Ace himself is dead). The Rookies' goal is to work together to kill the Ace Agent without accidentally fulfilling his goal for him. The end of the game occurs after all players pass their turn in a row (from being either dead or out of cards); upon which all character's ranks are publicly revealed to determine who the Ace Agent is and whether the Ace Agent or the Rookies succeeded.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Multi-Use Cards, Passed Action Token, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Armored Genesis Mospeda: Valkyrie vs Regios
description:
Armored Genesis Mospeda: Valkyrie versus Regios is the 2nd edition of Super Dimensional Fortress Macross: Minmay Attack. It includes all the previous material with the addition of Mospeda units.

The game is a doujin (fan-produced) game that was only sold at Japanese game shows. It was not made for the general public. To order, you had to place an order in advance. The game would then be made, and you would pick it up at the show. The game requires assembly.

This game reproduces the fleet battles that were fought in the world of “The Super Dimensional Fortress Macross”. It mainly deals with the First Macross War. In addition, the ships from the anime show Mospeda have been added to the game, so the players can do some Robotech battles between the Zentraedi and Hunter's expeditionary forces.

The game is a hex-and-counter wargame, typical of many wargame types, with ZOC's and CRT's. It comes with a map, counters that need mounting, player aids, and unit data sheets.

The sequence of play is:

Phase 1: Special Weapon/Special Action Declaration
Phase 2: Initiative Decision
Phase 3: Movement Phase
Phase 4: Stealth/Dimensional Movement
Phase 5: Air Operations
Phase 6: Bombardment/Missile Attack
Phase 7: Special Weapon Judgment/Special Action Execution

There are units for Zentraedi, Maltrandi, UN Spacy, and Mospeda.

The game required assembly of the counters. Players will also need to find a hex map to play on (although a small A4 map is included (and it can be photocopied many times to create your map).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table
publishers: Hitachi Mito Game Club (a.k.a. Mr. Nambu and Prince Mito)

name: Irritable Vowels
description: Players create words using consonants on cards combined with vowels on an electronic die that changes (rolls) on its own. A D6 decides how the consonant will be used and you collect cards when submitting a successful word.

name: Сокровища пирамид (Treasures of the Pyramid)
description:
For thousands of years, the pyramids of Egypt have kept their secrets, and throughout this time, pyramid robbers have been trying to get to the countless treasures of ancient kings.

Desperate daredevils are not deterred by the curses of the pharaohs, death traps and ruthless guardians of the pyramids - revived mummies. And his brother, a treasure hunter, who met in the labyrinth of the tomb, will not hesitate to put a bullet in his hapless colleague. In short, adventures and dangers, victories and disappointments are waiting for you, friends!

—description from the back of the box (translated)
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pieces as Map

name: Mortal Combat
description:
Mortal Combat was a Childrens game of dexterity whereby each side was trying to eliminate each other's soldiers.

The game came in two larger boxed sets and two mini sets. The contents of each "set" were:

Larger boxes:
-8 figures
-1 crossbow firing device.
-1 cannon firing device
-1 catapult firing device
-projectiles
-Gates and wall pieces
-a spinner
-one page of rules

Even the box was needed because it was used to measure movement of troops and distances between the combatants.

Each player sets up their forces two box lengths apart. Both sides setup their castle and position their four soldiers and firing device.

A turn begins with both players spinning the spinner, with the high side shooting first that turn. A soldier needs to be within 3 centimeters to be able to fire a device. Both sides take turns shooting at their opponent. Each soldier that is struck, even by ricochet, is out. Players can also forfeit shooting and instead advance one of their soldiers, and the firing device next to them, one box length (to get the weapons closer). A cannon or crossbow can only be fired every three shots.

The first player to knock out all their opponent's soldiers wins. There are additional rules to continue the game as a campaign, which ends when the opposing player has no room left to deploy.

This game would later inspire the games Emperor 1 and 2.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: 7 футов под килем (7 Feet Under Keel)
description:
The sea... Distant countries, exotic ports, calms and storms.
Weary ships, that have crossed the seas and oceans more than once, are heading to their native shores. And how many more dangers and adventures lie ahead! Valuable cargo is waiting in a distant port. We need to hurry! Haul loose the mooring lines! Weigh anchor! Set a course for adventure! The journey takes place on a real map of the world with the designation of seas, ports, and countries. Players act as captains of sea transport ships. Their task is to deliver valuable cargo to its destination...

—description from the back of the box (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gump Jsme dvojka
description:
A quick card game with simple rules that still challenge you to think through each move.
Players aim to pair up all the good characters and their animals to ensure no one is left alone. Cleverly connect the pairs, strategically discard them from your hand to be the first with no cards left. But beware of the wicked dog owner who might suddenly appear and thwart your plans!

—description from the publisher

Rychlá karetní hra, která má jednoduchá pravidla, ale přesto vás donutí přemýšlet nad každým tahem.
Hráči se snaží dostat všechny dobré postavy z filmu a jejich zvířata k sobě, aby nikdo nebyl sám. Chytře propojujte dvojice, odkládejte je z ruky pryč tak, aby vám jako prvnímu nezůstala žádná karta v ruce. A pozor na zlého pána, který se může znenadání objevit a vaše plány zhatit!

—description from the publisher (Czech)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 湿地生存法则 (Wetland Survive Rule)
description: The Wetland Survive Rule is an ecological puzzle pure hand-painted science popular science game jointly planned and developed by Shanghai Natural Museum and SAEC. The crisscrossed wetlands nourish countless creatures, and all kinds of creatures perform their respective functions in the wetlands, forming a web of life and maintaining the ecological balance of the wetland. In this game, players can be predated by ecological principles, carry out ecological investigations, and use special skill to increase moisture.Diversity of species to build a more stable and harmonious wetland ecosystem.

name: Incarnation
description: Based on the domestic animation Intellectual Property "Incarnation" as the background production of a support 1-5 people card library building game. You will play as a leader of the hunting team, form your own team, and lead the hunters to the dangerous ground, collect supplies, fight with the spinal poison and the eating pole beast, and fight for the survival of the lighthouse!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Вторжение (Invasion)
description:
Вторжение ("Invasion") is a game by Zvezda. It is a wargame in which two sides are trying to take out each other's HQ unit. The game is entirely land-based, and there are no aircraft. However, there is an expansion that can be added for this.

The game includes:

1 map
2 sprues, each with:
2 Tanks
2 APC
2 Self Propelled Artillery
1 Truck
8 Soldiers
1 HQ

1 die
rules


The game is a precursor to their "ATAKA" game.

—user summary

name: Воздушный Бой (Air Combat)
description:
Воздушный Бой ("Air Combat") is a standalone game by Zvezda that deals with modern air combat involving jets and helicopters. The game can also be used as an expansion for Zvezda's Invasion game.

The game comes with:

1 map
6 runways
3 sheets of air defense counters
2 sprues, each with:
8 helicopters
8 jet fighters, fighter-bombers, tactical bombers, and interceptors

1 die
rules


This was a precursor to Zvezda's game "Ataka."

—user summary

name: Licz dobrze, bobrze!
description:
Players compete to build dams as beaver families. Spin the arrow that shows a log's length. You don't like the result? Spin it again. But there's a chance your beaver will return empty-handed.

Place the log on the construction site. Each piece of wood has its length marked on it, either as a numeral, or a number of knots on the other side. Match the length of the logs with the width of the river using simple maths and counting to 10.

For a greater challenge, combine the river boards to build dams counting up to 20.

—description from the designer

name: Trivial Pursuit DPM edition
description: Trivial Pursuit, tank-themed: This edition was published by the Deutsches Panzermuseum in Munster (German tank museum, Munster). It has 330 qustions to the 6 themes tank technology, anti-tank combat, tanks in pop culture, personalities, WWII tanks, cold war and modern tanks.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Chemical Mind
description: The players have to put the periodic element cards from their hand to the table in line.

name: Battleport
description:
The duel between 2 computer scientists, where your goal is to unplug your opponent's server before he unplugs yours!

First, players split the board in half to separate playfields and secretly plug in 5 cables however they like. Then take turns, playing one of 3 cards they have in hand at the same time. Then they compare whose card is of a higher power. The player with higher power subtracts the power of their opponent's card and then chooses which ports on the grid should be unplugged. The other player doesn't unplug cables but instead uses the ability of the card they played. Then both discard their cards, draw a new card and play continues in the same way until one player doesn't have any more cables.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Single Loser Game

name: Rumors of Gold: Outlaw
description:
Operating outside the law, they must avoid or bribe the sheriff to make a living.

An expert difficulty variant setup and gameplay card for Rumors of Gold, that adds a Sheriff die, which can affect your dig.
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Türmen
description: On your turn, throw the color die and take a wooden piece of the same color and put it onto already placed ones constructing a stack. A player looses the game if the stack crashes. If the last piece is added and the stack still didn't crash, all players win.

name: Stalingrad 1942 (Campaigns in Europe Volume 2)
description:
Campaigns in Europe (CIE) is a two-player series of games focused on campaign scenarios at the division/corps level. The system uses the same maps as War in Europe (WIE), with updated graphics and a more detailed terrain analysis. The counters have been upgraded and are presented with historical identifications. The game system utilizes a Move/Fight, Fight/Move sequence of play to portray simply doctrinal differences among contending armed forces. It also utilizes headquarters units to project logistics and combat support capabilities.

Stalingrad 1942 covers the German offensive to the Caucasus and Stalingrad. It ends at the point where the Soviets launched Operation Uranus, their Stalingrad counteroffensive.

Each game turn (GT) represents around one week in clear weather and two weeks in mud and snow game turns. Each hex represents 20 miles (32.5 km) across. German, Finnish, and Western Allied units are shown mostly as division-sized units, with Soviet and Axis Allied units depicted as corps.

name: Italian Campaign 1943-44 (Campaign in Europe Volume 3)
description:
Campaigns in Europe (CIE) is a two-player series of games focused on campaign scenarios at the division/corps level. The system uses the same maps as War in Europe (WIE), with updated graphics and a more detailed terrain analysis. The counters have been upgraded and are presented with historical identifications. The game system utilizes a Move/Fight, Fight/Move sequence of play to portray simply doctrinal differences among contending armed forces. It also utilizes headquarters units to project logistics and combat support capabilities.

Italian Campaign covers the Italian campaign, from the Allied invasion of Sicily through the Anzio campaign.

Each game turn (GT) represents around one week in clear weather and two weeks in mud and snow game turns. Each hex represents 20 miles (32.5 km) across. German, Finnish, and Western Allied units are shown mostly as division-sized units, with Soviet and Axis Allied units depicted as corps.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: D-Day to The Rhine 1944 (Campaign in Europe Volume 4)
description:
Campaigns in Europe (CIE) is a two-player series of games focused on campaign scenarios at the division/corps level. The system uses the same maps as War in Europe (WIE), with updated graphics and a more detailed terrain analysis. The counters have been upgraded and are presented with historical identifications. The game system utilizes a Move/Fight, Fight/Move sequence of play to portray simply doctrinal differences among contending armed forces. It also utilizes headquarters units to project logistics and combat support capabilities.

D-Day to the Rhine covers the campaign in France, from after the Allied landings at Normandy through the drive to the Rhine. It ends at the completion of Operation Market-Garden.
