Each game turn (GT) represents around one week in clear weather and two weeks in mud and snow game turns. Each hex represents 20 miles (32.5 km) across. German, Finnish, and Western Allied units are shown mostly as division-sized units, with Soviet and Axis Allied units depicted as corps.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: 13 Moons
description:
Embark on a celestial journey with 13 Moons, a beautiful card-matching game that blends strategy with the beauty of lunar phases.

This cozy card game encourages you to connect with the ever-changing face of the moon.

In 13 Moons, players collect points by arranging sets of moon phases and special lunar events. The game's mechanics ensure a dynamic and ever-evolving experience.

What sets 13 Moons apart is its unique tie to reality – the game rewards players for aligning their strategies with the actual moon's position on the day of play. Extra points are bestowed upon those who synchronize their in-game moves with the real-life lunar calendar, adding an extra layer of connections with one of our most beloved celestial bodies: The Moon!

Whoever reaches 354 points first wins. Why 354? Because that's the number of days in a lunar year!

—description from the designer

name: Commanders at War: Stalingrad – Cauldron of Death
description:
Commanders at War: Stalingrad - Cauldron of Death is an operational-level wargame in the “Commanders at War” solitaire book wargame series.
The player controls the German 6th Army during Case Blue, the 1942 Eastern Front offensive attempting to reach Russia’s coveted oil-rich region. Standing in the way is the industrial city on the Volga River - Stalingrad. The stage is set for one of the most important and brutal battles in history.
Players get a chance to recreate the titanic clash between Germany and the Soviet Union in a dynamic solitaire wargame with a challenging enemy bot opponent. Only two D6 dice are required with minimal rolling; one roll resolves attack, defense, and potential events. Simple rules allow players to concentrate on gameplay while enjoying a deep and engaging solitaire operational wargaming experience.
Never in the history of warfare has there been so many great commanders fighting in a global war. Masters of warfare, strategy and tactics.
The Commanders at War series gives players a streamlined and quick-playing solitaire wargame to recreate and rewrite history from the perspective of operational-level tacticians during the most important battles of WWII.

Features:
Game Features
Unit Scale – Division
Map – Hexagonal. One hex = 10 km.
Turns – Abstracted-Weekly
Playing Time – 60-90 Minutes
Players – One (Solitaire Play)
Complexity - Medium
Dynamic enemy Bot system.
The player sets up units freely west of the Don.
Command Orders allow for the use of limited specific actions at any time.
Comprehensive Play Aid with Quick References.
Easy to follow Bot Play Aid.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: BB Blast
description:
BB Blast is a dynamic, print and play board game that transports players into the heart of intense airsoft battles. With 1 v 1 or 2 v 2 fast-paced matches, players choose their class—Light, Medium, or Heavy—dictating their movement speed and points for weapons and items. Dive into the action as you strategically equip yourself with airsoft weapons, including Pistols, Shotguns, Submachine Guns, Snipers, and Machine Guns, along with tactical items like Rubber Throwing Knives, Grenades, Trip Wires, and Riot Shields.

This game really stands out with its engaging and accessible gameplay suitable for all ages. The game is designed to keep players thinking critically, offering a quick 5-15 minute average playing time, allowing you to jump right into the action whenever the gaming mood strikes. What sets BB Blast apart is the fusion of strategy, customization, and the thrill of airsoft battles, delivering a unique board game experience.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, King of the Hill, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Vinyl: Totally Awesome 80's
description:
This version of Vinyl adds some new mechanics to the game. We have opened up the Trade Counter. You will now be able to trade unwanted or low-value records in to gain attributes that you may use in later turns.

Collection rewards have been reduced to max out 4. The lower end will now be 2 albums in a small collection and this will increase the number of records that a player may retire during the game. In addition, the Extended Play format and the Long Play format have been added as attributes and these albums can provide a bonus to your collections for end game scoring. There is still more, however.

We have also added 12 new Loyalty Cards which will help to bolster your end game scoring even further. Taking all of this into account that is over 150 new components added to the game!

We will also introduce gameplay with 5 Genres in play instead of 4. This will give players a different style of game in this expansion. There are 6 Genres added so that players can choose which 5 Genres they would like to play with.

—description from the publisher

name: Vinyl: British Invasion
description: Vinyl: British Invasion builds on the original game of Vinyl and introduces the Listening Booth and singles (aka 45s). Historically, 45s were purchased to initially and eventually encouraged buyers to acquire the associated LP album or even another album from the band. In BI, players can acquire 45s by matching the band icon. Each 45 has an "A-side" with locked attributes that can be unlocked at the Listening Booth. At the Listening Booth, players will discard a magazine card with one matching icon to flip the 45 to its "B-side" giving the player more points and the opportunity to use the 45 to acquire LPs with similar attributes in future rounds.

name: Simplicissimus
description:
Memory-style game to build Latin-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Latin words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun. The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

name: Guilds of Symrania
description:
The King of Symrania is dead and his successor must be chosen! As a member of one of the most reputable noble families of the kingdom, your mission is now to get workers and resources from the guilds that control each of the cities to expand your influency. Form an army of mercenaries, control the markets, use magic or fill your gold reserves and obtain resources. Only one of the candidates to the throne will win the crown!

In Guilds of Symrania the objective is to be the player with the most victory points when at least one of the two players has exceeded 7 points at the end of a round. Each player will have a board with a map of the kingdom with twelve cities, each associated with a numerical value between 1 and 12. In each turn, the active player will roll two dice and all players can receive benefits from the cities. Each player can decide whether to add the two dice together (obtains resources) or use them separately (obtains workers).

Guilds of Symrania is a quick-to-learn, quick-to-play roll and write game using the core " roll a dice, everyone get stuff" mechanism. It’s also a strategic engine builder using a player sheet with all the workers and resources that you can get an add on it. How the cities are placed at the beginning of the game, the resources you get and the order you do have interesting implications in development of game beside the strategy you take: quick and explosive gains, low luck and steady income or big end-game combos to launch from last to first or a mix-and-match approach.

Guilds of Symrania is “an easy to play but difficult to domain” game that you can enjoy from the first game in solitaire mode or multiplayer.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Soy Battle
description:
Soy Battle is a simple and fast-playing party game for 2 to 4 players with intuitive, dynamic and engaging game mechanics. The goal is to have a sushi all-you-can-eat experience using your chopsticks, and whoever eats the most wins!

Six randomly selected numbered pieces of sushi are placed on the game table. The roll of the dice determines which piece is to be picked up. As you see the result of the roll a challenge of skill and speed between the players begins to pick up the correct piece using chopsticks.

Hands forbidden at the table!

Once a player firmly holds the piece of sushi between his/hers/their chopsticks he/she/they can place it on the dunking saucer in front of him/her/them. The sushi piece is not safe yet, it will only be safe once it is placed on the little boat. Thet's because a possible outcome of the dice will see diners competing for the sushi present on the saucers. The sushi will be safe after winning a second piece, thus moving the previous sushi from the saucer onto the small boat.

Every time a piece of sushi is replaced in the center, and dice are rolled until all the pieces are picked up. The winner is the player who, by adding up the numbers on the conquered sushi pieces, gets the highest score.

—description from the publisher

name: Opportunity
description:
In 2004, the American rover Opportunity landed on Mars. The mission to search for signs of life on the planet was expected to last 3 months. Instead, because of luck and mission ingenuity, Opportunity continued for more than 14 years. She and her twin rover Spirit helped discover some of the first clear signs of ancient water on Mars and reinvigorated exploration of the red planet.

Opportunity is a fast-playing solo strategy game that gives you the chance to control the mission yourself. How successful will you be?

You mission: Move point-to-point across Mars. Make as many Discoveries as you can. Keep going for as long as you can. Score as high as you can.

You'll need: One deck of poker cards and two different colored six-sided (d6) dice (one for rolling, the other as a game piece).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Medang: Stupa Expansion
description: Six additional tiles. Use randomly two of them and place them below the outer temples. When a player completes a column with a stupa tile, he gets the tile's reward.

name: Fun Fact Trivia Deck: Party Mix
description:
The Fun Fact Trivia Deck (Party Mix Edition) is a wildly entertaining twist on trivia. Tailored for curious minds aged 8 and up, this game packs a punch with 100 cards of mind-bending questions, ranging from death-defying facts to cosmic curiosities. With a mix of multiple choice and true/false, it's a laugh-out-loud learning experience that's perfect for any gathering, designed to challenge, educate, and amuse in equal measure. Whether it's family game night or a party with pals, this deck promises a hilariously nerdy good time.

—description from the publisher

name: The City of Kings: Earthshaker Costume Promo
description:
A promotional card originally released during The City of Games festival in 2023.

This promo introduces a new equipment card to the game and is part of the 'Costume Pack' of promotional cards.

Equipping this item will increase both attack and health, making it a very powerful item.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Drunk On Mars
description:
Embark on the treacherous journey to complete the colonization of Mars, getting it ready for the billionaire tourists who will soon be arriving. Without food or water and only a massive stash of alcohol to stay alive, you must navigate these completely sauced astronauts as they each race to conquer their mission before launching back to Earth.

Players are each dealt 3 task cards and 5 cards from the deck. Each player must acquire the necessary resource cards to successfully complete their (sometimes mindless) tasks. The first player to complete all their tasks wins! Beware of unruly obstacles like drawing a Passed Out card, keeping you from completing your mission. But fear not worthy space traveler, the Rocket Rope Ride card or a lucky roll of the dice will definitely help sober up your drunken astronaut.

And nobody likes to drink alone, so watch out for sneaky fellow astronauts getting you drunk and swiping your resources to complete their tasks before you! Drunk cards can be an advantage to you when played against another opponent. Playing matching Drunk cards affords players the opportunity to swipe a resource card or a card from their opponent's hand.

Additionally, players can experience other challenges along the way with skip, double skip, and shuffle the deck cards.

*Please note: Drinking is not required or part of the gameplay. However, due to the nature of the game we put the age requirement as 21+ yrs.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Space Exploration

name: Oathsworn: Into the Deepwood – Dennis the Geek Ally
description:
The Promo Card shows Dennis of the YouTube channel staygeeky

Dennis The Geek

Might: 1 red dice
Defense: 4

Ability: Stay Geeky - Whenever you critial, one other character may Battleflow one card once.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: The Big Baseball Pennant
description:
This is a baseball boardgame from Hobby Japan. It features cards from the teams in Japan.

Information about the team players is on each card, and these are used to determine the results of play. Careful organization of the team players is required to achieve the best results.

name: Staedte Memo
description:
A variant of memory. There are 31 pairs of square tiles, each with a picture of a Russian geographic denomination (mostly cities). One card is subtitled in Russian (using the Cyrillic alphabet), the corresponding tile with the German translation (not: transcription). In addition, there is one pair of tiles with the logo of the publisher and another one with "Russisch kommt!" (The Russian language is coming).
The educational aim of the game is to learn the Russian alphabet.

name: Firesiege: Ballad of Fire
description:
In the epic saga of "Ballad of Fire," an expansion of Firesiege, players confront raging flames engulfing the city of Medda. As if the inferno weren't challenging enough, the fearsome Zagal, deploys grotesque creatures to swarm the citadel in an attempt to conquer it, the Dharn. The fate of the city lies squarely in the hands of the players as they resist the siege and reclaim control over the menacing sand creatures.

This game version introduces several enhancements to the original core set:
Joining the legion of Valkun is a new troop – the Valkun archers.
With formidable prowess from a distance, they lack the strength to withstand formidable foes like the queens but make up for it with their deadly accuracy in dispatching enemies from afar.

Additional command tiles, tokens, including flames and Dharn tokens, bombs, and a pivotal new element – a new Hero!

Meet Nakra, the mysterious mercenary. Despite not being a Valkun, Nakra's enigmatic origins only add to his allure. Rescued by Norad, he defies the typical mercenary code by fighting not out of obligation but gratitude, aligning his efforts with the player's commands in the resistance against the Skreel horde within the battle-scarred streets of Medda.

-description from publisher

name: インチキはナシ (Inchiki ha Nashi)
description:
インチキはナシ (Inchiki ha Nashi) is a game from Japan about pears. In Japan, Ichikawa City is the primary producer of pears, and 'Nashi' is a particular brand, so the game title is a pun on the two words, and means something like 'no fakes'. In this game, players try to eliminate the cards in their hand by spotting lies. A battle of wits between the pears and the ants to decide who wins.

The publisher says:
A must for pear lovers! The first local card game of Ichikawa City, Chiba Prefecture, the number one pear producer!

You can cheat to win! But if they spot you're cheating...
A heated battle of wits where the game between the pears and ants decides who wins!

The cards have information about pears, so there is an educational element where you can learn the benefits of pears from the trivia while playing! The pear characters are Kosui, Toyosui, Niitaka and Akizuki, four varieties that are commonly harvested in Ichikawa City.

As the cute illustrations show, this is a game that can be enjoyed by children from early primary schools age.

梨好き必見！梨の生産量第1位・千葉県市川市のご当地カードゲーム第1弾！

勝つためにインチキしてもOK！ただしインチキを見抜かれたら・・・。
梨（ナシ）と蟻（アリ）との駆け引きが勝敗を決める白熱の心理戦ゲーム

カードには梨にまつわる雑学が書かれており、遊びながら効能が身に付く知育の要素があります
梨のキャラクターは市川市でよく取れる品種の幸水、豊水、新高、秋月の４品種
可愛いイラストが示すように、小学校低学年からお楽しみいただけるゲームです
千葉県市川市の地域ブランド「市川のなし」商標入りご当地ゲーム！トランプのダウトのように嘘を見抜きながら手札をなくしていくカードゲーム。
description by publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Farming, Trivia
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Singing

name: The Butterfly Collector
description:
You wake up to the sound of a clock striking midnight.
Its dark.
Your head aches.
All you remember from the night before is dancing in a nightclub with a beautiful tall dark haired stranger.
You lean over and put on the lamp, look around and find yourself in a small locked room.
The room only has a single bed, side table with a lamp, wall clock, backpack and notebook and pen lying on the floor besides the bed.
The only way out of the room is through the door which has a padlock on it.
You need to find a key.

This is a pick up and play, solo, horror, choose your own adventure card game. The rules are explained as you play the game. In order to win the game, you need to escape from the cabin before time runs out at dawn. Time is tracked by throwing a dice and moving down a time track on a card, before reading each card. You will either win by escaping from the cabin or lose when time runs out. Your decisions will either have a good outcome or a bad outcome which could suddenly end your game.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Print & Play

name: おもんぱかる (omompakaru)
description:
おもんぱかる (omompakaru) is a co-operative word game from Japan. Players use cards with specific questions to reach an understanding of the secret word. If everybody agrees they have made the same association, they declare what they are thinking. If any player is thinking of something different, everybody loses that round.

All the cards, the theme cards and the question cards, are written in Japanese and English.

An example goes like this:

Subject card [animal].
Mr A: Clue card "How many letters*? → "Two letters." (*kana)
Mr B: Clue card "What is your weak point? → "Monkey"
Mr C: "Ah, okay."
ABD: "Shall we go then?"
Mr C: "Let's go! That one, eh, that one?"
ABCD: "Se-no*." (*Japanese cry of enthusiasm!)
ACD: 'Dog' = associated with dogs and monkeys
B: "Crab" = associated with the Monkey-Crab War
-Challenge failure! -A: 'I'm not a good player!'

事例：お題カード【動物】
Aさん：ヒントカード【何文字？】→「２文字」
Bくん：ヒントカード【苦手なものは？】→「さるで」
Cさん：「あーわかった」
ABD：「じゃあいく？」
Cさん：「いこう！あれだよね、え、あれだよね？」
ABCD「せーの」
ACD：「いぬ」＝犬猿の仲から連想
B：「かに」＝さるかに合戦から連想
−チャレンジ失敗！−
description by user
categories: Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Paper Nomads
description:
Paper Nomads is a nomadic adventure game.

Use your shepherds to collect sheep, goats, and camels to add to your herds and protect them. Trade with other players or raid their vulnerable herds to build your own as you lead your Bedouin tribe and trade your herds to achieve five improvements to your camp. The first player to complete all five improvements to their camp wins the game.

-description from designer

name: STAKD Elite
description:
Elevate your gaming experience to new heights with STAKD Elite! This premium version introduces an advanced level of strategy, challenging players with the inclusion of an exclusive game piece that demands expert-level skills.

As in STAKD, players add and stack pieces to the base until the last piece that can be placed has been played. Introducing the Blue Bomber game piece in the Elite version empowers players to strategically neutralize segments of the play field vertically as well as horizontally.

Engage in thrilling challenges by strategically positioning these formidable barriers, adding a dynamic layer of gameplay that demands both foresight and tactical prowess.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination, Stacking and Balancing, Take That

name: Киберпанк-2 Битвы в стальных пещерах (Cyberpunk 2: Battles in the Steel Caverns)
description:
Cyberpunk 2 is a new version of the previous game.

This is a game about cyborg battles and gathering raw materials in the dystopian distant future. Stylish décor (a dim dump field lined with a variety of obstacles and containers), miniatures of bipedal cyborgs and six-legged zhucybers. Real shooting with plastic shots, and the damaged parts of the cyborgs' bodies are removed, respectively limiting their capabilities; Thus, the increased firepower of bipedal modifications is compensated by reduced survivability. There are many different finds on the field, and cyborgs can also have different specializations, whether it's assault or, for example, electronic warfare.

—user summary

name: Киберпанк-3 Засада на UNL-2 (Cyberpunk 3: Ambush on UNL-2)
description:
This is the third edition of the Cyberpunk game.

The game is about cyborg battles and gathering raw materials in the dystopian distant future. Scenery (a dim dump field lined with a variety of obstacles and containers), miniatures of bipedal cyborgs and six-legged zhucybers. Real shooting with plastic shots, and the damaged parts of the cyborgs' bodies are removed, respectively limiting their capabilities; Thus, the increased firepower of bipedal modifications is compensated by reduced survivability. There are many different finds on the field, and cyborgs can also have different specializations, whether it's assault or, for example, electronic warfare.

—user summary

name: Shrinkopolis
description:
Humanity has found a solution to solve global warming, overpopulation, and hunger: they made all people tiny! We have saved the planet, but now we have to survive in a giant room, full of challenges. Lead your tiny community to victory by building the most awesome shrink town!

Shrinkopolis is a card drafting resource management tile-placement game for 1-4 players and 15 - 40 minutes.

On your turn, draft two adjacent cards (a city card and a reward card) from the circular offer. Place one to expand your city and gather resource dice by creating connections with already placed cards. Then, optionally spend a specific die to get a reward card of the same color from the common or personal supply. Collecting different animals gives you cute meeples to share other players´ resources. Getting useful tools allows you to manipulate with resource dice. Build sets of the same type of cards to unlock even better actions and receive more points.

After 6 rounds, tally up all points earned from reward cards and public and personal goals, and whoever has the most points wins and earns the Shrinkopolis title!

-description from designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Professional Wrestling
description:
This is a card game from Tsukuda. Each player uses their cards to try to assault their opponent and attempt to pin them. Players can respond by using one of their counter cards. the assault-defense system can go back and forth. The person to pin their opponent wins.

Game comes with:
-100 cards
-game board
-rules

name: Tiere im Weltall
description:
You need 3 Animal Astronauts of the same kind or three astronauts with the same background color to get stars. Whoever has the most stars wins.

Setup:
All tiles are shuffled in the middle and each player gets 3 face up in front of him.

Gameplay:
During your turn you can take one of the tiles in the middle (either face up or down) and switch it with one of your 3 starting tiles. Put them in front of you face up, others can take them later, but you can’t anymore during this round.
If you manage to get 3 of a kind you get a star and 3 new tiles for the next round.
The game ends when all 12 stars are distributed

name: Age of Battles
description:
This is Zvezda's rulebook for fighting ancient to medieval battles using the Art of Tactic system.

In order to play the game, you require bases for your troops. Each base contains and identification flag and a data card that is used when moving, fighting, or checking moral during the game.

Most of the Zvezda boxed Art of Tactic sets include figures, bases, data cards, and rules. This book was sold separately. It came with a car protractor and data cards.

name: День вторжения (Invasion Day)
description:
Earth's Space Tracking Stations have detected several giant man-made space objects in the moon's shadow. Specially created international units of COBRA are preparing to welcome the intruders.

COBRA fighters not only intercept alien scouts, but also collect and study alien artifacts, creating their own samples of offensive weapons and defense systems based on them. Will the brave defenders of Earth have enough time and strength to prevent an attempted alien invasion? Time is counting down!

—description from the publisher

name: Империя (Empire)
description:
Империя ("Empire") is a conquest and building game, much like Risk and Civilization, with only two pages of rules.

The map is divided into territories. Each territory has the portrait of its dictator on it along with a gold symbol for how much income it gives, and symbols for the units it can recruit.

—user summary

The turn begins with a roll of the dice to check for rebellion. If it is "6", then some province has rebelled. Rolling a pair of dice indicates its number.

Next, players take turns buying armies with the available money at approved ancient Spartan rates, placing them in the provinces where they are hired.

Then they begin to move armies to neighboring provinces for conquest. Armies are led by a general. Without it, it is not an army, but a collection of recruits who cannot fight on their own but are able to simply move around. Most often, as conscripts in the direction of the "military registration and enlistment office", that is, the commander. And only this "head" (and this is what a commander looks like) is able to unite forces into an army and lead into battle. Since each side has only four generals, no empire can afford more than four directions for simultaneous aggression.

When entering someone else's territory, a battle begins. Even neutral countries at the beginning of the game snap back very painfully. So, there is no easy loot in the game.

In the mechanics of combat, the dice has a great influence as a generator of battle randomness. First, both sides play rock-paper-scissors, choosing a value between 1 and 6. When announcing the values, refer to the "Battle Scheme" in the center of the map.

The winner gets the right to an additional roll of the dice in the battle. The second additional roll of the dice is played in the same way. Next, each player calculates the strength of his army (infantry = 1, cavalry = 2, etc.), adds the main roll of the dice and, if he wins an additional roll, also its value. The opponent does the same, after which the obtained values are compared. The result of the battle is described in the "Battle Table".

I would like to note that the winner, no matter how huge the advantage, always loses at least one infantryman. Or an analogue of his power if the attacker does not have infantry. War requires sacrifices, even if it is "small and victorious."

But on the other hand, a pleasant surprise awaits the invader. Lovers of "robbing cows", rejoice! A roll of the dice is used to determine how many coins have been requisitioned from the undoubtedly grateful population to the liberator. And then there's the ODN fee, ugh, the tax will be collected from this province at the beginning of the next turn. In general, war is a profitable business here. True, if not for the rivals, who are probably of the same opinion.

Then the next player attacks, and so on.

From time to time, successful expansion is disrupted by unfortunate uprisings in the rear, often leading to the "breakaway" of the province from the empire. The restoration of constitutional order takes time for the transfer of troops and breaks plans for the conquest of peace. Plundering a newly enslaved province, as an easy form of compensation for the inconvenience caused, sweetens the "bitter pill" of losing momentum.

The turn ends, and it repeats all over again. (end of article)

The game comes with numerous miniatures for the infantry, cavalry, elephants, chariots, ships, and fortifications.

—description from the designer (translated)

name: Nemesis Collectible Card Game
description:
Nemesis CCG is a two-player dueling card game where each player builds a team of champions to fight against their opponent’s team of champions in a winner-take-all battle! Assemble your Team, Build your Deck, and Crush your enemy. The first Player to defeat all of their opponent’s champions wins the game!

Assemble your Team -- Choose 3 or more Characters from up to 20 original characters to create your unique Team of champions. Nemesis CCG's Rank Card system means there are literally BILLIONS of unique team combinations.

Build your Deck -- Build your custom deck around the Characters that you have chosen. Each Character has five unique Ability Cards. You can further customize your deck by incorporating S.T.A.R. Cards - 18 Standard Tactics And Resources Cards that any Character can use.

Crush Your Enemy -- Each turn, use the cards in your hand to have your Characters launch attacks against the opponent team. Once all of the opposing Characters have been defeated, you win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction

name: Last Heards
description:
Last Heard is a game centered around dark humor and is about having an eye for the morbidly funny aspect of death and disaster.

It’s a variation on the idea of the last words someone speaks before they die: Last Heards are the last words someone hears before they go to that big mansion in the sky.
Players of Last Heards make combinations between Text Cards (containing a quote of the last words someone hears before they bump off) and a Photo Card, depicting the lethal situation that led to their unfortunate end.

An impartial referee (known as “The Executioner”) decides which combination between Text Card and Photo Card wins the round.
Last Heard is also a board game. The player who wins the round, throws a dice and moves forward on the board. A surprising feature of Last Heards is that the player who reaches the finish first, also wins the game.
The playing board features “Verdict” cards. A player who lands on a “Verdict Square” on the game board, has to pick a Verdict Card and vill follow ze instructions on ze card. Will you be the first one the reach the finish?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mexico (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: Unofficial user-created map of Mexico and ticket cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management

name: Spider-Man: Spider Sense
description:
Similar to:

Happy Feet Two: Hold on Erik
Hold On Scooby-Doo
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: BandiPunto
description:
In a plastic suitcase, there are 5 dice, 32 cards and some chips (points). Each player starts with 10 points of life. By rolling special dice showing gangsters and the loot you try to lower the points of your opponents or to get the loot. Each player starts with 3 cards and may play one in addition to their die roll. If you don't succeed in lowering or getting points you draw a card as well. A player with no pints left is eliminated. You win if you get the loot or are the last man standing.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Take That

name: Øresund Runt (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Sweden and Denmark are so close yet so far apart, so alike yet so different. The neighbouring countries are separated by Øresund, a strait 118 kilometers in length. It is crossed in the north by ferries and in the south by the Øresund bridge, connecting the rail networks of the two countries and allowing Swedes and Danes alike to travel around Øresund.

Øresund Runt is a fan expansion for Ticket to Ride which lets you visit the eastern-most parts of Denmark and connecting with the southern-most parts of Sweden.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Astro Knights: Tai Sabaki Assault Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Tantrum House Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

Tai Sabaki Assault
Weapon
Cost: 8
Attack: Deal 7 damage.
Ability: Each ally may discard a card. For each card discarded this way, power up the Homeworld once.

name: Сталкериада (Stalker)
description:
Based on the book "Roadside Picnic" by Arkady and Boris Strugatsky. The game follows the book.

Footprints left by the aliens after their visit changed the nature of the Earth. Zones of "contamination" remain, bearing hidden treasures.

Despite the mortal risk, brave "stalkers" dare to enter these Zones in order to take out the objects left by the aliens, such as the ship "Khabar". The leakage of Khabar is being suppressed by governments in every possible way.

Stalking has been outlawed in the vicinity of the Zones, and special Institutes for the Study of Anomalous Phenomena have sprung up. The Zones are fenced with barbed wire and guarded by police and troops. Life in the cities adjacent to the Zones is unbearable, and you need to buy a Visa to leave. Money can only be obtained by successfully selling to dealers.

You take on the role of one of these "Stalkers" in the game. The game is for those who love risk, fantasy and adventure.

name: Состязание амазонок (Contest of the Amazons)
description:
A children's game where you are trying to be the first to cross the finish line.

On a player's turn they roll a die and move that many spaces along a predetermined track. Some spaces have benefits, and some have penalties. If you land on the same space as another player, they go back to start.

First player across the finish line wins.

The game comes with:
-game map
-6 figures
-one die
-rules

name: Киборг (Cyborg)
description:
A children's game where you are trying to be the first to cross the finish line.

On a player's turn they roll a die and move that many spaces along a predetermined track. Some spaces have benefits, and some have penalties. If you land on the same space as another player, they go back to start.

First player across the finish line wins.

The game comes with:
-game map
-6 figures
-one die
-rules

name: Снайперы (Snipers)
description:
In this game, each player strives to be the first to destroy the enemy's warriors.

Players take turns. During his turn, the player makes one shot with the help of the dice. The right of the first move is determined by the roll of the dice. The player who gets the right to shoot is the first to call the opponent's sector A or B and rolls his dice. If the number of points on the dice coincides with the number of the hex, on which the opponent's figure stands, then the shot was accurate.

The opponent must make a defensive throw with his dice. If the number of points of the defensive throw coincides with the number of points of the "shot", then the protective equipment saved the warrior from being "wounded", the figure of the warrior remains in the same place. If the points of defense and shot do not coincide, then the figure of the warrior is "wounded" and moves to the yellow field of its hex.
The next time the unit is wounded, it should move from the yellow to the red field. If a unit is on the red field and is wounded again, it is considered destroyed and is removed to the center of the hexomap, where the sector designation is depicted.

The ARMOR icon in the card next to the unit figure saves the unit from one wound if it is on a yellow field. The ARMOR Usage Card is out of the game if it does not have the MEDKIT icon on it. If there is a MEDKIT icon, the card stays next to the unit, but lies down halfway so that only the MEDKIT icon remains open. The player will need the FIRST AID Kit a little later - on the red field.

The MEDKIT icon saves the unit from one wound if he stands on the red hex. After using the First Aid Kit once, the card is out of the game.

Cards provide additional protection for warriors. There are two symbols on the cards: "yellow shield with a blue stripe" - ARMOR and "red cross" badge - FIRST AID KIT. Each of the badges saves warriors from being wounded once.

Game come with:
-Hexopoles - 4 pcs
-Flashcards - 12 pcs
-TRKP squad figures - 6 pcs
-Heavy line infantry figures - 6 pcs
-Dice - 2 pcs

name: Схватка за ковчег (The Battle for the Ark)
description:
In this game, up to four teams are trying to get to the center of the board. The map is divided into levels, and as a player gets to the circular corners, they are allowed to move into a closer level to the center. Players that land on another one can be eliminated.

The goal is to get a figure to the center of the map. There, the last four will fight for supremacy.

Game includes:
-map
-12 figures
-tokens
-1 die
-rules

name: ArcheOlogic: Promo
description: A set of two additional problems for ArcheOlogic.

name: Битва магистров (Battle of the Magicians)
description:
In this game both sides are trying to enter each other's castle.

During a turn, a player rolls a die to determine how many actions they get. A piece can move one space for one action and may do up to the total rolled in actions. You can also split the total actions over several figures; if a five was rolled you could move two figures two spaces each and another figure one space. Only one figure can be in a space.

A piece can kill an enemy piece by landing on it, this ends its moves for the turn.

Pieces that land on a teleport symbol are teleported to another symbol.

Tower spaces provide immunity to death from for the figure that is on them.

Game includes:
-Playing field
-Set of 8 figures in two colors (16 pcs)
-one dice
-game rules
mechanics: Action Points, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fröschis Schnupperspiel
description:
Fröschis (engl. Froggis) is the German version of the game תעשו מקום (Make Room), published in 2020 by Shafir Games in Israel.
In Fröschis, you want to line up your cards in numerical order, eventually getting rid of your card row entirely.

The deck consists of cards numbered 1-8 with six of each, along with four frogs and eight trash. To start the game, deal each player a row of eight cards face down.

On a turn, take either the top card of the deck or the discard pile, then place the card in the proper place in your row — a 1 goes in the first spot, a 2 in the second spot, etc. — as long as the card you're replacing is face down. Reveal that face-down card, and if you can place it in your row — again, replacing only a face-down card — then do so. If you reveal a frog, it's a joker that can serve as any number. If, for example, you place a frog in the 4 spot, reveal a 6, then place the 6 and reveal a 4, you can place the 4, then move the frog to a different face-down spot. If you reveal trash or a number you already have face up, discard it to end your turn.

If you have eight face-up cards in a row, each other player takes one final turn, then you start a new round, and all players who completed their row are dealt only seven cards instead of eight. Now you have to get only seven cards in a row to win the round, but all 8s count as trash for you, possibly making it harder for you to do so. Keep playing rounds until someone gets down to a row of only one card, completing it with a 1 or a frog. That player wins when they do so, and multiple players can win if they complete their one-card row in the same round.

This free demo version doesn't have all the cards of the full version.

name: Битва за планету Велиан (Battle for the Planet Velian)
description:
The board consists of a starting zone for the figures (numbered 1-6), a space that is a hospital (where a piece goes when it is attacked and loses) spaces where a piece is protected, and spaces where an attack may be made to an adjacent space (determined by the direction of the arrow).

Players roll to see who goes first. That player then selects a figure and rolls a die, with the number rolled being the number of spaces it can move. If the figure moves onto a space with a token, they collect it. If they land on a space with an attack icon, they shoot a piece in the adjacent space the arrow is pointing in. If they land in the same space as an enemy figure, both roll and the high side wins. In both cases, the figure is sent to the hospital and must roll a 6 to revive.

The goal of the game is tom be the first to collect the most tokens and return to their base. The first to do so gets a bonus of +50 points to their total.

Comes with:
-playing field
-cards 50 pcs.
-figures "militia of the planet Velian" - 6 pcs.
-figures "Skanda" - 6 pcs.
- game dice
- rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Рыцарский марафон (Knight's Marathon)
description:
Knight's Marathon is a sort of "foot" racing game by Tehnolog.

The players determine who goes first and that player rolls two dice. He can move one figure that many spaces or select two figures and move them the distance shown on a die (if you roll 3 and 4, one soldier moves three and the other moves four). If you roll doubles, then you get a bonus turn, whereby you can use the number rolled for another round of moves (as before).

If a piece lands on a red square they advance to the next red square. If a piece lands on a blue square, then they advance to the next blue square. If the opponent's figure is in the same spot, then it must withdraw to the next red of blue space.

The first player to get all their knights tom their proper camps wins.

Game comes with
-playing field
-two sets of 6 soldiers, one for each player (12 total)
-2 dice
-rules
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Башня страха (Tower of Fear)
description:
The game deals with a fight over an ancient lighthouse by orcs and Vikings. The goal of the orcs is to get one of their tokens to the top of the lighthouse, while the Viking are trying to prevent this.

A turn consists of three phases:
1.Manuever
2.Hand-to-hand
3.shoot

Maneuver - a player rolls a die for how many actions they get. A piece can move one space for one action and may do up to the total rolled in actions. You can also split the total actions over several figures; if a five was rolled you could move two figures two spaces each and another figure one space. However, no piece may move further than three spaces. Only one token can be in a space. There are additional costs for climbing stairs.

Hand-to-hand - Figures that enter another space occupied by an enemy figure fight. Both roll a die and the high side wins. If the difference was only one then the piece is returned to their side of the map, if by two then the piece is killed and removed.

Shooting - The player then shoots adjacently with their figures. Viking roll one die per figure, but Orcs roll two. On a 6 the piece is killed and on a 5 it is wounded (the piece is returned to owner's side of the map). There are different modifications for tower shots.
The game includes:
-Playing field
-Game tokens 18 pcs (8 of one color and 10 of another)
-2 dice
-Rules of the game
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Бой в волшебных руинах (Battle in the Magical Ruins)
description:
The map is divided into hexagons that have a die symbol in them. That symbol shows a die value from 1-6, which is the roll necessary for a figure to enter it.

Players take turns rolling dice for their figures and moving their pieces into a hex that they are allowed to. For example, if I rolled a four, then I could move into a hex that has a four in it. After entering it, you can continue to move into the next hex if it has a four, and so on. All of a player's figures have a chance to move, so make sure that you do not block their path.

If an enemy piece is in the hex, then they fight a melee. Both roll a die, and the high side sends the loser's piece back to start.

To win you must bring three of your figures to the base on the other side of the board.

includes:
-Playing field
-5 Siegfried figures
-5 Centurion figures
-Legend
-Rules
-Dice
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Мушкетёры Острова Магов (Musketeer of Mages Island)
description:
The objective for the Musketeers is to get three of their figures to the Guild. The Guards must get three of their figures to the Castle.

The phasing player rolls a die for how many actions they get. A piece can move one space for one action and may do up to the total rolled in actions. You can also split the total actions over several figures; if a five was rolled you could move two figures two spaces each and another figure one space. Players can also travel thorough the tunnels. Only one figure can be in a space. Each Musketeer piece that enters the guild gives them +1 to their die roll, and likewise, each Guard piece that enters the castle gives them +1 to their die roll.

Figures that are adjacent (not diagonally) can fight. Both roll a die and the high side wins and removes a figure and places it back in their starting area.

The game includes:
-Playing field
-Musketeer figurines 5 pcs
-Guardsmen figurines 5 pcs
-Dice
-Rules
mechanics: Action Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Тайна Забытого Подземелья (Secrets of the Forgotten Dungeon)
description:
Mystery of the Forgotten Dungeon is a game where two players are trying to find a secret manuscript located inside a dungeon.

The game includes:
-Game map
-10 miniatures (five for each player)
-11 cards
-2 red doors with stands
-2 blue doors with stands
-rules
-one die (with numbers 1-3)

Players take turns rolling a die and moving that many of their figures one space each, in any direction but diagonally. Only one piece per space. When a room is entered the card is revealed and resolved. Players continue in this way, exploring rooms. Some rooms require a colored key.

If a player lands on another they fight. Both roll a die and the high side wins, and sends the other back tom start. They also get to steal a card.

The winner is the player who finds the manuscript and exits the dungeon.

name: Ключевое сражение (Key Battle)
description:
The board consist of a square-grided board with starting zones on each side and a laboratory in the middle. Both sides are trying to get three of their warriors into an abandoned Labatory. Entry is only possible through the red or blue doors.

Players take turn rolling three dice. Each number rolled corresponds to a soldier in their starting area. For example, if 4,5,6 was rolled, then soldiers 4,5, and 6 could move one space each. If a 4,2,2 was rolled then soldier four would move one space and soldier two would move twice. You can move in any direction, including diagonally, but you may not enter a space with another figure. Only one figure per space is allowed.

A move may be forfeited in order to shoot. A shot can be taken up to three squares away. Two dice are rolled; if at least one is a 6 then you hit your target and it returns back to its starting area.

If you occupy two of the same-colored squares (red or blue) you are allowed to open that same-colored door on the laboratory. Thus, if you wish to get inside the laboratory, it requires two figures to be on the outside-colored squares, which allows another figure to open the floor of the Labatory and enter it.

If you land on a space next an enemy soldier you fight. Both roll a die and the high side wins. The figure is returned to their starting zone. Ties reroll.

To win, you need to get three figures into the laboratory and on their colored squares.

The game includes:
-Condor Case - 6 figures
-Tornado Case - 6 figures
-Playing field
-Rules of the game
-3 dice
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Square Grid

name: Tassacra
description:
A magical meteor crashed in the Tassacra desert, sparking a fierce competition among fantasy creatures. They're all after the magical shards the meteor left behind to become the top faction in Zephyrund. Possessing these shards increases your faction's influence, or they can be used to craft powerful artifacts, boosting your strength on the battlefields.

In Tassacra, you play four rounds called Days, and the winner of the game is the player with the most victory points at the very end. During the course of the play, you can earn victory points in many different ways, such as defeating foes, winning battles, scoring end-day objectives, stealing from your opponents, selling resources, and more.

In this strategic race, players select asymmetric factions of magical beings, each equipped with distinctive abilities and strengths. Factions also have different activity peaks during specific times of the day (dusk, day, and night), but all players will take eight main actions by the end of the day. To win, you will invade the desert, move units, engage in combats, scavenge magical shards, and resupply. Additionally, you can craft items to upgrade combat abilities, sell shards to the market, and complete quests.

You will attack and get attacked. In combat, active players roll combat dice, which can be modified by upgrades and combat cards.

There are just four days before rivals and the desert sands claim the shards. Get your warriors ready – the battle in Tassacra begins!
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Open Drafting, Race

name: Киборги на тропе войны (Cyborgs on the Warpath)
description:
Киборги на тропе войны ("Cyborgs on the Warpath") is a typical roll-and-move track type game.

Players begin by placing their token on the starting box. They then roll to see whom goes first and that player rolls the dice and moves the number indicated along the track.

If they land on a red or blue box, they must follow the path it tells them to. This continues through each level of the game.

The winner is the first one to reach square 44 wins the game.

The path has an intricate design, which can send a player in different directions with all sorts of consequences.

—user summary

name: アクシズ攻防戦 (Operation Axis)
description:
Operation Axiz is a solo-only, doujin game themed around "Operation Axis" which occurs at the end of the movie "Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack".

The player takes on the role of the Londo Bell forces, trying to prevent the Neo Zeon forces from dropping the asteroid Axis on Earth by destroying the asteroid.

On their turn, the player draws mobile suits, ships and events from their deck, and must decide to either "patrol" to intercept incoming Neo Zeon Mobile Suits, or attempt to set bombs on Axis in an attempt to destroy the asteroid.

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Kronologic: Babylon 2500
description:
Kronologic are modern alternatives to Clue: find the culprit, the weapon and the location. Each turn, the active player needs to interrogate a suspect (by aligning cards under perforated cardboard tiles), giving away information to everyone at the table, but giving the active player extra information (how many time a suspect visited a specific location, at what time, etc.)

Be the first to solve the mystery to win the game.

name: Kronologic: Cuzco 1450
description:
Kronologic are modern alternatives to Clue: find the culprit, the weapon and the location. Each turn, the active player needs to interrogate a suspect (by aligning cards under perforated cardboard tiles), giving away information to everyone at the table, but giving the active player extra information (how many time a suspect visited a specific location, at what time, etc.)

Be the first to solve the mystery to win the game.
Three standalone boxes are scheduled, the first of which "Kronologic: Paris 1920" is expected for the "Festival Internationnal des Jeux de Cannes '24".

name: Post- u. Reise-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 36 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Stadt, Land, Binge Watching
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City, Country, Bingewatching edition you'll always bring a big dose of fun to the round! In 26 categories you can test your series knowledge and prove your creativity. The game block convinces with cool design and exciting topics - perfect for all series lovers. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something here for everyone.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Stadt, Land, Tor
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City, Country, Goal Edition you'll always bring a big portion of fun with you! You can test your football knowledge and prove your creativity in 26 categories. With its cool design and exciting questions, the game block will convince both amateur footballers and professional footballers, whether big or small. From simple questions to tricky categories - there is something here for everyone.
The person who fills in everything the fastest wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Stadt, Land, Suff
description:
No matter where you are - with this original Stadt, Land, Suff edition you'll always bring a big portion of fun to the round! You can test your knowledge of the liquid gold and prove your creativity in 26 wine-related categories. The game block convinces with cool design and exciting topics - perfect for all party people. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something here for everyone.
The person who fills in everything the fastest wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Alicematic 完全世界
description:
From across the multiverse, an army of Alices was summoned to save Wonderland from the threat of the Void, a powerful darkness born from people's hearts. After a massive battle, the Alice's drove out the Void, saving the inhabitants of Wonderland. But when it came time to rebuild the devastated Wonderland, every Alice insisted on creating their own version. They couldn't agree on anything, so the Queen of Hearts made a suggestion. "Let the Alices fight, and the winner shall decide." In response, the Alices made alliances and split into four factions, each fighting for their own ideal world. A ruthless battle royale begins…

Alicematic 完全世界 (Kanzen sekai / Whole Wide World) is the first game in Manifest Destiny's Alicematic series. Players compete to win the most territory in Wonderland. Battles are carried out by each player drawing and placing a line of five cards, with some cards face-up and some face-down. The different factions defeat each other in the style of paper-rock-scissors, but players have the option to play cards from their hands as reinforcements. Unique Alice cards and Landmarks offer special abilities that can quickly turn the tide of each conflict. Players play a set number of rounds depending on the player count, and the player with the most territories on the shared map plus the Landmarks they won from other players is the winner.

One of the most interesting aspects of the gameplay and components is using jigsaw puzzles as the player maps. Each player has their own map, while battles take place on a central shared map. All the 28-piece puzzles are cut the same, so their pieces have identical shapes. To show you've conquered a territory in Wonderland, you replace it with the puzzle piece from the same position on your own map.

name: Don't Catch a Crab
description:
Don't Catch a Crab is the perfect strategic card game for rowers. You can draw out of the draw pile, or strategically draft rowers from other players to get the perfect lineup. Be careful though as you can catch an ejector crab and remove yourself from the game if you pick the wrong card. This game is perfect for the down time at regattas, hangouts with friends, or even the bus ride. The game plays fast so you can fit it in real quick, or have multiple rounds to extend the fun. Happy rowing and don't catch a crab!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Super Stylist
description:
Become a Super Stylist and put together cool outfits!

Four girlfriends use a common wardrobe, full of wonderful pastel-colored and well-combined black and white clothes. They have a busy schedule: after school they often play sports, prepare for exams, and have been invited to a tea party. They also have theater and festival tickets and end the long week with a pajama party. Be their style consultant and help them choose the right outfit so that they can appear impeccably fashionable everywhere!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: ¡Viva México!: Campeones
description: Game of questions and challenges based on Mexican culture. Some of the questions include mentioning three types of chilli, three presidents of Mexico or the recipe for guacamole. While some of the challenges include saying a Yucatecan "bomba", saying an "albur" or dancing the "jarabe tapatio".

name: Время варягов (Time of the Varangians)
description:
The game, which can also be titled "Time of the Heroes," is about Heroes and wizards wandering the Earth and fighting battles of competition against its native forces.

The players maneuver around the battlefield in an attempt to seize sources of magical energy, they play cards, shoot and melee, all in an attempt to gain the upper hand on their opponent.

The goal is to be the first to eliminate all your opponent's figures.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Время великанов (Time of the Giants)
description:
The game, which can also be titled "Time of the Heroes," is about Heroes and wizards wandering the Earth and fighting battles of competition against its native forces.

The players maneuver around the battlefield in an attempt to seize sources of magical energy, they play cards, shoot and melee, all in an attempt to gain the upper hand on their opponent.

The goal is to be the first to eliminate all your opponent's figures.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Время витязей (Time of the Knights)
description:
The game, which can also be titled "Time of the Heroes," is about Heroes and wizards wandering the Earth and fighting battles of competition against its native forces.

The players maneuver around the battlefield in an attempt to seize sources of magical energy, they play cards, shoot and melee, all in an attempt to gain the upper hand on their opponent.

The goal is to be the first to eliminate all your opponent's figures.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: SherBlock Holmes: Il caso Victoria Cake
description:
Victoria Cake is in danger! Will it be you, Wiggins, Sherlock Holmes' stealthy sidekick, who will cause her disappearance? Or will you, Mrs. Hudson, landlady of 221B, prevent her disappearance? In a SherBlock, you can play as many as two protagonists! Choose sides, flip the block and play!

The rules are very simple and are all contained on the first page. We will begin our adventure as Wiggins whose acumen was rated a whopping 5 pipes by Sherlock Holmes. As we progress through the adventure this number will eventually increase or decrease based on our choices. As for Wiggins, the final rating will depend on the number of pipes in our possession.

On some pages of the work then we will find portions of text written in red. At that time we may decide to flip the game to play the adventure as Mrs. Hudson. We will experience the story from the point of view of the two main characters, and it will be up to us to decide who to lead to victory. Mrs. Hudson's final evaluation will be decidedly different from Wiggins'.

The plot is simple and a run of the game takes about 10 minutes. However, the fact that it is replayable several times to discover the various possible scenarios, encounters and endings is definitely a plus.

Excellent introduction to this genre of games, suitable for even the littlest ones (but not only) that is set to fill all that downtime you have during the day: pick up the pad and read.
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Слуги огненной саламандр (Servants of the Fire Salamander)
description:
Servants of the Fire Salamander is a typical roll-and-move track type game.

Players begin by placing their token on the starting box. They then roll to see whom goes first and that player rolls the dice and moves the number indicated along the track.

If they land on a red or blue box, they must follow the path it tells them to. This continues through each level of the game.

The winner is the first one to reach square 41 wins the game.

The path has an intricate design, which can send a player in different directions with all sorts of consequences.

The game includes:
-playing field
-4 tokens in different colors
-dice
-rules
-Storybook: chronicle of "Fantasy battles"

name: Путешествие в Изумрудный город (Journeys to the Emerald City)
description:
Journey to the Emerald city is a typical roll-and-move game on a tract map. It is designed for children and has low complexity.

Players take turn rolling a die and moving. Along their way are advantageous and dangerous spots, some of which take them off the path, delay them, and force them to get out of their situation.

The winner is the first player to reach the Emerald City.

This is part of a 4-in-1 set called "Color your favorite Character." In addition to Emerald city, it contains the other games. The entire contents of the box are as follows:

-Playing field "Journeys to the Emerald City"
-Playing field "Ilya Muromets"
-Playing field "Pirates Board!"
-Puss in Boots playing field.
-Game chips - 16 pcs.
-Rules
-Dice D6 - 1 pc.
-Coloring book - 1 pc.
-Colored pencils - 6 pcs.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Арена магов (Arena of Mages ): Box 2
description:
Arena of Mages is the first installment in a series of games released by Tehnolog. It was released in 2001 in two large, boxed sets, along with 10 supplements.

This entry is for the second boxed set.

The boxed version included:
-a playing field (made up of 4 sections)
-12 standee markers
-2 player aids
-72 soldier cards
-48 artifact cards
-18 event markers
-2 game dice
-rules

The rules of this boxed version were slightly different from the rules of the game of the larger version. However,
the cards (soldiers and artifacts) of the different sets were compatible with one another, and players had the opportunity to assemble their own, invincible armies.

Fans of the Fantasy Battles game system will recognize the characters on the cards from the units of the Fantasy Battle system. Each of them has its own name or nickname.

The rules of the boxed version are based on the confrontation of squads from two players (no more than six squads on each side). One soldier from each squad can be on the field at the same time. Each player's turn consists of four phases:

1. Preliminary phase - introducing new fighters into the game, equipping fighters with artifacts.
2. Maneuver phase - movement of fighters on the field.
3. Action phase - each player's fighter on the field can perform one action: movement, healing, shooting, using magic, declaring hand-to-hand combat, passing.
4. The final phase - turning the cards of the fighters turned over in the action phase to the starting position.

To win, a player must remove all of their opponent's tiles from the field first (regardless of whether the opponent has any units left in the squad decks or not).

If you wished to expand your game, there were up to 10 expansion packs that you could add. Each contained:
-a small playing field
-6 game tiles in three colors
-18 soldier cards
-12 artifact cards
-rules
-1 die
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination

name: Radio-Spel
description:
The game is Dutch and played with a dice, and by two or more players. The aim of the game is to see who reaches all wavelengths first.
Anyone who ends up on the water moves forward one space. Anyone who lands on land moves back space. Anyone who comes to the Chinese, Negro, Redskin or Eskimo must listen for a moment and misses their next turn.
Whoever reaches or passes 160 first wins the pot

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Das Brettspiel – Junior Edition
description: Extension set with Child-friendly categories. There are 354 different categories at all.

name: Остров сокровищ (Treasure Island)
description:
Остров сокровищ (Treasure Island) a game about treasure hunting. Players must first find three precious stones of the same color and bring them to the old pirate who will then give them a map. They must then go and find the treasure. 

Players begin in one of the cities on the map. They select a path to travel on and roll a die. The number rolled is the total spaces they may move. When a player rolls a 4,5 or 6 they get a $100 bonus from the bank.

There are three modes of travel: land, sea, and air. Moving on land is free, moving by sea cost $200 per turn moving on it, and air cost $300 per turn. To transition from one type of mode to another costs $100. Air travel is from city to city.

Event cards (circular tokens) are gained by landing on them. They can also be purchased by being in proximity to them and paying a fee of $100 times the distance to the card. So, if I was three spaces away, I could pay $300 and get the card, or I could get closer and pay less. Cards have different abilities and can be bad or good. Some are worth cash, or cause the loss of cash, and some are colored precious stones.

Once the player acquires the three stones of the same type they must go to the pirate and obtain a map (card with a location on it). Once they reach the designated location on the map, all players roll a die. If the total value of the dice is even, then the map was real and the player wins. if not, the map was fake, and they must start the process all over again and bring the pirate (swindler) another three stones.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Economic, Pirates, Transportation
mechanics: Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Joking Hazard: Patreon Exclusive Pack
description: A promo pack of 5 new cards for Joking Hazard. It was sent to all Patreon Supporters, beginning from the 5$-level, supporting for at least 4 months.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Money Management Card Game
description:
Educational game to learn how to cope with money wisely. On your turn, draw 2 cards from the money card pile or the goal card pile or one card from each pile. If you fulfill your goal card, you will get points in the end. In case of an event, you must pay the amount told. If you don't have enough money, use your goal cards instead or sell already bought items for the second hand price. If you still cannot pay, you are bankrupt. At the end, the value of all cards is added. In addition, you loose or get points for less or more essential expenses you made.

—user summary

name: Hi & Low QUEST
description:
ハイロークエスト (Hi & Low QUEST) is a card game from Japan for one to three players. In the game, the players are on a sword and sorcery quest, and use their adventurers and mages to fight a series of strange creatures as the explore a dungeon.

The players are trying to work out whether the next card revealed will be a higher or lower value than the current card. By successfully completing a run of cards, the players earn Quest Cards, which they can use to manipulate the card values when they are wrong.

The winner is the player with the most stars on the Quest Cards they have collected.
user summary

name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Events of Aughmoore Mini Expansion
description:
Prepare yourself for an immersive journey with this captivating mini expansion. This expansion features a remarkable assortment of 52 distinct events, each beautifully depicted to ignite your imagination. Brace for an exhilarating whirlwind as these events come to life and introduce thrilling changes to the game's dynamics.

Contents:
• 52 Unique Event Cards
• 52 Event Sleeves (63.5 x 88 mm)

-description from Gamefound campaign
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Follow, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Battle Booster Box
description:
Experience the Great War of Aughmoore like never before with the revolutionary 55-card Tactics Deck. Unleash devastating strategies and catch your unsuspecting enemies off guard with a Serf-led Charge! Strengthen your Barricade by recruiting a Warrior directly into the heart of the battle! And secure your triumph with a Heroic Siege!

Introducing the Battle Booster Box, which provides three new categories of one-time-use Tactic Cards:

1. Ambush: Gain the upper hand by initiating impactful battles earlier in the game. These lighter Tactic Cards require fewer resources to execute and do not have specific unit requirements, allowing for swift and unexpected maneuvers.

2. Mystic: Turn the tides of battle with these special Tactic Cards that provide bonus actions, surprise maneuvers, and more. Unleash the power of mystic forces to outwit and outmaneuver your opponents.

3. Heroic: Seize the Crown or defend it with these high-scoring Tactic Cards that guarantee the victory points needed to secure your triumph. These cards embody the essence of heroism and will lead you to glory.

Furthermore, each player's hand of Tactic Cards will receive a permanent boost with the all-new Barrage Tactic Card. This powerful addition is specifically designed to overcome even the most stalwart Barricades, ensuring that no obstacle stands in your path to victory.

Prepare for an exhilarating experience as this booster pack unlocks the true potential of battle. Immerse yourself in the thrilling world of Aughmoore and reimagine the possibilities of warfare. Are you ready to reshape history?

Contains
• 55 Tactic Cards
• 55 Tactic Sleeves (63.5 x 88 mm)

-description from Gamefound campaign
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Follow, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Guardian Mercenary "Heart of Gamelyn"
description:
The Heart of Gamelyn Mercenary is an exceptional character renowned for its unparalleled expertise in safeguarding your troops at any expense. Owning this figure will not only make you the object of envy within your gaming circle, but more significantly, it will ensure your survival, giving you the opportunity to boast about your triumphs!

Contains
• 1 Miniature
• 1 Mercenary Card

-description from Gamefound campaign
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Follow, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Two Worlds Game Board Mat
description:
This gaming mat boasts an extraordinary alternate new world map on the reverse side. This captivating addition will put your tactical skills to the test, offering countless hours of replayability. Immerse yourself in a whole new realm, where every move counts and every decision shapes your destiny.

Oversized 48" x 34" double-sided and stitched edged neoprene gaming mat.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Follow, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: GURUGURU Charm
description:
ぐるぐるチャーム (GURUGURU Charm) is a trading card-style fighting game from Japan, with players fighting using traps, magic and weapons.

The players are dealt 20 cards from the deck and select up to 7 cards to set aside that will add to their attack. Then they select 7 hand cards to use in battle, with a character card with skills. The remaining cards are shuffled into a draw deck.

The card values are from 1 to 5, with higher values beating lower values, and 1 beating 5.

A card is turned up from the draw deck to set a weather condition for that round. Players can then choose a card to place face-down as a trap. Then they choose a card to fight with, and hold it face-down until all players are ready to reveal, with a shout of SENO!

The players can then activate their traps and also use magic in the combat. The strongest fighter wins the round and the losers mark up damage on their own score card.

Players then draw back to 7 cards in hard and begin a new round. If the deck is exhausted it is shuffled over.

When a player falls to zero hit points, they are out. The last one standing is the winner of the game.
user summary

With this game, a player can enjoy strategies using card battle deck construction, summoning, traps, and magic. Players use cards to battle against their opponents. By playing attack, trap, and magic cards from their hand, attacking their opponent with a summoned character, players try to be the first to reduce the opponent's Hit Points to 0. Through luck and strategy, even a weak character may be able to defeat a powerful enemy.

TCG(トレーディングカードゲーム)風、カードバトルデッキ構築、召喚、罠、魔法を使った戦略が味わえます！

このゲームは他のTCGと同じように、カードを使い 相手とバトルをします。
手札から攻撃、罠、魔法カードを出して、 召喚したキャラで相手を攻撃し、 先に相手のHPを0にするゲームです！
運と駆け引きによって弱いキャラクターでも、 強力な敵を倒すことができるかもしれません.

description by publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: HVRTING
description:
HVRTING is a Party Game to celebrate Pain.

HVRTING: The Extreme Haunt Card Game offers guests the opportunity to experience an immersive horror experience from the comfort of their own home. Two to eight friends can get together, gather items that most normal haunt-goers should already have, and customize the deck to their level of intensity–and then the fun begins. Your friends are now your enemies, and you must strategically work to obtain four resource cards by earning them, stealing them, or bartering for them–and escape. But while you are gathering the resource cards, The Director has placed a series of restraint, endurance, and torture cards among them to make you hurt.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hot Potato, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Take That

name: Smart10: Kändisar
description: New questions to Smart10, now with questions about celebrities.

name: Das Buffet ist eröffnet
description:
A card game very similar to Career Poker. Starting with the first player, then in turn order you play one or more cards of the same value from your hand. A following player must overbid by playing at least the same quantity of cards. If you play the same quantity of cards, the value of each of your card must be higher. If you increase the quantity of cards, the value may be lower. The first player who got rid of all his cards gets the figure "aunt Lisbeth", the most valuable personality. The last player gets "neighbor Albert" and must shuffle, distribute and discard all the cards during the next complete round ("manche" or "Durchgang"). The rest of the cards that couldn't evenly be distributed is distributed to the player with "neighbor Albert". After several complete rounds, the player who hold the most time "aunt Lisbeth" wins and the player who hold the most time "neighbor Albert" loses.

—user summary

name: Legendarium
description:
Legendarium is a Roll and Write game of strategy and risk taking. It's a fast paced game, taking on average 15-30 minutes per game, allowing you to easily fit it into your game night, or to play it multiple times (we usually play at least two games).

You will forge the story of the rise and decline (and possible destruction) of 5 fantasy kingdoms through 4 ages of myth, scoring points as your kingdoms act in each age. You will also initiate Mythic Moments to add additional flavor (and points) to your myth that you are building.

Each round, you will choose from the available dice to grow one of your kingdoms. Each successive die must be higher or the kingdom will start to decline. Points are given based on the number of boxes filled for each kingdom. There are four ages to the game. as soon as any player fills all the boxes for any kingdom, the whole group will proceed to the next age.

name: Legendarium: Folktale
description:
In Legendarium Folktale you'll manage the rise and fall of 5 folktale kingdoms such as fairies and goblins. It increases the inter-player dynamic as you will be changing each other's scorecards through mischief and favors.

This expansion gives a new kingdom sheet with additional rules that encourage more player interaction.

name: Legendarium: Primordia
description:
In Legendarium Primordia you'll be reaching back further in time, to the age of Titans, Gods, Elementals, and Eldritch Horrors, near the dawn of creation. These factions are never destroyed, but can be sealed away for an age. In this era of creation, when the world was young, what kind of a world will your creation myth take?

This expansion gives a new kingdom sheet with additional rules. Kingdoms can no longer be destroyed but can be locked away for an age, preventing additional scoring.
categories: Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Court of Influence
description:
