Use your cunning to place those loyal to you in positions of power within the king's court. Assassinate rivals and forge deals with other players to secure the votes you need to gain influence over the king and win the game.

Each round, a new position within the king's court becomes available. Players may put forward a suitable courtier as a candidate or draw cards from the courtier deck to strengthen their hand for the next round. The candidate with the most votes will fill the empty position and give the player who put forward that candidate influence each round. Players with candidates up for the vote make deals with other players to secure votes or play secret cards to turn the outcome by force. The player with the most influence will win the game.

Court of Influence is a game of manipulation, deal-making, and statecraft.

-description from designer

name: Diner Flip
description:
Diner flip is a quick, 18 card, 2 player game where players try to get the most points by bidding on cards and adding them to their scoring tableau. The trick is that winning or losing the bid determines what card you get and also its orientation in your tableau. Try to match diner cuisine icons, and get the most of each type of music record to score points. Plan your strategy but be prepared to alter it as your opponent may take the card you want. Play two games and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Connections, Constrained Bidding, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Matching, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Turn Order: Auction

name: The International Game of Justice
description:
The International Game of Justice is an educational card game based on the case law of the International Court of Justice, the Permanent Court of International Justice and the Permanent Court of Arbitration. The IGJ is designed for law students and international legal enthusiasts who desire to engage with international case law in a playful manner. However, the card game can also be played by and with non-lawyers if one ignores the advanced rules.

Each IGJ set consists of 55 cards (bridge size) and is delivered in its own paper box. The Jessup Editions differ from the Standard Editions in design only.

name: Schlock!
description:
Schlock! is a real-time word game in which players race to complete b-movie posters using word, picture and cinema tiles.

When one player has completed their 3rd movie, a sand-timer commences a final countdown to the end of the game. Each player's completed movies are scored on their size, chaining of illustrations and words, the prestige of cinema at which they appear and the size of their cinema audience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Chaining, Contracts, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Clap
description:
Welcome to the unique show of Clap, where your voice harmony, rhythm and melody will be the stars. Do you have no rhythm? Don't worry, it'll be fun!

Choose one player to be the metronome, they'll be in charge of keeping the tempo and dealing the cards. The metronome chooses the cards according to their difficulty and shuffles them.
The first times you play, we suggest starting with value 3 cards.

The metronome deals one card facing up to each player and starts marking a time signature (one, two, three, four) repeating it throughout the round. This will mark the rhythm to follow.

After the first time signature (one, two, three, four) the rest of the players will clap or hit as indicated on their card at the same time.

In each time signature, before number three, the metronome will give a new card to one of the players. Those will have to switch between their notes from now on. For each number of the time signature, they will sing a note. A player shall never have two cards more than another.

If at any time, the metronome detects a mistake, stops the song shouting 'CLAP!'. All the players keep their card with the highest score, except the one who made the mistake, who gives their highest card to the metronome.

If nobody makes any mistakes and all the players get to ^play their 4 cards during a time signature, each one keeps their card with the highest score and the metronome doesn't keep any.

The remaining cards are shuffled again and the player on the right of the previous metronome becomes the new one.

The game ends when all the players have played as a metronome once. The one with more points wins.

name: ふしぎ商店街 (Fushigi Shotengai)
description:
ふしぎ商店街 (Fushigi Shotengai) is a game from Japan, themed on the very familiar covered shopping street that is common across the whole of Japan.

There are two games that can be played, a racing game かけっこ(Kakkeo)and a memo game where you are finding tags at night. As the game progresses, you can make combos that speed you along.

For the racing game, each turn, each player chooses people in the shopping district who will lend their help. Some characters will let you advance a few squares, some will steal money from other players, and some will use that money to advance the pieces all at once, and depending on the character's power, exciting developments will unfold at every turn!!
description by publisher

How to play かけっこ (Kakekko) racing game.

Place the tiles that correspond to the starting point, bus stop, and jewellery box on the daytime board and arrange the remaining shop tiles (daytime) in a random order. Place 5 jewel pieces in the treasure box squares.
Shuffle the Resident cards and place them face down next to the board along with the money chips. Place all player pieces at the starting point.

Depending on the number of players, each player chooses two Resident cards as helpers, so that other players do not know.

Players then go through the Resident cards chosen in numerical order, from 1 to 9. Where players have chosen the same kind of helper, such as borrowing money, the lower value goes first.

When a Resident helps by moving the player piece backwards or forwards along the street, the player takes the action on the space they land on. If this causes them to advance to another tile, they continue with the action given there. If a player moves through one of the jewellery boxes, they collet the jewel they find there.

The game ends when all the jewels are taken, with the most valuable total being the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: ねこのひたい。(Neko no Hitai)
description:
ねこのひたい。(Neko no Hitai) is a children's deduction game from Japan. The title means The Cat's Forehead, which is very small, so there isn't much room to hide things there. There are only 12 hiding spaces in the game.

In this game, players compete by hiding and searching for fish, and the points earned depend on where the piece was hidden.

The 12 number tiles are arranged at random, and everyone get a fish in their colour. All the players look away whist the youngest player starts by hiding their fish under a number. The player searching chooses a tile, and if the fish is there, the hiding player gets the points. Play continues clockwise, with more fish being hidden (a player is out until their fish is found).

Alternately, a fish one can be hidden which yields double points.

The winner is the player with the most points by the end of the game.
user summary

name: Rabbits and Rats
description:
This is part a series of games that was in Japanese Tactics magazine issues 48, 50, and 52.

In issue 48, the players take on the roles of either rabbits or rats. This is a kind of RPG, and the battlefield can be whatever the Game Master decides, so you may be trying to get sustenance or to other objectives. However, in your way are many obstacles. For the rabbit there is the farmer and fox, and for the rat there is the lady of the farm and various birds and owls. There are additional foes that can be thrown into the mix, such as a squirrel, cat, dog, mole, beaver, snake, even barbed wire. Each of these had their own ability stats which were resolves using one or more d6.

The later issues featuring the game added different complexities and critters.

All issues came with a map and paper tokens, with the rules and charts being inside the magazine. The tokens were standees. Assembly was required.

—user summary

From Japanese Wikipedia:

A TRPG in which the player plays a small animal such as a rabbit or a cat as a player character (PC). Other than the fact that PCs are animals, PCs do not have a common purpose. What the PC needs to do depends on the scenario prepared by the game master, and at one time the goal of the game is to hunt for survival, and sometimes the goal of the game is to explore the city of humans.

According to the design concept defined in the rulebook, the atmosphere that Rabbits & Rats is aiming for is "The Rabbits of Watership Down", "The Adventurers" (Gamba's Adventures), "The Adventures of Miss Bianca", and "Rocky Chuck the Mountain Mouse". ", "Dr. Raccoon and His Friends", "Seaton's Book of Animals", etc.

In this game, the player characters are able to communicate with each other even if they are of different races due to the common language of the animals. (However, you must succeed in the skill assessment.)

The player character is determined by choosing a preset animal race. Each animal race has its own set of stats and initial skills, making it a kind of archetype-based character-making system.

The animal races in the rulebook are rabbits, badgers, rats, squirrels, cats, dogs, otters, sea otters, snakes, and moles.

The act judgment belongs to the percentage roll. If two decahedral dice are rolled to obtain a value in the range of 10~1, and the value is less than or equal to the skill value used for the action judgment, the judgment is considered successful.

Many of the skills are unique to animals, and some of them are not often found in regular TRPGs. (For example, when performing actions that are common sense for humans but should not be performed by wild animals, such as "crossing a river using something similar to a boat instead of swimming," it is necessary to succeed in determining the act of "conceivable" skills.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: Infinity Rogue: Space Dungeon
description:
As the Infinity Rogue, you're more than a spacefaring adventurer - you're a luck-pushing, hell-raising maverick with a knack for diving head-first into the galaxy's most perilous pits. This time, you've crash-landed into the depths of the infamous Space Dungeon.

Brace yourself to fight, dodge, and endure the relentless onslaught. Fortune favours the bold? Maybe, but push Lady Luck too far, and she's ready with a cosmic-sized sledgehammer to deliver a brutal reality check.

Objective
Find the Key Card: Navigate the Dungeon Level, exploring rooms to find the crucial Key Card.
Defeat the Boss: After you've got the Key Card, head for the exit. However, you'll find a challenging end-of-level Boss waiting to test your skills.
Win the Game: Battle your way through all three Space Dungeon levels to escape and claim victory!


Tactical Card-Based Gameplay: Push-your-luck Blackjack style. Build your player deck with legendary items and enhance your odds of survival. Tailor it with each shuffle, balancing risk and reward to carve your path to victory.
Roguelike dungeon crawler: You’ll face Brutal Opponent Threats (BOTs), crafted to be almost sentient, ensuring every battle is not just a challenge but a duel for survival.
Unending Roguelike Journey: Every game and every Dungeon Level of Space Dungeon is randomly generated, and with four levels of difficulty, it guarantees infinite unique adventures.


—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Bet x Battle
description:
Bet x Battle is a 10-card Poker-esque bluffing microgame. Each round, you play 2 cards from your hand face-down, then start Betting: You can raise, fold, or call. Y’know, the usual Poker stuff.

Then Battle: flip your cards over to see who won! Don’t just play your best cards all at once, though, because any cards that you play get passed to your opponent!

How many moves ahead can you read? Maneuver & position, and bluff & bluster your way to victory!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wine of Sicily
description:
Wine of Sicily is a battle of wits for 2-6 players, distilled down to one single card. The card represents a goblet of wine. Its reverse side has two orientations: Poisoned and Unpoisoned. Each round, the Sommelier takes the Goblet and chooses whether or not to Poison it by rotating it to the associated orientation, then hands it to another player face-down. That player can choose to Drink from the Goblet, or peek at the card and Pass it to another player, who then chooses between the two options, but watch out: If all other players Pass, the Sommelier must drink from the Goblet themself!

If you drink poisoned wine twice, you are eliminated from the game. You win the game if you drink unpoisoned wine twice or all other players have been eliminated. Will you leave the goblet unpoisoned knowing that no one else will want to drink from it? Or will you poison it, knowing that someone else will know that you know that no else will want to drink from it and thus will want to drink from it?

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Bonsoir!
description:
A game adapted from the challenges of the youtubers Mc Fly and Carlito. With the party game Bonsoir! YouTubers Mc Fly and Carlito have not been idle. In this Party Game adapted from their videos, you will find their whole crazy universe

The different games
By playing Bonsoir!, players embark on a fun and lively journey punctuated by crazy challenges. Each square on the board represents a challenge to be overcome:
"We call random people": Call a random person and say a forced word in the conversation.

The "Trivia Contest": Tell a story to players who have to decide if it's true or not. Earn 100 likes per wrong answer.

The "Too Honest": Raise your hand if you've committed this sin and earn 100 likes if the majority wins.

The "Blind Test of Synonyms": Guess the title of a song from synonyms.

The "Double Baccalaureate": You have 30 seconds to give as many words starting with the same letter from a theme.

The "Overrated or Underrated": From a list of words, you must choose one and say whether you find it to be overrated or not. The other players must vote. The goal is to get as many players as possible to agree with you.

The "Mix'N'Twist": You have the time of an hourglass to validate the most "Mix'N'Twist" which consists of combining two delicious foods separately but disgusting when they are together.

The "Rock, Leaf, Toucan": Challenge the player of your choice and win two rounds of this game made famous by McFly and Carlito.

The "Cheh!, Deso not deso, Seum" boxes: The player who lands on one of these squares must put 100, 200 or 300 likes respectively into the Thumb Market prize pool.

The "Compliment" box: All players must give a sincere compliment to the player on this box and give them 100 likes each.

The "Thumb Market" square: The player who lands on this square, earns all the likes present on the square.

name: 秘宝の郷 (The Hidden Treasure Village)
description:
秘宝の郷 ("The Hidden Treasure Village") is a game that was presented in issue 64 of TACTICS magazine (March 1989).

The game deals with an investigation by a team trying to locate a treasure that was hidden by a Lord during the Sengoku Jidai. The players act as the investigators of this team and must not only uncover the treasure, but they must also protect themselves against espionage, sabotage, and hidden dangers. that is trying to uncover.

The game is a chit-pull system, where the players draw from a cup. Players take turn moving and doing an action. The action can be things like drawing a counter, espionage, sabotage, and metal detecting.

The winner is the player who discovers the treasure before turn 60.

—user summary

name: Ruck-zuck
description:
At the start of the game, the movable color slide is in the neutral space in the middle. The players take turns to roll the color die and move the slide by pulling on the cord.
Whoever is the first to roll yellow begins the game and can choose one of the two target colors - red or yellow - and pull it forward to the first yellow color space in their own target direction. If you roll black, you can “quickly” pull to the next space of the same color.
If you roll a color in front of the goal that no longer appears, you skip the tug of war once. Whoever pulls the color plate into their own target space first is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tug of War

name: C'est grave docteur ?
description:
Turn on the voice-recognition bed, choose from 12 funny and original characters!

Ask your patient! How's his nose? His head?

To question your patient, press and release the button. You'll hear a beeping sound and then you'll be able to speak.

Examine and manipulate their analyses such as their temperature, blood pressure or x-ray!

Take notes on your diagnostic pad and compare them to the diseases on the poster to identify your disease!

name: Escape Game: Le cadenas électronique
description: Solve the puzzles and discover the clues with your detective tools and play the winning combination to unlock the electronic padlock in time!

name: Garden Getaway
description:
Join the lively gathering of garden animals as they come together each summer for an extravagant feast in ﻿Garden Getaway. A surprise awaits them though: the furious Gardener, upset to find them feasting on his veggie patch!

Run as fast as you can to outsmart the Gardener by navigating through the chaos, learn decision-making skills, and immerse yourself in a colorful world with charming characters!

Includes multiple ways to modify the game to play with younger or older children.
Delightful wooden player pieces and dice.
Fun for adults and children to play together!

name: Wandering Monsters
description:
A cozy, non-violent fantasy engine builder game

Story: Roam the lands, foraging, exploring, crafting, and building. Leave this place better than you found it. Not to prove that you're not the monster others think you are, but because it makes you happy.

Overview for Solo Rondel Game: Cards are multi-use. They can be discarded to move, or consumed for action points or card draw. Additionally, they can be played onto the rondel, improving your actions. Build up an engine at the cost of whittling your deck away. Gain hearts for playing cards and using the actions of certain cards when you visit them. Score at least 16 hearts to win!
categories: Adventure, Animals, Economic, Exploration, Farming, Print & Play, Puzzle, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Pieces as Map, Race, Resource to Move, Rondel, Set Collection, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource
publishers: (Web published), Charming Games Collective, Studio Denka

name: Battle in Front of the Witch's House
description:
Using 5 dice: 1 for the witch which she will use to launch her negative powers on the board, the other 4 dice use them to determine the column or row by first placing a number on a servant of the witch and from there you must place numbers in a straight line, as far as possible with equal adjacent results, which represent the great battle. Collect very useful items from the patio, by means of the last number placed, you obtain the adjacent items to use them later, use the magic that is thrown towards you to your advantage trying to survive from the sorceress's lackeys throughout 9 rounds and managing to win by more victory points than the other players who have gone out to hunt the evil witch.

-description from designer

name: VanWoow
description:
Board game for caravaning and small-town lovers.

Visit Alange during the orchids month. Look for dinosaur fosils in Prejano. Walk through the overlook and fountains route in Fulleda...

Show you are the most expert traveller!

In VanWoow we choose carefully which small towns we visit, trying to maximize the number of different experiences and participating in typical events in each town.

It will be fun!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Hazardous Movement Scenario Pack 4: Making the Grade
description: Making the Grade recreates World War II battles the world over: from the frozen forests of Finland to the steamy jungles of Guadacanal, from the Winter War of 1939 to the last, desperate attempts by the Germans to stem the inexorable advance of the Red Army on the Eastern Front battles in 1945.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ミニモニ。人生ゲームだぴょん！(Mini Moni Jinsei Game da pyon!)
description:
A simplified game of Life featuring the girled from the Hello! Project group Mini Moni。Spaces to encounter include ジャンケンぴょん！ spots, events, items and shops. All Japanese text is simplified for ages 6+.

Character meeples included for Mika, Kago Ai, Yaguchi Mari and Tsuji Nozomi. Movement occurs by spinner.

name: Pacific 1941-45: Wake 1941
description:
This small battle is an expansion for the Pacific 1941-45 by TiS in its Battles of the World War (B-35) system. It covers battle of the Wake island (Operation Straight Line) fought December 1941. It contains two scenarios, allowing to fight from 11 or 23 December.

The operation involved Imperial Japanese troops, mounting an assault on the Wake island, defended by US marine detachment.

There are map, counters and a single scenario sheet. Ownership of the Pacific 1941-45 is required to play.

Game was published in the 45 issue of TiS magazine in the Polish language only.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Fortitudinal Resonator Promo Card
description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2023!

Text on the card:
Fortitudinal Resonator
Prize

The next time another player gains Fortitude, add this card to the Prize Bin. You gain Fortitude equal to the amount that player gained.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: What Lies In Shadow Game Supplement
description:
The Darkness corrupts all that it touches, spreading fear and greed through even the toughest soldiers that dare stand against it.

This 15 card Game Supplement for Shadows of Brimstone includes new Spanish Explorer Darkness cards, Growing Hunger cards, and Spanish Fort Encounter cards. This pack was not part of any Kickstarter pledges.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: My Bloody Valentine: The Game – Expansion Pack #1
description:
My Bloody Valentine: The Game – Expansion Pack #1

Adds 6 NEW Characters and 10 NEW and GROUP Action cards.

Comes in a mini-replica heart-shaped candy box that you can store directly INSIDE the main board game box!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: My Bloody Valentine: The Game – Expansion Pack #2
description:
My Bloody Valentine: The Game – Expansion Pack 2

This expansion adds a Trivia module to the game. If Harry (the killer) is 6 or less away from winning the game the players can choose to try the "Trivia Setback Round". IF they successfully answer the Trivia question within 15 seconds, they can move Harry back 6 spaces. This can only be done once per game.

Includes 15-second sand timer and 30 sealed trivia cards (enough for 30 games - used once per game).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Battle of Amritsar
description:
This is a Japanese Doujin (fan-made) game that was produced for sale at the Japanese game shows, such as Game Market. You would place an order for it and then pick it up at the show.

This game simulates the Battle of Amritsar in the series Legend of the Galactic Heroes. The game's rules are based on the "Fierce Battle!" system in Game Journal 29.

Comes with rules, two player aids, a sheet of counters, and a four-part map. Assembly is required.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: 6th Battle of Iserlohn and The Battle of Tiamat
description:
This is a Japanese Doujin (fan-made) game that was produced for sale at the Japanese game shows, such as Game Market. You would place an order for it and then pick it up at the show.

This game simulates the 6th Battle of Iserlohn in the series Legend of the Galactic Heroes. The game's rules are based on the "Fierce Battle!" system in Game Journal 29. A bonus scenario for the battle of Tiamat is also included.

Comes with rules, two player aids, a sheet of counters, and a four-part map. Assembly is required.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Battle of Vermilion Star Zone
description:
This is a Japanese Doujin (fan-made) game that was produced for sale at the Japanese game shows, such as Game Market. You would place an order for it and then pick it up at the show.

This game simulates the Battle of Vermilian Star Zone in the series Legend of the Galactic Heroes. The game's rules are based on the "Fierce Battle!" system in Game Journal 29.

Comes with rules, two player aids, a sheet of counters, and a four-part map. Assembly is required.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: All things Impermanent:  The Battle of Dannoura
description:
The Battle of Dannoura is a Japanese doujin (fan-made) game produced by Ludens Faber. The game simulates the last battle of the Gempei War, a naval combat, between the Taira and Minamoto.

The game is a typical wargame, with movement and attack values, zones of control, a CRT for combat results, and a turn track.

The game includes a map, rules, historical guide, and mounted counters. The counters need to be cut out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table
publishers: Dōjin Club Ludens Faber (同人会ルデンス・ファベル)

name: Ragnarocks: Sif Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign.

Card Description:
At The Start of Your Opponent's Turn:
If an opponent's Viking is adjacent to any of your Vikings, that Viking cannot summon this turn (it can still be selected and moved).

name: Last Light: King Missile Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign.

Card Description:
Exhaust and roll 1 combat die and resolve it.

name: Good Cop Bad Cop: Equipment Pack 4 – Survive
description:
This is a pack of 5 equipment cards included in the Game Boy Geek Season 11 (2023) Kickstarter Campaign. It contains:

1) Molotov Cocktail: Anyone who has a leader card must draw an equipment.

2) Landmine: Use when a player with no revealed leader cards investigates, that player is shot.

3) Shotgun: Use when another player shoots. The shooter chooses a non-wounded player to also be shot.

4) Baseball Bat: Starting with you and proceeding in turn order, everyone who is armed must change their aim.

5) Floodlight: Choose a player. Investigate them and the players to their left and right.

name: Super Kids Board Game
description:
Oh no, the town needs the Super Kids help! Gather the Super Kids and work together to help the town clean up the messes caused by the Mischief Maker and catch him before he escapes! The Super Kids are ready to race around the town collecting super gear that will help their neighbors clean up the messes made by the mean Mischief Maker. But they better be fast! If the Mischief Maker sneaks out of town before all the messes are cleaned up, he’ll be back to cause trouble again.

In Super Kids, our little heroes race around town collecting the things they need to clean up their neighbors’ messes. Players move around the board using dice with simple numbers and collect their super gear cards as they go. Work as a team to help all the neighbors and catch the Mischief Maker in time.

Super Kids uses a cute and colorful setting that makes helping your neighbors and saving the day and exciting adventure. This cooperative game is the perfect introduction to basic counting, strategic thinking, and teamwork. Minimal reading makes this game perfect for kids ages 5 and up.

Box contains 1 game board, 1 Mischief Maker token, 4 Super Kid tokens, 7 neighbor tokens, 2 dice, and 30 cards.

-description from publisher

name: Shadow House: The Code
description:
After a series of extraordinary events, Viscount Shadow met an untimely demise. With no designated successor, the family recalled the existence of the Viscount's will, securely stored in a safe. The challenge, however, lies in the fact that nobody possesses the complete password to access the safe. The Viscount, known for his love of solving mysteries, had scattered clues throughout the mansion.

In Shadow House: The Code, players assume the roles of detectives, invited to the Shadow Viscount's mansion to uncover clues that will unlock the safe. Throughout the game, you have already discovered some clues to make educated guesses about the password. You interact with your opponents, posing questions to extract additional clues, and then work towards deducing the final solution. It requires cleverness to answer accurately, as your conversation may inadvertently reveal more information to the listener. However, making a mistake in divulging secret document clues could expose your own secrets. The first person to input the correct pair of numbers while revealing the correct answer emerges victorious.

This deduction game carries a lively party game atmosphere. In the course of the game, will you choose to disclose details such as the time you woke up today, your weight, or your birthday?

-description from publisher

name: Kickoff
description:
Kickoff is the boardgame for real football fanatics, played with 11 pawns and corresponding cards on each team. Each card has a set of skills.

The game is being played with 5 six-sided dice to move around. When interacting with an opponent a combination of dice and the skills on the player cards will decide the winner.

Scoring a goal happens through the use of an action spinner, an eight-sided dice and a six-sided dice.

Try to score before your opponent does in a thrilling football game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Score-and-Reset Game, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game

name: Slime Control
description:
Slime Control is a single-player puzzle game. The goal is to eliminate as many of the Multi-Eyed Gelatinous Cubes (D6 Dice) as possible before your last Slime is eliminated.

The game setup includes tossing the dice onto the game board as a random setup each time the game is played.

Slimes can take 1 of the following Actions each Turn as they take control of the Multi-Eyed Gelatinous Cubes (MEGC):
Move a MEGC
Grow into a Large Slime
Suck Life out of a MEGC
Jump onto an Adjacent MEGC
Activate the Power of the MEGC

Large Slimes can split into 2 smaller Slimes to take control of more MEGCs at the same time.

Multi-Eyed Gelatinous Cube Powers
Black - Can only be controlled by a Large Slime.
Blue - Grow an Extra Small Slime and place it on an Adjacent MEGC, on the same turn
Brown - Starting Value is 6. 6
Green - When controlled by a Slime, it can move 2 Squares (instead of 1).
Purple - When controlled by a Slime, it can pass through a wall.
Red - UPKEEP: Automatically hunts down the nearest Slime and explodes when adjacent to the Slime.
White - Frozen and cannot be moved.
Yellow - UPKEEP: Automatically move clockwise around the board.

After no additional valid moves can be made, count the number of dice remaining on the board. The fewer dice remaining, the better the score.

Required components:

A printed Dungeon Map (printed on 8.5 x 11 paper). It contains a 6x6 grid of squares
5 Blue Glass Gems – 3 Small gems as small Slimes, 2 Large gems as large Slimes.
If you do not have gems, use 3 small coins (like dimes) and 2 larger coins (like nickels).

Sixteen D6 Dice (2 of each of the following colors). These are the Multi-Eyed Gelatinous Cubes (MEGC) that populate the Dungeon.
2 Black
2 Blue
2 Brown
2 Green
2 Purple
2 Red
2 White
2 Yellow



Each Turn is made up of two Phases, Action and Upkeep.

During the Action Phase, the Player controls the Slime(s) on the board.
During the Upkeep Phase, the Player moves the Dice per specific rules.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Knives Out
description:
The queen is dead! Long live the next heir or heiress or pet who survives this fierce battle of backstabbing, betrayal and dirty tricks.

Place one candidate for the throne between every two players and two more in the center of the table.
Each player chooses one of their cards, the number on it will determine the turn order. In that order, the players use the ability of the card on the table, available, furthest to the left, covering the old card with which they have played and, thus, create the new sequence of abilities for the next round.

At the end of the game the candidates for the throne with more daggers than resistance will be eliminated. The candidate with the lowest value alive will be the worthy successor, and the players who are next to him will be the winners... If any...
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Night Princess
description:
隠れ身のナイトプリンセス (Night Princess) is a werewolf-style game from Japan, in which two teams try to identify the leader of the opposing team and defeat them. However, if a non-leader is defeated, the attacking team loses.

The game has decks of cards to identify the two teams and the players' roles in their team, and item cards which are used for attack. Once the teams are established, the items cards are dealt out to form player hands.

On their turn, a player plays an item card as an attack and places a damage token on it, and directs this against an opponent. The damage token represents a clue as to the identity of the attacker. The item cards have unique abilities which aid in the attack.

Once the attack is resolved, the victim becomes the next player to attack if possible.

The game continues in this manner until somebody is defeated, and reveals their hidden identity. If they were the leader, the opposing team wins. If not, the opposing team loses.
user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Host Your Own Murder Mystery: Murder At The Mansion
description: It's the 1970's and there's been a murder! Charlie Rosemary has been found murdered at the Rosemary's mansion in spooky Salem, Massachusetts during a costume party. Friends and family have to remain in the mansion all night whilst the local police investigate!

name: Princess & Werewolf
description:
姫と人狼 (Princess & Werewolf) is a werewolf-style game from Japan which re-implements Night Princess from 2015 into a broader game design.

The players are either in the Red or Blue team, and must identify and defeat the other team's leader (the Princess) to win. If a non-leader is defeated, the attacking team loses. Players have secret roles in the game, and use item cards to attack on opposing character, adding a token which gives a clue to their own identity. Players also have sword and shield tokens to use, and witch tokens.

The new game differs by having each player run a number of characters in their team. This allows broad gameplay with just two players. Further, players do not start the game knowing who their allies are, and the characters include a werewolf who is a traitor to the team. If the werewolf can identify the princess, they win outright.

When the game was first produced at the Tokyo Game Market in December 2023, pre-orders received some bonus cards:

Hidden Princess - This character allows the leader to be switch amongst the other characters. The Hidden princess is more powerful than the normal Princess, and enables the game to played longer.

Cursed Werewolf - If the cursed werewolf identifies the opposing Princess, the game does not end, and the team's leader may switch to another character.
user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Manchomémo
description:
Manchomémo is a funny memory based game which target is getting points remembering and guessing several kinds of animals until the penguin is discovered.

Then the Game is over and the winner is the player with the most scoring.

What's hiding on the other side of the card? You will need a memory like an elefant to win as many cards as you can just before the hiden penguin appears in order to finish the game.

name: Only Fools Rush In
description:
How close can you get to the dragon without getting eaten?

Send your three heroes on a dangerous mission to gain renown and hopefully steal a couple gems from the dragon. But be careful… get too close and you may not return at all…

On your turn:
Flip a card to reveal movements and place it beside the top card on the colors deck. You may change orientation to best suit your goal. Strategically, move the heroes in any order you wish. When moving, skip completely over occupied spaces. Once any player has entered the cave, there will be one more turn to see if they can keep their spot in the cave. If they are still in the cave at the end of the turn, the game ends and everyone scores points based on how close they are to the cave.

Solo play introduces a brain bending puzzle to the mix as you must control 4 heroes of different colors, but end up as close to the dragon as you can in a certain order.

A bidding variation allows you to predict what hero will win and gain points while it gradually becomes more and more obvious who will win. If they don’t get eaten, that is.

-description from designer
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Moving Multiple Units, Push Your Luck, Relative Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Viva el Cristo Rey!: Wargame Rules for the Spanish Civil War of 1936-1939
description: Miniatures rules written for 1/72 or 1/76 scale, with each base representing an infantry company or cavalry squadron.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: SD Gundam: Battle of the Sky Castle
description:
This is an LSI Electronic game centered around the SD Gundam franchise.

The game involves both sides moving their pieces on a board in an attempt to capture each other's base. When the time comes to resolve combat, the attacking and defensing pieces are placed into a machine which animates the battle and determines the outcome.

name: SD Gundam: GARMS Command Grand Strategy
description:
This is an LSI electronic game using the SD Gundam franchise.

This is a wargame in which two players fight in an attempt to take each other's base out. The game has electronic counters which, when one player attacks another, are placed inside a device that animates the battle and displays the results.

Once a player invades their opponent's base, the land map is changed and they fight inside the headquarters.

name: Cake-N-Bake Challenge
description:
Cake-N-Bake Challenge is a competitive game focused around stacking foam pieces to create a cake shown on the game card players are given. Players can win a Candle Card by being the first to stack the cake correctly, and the first to receive six of these cards is the winner and gets to wear the Chef's Hat. During gameplay, Special Action Cards can be drawn that change the way players must stack their cakes. Examples include stacking the cake with one hand, in the reverse order of what is seen on the game card, or from memory after viewing the game card for 10 seconds. The game can be played in three ways, but the main objective is always the same.

Beginner Bakers (2-6 Players): Players start with foam cake pieces in all six colors and two different double-sided icing pieces that is theirs to keep throughout the game.

Mixin' Madness (2-6 Players): All pieces (cake and icing) are mixed together in the middle of the table at the start of the game.

Bakery Bakeoff (Sensory Play, 2-3 Teams): All pieces (cake and icing) are mixed together in the middle of the table at the start of the game. Each team picks one player as the Lead Baker, and one as the Assistant Baker. The Assistant Baker has their eyes closed, and must be instructed by the Lead Baker on how to bake the cake while feeling for pieces with the correct texture. The winning team receives the Candle Card at the end of the round.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stacking and Balancing, Team-Based Game

name: 3Stein
description:
The battle for the three castles
The peaceful coexistence of three castle lords is over and the gauntlet has been thrown down. Now they go into battle with their knights and squires. Everyone against everyone. How will this battle end? Which lord of the castle will be defeated first? And by whom? After all, three strong rivals are facing each other - there can only be one winner in this battle! But even the lord of the castle who is knocked out of the field first still has a chance of winning as a vassal.
Strategic thinking, ingenious tactics and sensitive empathy are required, but a little luck is also necessary.

name: Game Against Grey's Anatomy
description:
Similar to "Cards Against Humanity", but specifically for fans of the TV show "Grey's Anatomy."

To start, the player who does the best imitation of the character 'Meredith' begins as the "judge" and is referred to as "Queen Meredith." This person draws and reads the question or fill-in-the-blank phrase on the first black card. The players have previously been dealt or draw ten white phrase cards. Each player selects one phrase card and passes it face-down to Queen Meredith, who then shuffles them all together. Queen Meredith then reads each card combination with the group. For a fuller effect, Queen Meredith should re-read the black card with each of the white cards.

Queen Meredith then chooses which combination they think is funniest, and the player who submitted that card receives one point. A new Queen Meredith is then selected and draws and reads a new black card, while the other players draw their hand back up to ten white cards.

Play proceeds until a pre-determined number of rounds have been played, with the point leader being the winner, or one of the players reaches a pre-determined number of points.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Энергосеть: Россия (Power Grid: Russia)
description:
Your main task in the board game Энергосеть. Россия (Power Grid. Russia) is to provide electricity to the largest number of cities. Players choose pre-existing routes between cities to connect, and then bid against each other to purchase the various power plants that are needed to provide the selected cities with energy.

However, once the plants have been purchased, new, more efficient power plants become available over time. Therefore, by your purchase, you are potentially allowing other players to gain access to equipment superior to yours.

In addition, players need to purchase the raw materials (coal, oil, garbage, and uranium) needed to power the power plants (except for renewable wind and solar power plants, which do not require fuel), creating a constant struggle and competition.

Thus, you are faced with a difficult choice - either upgrade your power plants to maximize efficiency or have enough money on hand to quickly expand your grid when the time comes to get the cheapest and most profitable routes.

---

This is a stand-alone version of Power Grid that comes with the Russia/Japan map instead of the Germany/USA map.
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Income, Market, Network and Route Building, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up

name: Экопатруль: Биотрансы и техногиры (Ecopatrol: Biotrans and Technogears)
description:
Ecopatrol is one of the early game to be released by Tehnolog after their founding.

The game deals with a planet where robotic animals live. There are two sides: Biotrances and Technogyrs, who have been at war with one another for some time (much like Battlebeasts).

The game is a miniatures-based one, with players moving their robots on the board (a 3-D structure). Each of the robots has their own abilities and attributes which players use in their games. For combat, players actually "shoot" with their robots and try to knock their opponent's over.

—user summary

EcoPatrol is a battle of robot-like beasts. The arena of battles is multi-tiered cardboard fortifications - ramps, galleries and towers. The characters of the game, the Environmental Rangers (in this role are animals - lions, rhinos, dogs, crocodiles, turned into combat cyborgs) confront smugglers and mercenaries - Technohybrids, robotic monsters. A series of exciting missions immerses players in the atmosphere of confrontation between galactic special forces protecting the nature of wild planets, and mercenaries in the service of interstellar corporations.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Экопатруль: Биотрансы и техногиры 2 (Ecopatrol: Biotrans and Technogears 2)
description:
Ecopatrol is one of the early game to be released by Tehnolog after their founding.

The game deals with a planet where robotic animals live. There are two sides: Biotrances and Technogyrs, who have been at war with one another for some time (much like Battlebeasts).

The game is a miniatures-based one, with players moving their robots on the board (a 3-D structure). Each of the robots has their own abilities and attributes which players use in their games. For combat, players actually "shoot" with their robots and try to knock their opponent's over.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Grizzly Gulch Runaway Adventure
description:
Based on the Shanghai Disneyland attraction, this board game was a promotional item sent out in advance of the ride's opening.

In this elaborately produced game, players race their mine carts around the track, collecting gold nuggets and avoiding hazards. The player to finish with the most gold wins!

name: Muffin's Magical Kingdom
description:
On an ordinary day, an ordinary house cat named Muffin, was given an ordinary taste of some less than ordinary cat food. The mix of rotting fish and peculiar additives made her hallucinate. In a very extraordinary feverish trip, seven personalities diverged to manifest the seven houses of Muffins Magical Kingdom. Through acts of political discourse, and the clever use of magical tails, the Houses began to vie for control as they sway the tides of the Muffins Mind.

Muffin's Magical Kingdom is a semi-cooperative trick-taking game for 3 or more players, that plays in 20-45 minutes depending on the number of players. It plays in exactly 21 tricks.

We start with the dealer, who comes in the form of a Rat trying to put the pieces of Muffin back together again. They randomly deal a House and 10 cards to each player. The Rat then chooses the Trump House which serves a dual purpose for scoring. Each trick won, the player collects not only the cards from the trick but also the Trump house card.

Each House has a special ability that is a reflection of their personality trait that is triggered whenever the card is played. These abilities can manipulate players hands, communication, and their future. Players may communicate by passing messages through courier Rats, but each message sent can be read by the Rat player so all houses should handle with care.

The game ends when all 21 tricks are won, or any player wins a Trick from all 7 Houses. If the Rat player wins all 7 Houses, they immediately win the game. If a House player wins all 7 Houses, they immediately lose the game and the Rat wins.

Scoring is based on the house and playing cards won during each each. 1 point for each card, 5 points for each card with a matching house, and 10 points for each card where all house cards are collected for that house. There are 4 cards for each house inclusive of the one randomly dealt at the start of the game.

-description from designer

name: Monopoly: Mandai
description:
A unique official licensed edition of Monopoly for the "Mandai Wildlife Group".

The how-to-play is similar to the typical Monopoly board game but instead of Chance and Community Chest cards, you will have Act for Wildlife and Care for Wildlife cards. The tokens are also different from the usual ones -- they include an orangutan, pangolin, turtle, cockatoo, handheld transceiver and gumboot, represent threatened species under the care of the Mandai Wildlife Group as well as the equipment and tools used in the parks.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mail Bucks
description:
MAIL BUCKS is a light, yet strategic math game. The game is all about delivering mathematically-correct mail around neighbourhoods and collecting money in return.

LASERCUT COMPONENTS:
• 108 number tiles: 1-9, 10, 20, 25, 30, 40, 50
• 12 sets of operator tiles: + - x
• 10 house standees with bases
• 5 mailboxes with bases
• 5 mail trucks with bases
• 20 coins in two denominations ($) ($$)

GOAL:
Players will be required to collect numbers to form equations. The equation will match a house number. Deliver the mail to the matching house to get paid. Collect the most value in coins by forming simple mathematical equations that yield a street delivery address for a target house.

MODES:
Younger Child Play: Only the addition operators will be used and house numbers will range from 11 to 20.
Full Play: All mathematical operators are used with house numbers 11-99.
 
SETUP:
• Arrange the houses into your choice of neighbourhoods with one mailbox per group (see Neighbourhoods below)
• Shuffle the number tiles and operators upside down in two separate draw piles
• Assign each house an address using random number tiles (1-9 only) face up.
• Place a coin on each house base as follows: one ($) for addresses 11-50, ($$) for addresses 51+.
• Place three number tiles and one operator tile face up on each mailbox base.
• Each player grabs a mail truck.
• Each player grabs one number tile to keep in secret.

END OF GAME CONDITIONS:
Agree upon what constitutes the end of the game:
• Abandoned Homes: upon picking up money, the house is abandoned and will no longer have an address.
• Target Score: play until a player has collected coins that total a minimum value like 5 points.

GAME PLAY:
On each turn, a player has 30 seconds to do the following:
• Move their truck to either a mailbox or house.
• When at a mailbox, pick up one or more required tiles into their truck slots, replacing empty mailbox slots with fresh tile(s) from the draw pile(s).
• When at a house, call out their equation and destination address, allowing opponent(s) to verify the math is correct; collect the coin; replace the house with two fresh tiles (unless abandoned); discard all the tiles from the truck.

Secret Number Tile:
Place your secret number tile into your truck at any time. Once used, grab another number tile to keep secret.

Mailbox Operations:
A truck at a mailbox may either:
• Take one or more tiles from the mailbox and place in the truck; replace all empty mailbox slots with new tile(s) from the appropriate draw pile(s)

House Operations:
If the truck is in the same neighbourhood as their destination address, the player calls out their equation and collects the coins.

If the truck fulfills their equation and is not at the neighbourhood with the destination address, the player must wait until their next turn to move their truck to the correct neighbourhood.

TIP: Before selecting tiles at a mailbox, choose wisely based on the addresses you see.

FORMING EQUATIONS:
Form math equations by using at least two numbers and one operator. The equation is formed within the base of your truck. The solution to the equation will be the address of a house (destination). To form the equation, collect the correct numbers and operator(s). Examples:

Valid Matching Equations
7+7 2x5+4 20-6 all match house number 14.

ENDING THE GAME:
Keep playing until no one can collect any more tiles.

WINNING THE GAME:
The winner will have the most value in coins. If there is a tie, play another round.

EXCEPTIONS:
You cannot stop in a neighbourhood where there is another truck. Only one truck per neighbourhood.

FAQ: TBD

-description from designer

name: Horns Up: Circle Pit Perils
description: Expansion card deck. Aditional characters and effect cards.

name: Quagmire
description:
A race to stay afloat as the land gives away underfoot. Walk, run, and jump around the board to hamper the other team, but make sure to leave enough room for your own!

Quagmire is an abstract strategy game for two players, played on a small hexagonal board. On their turn, a player moves one of their two meeples a short distance and destroys some of the board in the process. Meeple can jump small gaps, but eventually, through tactical movement and blocking, one player will run out of moves and lose the game.

The game is intended to be an introduction to luckless, combinatorial games and to be accessible to young children. Thus the game has simple rules and plays very quickly.

-description from designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Reduction

name: Старсис: Вторжение на рун (Starsys: Rune Invasion)
description:
The game Starsis was released in 2 sets: Invasion of the Runes and Skirmish on Gronta. Each of the sets is dedicated to one "amphibious operation" in wars of the distant future. While managing a unit, players must complete a chain of missions - by completing them, one by one, they are approaching the ultimate victory. The games of the Starsys series unfold on a playing field divided by on the cells. But it doesn't stop there - the kit also includes a construction set. Its parts can be used to construct A whole labyrinth of ruins and fortifications. The game is decorated with spectacular accessories - cards, cubes, flags, a bright playing field. Squads of soldiers have their own names, combat characteristics, and army ranks.

There is also a legend of the game - the battles of the space Empire and the interstellar Trade Protectorate. Star Troopers are Troops of the warring states. Having clashed in the battles of the first two missions, they will continue the war in the vast expanses hostile space.

Games of the Starsis series no longer contain firing weapons - everything is solved with the help of dice. The figurines are noticeably smaller than those that Fantasy Battles players are used to. In general, the games of the Starsis series are solid tabletop tactical war games. Despite the fact that there are only two sets in this series, there are more than a dozen miniature figures. So Starsis can be safely to be called the first Russian "fantastic" wargame.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Старсис: Схватка на гронте (Starsys: Skirmish on the Gront)
description:
The game Starsis was released in 2 sets: Invasion of the Runes and Skirmish on Gronta. Each of the sets is dedicated to one "amphibious operation" in wars of the distant future. While managing a unit, players must complete a chain of missions - by completing them, one by one, they are approaching the ultimate victory. The games of the Starsys series unfold on a playing field divided by on the cells. But it doesn't stop there - the kit also includes a construction set. Its parts can be used to construct A whole labyrinth of ruins and fortifications. The game is decorated with spectacular accessories - cards, cubes, flags, a bright playing field. Squads of soldiers have their own names, combat characteristics, and army ranks.

There is also a legend of the game - the battles of the space Empire and the interstellar Trade Protectorate. Star Troopers are Troops of the warring states. Having clashed in the battles of the first two missions, they will continue the war in the vast expanses hostile space.

Games of the Starsis series no longer contain firing weapons - everything is solved with the help of dice. The figurines are noticeably smaller than those that Fantasy Battles players are used to. In general, the games of the Starsis series are solid tabletop tactical war games. Despite the fact that there are only two sets in this series, there are more than a dozen miniature figures. So Starsis can be safely to be called the first Russian "fantastic" wargame.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Bam! Smash! Ka-pow!
description:
This retro parody super hero themed card game requires players to defeat 3 villains ravaging Crime Capitol City. Players gain Mutations, Weapons, and Hideouts on their play mat to power up attacks. During an attack opponents can help as a side kick or hinder with a variety of modifier cards such as “Annoying Detective.” Watch out when drawing Final Strike as you may end up fighting another villain instead!

Turn based gameplay consists of two actions that allow players to combine strategies to disrupt opponents (such as passing/stealing cards) or maximize an attack opportunity. The best laid plans can be interrupted by a timely Plot Twist- a counter to most cards and actions in the game.

This strategic party game is for 2-6 players (single player rules available on the game’s website). Players will enjoy the retro graphics, clever card text, and strategy that evolves the more you play.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Drawing, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: Fire Flowers (Clear Duets & Solo Series)
description:
Japan's most prestigious fireworks competition is about to begin! Will you be able to make all your fire flowers bloom to their fullest? It's up to you to keep the audience delighted!

Fire Flowers (Clear Duets & Solo Series) is a polyomino puzzle game for 1–2 players that combines hand management, limited communication, layering, and grid coverage/reduction in a fun way. It consists of 36 cards (18 Clear cards + 18 Standard cards).

This game is part of our Clear Series, more specifically our Clear Duets & Solo Series, which focuses on cooperative and solo games for 1–2 players and combines Clear cards and Standard cards in many surprising ways.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Grid Coverage, Hand Management, Layering, Map Reduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Vault: Lockboxes, Accomplices, and a Pair of Thieves
description:
This Print and Play expansion for “Vault: a Solitaire Dice Game,” adds three modules to the game that will change the way that you play the original game, and add some extra replayability to the game.

Lockboxes

These cards give you one extra way of gaining gems. Rather than focusing just on the grid, you now must focus on a list of objectives you can optionally complete alongside the main Vault.

Accomplices

Unlike the original game where each play of Vault was separated, this module connects three plays to each other. In addition, it adds units that you can recruit throughout your game, all of which will give you game breaking options you never had before.

Pair of Thieves

This variant allows you to now play a co-operative version of Vault with one other thief. Complete two Vault's together to see if two thieves really are better than one.

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Star Realms: Deluxe Colonial Collection
description:
Get the ultimate travel version of the award-winning Star Realms Deckbuilding Game! The Deluxe Colonial Collection is an awesome, all-foil 2-4 player card set with 4 high-quality score dials and a beautiful game board in sturdy magnetically sealed box!

The Colonial Collection features 234 beautiful foil cards. That includes foil versions of every card from Colony Wars, Scenarios, all 4 United Packs, Stellar Allies, and the Year 2 Promo Pack. Plus, you’ll get beautiful Alt Art Scouts and Vipers in the four included starter decks.

-description from developer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: ドキドキッチン？！ (Dokidokitchen⁈)
description:
ドキドキッチン？！ (Dokidokicchin⁈) (Dokido kitchen⁈) is a game from Japan, in which players try to guess the ingredients and the name of a dish. (The game title is a pun; 'dokidoki' is your heartbeat).

The ingredients are guessed by closing your eyes, touching the ingredient piece and guessing from its shape.
For the name of the dish, the player guesses and guesses the dish that can be made by combining the guessed ingredients.

Depending on the degree to which the player guesses the ingredients and the name of the dish, the 'maker' and the 'guesser' each get a point. The person with the highest score wins.

The game tests the overall ability to remember the shape of the ingredients, the ability to analyse and identify the differences in shape by touch, and the ability to deduce the dishes that can be made from these ingredients.

「ドキドキッチン」は、料理の食材と料理名を当てるゲームです。

食材は、目をつぶって食材ピースを触り、その形から推測して当てます。
料理名は、推測した食材を組み合わせてできる料理を推測して当てます。
食材や料理名を当てた度合いによって「作った人」と「当てた人」がそれぞれ点を得ます。
当てる人を順番に回していって、得点の高い人の勝ちです。

食材の形を覚えておく記憶力、細かい形の違いを触って見分ける分析力、それらの食材からできる料理を推理する推理力といった総合力が試されます。
--description by publisher

name: Infinity: Endsong
description:
The Acheron and Cerberus Blockades have fallen.

The Combined Army has shown its might, unleashing massive forces on its primary targets on Paradiso and Concilium Prima.

A chapter in the history of the Infinity Universe comes to a close, bringing an end to the Human Sphere as we know it.

Endsong is an expansion for Infinity that opens up a new stage in the universe and game, welcoming the release of the new Reinforcements rules with a complete overview of all Infinity factions' reinforcement and reaction groups, as well as their respective troops.

In addition to broadening the universe and backstory, preparing it for a new phase, this expansion also covers the Nomad mothership Bakunin and its Observance, the Hassassins of Haqqislam, and ALEPH's Steel Phalanx.

This book also features three narrative scenarios to expand on the aftermath of the events of Endsong, which can be played in ITS to shape and determine the future of Concilium, either in campaign mode or as standalone games. In addition, there are four top-level painting guides to unveil the secrets of professional painting for the most emblematic troops of Bakunin's Observance, the Hassassins, and the Steel Phalanx.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bonnie and Clyde, Love at First Shot
description:
Bonnie and Clyde, Love at First Shot is an engaging solo game where you step into the shoes of Clyde Barrow. You must navigate a dangerous world, evading the police while trying to win Bonnie Parker's heart. Every decision matters, from resource management to avoiding law confrontations, as you carve your path to destiny.

In this game, Bonnie’s presence through her poetry is a constant influence on your choices. Her spirit and writings add a romantic and narrative dimension, as you, playing as Clyde, seek to earn her affection and forge the bond that will unite them in history.

Gameplay: Each turn, you have (at best) 4 actions to distribute in order to optimally manage your resources while paying the cost of living and avoiding being imprisoned too often or too quickly. You need to accumulate poems, love, and boredom, as well as ammunition, before stealing a 1927 Ford A and embarking on the roads of "Bonnie and Clyde, Love and Death" before being killed by the police.

-description from designer

name: Justin & Dave's Awesome Would You Rather...? Board Game
description:
Deal an ‘A’ and a ‘B’ answer card to each player and place your mover piece on the start position. The person to the player’s left picks up a card and reads the dilemma.

The player must decide between ‘A’ or ‘B’ and places their answer card face down. Other players decide what they think the player has chosen and cast their votes.

Everyone flips their cards OVER. If no-one guessed what the player chose the PLAYER moveS ahead 3 spaces, otherwise anyone who guessed what the player chose moves ahead 1 space.

The first player to reach the finish space wins. If more than one player makes it to the finish at the same time – you’re all winners!

name: Dragon City: Battle of Taiyuan
description:
龍城飛將：抗戰之太原會戰 ("Siege Songs: Battle of Xuzhou") is a two-player board wargame that simulates the battle of Beiping- Tianjin and the battle of Taiyuan, from Jul.7 , 1937 to Nov. 10, 1937. "Dragon City" is the third game in the War of Resistance series.

Each turn represents 1 week and each hex is about 10-12 km across. Each unit is from battalion to division. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Army （大日本帝國陸軍） and the other player commands the National Revolutionary Army （國民革命軍）.

In Siege Songs, each player uses operation points to activate Army HQ to lead combat units to move, barrage, combat. In each turn, each player draws tactic markers respectively and roll for initiative. The units include infantry, artillery, cavalry, and tank, etc. The NRA side needs to defend Xinkou, Pingxingguan, and Taiyuan in different scenarios to win the game.

The components includes two 80cm*57cm inches map and 3 15mm die-cut counter boards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid
publishers: Formosa Force Games, Kuro Neko Design Workshop

name: 秘宝の番人ゾンビゲーム (Keeper of the Hidden Treasure: Zombie Game)
description:
This is a game designed by Ginichiro Suzuki, and produced by Epoch. It is a game where you are exploring the underground, uncovering treasures, and fighting monsters, all in an attempt to get to the castle and have the most treasure.

Hailed as a Masterpiece in Japan. It is not so much the game, but the art of Ritta Nakanishi that makes this game so popular. Ritta is noted for his military illustrations and military model art. This game is fully illustrated from top to bottom (well, not the bottom of the box) with his wonderful art featuring all sorts of horror.

In addition, the entirety of the box is used. In fact, there are four tops/lids that are illustrated and used in the game. The result is a three-dimension board where the players move through different levels. There are even pitfalls at the highest level, as well as caves, in addition to foldable terrain pieces. To top this off, there is a facade that fits to the back of the board featuring the game's objective. All this creates a highly immersed game experience.

—user summary
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pieces as Map

name: まとりて！ (Matorite!)
description:
まとりて！ (Matorite!) is trick-taking card game from Japan using magic cards.

Magic has the attributes of fire, water, earth and wind, and if the lead player uses magic of the fire attribute, the other players must also use magic of the fire attribute.

However, if there is no fire-attribute magic in the hand, magic of another attribute can be used.
Attributes have affinities, such as "Fire ← Water ← Earth ← Wind ← Fire".

If you can use water-attribute magic that is effective against fire-attribute magic in such a situation, you will be one step closer to victory.

まとりて！は魔法カードを使用したトリックテイキングです。
魔法には火・水・土・風の属性があり、親が火属性の魔法を使用したら他のプレイヤーも火属性の魔法を使用しなければなりません。
ただし、手札に火属性の魔法がない場合は他の属性の魔法を使用することができます。
属性には「火←水←土←風←火」のように相性が存在します。
このような時に火属性に対して有効な水属性の魔法を使用することができれば、勝利へ一気に近づくでしょう。
--description by publisher

name: Mischievous Moments
description:
Mischievous Moments will quickly become your new favourite adult party game. It is a game for 2 to 16 players consisting of 69 mini-games, all with a theme of humour, drinking or risqué behaviour. The unique grading system lets the players decide how intimate they want to be. The game is completely flexible and will be different every time you play.

A mobile app is provided to provide instructions and help manage the game for the players. All players can log into the game to see the random card draws, instructions and player choices on their own devices.

A game board and 16 quality playing pieces are also provided to track the progress of the players through the game.

The game is LGBTQ+ friendly and can be enjoyed by everyone aged 18 and over. The grading system allows the players to dictate what level of intimacy there is between them, from no physical interaction to activities which would make seasoned swingers blush.

The game can last from 30 minutes to several hours and often lasts longer than the players do with all the drinking and excitement which it generates. Play can continue until the end - and a winner announced - or played for a certain period of time. The object is to have fun with your friends, to get to know them better and to help improve intimacy among couples rather than simply winning a game.

The game is suitable for individual couples and groups of friends whether in a relationship or not. It has proved popular with the swinging community during our testing but is suitable for all levels of intimacy.

—description from the publisher

name: ジャンヌダルク暗殺 (L' assassinat de Janne d' Arc)
description:
ジャンヌダルク暗殺 (L' assassinat de Janne d' Arc) (Assassination of Joan Of Arc) is a game of identity concealment from Japan.

Players become knights, royalty and nobility fighting for the realisation of the prophecies of 'war', 'politics' and 'miracles' and the victory of France at the same time as Jeanne d'Arc at the end of the Hundred Years War.

Some become infiltrators of England, trying to prevent the French victory or assassinate Jeanne d'Arc herself.


An asymmetrical invitation concealment game set in late medieval France, in the vein of Werewolf and Avalon.
Players can either be pious French knights or enemy English insiders.
Two camps battle through the end of the Hundred Years War over the fulfilment of nine prophecies!


正体隠匿ゲームです。
プレイヤーは、百年戦争終盤のジャンヌダルクと同時代に「戦争」「政治」「奇蹟」の預言の実現とフランスの勝利にむけて戦う騎士、王族、貴族となります。一部は紛れ込んだイングランドの内通者となり、フランスの勝利を阻止するか、ジャンヌダルク自身を暗殺しようとます。
＊中世末期フランスを舞台にした、人狼やアヴァロンの流れを組む非対称招待隠匿ゲーム。
＊プレイヤーは敬虔なフランス騎士か、敵国イングランドの内通者になります。
＊２つの陣営が９つの預言の成就を巡って、百年戦争末期を戦い抜きます
--description by publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Simultaneous Action Selection, Traitor Game

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: Pacific Theater
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII related to the conflict in the Pacific.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: Battle of Britain
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII related to the historical Battle of Britain.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: Blitzkrieg
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII with content related to the initial stages of the WWII in Europe.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Skeletens
description:
Skeletens is bone-rattling 2-4 player card game, where each player vies for battlefield supremacy with an army of skeletons! The first player to enlist 10 of their calcium-rich, creaky comrades are declared the victors.

Setting up the game is easy! Shuffle the deck and deal each player 5 cards. Players take turns to play a card of any type onto their battlefield OR draw a card into their hand.

Go wide with skeleton spam or tower up to protect your crew. Turn your opponents' skeletons to dust with attack cards or bolster your fortifications with defense cards. Just remember you need skeleTEN to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Hand Management, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: Eastern Front
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII related to the aerial battles on the Eastern Front.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: African Campaign
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII related to the aerial battles that took place over the Northern Africa.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Antyk
description:
Antyk is a card game that can be played by 2 to 5 players aged 7 and over. The average game lasts 15 minutes. The aim of the game is to be the player with the most Olympus points, which means stealing and earning points, as well as spending them to play cards. It's up to you to find the best strategy for reigning supreme on Olympus.

To do so, the game proceeds as follows :
At first, a god card and 10 Olympus points are distributed at each player.

On each turn, players draws 2 cards and can play as many as they like.

When a "power" card is played, an Olympus point is stolen from the player with the corresponding god, or taken from the reserve if it is of his own god. These cards are discarded afterwards.

For every other types of cards, players needs to pay the appropriate number of Olympus points to place the cards and use their powers.

A player loses when he runs out of points.

To win, a player needs to be the first to gather 20 Olympus points, to be the only player left with points or to be the one with more points when the card deck is empty.

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: Advanced German Aircraft
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII that introduces Advanced German Aircraft into the conflict.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: Special German Aerial Weapons
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII introduces special weapons on the German side.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Age of Dogfights WWII: Transport Aircraft and Gliders
description: An expansion for Age of Dogfights: WWII introduces transport aircraft and gliders as new content for your aerial battles.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Fracas: The Battle of the Pets
description:
We all have our favorites, but which pet is best?

This is a fun, chess-like strategy game that animal against animal to earn the title of top pet.

This is a themed 4-player version of MetaCheckers: Battlefield with all-wood, laser cut pieces. Choose one of four animal checker armies:


Dogs
Cats
Rabbits
Parrots


Each checker army has a hidden king checker.

The game uses 24 board tiles, each made of four squares. Players each get 6 board tiles which they take turns placing on the field of play, connecting the tiles to form a unique battlefield. Players place their 12 checkers strategically on the squares of their tiles, with the kings hidden, face down at the beginning of the game. Eliminate your opponents by capturing their king.

On their turn, players roll two dice to determine how to move a checker. One die has the symbols for chess pieces, the other is a standard d6 numbers die. Whenever a 6 is rolled, the player may opt to reroll with the KANGAROO Die and the numbers die for 6 additional useful moves.

Players eliminate their opponents by capturing the hidden king of the opposing army, which then leaves the board. Last player standing wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Deadly Mist
description:
Your ship crash landed on a strange planet. You appear to be mostly unharmed, but the same cannot be said for your ship. Key components of your main engines, your medical lab, and your weaponry have been scattered across the planet's surface. As you set off to find these parts and repair your ship, you also find something quite strange: a medical device, a few capsules, and a button with writing that your translators interpret as "PURGE." You wonder what such a device could possibly be used for, when a deadly mist begins to descend...

In Deadly Mist, you must explore this planet for the three missing parts of your ship, collect them, and make it back to the Crash Site. While you do so, you must clear the ever-spreading Miasma and avoid taking deadly Infection cards into your deck.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: TKG ARENA: The Vanguard Duels
description:
A Vanguard paves the way for the rest of the forces in a faction. Bound by honour and pride, their duels are often the first of conflicts between two opposing forces in an arcane war. Their victories amplify morale and their defeats ominous signs for their Battle Mage masters …

TKG ARENA: The Vanguard Duels is a game set up for 2 players.

Components required for this game:

STANDARD DECK (DECK): 1
PLAYING CARD STAND (STAND): 2
OINKS: 1 from each element

Winning Condition

The player with the most HONOUR points wins the game when it ends.

Ending Condition

The game ends when one of the players reaches 12 or more HONOUR points.

Setup

A player starts the game by designating the following areas: A draw deck area O, a discard area X and five adjoining spaces that is designated A, B, C, D and E on the card stand. The players should be seated facing each other with sufficient space between them to place the trumping order represented by the spaces T, 1, 2 and 3.

X A B C D E O
