Determine the starting player by taking turns to draw cards from a shuffled standard deck. The player who draws the highest face value starts first. In case of a tie, the tied players keep drawing till the tie is broken with a player drawing a higher face value. The other player decides the initial trumping order.
All 36 cards are re-shuffled and each player receives 18 cards faced down as a drawing stack at their respective area O.
Each player draws 5 cards from the top of the draw stack and places them on the stand one by one in the sequence drawn. The 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th card drawn should be located on the stand at positions A, B, C, D and E respectively. All the front facing contents of the cards face the player and the backs of the cards towards the opponent.
Players are not allowed to switch the positions of the cards freely during play.
The area X is used as a space to place discarded cards during play.
The Oinks representing the 4 elements will be placed in the spaces T, 1, 2 and 3 to indicate the priority of the elements. The trumping element has priority over all other elements during play.


T 1 2 3

E.g. Fire (Ashw) is in the T space – Any Fire (Ashw) card will beat cards of any other element, when both cards are Fire (Ashw) cards, the card with the higher face value will win. Moving forward, let’s assume that Water (Esbner), Earth (Ohif) and Air (Ukelele) are in positions 1, 2 and 3 respectively, this means when face values of opposing cards are the same, the tie is broken using this priority: All Water (Esbner) cards will prevail against Earth (Ohif) cards which will prevail against Air (Ukelele) cards. Water (Esbner) cards will also prevail against Air (Ukelele) cards.

On each player’s turn

The player can choose to execute ONE of the two following actions.


End the round immediately by discarding 2 cards from his/her draw stack at O. All players proceed to scoring the round. This move cannot be chosen when there are less than 2 cards in the draw stack at O and 5 cards in the discard space X.
Draw the top card from the draw stack at O and may choose to either discard it into X or replace it with one of the cards placed in A, B, C, D or E. In this case, the replaced card goes into the discard space X. 3 further possibilities stem from here.
If the discarded card into X has an odd face value (1, 3, 5, 7, 9), the player must reveal one of his/her cards by placing it face up in front of card stand while maintaining its position relative to the other unrevealed cards.
If the discarded card into X has an even face value (2, 4, 6, 8), the player must reveal the top card of his draw stack at O and keep it face up until it is drawn.
If the discarded card into X is of the same element as the immediate previous discard card, the player can choose to re-arrange all the elements in the trumping order.



At any point of time, if the draw stack at O has no more cards, the last turn takes place followed by scoring of the round. Otherwise, the other player takes his/her turn and the game proceeds.

Scoring

When each round ends, players will pit their cards against each other in the respective spaces on the card stand. E.g. Corresponding cards in space A of the players are compared, followed by those in spaces B, C, D and E. Trumping priority are resolved first. This is followed by face value priority. Cards with higher face values win those of lower values. Ties in face value priority are resolved by spaces 1, 2 and 3 in the trumping order explained earlier. For each card that has higher priority over his/her opponent’s respective card, a victory is scored.

Over 5 spaces, the player with more victories will claim HONOUR points equal to the number of discarded cards in the opponent’s discard space X. If the ending condition is met, the game ends and the winner is the one with most HONOUR points. Otherwise, the HONOUR points are recorded, all cards (inclusive of discarded or unused cards) in the game are re-collected and the set up for a new round begins.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Vad du borde lärt dig i skolan
description:
The nerd or the class prankster, who were you in school? Once again, up to proof! You who thought you got away just because you left school - forget it! Now it's a battle of the brains with this quiz game about what you should have learned in school. Test yourself and not least those around you.

Contains 400 questions in 8 different categories.

name: Droplets: Dry Erase Word Game
description:
Droplets is a light, yet strategic word game all about dropping and collecting letters to form words.
 
GOAL:
Make and score the most valuable words.

SETUP:

Give each player a dry erase form and marker or pre-printed game sheet.
One player calls out two “seed” words from the back of the dry erase form.
Players simultaneously drop letters from each seed word into each of the seven rows, two letters per row, one from each word. See examples below for clarity.


GAME PLAY:
Players have five minutes to simultaneously form words horizontally in each row by adding one or more additional letters from their stockpiles. As you add a letter, mark it off from the stockpile. You cannot reuse letters. Words must be at least three letters long.

SCORING:
At the end of five minutes, assemble your letters into words, unscramble as needed. Score each completed word, then add up the total for your final score. The player with the highest score wins. If there is a tie, the player with the alphabetically-highest word wins.

EXAMPLE:
(See images for example).
Wendy calls out COUNTRY and OUTCOME as the seeds.

The letters from both words are written down vertically in order.
Letters are added from the stockpile and marked off
The letters in row 6 are unscrambled.


as used.

Words are scored to get the final score.



STRATEGIES:

Before dropping the initial letters from each seed word, think about what new words you might wish to form for maximum points.
Try to use the top value letters.
Call out your own, more complicated seven-letter words.

name: How Did the Chicken Cross the Road
description:
How did the chicken cross the road? According to this game, it could be anything from a catapult to a pterodactyl. They're tearing down a novelty factory to make way for a new freeway! The first Rubber Chicken to make it back will save the day and become the king of novelties. It's a race to build an idyllic garden path back home as your opponents build freeways blocking your way.

Up to four players take turns placing tiles to build a road from work to home. Players can also play obstacles to other players' roads. First chicken to make it to work wins.

name: Dwars
description:
Dwars is a fast-paced card game combining tactics and bluffing for 2 players. Here you are in the shoes of clans battling for control of Toulahô mountain.

One player plays the dwarf clan, while the other plays the goblin clan. Each player receives a 25-card deck, consisting of 5 copies of each of 5 different characters, each with its own power.

Players take turns placing character cards in front of them. When a player has all 5 characters in front of him/her, he/she immediately wins the game.

During his turn, when a player places a card in front of him, he places it face-down, giving his opponent time to counter if he wishes. If this is not the case, the active player turns his card face-up and activates his character's power.

name: Бородино (Borodino)
description:
This is a simple game from Tehnolog dealing with an episode during the Battle of Borodino.

Both players have four soldiers, a cannon, and a redoubt. The players set up their forces 1 to 1.5 meters apart and roll a die to see who goes first.

Each player, in turn, fires one shot for every soldier they have. Each shot must be from behind their line of fortifications, and no shot can be made unless a soldier is within 5cm of their cannon. If there is no soldier within 5cm, then the player, at the start of their turn, must place a solider within 5cm of their cannon. If a player hits their opponent's officer, then they get a free shot. The first side to eliminate all their opponent's soldiers wins.

—user summary

name: Vikings' Tales: Edge of the World
description:
Get ready for adventure! Are you ready to set sail for the Edge of the World? Put together the best crew and start trading goods while fighting battles and heading further towards the unknown. The Viking chief, who has accumulated the greatest fortune, is the winner, but there are many perils along the way. This adventure game suits 3-4 players and includes impressive wooden game pieces. Edge of the World is a game you will want to play again and again!

The board depicts Europe. Players move their ships playing dual-use cards that have movement and combat points. When players visit cities, they can buy goods, sell goods or raid the city. Once some collects 150 points, they must head back to their home city and the first player to meet them there can challenge them to a duel to see who wins the game.
mechanics: Finale Ending, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Sacátelo Vos
description:
Sacátelo Vos arrived to raise the tone of the previous ones. Brother of Tomalo Vos, it adds the spicy component.

How to play? The cards are dealt and the Strip card is placed in front of one of the players. On your turn, you have to try to get that card off of you and pass it to another player. If you can't, you lose a life... and a piece of clothing.

If you are already a recurring player of Tomalo Vos, we are happy to let you know that you will be able to mix them.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Deep Down
description:
In Deep Down, each player represents a salvage crew attempting to make their fortune. Players complete contracts by retrieving objects from the bottom of the ocean and executing technical jobs. Those contracts will pay the players who in turn can use their hard-earned money to improve their crews and get the right equipment for the job.

The game progresses as players score points. Those points are earned for accomplishing any of the following:


Completing contracts
Boosting reputation
Exploring uncharted regions
Fulfilling ambitions
Collecting corporation shares


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Income, Investment, Movement Points, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stock Holding, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Kristian på sporet af... Den gyldne skat
description:
Finally the readers of the popular series about "Kristian på sporet" (Kristian on the trail) can travel with Kristian through jungle and desert, over mountains, under water and through the dangers of the big city, on the hunt for the golden treasure.

Kristian is on the trails of the worlds largest gold treasure. But in order to reach the treasure, you have to fight your way through quicksand, avalanches and the dangerous alleys of the city, he has to reach the bottom of the sea, and through a dense jungle, before he reaches his target. Help Kristian on his adventure through the five challenging worlds, collect diamants, find shortcuts, fight dangers, and reach the treasure before your opponents. The fastest player wins the treasure and the game!

The game contains a large board, diamants, dice, sandtimer, player pieces and vehicles to traverse the five worlds.

The goal is to be first through the boards many challenges. You will meet dangerous animals, unforeseen obstacles, and there are 260 cards in the game, that you draw, that will test you with challenges, games, questions and funny tasks.

The game is for the whole family. If you can't read, you can play a slightly easier version of the game with cards that does not require reading skills.
The game is illustrated by Franck Wagnersen, who has also illustrated the books in Kristian Gintbergs popular series of books.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: TrainBow
description:
TrainBow is a roll and write game of collecting goods, shipping goods to stores, and making connections along a rainbow track. Each turn 2 dice are rolled, players play simultaneously, either connecting the dice to form one big action with potential bonuses or 2 smaller actions.

Completing connections on tracks gives the players an extra die for themselves only which can be any value 1-6. Shipping goods to stores offers big bonuses too, but only if you stay after them. Players will race to close shops, but they still want to make the most of global scoring bonuses chosen randomly at the start. Make those connections to get big points in this Train game for 1-100 players!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Landing Strip
description:
Landing Strip is a roll and write game that utilizes two dice to have the players help guide the various airborne travelers in to land safely. Dice may be combined for a larger value or used for a smaller value. The players will have to be mindful of each traveler seeking a path as paths overlap and leaving one where it was can disrupt the path of another.

Players will also be able to place unused dice toward their coffee breaks scoring bonuses for doing so. But be aware that too many unused dice which may result from challenges with planning will result in unwanted baggage. Can you get all of the travelers in safely? Landing Strip is a game of air traffic control for 1-100 players.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Print & Play, Transportation

name: Unicorns Love Rainbows
description:
Our first party game!!: Unicorns Love Rainbows! They also love Cupcakes, sometimes they love both. Help Unicorns find Rainbows, Cupcakes, or both in this fun and funny party game! The players each draw a card then act out their card to other players to make those connections. Link a hungry Unicorn with a Cupcake and you both score a point! Find a Rainbow for the speedy Unicorn to go for a jog and score a point as well! Or even go for 3 points with connections between your Unicorn who wants it all and other players who have a Cupcake and a Rainbow! Grab a new card and keep the fun going!
Lay scored cards down portrait for 1 point, landscape for 3 points. Play till 5 points, then give it another go! But remember if you can’t make a connection you’ll need to draw a new card. But that just means more options to act out!
There are also separate rules for 1-3 players to engage in rapid-fire real time play of playing cards from their hand to a face up row of cards. Can you be faster than your opponents?
Unicorns Love Rainbows is played with 54 cards and can be played by 1-8 players.
—description from the designer

name: Ensemble: Boardgame Box Promo Card
description:
This is a Promo Card for Ensemble, distributed during events and shows.

It's a new Remembrance card to be shuffled with the deck and represents the box of Ensemble, with a little difference: the orchestra director is now facing the players.

—description from the designer

name: Pyramidice: Scarabeo di Agata Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Pyramidice initially distributed during the "Lucca Comics & Games 2023" event and during the game presentation at the "Museo Egizio" in Turin.

The effect granted to the player that owns this Scarab is: before choosing whether rest or play, you may peek at the first card on top of the God Deck. You also skip the Phase 4 of your work turns (Support the cult of the Gods).

—description from the designer

name: 'Hä' Wie war das..? Musterpackung
description:
From the creator of video game classic Puyo Puyo comes a party game to test your acting abilities.

Use only facial expressions and the tone of your voice (and sometimes less than that) to portray different scenarios.

Does that “Ha-“ sound angry, heartbroken, or curious? Players draw a card that determines a topic sound like “Ha-“ or “Eh” along with a list of eight different scenarios. Individual players then draw a card that assigns them a scenario from the list to enact. Without using any body gestures, players act out their scenario to each other and try to guess who was assigned what.

This is a stripped down version of the full game

name: Fabula Rasa Schnupperspiel
description:
In Fabula Rasa, players take turns telling a constantly changing story as is typical of oral traditions. The motifs on the cards provide visual bullet points for people, objects, and locations that are central to the action, things that must be remembered in the correct order, with cards disappearing and new ones being added each round. Those who, as a narrator, manage to present their version of the story without errors will be rewarded accordingly.

A free demo version of Fabula Rasa.

name: Onmyodo: Matsuri Expansion
description:
A set of rare items your weary travelers can earn when they participate in a Matsuri event! (as these festivals randomly pop up in your adventures)
These items offer your group interesting and unusual abilities!

The Matsuri Item cards easily integrate with the base Onmyodo game, and come in a kawaii little red pouch for storage!

—description from the publisher

name: Битва на песке (Battle on the Sand)
description:
Battle on the Sand is a miniatures game with real shooting.

The game takes place on the Planet of Innosand, and a garrison of Empire infantry is trying to hold a fortress against a force of besieging militia.

The players setup their forces 50cm apart and then roll for initiative. The side with the initiative then rolls a die for the number of action points they get.

An action point can be used to:
1. Fire the walker or multigun. The multigun can only be fired a maximum of three times per turn. To fire the walker all friendly militia must be closer to the fortress than the walker, and for the multigun to fire the infantry must have a soldier within 5cm of it.
2. Move a walker, gun, or soldier 10cm. Moving up and down the stairs of the fortress costs 10cm.

When enemy soldiers are at a range of 5cm or less to one another, they fight a melee. Both roll a die and the high side wins.

To win the attackers must eliminate all enemy soldiers or capture the flag atop the fortress. The defenders win if they kill all enemy militia.

The game comes with:
-1 Firing Robot Walker
-1 Firing Multigun
-6 Militia troops
-6 Empire Infantry
-Shells
-Fortress
-Flag for the fortress
-1 die
-1 measuring device
-Rules

The photo on the box also shows two palm trees, but these are not included in the rules manifest.

name: Sherlock Files Junior: Introductory Investigations
description:
Includes three crazy cases that are fun for the whole family!

 • Suriguri - Figure out why a meerkat was stolen from the zoo, and then mysteriously returned only a few days later.

 • Where Is Alba? - Follow the footsteps of a young girl who went somewhere after school and still hasn't made it home.

 • Doggy Business - Get to the bottom of some stinky business . . . who left dog poop in the park?

For each case you will follow the clues, piece together the evidence, and then identify who did it, how, and why.

This is a completely standalone game, and does not require any other Sherlock Files games to play.

name: Wicked & Wise: Treasure Cards Promo
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign as part of the Weird Giraffe Games Promo Pack 2023.

Includes 4 cards.

Add these cards to the deck of treasure cards from the base game and proceed as usual.

name: Weird Giraffe Games Promo Pack 2023
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign as part of the Weird Giraffe Games Promo Pack 2023.

Includes: 18 cards + 2 rules cards.
8 cards are for Fire in the Library, 4 cards are for Wicked & Wise, and 6 cards are for Dreams of Yesterday.

name: Битвы фэнтези: Герои меча (Fantasy Battles: Heroes of the Sword)
description:
Heroes of the Sword is part of a series of five games. The other four are:


Key Battle
Combat in the Magic Ruins
Musketeers of the Isle of Mages
Mystery of the Forgotten Dungeon


Like the other games, this one has its own rules and victory conditions.

This particular game has the players trying to get from their starting point tom their base, but at the same time trying to prevent the other side from doing so.

name: Битвы фэнтези: Падение Рима (Fantasy Battles: The Fall of Rome)
description:
Mages, archers, pirates, Roman legionnaires, elves, skeletons, zombies, dwarves, Vikings, barbarians... The world of Magic is engulfed in endless battles, in which literally everyone takes part! Squads face off against each other to prove their superiority over the rest. The noise of battles is accompanied not only by the grinding of blades and the whistling of arrows, but also by the loud shots of cannons, catapults and other ranged equipment. And there is no end in sight to these clashes...

All this is the combat system of the "Battle of Fantasy" from the Russian company "Technolog"! Assemble your squad from all classes and races, spice it up with guns, and face off in an epic battle with your friends! Each set of the series includes miniatures of units and armor sheets, which contain all the necessary information. You can buy a couple of boxes with armies of soldiers, and this will already be enough for heated clashes. But if you're looking for some truly epic battles, check out the Fortress Packs, which can be used to build any battlefield you want!

An exceptional feature of the combat system created by the Technologist company is the long-range weapons - they can literally shoot small shells and attack miniatures of the enemy army. This feature makes the gameplay even more fun!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Штурм Бастиона (Storming of the Bastion)
description:
This is a new game in the Fantasy Battles series.

This is a shooting game where the players try to be the first tom eliminate all their opponent's soldiers.

—user summary

name: Big Time Hockey
description:
Welcome to the world of Big Time Sports from Pungo Games. Each hard-hitting, fast-playing game is card driven, designed for two players, and will play in less than an hour. With uncomplicated rules, Big Time Sports games will have you suiting up and hitting the ice, field, pitch or ring in no time at all.

Big Time Hockey is the first game in our lineup; it's short on rules (an eight-page booklet) but long on depth and replayability. Big Time Hockey has everything you'd expect in a real hockey game -- skating, passing, face-offs, great saves by your goalie, defense, off sides, penalties, fights -- and more!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: MANTIS: Power Token
description:
To play with the Mantis Power Token, give it to the player on the right of the starting player, then follow these rules during the game:

- If you begin your turn with the Power Token, take one additional turn to Steal or Score from any player at the
end of your turn.

- If you successfully steal card(s) from a player with the Power Token, you steal the Power Token as well! When you take the Power Token, immediately take one additional turn to Steal or Score from any player.

- For a 2 player game, instead of using the “2 Player Game” rules in the Mantis instructions, use these rules and play
to 15 points instead of 10.

name: Three Moles in a Trenchcoat
description:
Three Moles in a Trenchcoat is a single player deck building skill check game, with a unique mole management system.

Pirates have kidnapped Great Aunt Hilda! Each round you will select an event to attempt, either unearthing more information about the occult Sisters of Delahaye or disrupting their operations.

The round starts by taking a hand or mole management action to increase your chances of succeeding, after which you combine a dice roll with bonus points from your hand and your moles to determine success. Passing unlocks a new part of the story. However, failing will increase your suspicion meter - can you navigate the human world and rescue Great Aunt Hilda, before they figure out that you're actually Three Moles in a Trenchcoat?

Created as part of the 2023 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

—description from the designer

name: Xalingópolis
description:
In Xalingópolis you work for the city council, erecting the best buildings for the city, using wooden building blocks from a traditional Brazilian children's toy, "O Pequeno Engenheiro" (The Little Engineer).

Each round the active player rolls a die and moves his pawn forward on a path around the city's ground plan. Your pawn position will dictate your action: receiving building blocks, receiving design cards, exchanging pieces. But not all actions are good and, if you're unlucky, you could lose a project or even lose your previously collected blocks.
Each project card shows a construction using specific blocks, and an amount of victory points corresponding to the difficulty of the construction. If a player has the card and the necessary blocks, instead of rolling the die, they can build on the city's ground plan.
Once there are 12 buildings in the city, the game is over and whoever has the most points wins.

name: Ravohria
description:
In a technological leap, the oppressive society unveiled Ravohria capsules, solidifying their monopoly alongside the coveted natural crystals preserved within the protected forest. This escalation heightened the existing delicate balance, amplifying both exploitation and control.
Enter the scene a mysterious figure with exceptional knowledge, who assembles a group of extraordinary individuals with a singular mission - steal the capsules and disrupt the dark society's hold. The plan is daring - escape through the forest to amplify the impact and convert the precious natural crystals to their advantage.
Predictably the disruptors succeeded in capturing the capsules and the dark society retaliated, dispatching relentless Sentinels to capture them.
As players navigate the dense forest, various events unfold - from defeating patrols to collecting valuable items and engaging in strategic duels with fellow players. These triggered events etched into the player's memory Core, become valuable and aligned with their unique agendas.
Crystals, scattered throughout the journey, offer a chance for character enhancement, shaping individual destinies in this high-stakes game.
Each player operates as a clandestine agent, harboring a covert agenda and a true identity that can be exposed.
The mysterious figure, the orchestrator of this daring plan, promises rewards based on the speed of mission completion. Yet, beneath the surface, selfish motives, vanity, and personal goals may just be the ticket to success.
Conceal your motives, unmask rivals, and pursue your objective. Will you survive?
categories: Card Game, Economic, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Force Commitment, Grid Movement, Hidden Roles, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Kill Steal, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Tags, Take That, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Rubik's Cube It
description:
CUBE IT GAME: The ultimate 2-player block-building puzzle game. Choose your level- easy, medium, or hard. Flip the card and race to match that shape. Face the challenge and be the best on the block!
MATCH, MAKE, CREATE: Two cube sets included- each set forms one cube. If you are a fan of the original Rubik’s Cube 3D puzzle, prepare yourself for hours of sequence puzzle game fun with your opponent.
Includes 2 Sets of Shapes (each set contains 8 different shapes), 54 Challenge Cards, Instructions


—description from publisher
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Race, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Struckle
description:
Struckle is a quadruple-player abstract strategy board game that takes players on a journey into the depths of creativity and critical thinking. It's a unique blend of tactics and strategy, where the engaging game's mechanics are matched by the depth of the gameplay.

The game board is an 8x8 grid reminiscent of a chessboard with colorful tiles each connecting with different elements of the game to create a uniquely challenging landscape. The number four plays a special role in Struckle, with four sides battling via a set of four pieces. Each set of four pieces available to a player is nudged to behave like a team by the game’s peculiar turn’s definition.

At its core, Struckle is a game of strategy and emergence. Players take turns mobilizing their entire teams at once and using their powers, when available. Progress toward the final objective of occupying two goal squares is intertwined by actions to disrupt the opponents’ plans.

The rules are simple, but the strategic depth is profound. It's easy to learn, yet it takes time to master. At every turn, players must consider not only their immediate actions but also anticipate their opponent's responses.

—description from the designer

name: 恐竜ボードゲーム ボルケーノ大噴火 (Dinosaur Boardgame: Great Volcano Eruption)
description:
This is a game that plays much like the Game of Life. Players take on the roles of Dinosaurs as they try to make their way through the game, accumulating dinosaur cards, and make it to the goal with the most cards in their possession.

Along the way they may land on rewards and penalties, which can cost them cards. Battles may be fought between rivals, and at one point they will have to cross the volcano. The volcano has working sounds, and the player must press the button on the back whenever they are on the eruption spot. The volcano will then launch three fireballs unto the gameboard, and if a dinosaur is hit, there is a penalty.

The spinner also Grows like a dinosaur when it is spinned. There are 30 different sounds.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Catacombs: Wyverns of Wylemuir (Second Edition)
description:
Wyverns of Wylemuir is an expansion for Catacombs Third Edition and Catacombs & Castles Second Edition. The set includes eight Wyverns enabling characters such as heroes and monsters to ride them and unlock their powers. New heroes, monsters, items, rooms and warriors complement a double-sided playmat featuring a wooded meadow on one side and a dangerous swamp on the other. Finally new area of effect templates add new strategic elements to both base games.

New in the second edition:
1. The double-sided game board was replaced by a double-sided neoprene playmat.
2. The manual was completely revised and updated.
3. There are more cards included with the expansion including dedicated cards for both Catacombs Third Edition and Catacombs & Castles Second Edition
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Creepes
description:
Players step by step develop their insects and acquire new ones into their insect crews. They look for food, can attack the opponent's insects and do other special actions.

The game is shared deck building focused to 2 players which means that there is a one deck related to both players where each player contributes to the deck with his own cards. Each round reveals 3 cards and players mainly try to develop their insect cards and acquire new ones.

Another element is dice placement. Each round players roll the number of dice depending on currently revealed cards and alternatively place dice on designated places on cards which trigger actions like acquire, development and attack.

Final mechanic is development and is performed by rotating of squar cards by 90 degrees (all cards are squared). Rotating of cards represents 4 stages of insect metamorphosis which gives to players advantages in form of dice rolling number and victory points which are summarized from the whole deck on the end of the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Property Millionaire: The Board Game
description:
Practice and try property investment with play money before you buy with real money. You get the opportunity as often as you want to practice getting it right for the rest of your life.

Property Millionaire is a simulation of the Australian property market where players develop investment strategies. Whoever gains the most income and property wins.

Following a Monopoly like board design, players bid on properties and learn its' special rules - like negative gearing - that influence the Australia property market while attempting to amass their property empire and win the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Investment, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Track Movement

name: Shuffle: Jurassic World Dominion
description:
4 games in 1!

Contains 1 deck with 33 playing cards, the perfect size for the little ones' hands.


To win in the Snap Game you have to be quick and say "SNAP" as soon as you see two identical cards.
In the Family Game you have to collect as many sets or families as possible.
In the Action Game you will have to get rid of your cards following the same suit, number or symbol as the card in the central deck.
And in the Couples Game, who will identify more couples with the help of their memory?


It includes game rules in 14 different languages.
Videos and instructions are available for download online.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fib: A Game for Liars and Thieves
description:
Fib: Dive into the ultimate party card game where lying, stealing, and catching culprits is the name of the game! Bluff your way to the top, or become the detective everyone fears.

Setup & Storytelling

Deal five cards to each player and determine the starting Storyteller.
Choose three cards, sequence them on the Storyboard, and tell a story, improvising where needed.


Listening & Accusing

Call "Pass" if you believe the story or "Fib" to accuse a card of falsehood.
Gain points for successful Fib identification or defending against false accusations.


The Aftermath

Continue passing the Storyboard and playing rounds.
First to ELEVEN points wins, or end early with the highest points as the winner.


—description from the designer

name: 王×錬金研究所 (King x Alchemy Institute)
description:
You are in a royal Alchemy Laboratory in the kingdom. One day the king said that “cutting unnecessary expenses for facilities at a time when finances are under pressure” and in the Alchemy Institute, they have to decided to lay off people.

King x Alchemy Institute is a trick-taking game where you have to collect the materials Win tricks and make combos using cards obtained from tricks and create a high score with alchemical synthesis.

name: Мой Супер Танк (My Super Tank)
description:
The game line "My Super Tank" is 12 mini-boxes in a colorful shopping box. Each box contains a set of parts for assembling a mini-model, a game card, simple rules and instructions for coloring. All models are assembled without glue.

Even though all tanks are different, their parts are interchangeable. This allows you to combine parts of different sets and assemble a super machine for victorious tabletop battles.

If desired, the models can be painted. The attached instructions will teach you this. In addition, the tanks are made on the scale of the popular Z.O.D. game system, and, thanks to the Army list in each set, they can strengthen the planetary armies of this game world.

—description from the publisher

name: Reign Absolute: Umbrous Edition – Death & Disorder Expansion Pack
description:
Bearing four destructive Factions and Battlefield modifier rules, Reign Absolute: Umbrous Edition Death & Disorder Expansion Pack brings the harbingers of evil to Reign Absolute: Umbrous Edition, the grid based conquest game where each player has an unique set of Faction units, and the objective is to locate and defeat the opponent's Faction unit, at which point that player is eradicated from the game.

Reign Absolute: Umbrous Edition Death & Disorder Expansion Pack contains

4 complete new Factions: Undead, Demons, Raiders and Ratlings
12 Battlespacer cards to modify the playing grid for more fun and action


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Salvem els aiguamolls
description:
Salvem els Aiguamolls is a solo boardgame that recreates, in abstract way, the campaign to save the wetlands of Alt Empordà (Catalonia), which took place between 1973 and 1984.

The goal is to manage the campaign in the best way possible, striving to achieve, at the very least, historical success.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Zipa
description:
Zipa is a 1v1 sci-fi card game where players select a pre-constructed Faction Deck then build a fully customizable Discovery Deck (powerful reward cards you receive as the game progresses) from their collection.

Featuring over 100 Discovery cards to choose from and 6 Faction Decks, Zipa allows players to express themselves through deck construction and strategy!

Race to be the first player to gather enough Energy to become a galactic superpower; or seek victory through interstellar Conquest, the choice is yours!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Take That

name: 姫とドラゴン人狼 (Hime to Dragon Jinro)
description:
姫とドラゴン人狼 (Hime to Dragon Jinro) is a Werewolf game from Japan, designed to be as small, quick and portable. Playable in 5 minutes without somebody to run the game.

A princess from the land of the wolf fairies has a great adventure across the Lake of Dragons!

A werewolf princess (werewolf) and her grandfather (madman), longing for the outside world, escape from their castle. But the lake surrounding the castle is crawling with dragons on guard. Moreover, the king has ordered a fortune-teller to find out where the princess is in the lake of dragons.

In a panic, the princess and her grandfather disguise themselves as dragons and hide in the lake.

In this visually pleasing werewolf game, the princess player crosses the hands of the players who are represented by the backs of dragons at the beginning of the game, and the discussion begins based on this.

GM要らずの５分間人狼です。

おおかみ妖精の国のお姫様が、ドラゴンの湖を渡って大冒険！

外の世界に憧れるおおかみ姫（人狼）とじいや（狂人）がお城を抜け出します。でもお城をかこむ湖には見張りのドラゴンがうようよ。しかも王様は占い師に命じて姫の居場所がドラゴンの湖と探り当てたもよう。

あわてた姫とじいやは、ドラゴンに化けて湖に隠れます。

ゲームの最初に姫のプレイヤーがドラゴンの背中に見立てたプレイヤー達の手を渡り、それをもとに議論が始まるというはた目にも楽しい人狼です。
--description by publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Voting

name: さかさま人狼 (Sakasama Jinrou)
description:
さかさま人狼 (Sakasama Jinrou) is an upside-down Werewolf game from Japan.

By turning the idea of the normal wargame upside down, a new game has been created! Players are wolves, not humans. Suspension by vote is gone, and the wolves attack. Werewolf attacks are also the cornerstone of human positions in upside-down werewolves. The hunter shoots wolves every night.

The game itself is almost the same as normal Werewolf. The only difference is the position. The Hunter is the key to the human role in Werewolf, and he shoots wolves every night.

通常の人狼ゲームの発想をさかさまにすることで、新しいゲームが生まれてしまいました！
プレイヤーは人間ではなく、狼です。
投票による吊りはなくなり、狼たちの襲撃になります。
また、人狼の襲撃は、さかさま人狼における人間役職の要、

「猟師」が毎晩、狼を撃っていく方式に変更。
やる事自体は、普通の人狼とほぼ変わりはありません。

ただ、異なるのは【立場】だけです。
それだけなのに人狼の常識が通用しないという摩訶不思議な現象が起きています。
-- description by publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Voting

name: Hanse: Kontoriate
description:
In Hanse, you get to represent your trade Kontor and sell the goods you brought with you quickly and cleverly. The player who has the fewest points at the end of the day or has got rid of all his cards wins! But you must not make your calculations without the other players and you are also not safe from historical events. A good memory and speed are the keys to success!

Learn about the culture and history of the great "Hansestadt" Hamburg and immerse yourself in one of the most turbulent and intelligent card games you‘ve probably ever played! Hanse - Kontoriate comes with 80 hand-drawn cards and will quickly pull you into the bustling world of the melting pot that is Hamburg's harbor!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Memory, Real-time

name: Dizzy Bee
description:
Wind Dizzy Bee up and listen as he buzzes around and moves up down and around the garden, scooping up honey pots and bringing them home to his beehive. The dial on top of the beehive tells players which color flower to put their honey pot on. But you can never tell if Dizzy Bee will scoop up a honey pot... or which one it will be. If he brings home all three of your honey pots first, you win.

—description from the publisher

name: The Big Brain Game
description:
It's time to discover the dominant side of your mind with this brain-defining game! Answer questions or undertake challenges from each of the six categories, designed to decipher which side of your brain functions best! Will you prove to be an analytical and methodical 'lefty' or a creative and artistic 'righty'?

—description from the back of the box

A light, party-type, social game. Players are against the clock to complete as many questions/challenges in each of 6 categories as they can over three rounds. For each correct answer, they add a brain token to their brain card. At the end whomever has the most tokens is the winner, but they also discover if they are more Einstein or Picasso.

name: Relic Knights: Star Nebula Corsairs – Broadside
description:
The Broadside minion offers both a powerful beam weapon to attack troops & ships and shields to protect nearby friendlies.

Broadside is an unpainted Minion model set for Relic Knight's Star Nebula Corsairs faction. The unit cards for this model are available in the Star Nebula Corsairs Cadre Deck.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: MetaX TCG: Attack on Titan Starter
description: This MetaX starter deck kit has two decks based around Survey Corps and Titans from the "Attack on Titan" animé series. The decks can be played against each other as-is, or combined with cards from other sets.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Friends: Escape Box
description:
3 different scenarios with easy, medium and expert difficulty levels.
After celebrating Rachel's birthday, you wake up in Monica and Rachel's apartment, where everything is upside down. Chandler and Joey are about to go out but impossible! The door is closed, and the key is nowhere to be found in all this mess. Rachel starts to panic. She has arranged to meet her parents, who are in the middle of a divorce, in an hour at Central Perk and if she arrives after them, they risk killing each other. You better leave the apartment as soon as possible!
You have 60 minutes, not one more, to escape the apartment! And if you succeed, two other scenarios await you in the legendary locations of the series: at Central Perk and in Chandler and Joey's apartment!

name: EVJF
description:
240 questions for Before the dress, the tears of joy, the bouquet toss and the embarrassing speeches of drunken witnesses, it's time to party with the girls!
240 questions to get wild before the big day!

—description from the back of the box

2 set of rules:
Individual: Gather 2 to 10 trusted girlfriends. Draw cards and follow the instructions in order to perform, gossip, share your dreams... The first girl who gather 1 card of each category wins!

2 teams: try to have more cards than the other team.

name: Pipi Caca Culotte
description:
Pipi Caca Culotte is a friendly board game for (almost) the whole family. This is a card game during which you have to guess words or expressions bordering on political correctness.

—description from the back of the box

How to play:
Shuffle cards and put the cards face up.
Decide the score to reach (usually the same as the number of players).
For the first player, pick a card and choose a color or a symbol and try to have the other players to guess your card. If it is guessed, you are marking a point, and then the first player is the one who guessed.

—user summary

name: Takattak Classique
description:
Goal:
Respond straight away to win more cards than your opponents.
The game is over when there is no remaining
only one card in the draw pile.
The winner is the player who made the
no more cards.

How to play:
At the start of the game, designate an Attacker.
The oldest, the most beautiful,the one who has the most answers more scathing, or the one who combines these three characteristics, you choose.
The Attacker is the one who judges the relevance of the
replies and anecdotes during penalties (see below).
For each new game, designate a new Attacker.

The other players must keep the hands on the table.

The Striker places the deck of cards on the table, illustrations down and back of the cards facing up.

The deck is clearly visible to everyone because it is the color at the top of the deck that determines the type of repartee to use.
The Striker takes the first card. And so it reveals the new color at the top of the deck.

He reads aloud the spade of the card.

The first player to knock on the table has the floor.

He wins the card if:

The instruction was respected
This is not a cliché
The reply does not contain any bad words
He responds quickly after hitting the table
He doesn't show that he is upset


The Striker takes the next card, and we continue.

name: Le Septième Meurtre
description:
What if you knew the next victim? A serial killer, certainly the bloodiest that history has known, is on the loose... And he will strike again.

Deep down, you are afraid. It's normal. But unfortunately for you, you no longer have time to be afraid. You are the lead investigator on this case and lives are at stake! You must use stratagems and tricks to corner him. To do this, you have to get into your head. Think, think, be like him.

Will you be able to foil his macabre plan before it’s too late?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: No me la Contés!
description:
Are you good at making excuses? In this game your creativity is tested so as not to be the one who takes the blame.

- For rounds there will be a "Guide" and a situation card: Someone did not put up money for the food; or he forgot to bring the ice... And it could have been you!

- With the words of your cards, try to excuse yourself and pass the blame to other players.

- When everyone has spoken at least once, the Guide decides who was the least convinced and therefore is the "Guilty" of the round.

- This is a game that also lends itself to inventing your own situations or narrating in a group.
---
Express your creativity to invent the best excuse with the cards you have!

Are you good at making excuses? In this game your creativity is tested so as not to be the one who takes the blame.

MODE 1: Don't tell me

For rounds there will be a "Guide" and a situation card: Someone did not put up money for the food; or he forgot to bring the ice... And it could have been you!

With the words of your cards, try to excuse yourself and pass the blame to other players.

Each player will have 3 cards in hand at the beginning of the game. You can use only one in the entire game, or as many as you want. When everyone has spoken at least once, the Guide decides who was the least convinced and therefore is the "Guilty" of the round.

In this game mode, all players win except one, who will be the one who wins the guide's vote for the least convincing or uncreative story. That player can also lose if he can't think of anything to justify himself.

MODE 2: You don't know what happened to me!

For this game mode, all players receive 3 cards. There will not be a guide.

In turns, each player will tell what happened to him that week, using his 3 cards as the beginning-middle-end. It may be a very unfortunate situation, or something very unusual, it is up to each player.

When everyone finishes with their story, a vote is taken and the player who has received the most votes is the winner for his or her original and creative story. In case of ties, more than one player may share the victory in this game mode.

This is a game that also lends itself to inventing your own situations or narrating in a group.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Allergie! 26 Kinder suchen ihr Lebensmittelallergen.
description:
A game that raises awareness and gives meaning to those affected.

"Is there milk in there?" Luis' standard question. He has a milk allergy. We, his parents, have to experience time and again that those around us know far too little about food allergies, which is why there was once even a life-threatening incident.

We want to change that: with the Allergy laying and memo game! 26 children look for their food allergen.

Alongside egg, peanut, fish, nuts, soy and wheat, milk is one of the allergens to which children react most frequently. The memo game Allergy! also revolves around these seven allergens. 26 children are looking for their food allergen.

I have drawn children from all cultures who are happy about a food and then have an allergic reaction to it: For example, a little girl bites into a chocolate marshmallow. The allergen egg is depicted on the corresponding card and the child has pustules. Players can easily match cards, as the child depicted and the background match on the pairs of cards.

Players not only learn which allergens can be found in food, but also the various allergic reactions: from itchy, burning skin redness and swelling to digestive and circulatory problems and breathing difficulties.

A pair of cards also explains how emergency medication can help allergy sufferers in the event of an anaphylactic shock. The game box also contains useful information on the topic.
We need your consent to load this video

Unboxing! What's inside?

When drawing, I made sure to package the serious topic in a funny way. The allergic reactions are depicted in an exaggerated way, which is particularly popular with young players and arouses their interest in the topic.

The game, which has been thoroughly tested by the German Allergy and Asthma Association (DAAB), is aimed at children of toddler and preschool age.

It consists of 56 cards, including four information cards. The appealing and child-friendly illustrations were created by Anita Barry.

The laying and memo game was produced in Germany using FSC-certified materials that are safe for children.

—description from the publisher

name: Chunky Fighters: Conrad Coursi
description: The headless horseman once again rises from his grave as a new character players can choose, using an assortment of swords and rifles, along with a jack-o-lantern, as weapons. Because he has no head, any hit rolls to the head count as misses, and he can only be killed by destroying the body.

name: Chunky Fighters: Odile Cedlespass
description: The space ranger is added as a playable character, bringing an arsenal of laser guns, along with a tricorder, to choose from.

name: The Curse of Camp Wila-Haunchoo
description:
The Curse of Camp Wila-Haunchoo is a game of trust, lies, and betrayal. As a camper in this cursed campground, you might not leave with your soul intact.

Players are secretly assigned Roles, either a Camper or Cursed. Using anything from machetes to toilet paper, you must find and kill every last Cursed. But be warned, there's no telling which friends are Cursed!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Chunky Fighters: Jack Rocher
description: The pirate lands in the combat ring to as another character to play, bringing his trusty hook, black-powder pistols, and a treasure of booty.

name: Chunky Fighters: Alcide Gastric
description: A gelatinous blob becomes a playable character, using various corrosive fluids to defeat enemies, while also being able to regenerate body parts.

name: Djinnchilla
description:
Djinnchilla is a captivating board game centered around summoning and bonding with magical creatures called Djinnchillas. The game, suitable for 2 to 5 players, starts with setting up two decks of Djinnchilla cards – Regular and Awaken – and preparing exploration cards based on the number of players.

In each round, players engage in various actions: summoning Djinnchillas from a shared row or deck, fusing male and female Djinnchillas to draw powerful Awaken cards, trading cards to acquire specific Awaken Djinnchillas, and exploring to gather exploration cards for additional benefits. The game ends when any of the decks (exploration, regular, or Awaken Djinnchilla) runs out.

Scoring is based on the collection of Djinnchilla cards with a focus on forming sets of different elements. The player with the highest score, combining points from Djinnchilla and exploration cards, wins the game. Djinnchilla combines strategic card play with a charming fantasy theme, appealing to players who enjoy tactical decision-making and a touch of magic​​.

—description from the designer

name: Overbaked!
description:
Overbaked! is a dynamic board game for 2 to 5 players that brings the excitement of pastry baking to life. Players step into the shoes of pastry chefs, navigating through strategic rounds that test their planning and risk-taking skills. The game's phases - Preparation, Baking, and Selling - each offer unique challenges and opportunities. In Preparation, players select from a mix of regular and 'Overbaked' (OB) pastry cards, setting the stage for their baking strategies.

The Baking phase introduces an element of suspense, as players flip their cards to find pastries, mindful of the risk posed by OB cards. Deciding whether to stop or risk continuing adds a thrilling push-your-luck aspect. Then, in the Selling phase, players engage in strategic decision-making to fulfill orders from the Order row or earn points by trading pastries, balancing their choices to maximize their score.

The game culminates after a predetermined number of rounds, where players tally their points primarily from order fulfillment. Overbaked! rewards the player with the highest score, celebrating the strategy and risks taken during the game. This blend of strategy, risk, and engaging gameplay makes Overbaked! a delightful experience for those who enjoy a competitive yet whimsical gaming atmosphere.

—description from the designer

name: Fahr mit!
description:
The player advances his pedestrian along the streets and sidewalks. If the player wishes to use a vehicle, he exchanges the pedestrian for the corresponding vehicle (only at the corresponding stations or airport) and pays the fee. However, passenger trains, bus trams have to stop at every station, express trains and railcars do not. If a means of transport is no longer used, you put it back in the box and it can then be used by another player.

There are 3 versions of play, according to the method of determining movement:

by number die
by vehicle die
by money


The goal of the game is tho reach various relaxing spots on the map to collect tokens of different worth. The game ends, when all but one player are back at home. The player to arrive at home with the most valuable tokens wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nawiedzona Kuchnia
description:
Nawiedzona Kuchnia is a solo deck building game. Prepare enough sandwiches to make it through the night, while chasing away ghosts in the Haunted Kitchen. Each round draw five cards and use three of them to chase away ghosts, prepare sandwiches, and add cards to your deck.

After 18 rounds, count the points awarded for prepared sandwiches, current goal card, and gained advanced action cards.

—user summary

Nawiedzona Kuchnia to jednoosobowa gra karciana polegająca na budowaniu talii w trakcie rozgrywki. Twoim celem, jako Lisiej Strażniczki, jest zrobienie jak największej liczby kanapek. Pojawiające się duchy, które opętują przedmioty, będą Ci w tym przeszkadzać. Z duchami też musisz się uporać.

Co turę dobierasz 5 kart i używasz 3 z nich, aby odganiać duchy, szykować kanapki czy rozwijać Lisią Strażniczkę o nowymi kartami, odblokowujące nowe możliwości.

Na koniec tury każdy aktywny duch wykona swoją akcję. Mogą Cię osłabić, zjeść kawałek kanapki albo wypić Twoją drogocenną kawę. Kawa w tej grze jest bardzo ważna, bo pozwala Ci wykonywać potężniejsze zagrywki!

Na koniec 18 tury, gra się kończy. Wówczas podliczasz punkty za kanapki, specjalny cel i zdobyte karty akcji.

Udało się? Bawo! Jeśli nie, nie martw się – grę przygotujesz ponownie w niecałe 2 minuty.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Crime Cases: Werde zum Ermittler! – Verbrecherjagd mit Sherlock Holmes
description:
The new series for all mystery puzzle fans: interactive puzzle adventure with lots of exciting and mysterious clues and evidence. Can you solve the tricky cases?
It's crime time: track down mysterious clues, decipher encrypted messages and crack secret codes - in the interactive mystery puzzle adventures in book form, you become an investigator and have to solve exciting criminal cases. Test your powers of observation and put your logical thinking skills to the test. Will you accept the challenge?

—description from the publisher

name: Crime Cases: Werde zum Ermittler! – Dem Verbrechen auf der Spur
description:
The new series for all mystery puzzle fans: interactive puzzle adventure with lots of exciting and mysterious clues and evidence. Can you solve the tricky cases?
It's crime time: track down mysterious clues, decipher encrypted messages and crack secret codes - in the interactive mystery puzzle adventures in book form, you become an investigator and have to solve exciting criminal cases. Test your powers of observation and put your logical thinking skills to the test. Will you accept the challenge?

—description from the publisher

name: Stadt, Land, Superheld
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City, Country, Superhero edition, you'll always bring a big dose of fun to the table! You can test your superhero knowledge and put your creativity to the test in 26 categories. With its cool design and exciting topics, the game pad will win over every Marvel fan, big or small. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something for everyone here. Dive into the world of superheroes and test yourself and your friends - which of you is the biggest Marvel fan and can fill in the categories the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required to be the first to shout "Stop!". Are you ready to immerse yourself in the world of the Avengers and co. Then grab your pencils, get set, go!
The person who fills in the gaps the fastest wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Le Trésor Perdu de Richster Islands
description:
Go on a treasure hunt in the islands, crisscross the beaches and mountains of the Richster Islands, in search of the lost treasure of your ancestor: Lady Mary Killigrew

While rummaging in one of the attics of the old family castle, you found an old trunk containing documents and a surprising letter written by one of your ancestors. You were always told that there were pirates in the family, but you never knew more…until today.

The letter had obviously never been opened and still bore a seal with a skull. Prove your courage to your ancestor Mary Killigrew, use the notes to return to the atoll and find the secrets of the Crown but, above all, its fabulous treasures!

Your mission: find the exact spot where Mary buried her treasure.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: L' Arche Maudite: Les trésors des pharaons
description:
Go in search of the Cursed Ark. Legend says that once opened, it will reveal the treasure of the pharaohs, a mystical object of legendary power.

Unfortunately you are not the only ones who want to find the Ark. The Zanis, the most powerful criminal organization of your time, covet it for dark projects. You absolutely must find and open the Ark before them to protect the world from this artifact.

So put on your best archaeologist hat and go on an adventure around the world!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Le Dernier Seigneur Dragon
description:
Do you know how to tame dragons? You'll have to learn quickly if you want to save the Kingdom from destruction and ruin. Without the dragon egg, peace will never return.

To this day, the nine kingdoms are at war. Only you have the ability to restore order to this world. But to get there, you have to take a winding path, strewn with pitfalls. You will follow in the footsteps of the last Dragon Lord. Find the egg. Hatch it. And tame its power.

Do you think you have what it takes to be a Lord?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Wer gewinnt den Hauspokal?: für alle Potterheads
description:
Who will win the house cup? This card box provides lots of fun!
Who is a real Potterhead and knows the most about the wizarding world? Over 60 action cards with exciting quiz questions, tricky puzzles and brainteasers as well as fun activities provide lots of magical fun for all Potterheads aged 10 and over. DIY Quidditch, broom race or catching flying keys - speed, concentration, skill and, of course, wizarding knowledge are required here. The perfect gift for all fans of the wizarding world.

—description from the publisher

name: Stadt, Land, Ladiesnight
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City, Country, Ladies' Night edition, you'll always bring a big dose of fun to the table! You can test your knowledge of handbags, lipstick colors and teen idols in 26 categories and put your creativity to the test. The game pad boasts a cool design and exciting topics. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something for everyone here.
Creative lipstick color, things that fit in a handbag or the perfect place for a first date - celebrate your femininity and test yourself and your friends - which of you is the most creative and can fill out the categories the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required to be the first to shout "Stop!". Are you ready? Then grab your (lip) pen, get set, go!

—description from the publisher

name: Stadt, Land, Hot & Sexy
description:
No matter where you are - with this tingling City, Country, Hot & Sexy edition, you'll always bring a large portion of spice to the table! You can test your knowledge of sex toys, dirty talk and hook-ups in 26 categories and put your creativity to the test. The game block impresses with its sexy design and hot topics. From simple questions to raunchy categories - there's something here for everyone.
Funniest safeword, tingling place for sex or funny synonyms for genitals? Test yourself and your friends - which of you has the dirtiest imagination and can fill in the categories the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required to be the first to shout "Stop!". Are you ready? Then grab your pencils, get set, go!
The person who fills in all the gaps the fastest wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Stadt, Land, 90s
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City, Country, 90s edition, you'll always bring a big dose of fun to the party! You can test your knowledge of the cult decade in 26 categories and put your creativity to the test. The game pad boasts a cool design and exciting topics - perfect for all nostalgics. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something here for everyone.
Boybands, fashion sins or cult objects - indulge in nostalgia, reminisce about the 90s and test yourself and your friends - which of you is the biggest 90s expert and can fill in the categories the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required to be the first to shout "Stop!". Are you ready? Then grab your pencils, get set, go!

—description from the publisher

name: Squid: The Game – Das inoffizielle Spiel zur Netflix-Erfolgsserie!
description:
The action-packed, nerve-wracking Netflix series Squid Game is now finally available as a game to play at home! A thrilling gaming experience awaits you with 60 cards, the dreaded guardian and only one winner. Feel the thrill: Who will win the game of life and death?
This fast-paced game for 2 to 6 people requires skill, speed and a bit of luck. Put your skills to the test and survive to the end! Who will make it to the last round? There can only be one winner!

—description from the publisher

name: おっぱいポーカーBraff (Oppai Poker Braff)
description:
おっぱいポーカーBraff (Oppai Poker Braff) is a hidden identity game from Japan.

Eight characters play a hand of cards to make their boobs bigger and play for pride! Braff is a game similar to Poker. The winner is the player who earns the most chips (pride) by hiding the true size of their boobs, bluffing and making sure their fake boobs are not exposed.

８人のキャラクターが、手札を使って自分のおっぱいを大きくし、プライドをかけて勝負する！『ブラふ』はポーカーに似たゲームです。おっぱいの本当の大きさを隠してブラフをかけたり、にせおっぱいがばれないようにして、一番チップ（プライド）を稼いだ人が勝ちです。
--description by publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: SPACERACE-BOTS
description:
スペースレース・ボッツ (SPACERACE-BOTS) is a roll & move robot fighting game from Japan.

Each player controls a fighting bot and sends it around the track to attack the opponents and collect prize money. The first player to reach 1 million Yen is the winner. Players collect three kinds of cards, Arms, Legs, Attack, and combine these to build a better bot.

The game has a short square track and the ability to attack is affected by the relative position on the track. So if the enemy bot is on the same side of the track as the attacker, it is easier to attack. Then the left or right side and finally the far side is hardest to attack.

Further, the more times a bot circles the track, not only does the prize money rise but it also multiplies. So by making three laps before a fight, a player can win triple money.

The winner of each fight steals money from the enemy, but the game includes many elements to reverse fortunes. So the designer advocates attacking quickly and often and not waiting for better equipment to turn up.
description by user
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Pocket Wars
description:
Welcome to the Pocket Wars! Unleash your imagination and transform everyday items into powerful "Curios" with mind-bending abilities. It's fast, fun, and fosters creativity! Whats in your pocket?!

In Pocket Wars, players will pull an item from their pocket and assign it a special ability of their creation. Each player has 5 health, tracked on your non-dominant hand, and the goal is to be the last player standing. Players simultaneously point at their targets and roll dice. Hits deal damage, shields block hits, and misses do nothing. Brainstorms supersede other outcomes and activate a player's special ability.

name: Sunny or Rainy
description:
Welcome to the weather report guessing club! You might not trust weather forecasts at all, but you'll still try to predict tomorrow's weather.

As the active player in Sunny or Rainy, you flip a tile to reveal a number, then reveal cards from the deck equal to the number on the tile. Before revealing each card, you have to declare "sunny" or "rainy". The more consecutive correct guesses you make, you larger your reward...and the larger your risk. The other players watch your guesses and might bet that you will make a mistake...

—description from the designer

name: Форпост (Outpost)
description:
This is an action game where both sides are trying to eliminate each other's soldiers. The game uses actual firing devices, similar to Crossbows and Catapults.

Players roll a die for actions and use them to either move pieces or fire. Any soldier that is knocked down is eliminated from the game. Players can also move their soldiers into contact with the enemy and fight melees. Players can also use magic cards to assist them.

The game comes with:
-2 artifact cards
-50 magic cards
-10 soldiers
-1 firing catapults
-1 firing crossbow
-2 firing multi-barrel guns
-ammo for the devices
-1 fortress
-1 die
-rules
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Император Галактики (Emperor of the Galaxy)
description:
The galaxy is in danger! The Galactic Federation is gathering all its forces to deal a crushing blow to the emperor's brutal dictatorship. The empire is also on the alert and is actively calling for an all-season call-in order to give a worthy rebuff and preserve the centuries-old foundations. Soon space will be ablaze.

Up to 4 people can take part in the game, where one will try to defend the interests of the emperor, and the other three will struggle to overthrow him. You will capture colonies, build and expand your fleet, as well as conduct combat operations to impose your regime.

The playing field is a grid of hyper transitions between planets, framed by Events. Each turn, the player rolls the dice and moves through the Events and, if it belongs to his faction, casts it. Then the player has the opportunity to receive and spend money, fly around the galaxy and fight with the enemy.

Players not only move along a grid on the sides of the board, but they also maneuver their fleets and capture planets. Fleets are rated for their movement ability and firepower. When two fleets meet in the same space there is combat.

In combat, the attacker rolls a die and adds the fleet's power to the roll. The number rolled is the number of ships that the defender must lose. Following this, the defender retaliates.

The game features quite a lot of beautiful plastic figurines of ships, which will undoubtedly attract the attention of younger players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Income, Team-Based Game

name: Blaster 5: Dead by Lead – Rival Guns
description:
Welcome to Rival Guns, the first supplement for Dead by Lead. Within this book, players will find the resources needed to create a rival gang of gunslingers to play against! These new resources include tables for naming your new rivals, and rules for helping them cause havoc in and around the city of Bloodstone. In addition, you will find rules for playing games of Dead by Lead either solo or cooperatively. We have designed three new scenarios for you to play to help showcase these new rules.

What’s in the book:

Solo play rules
Rival character and gang creation
3 new gameplay scenarios
Additional Items


What do you need to play?

Blaster Vol.05: Dead by Lead
Six to twelve Western miniatures or figurines to represent your gang of characters.
One twelve-sided (d12) and several six-sided dice (d6) for each player.
A tape measure or ruler for measuring distances in inches.
A standard deck of playing cards.


Dead by Lead is best suited to a flat 3' x 3' playing area to represent the battlefield.

Various western terrain or model scenery (red dirt, train tracks, rivers, rocks, city buildings and crates) for visual and tactical interest.

A pencil and tokens to help you keep track of various game mechanics. We recommend using six-sided dice as counters, as several dice are easier to manage than a score of tokens.

description from the publisher's website

name: The Brutal Challenge
description:
Each player gets a challenge card stand and a set of 9 same colored challenge cards. Dealer then shuffles and deals 10 playing cards to each player. Remaining cards are placed in the center of the table (draw pile) Then turn the top card over and set next to the draw pile (discard pile)

The players challenge cards are placed face down in front of the sand. The challenge the player is working on is placed in the stand and challenges the player has completed are place face up behind the stand.

Play: Each player takes the top Brutal Challenge card from their stack and places it in the stand so they can see the challenge they must complete this hand. Player to the left of the dealer starts and can either draw a card from the draw pile or take the top card from the discard pile. They then will discard on card from their hand to the discard pile, this will complete their turn.

Once the player has made the challenge on their challenge card they lay down those cards plus any other cards from the players hand that can be added to that challenge or another players challenge. If the player is able to use all their cards then they have won that hand

The first player who is able to play all their cards each hand receives 1 Brutal token

The winner is the first player to complete all 9 Challenges and uses all cards in their last hand

name: Schmuggleware
description:
Bid on strange and unusual contraband artifacts, collecting the most valuable to become the greatest collector at an auction that peels back the veil of reality and offers what lurks there... if you can outwit the other bidders.

Schmuggleware is a fast-paced bidding game for quick hand to hand play. Every player acts simultaneously so there's no more waiting for your turn to come around! Unique player card backs makes resetting for the next hand fast and simple so you can get playing instead of waiting for complicated setup. Tired of poring over instructions and rules until giving up and just figuring it out as you go? Schmuggleware's rules fit on a single card, making it simple enough for anyone to learn in just a few minutes! By eliminating all the tedious downtime of other games, Schmuggleware promises to keep everyone engaged and entertained.

Gone is the auction game of pure strategy. Whether socializing or competing mercilessly, Schmuggleware's perfectly tuned blend of strategy and chance allows players to start on equal footing before trying to outwit their opponents, never knowing exactly what will be auctioned off next!

-description From publisher's website

name: Apex
description:
Apex is a strategic game in which various civilizations vie for galactic dominance through influence, technological advancement, and warfare. Set in a science fiction universe unlike any you've seen before, it features truly alien civilizations, diverging from typical science fiction clichés.
The game is a straightforward and minimalist 4X, taking approximately 15 minutes per player. Victory points are accumulated by controlling sectors at the end of each of the three ages. While winning doesn't necessitate engaging in war, it can yield additional points.
Each age consists of five turns, during which players select a card to play from a drafted hand. Every card provides the option to pursue one of the four strategies: Evolution, Expansion, Colonization, or War, offering players a multitude of choices. Consequently, your overall strategy is not dictated by the civilization you choose or the cards you receive. It's entirely up to you whether you opt for aggressive expansion, technological improvement, war, diplomacy, or a strategic blend of these elements.
Highly symmetrical, with minimal randomness and devoid of the chaos found in more intricate games, Apex poses a chess-like challenge for seasoned strategists. However, its rich universe and straightforward mechanics make it an ideal game for introducing more casual players to strategic gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Simultaneous Action Selection, Zone of Control

name: Παιχνίδι Εκατομμυρίων (Millions Game)
description:
Listen to the question. Choose the right answer. Amass millions of Euros.

—description from the publisher

name: Oyster Dance
description:
七転牡蠣～Oyster Dance～ (Shichitenkakki～oisutaadansu～) (Oyster Dance) is a game from Japan in which players are grilling oysters to eat. Players roll the dice and following the icons, they prepare the oysters on the barbecue grill. The oyster tokens must be grilled on both sides and then brought to the plate, but only if the player has acquired slices of lemon first. The first player to get three oysters on their plate is the winner.

The oyster tokens show the normal shell on one side and the open oyster on the other. These open oysters have different face emojis which are matched with the dice. If a player cannot take an oyster (they cannot find a matching face or they do not have a lemon slice), they must turn an oyster face down and take a lemon slice as recompense.

If a player can find a matching face, and they have a lemon slice, they can take the oyster to their plate. Then the grill is spun around so that players forget which oysters are where on the grill.

The game is sold with the components in a round box (10.5 cm round, 5 cm deep) which acts as the charcoal burner. However, the actual metal grill used is too large to fit in the box (22.5cm across) and is supplied separately.
--description by user

World's first! A board game where you grill oysters on a net!
There are three rules to eating fresh oysters from "tajimaya".
(1) Grill them on both sides as they are very fresh.
(2) Always garnish with lemon.
(iii) Say "Itadakimaya" in appreciation of the oysters before you serve them to the plate.
You win if you are the first to welcome three oysters to your plate.

世界初！網の上で牡蠣を焼くボードゲーム！
“タジマヤ(tajimaya)”の新鮮な牡蠣を食べるためには、三つの作法があります。
①活きが良いので両面焼いてください。
②必ずレモンを添えてください。
③牡蠣への感謝をこめて「いただきます」と言ってからお皿にお迎えしてください。
一番最初に牡蠣を三つお皿にお迎え出来たら勝利します。
10.5cmΦ(円形の箱)、深さ5cm＋22.5Φcmの網が付属します。
--description by publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Memory, Pattern Recognition

name: Pummel & Friends: Kekse für die Glitzerwelt
description:
Every inhabitant of the glittering world loves cookies. But before you can enjoy your cookies with your cocoa in the evening, you need to stock up on a small (or very large) supply of cookies. While the Octogrummel wants to prevent you from collecting cookies, the Pummelfee likes to give away extra cookies. So, which one of you will have collected the most cookies by the end of the game?

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Steam Power: Cat Power
description:
Cat Power is the first expansion for Steam Power and introduces two whimsical maps and a mechanic for if you wake up sleeping cats.

The game otherwise plays per the standard rules and the sleeping cats provide an extra layer of the track laying puzzle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Territory Building, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Contracts, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: 山河奇迹 (Miracles of China)
description:
