Embark on a cultural journey and witness the miracles of China in this strategic tabletop game. Explore city stories, delve into 49 modern and ancient wonders, and experience the wisdom of the Chinese people.

Features:

Explore 49 modern and ancient wonders of China.
Develop strategic thinking and observational skills.
Hone path planning and competitive abilities.

Game Flow:

Purchase Tickets or Travel (Players choose to buy tickets or use existing tickets to travel).
Exchange Cards (Players discard remaining cards and draw 4 new cards).
Score Points (Players earn points when stopping at a point matching a tabletop landmark card).
Draw Cards (If a player obtains a landmark card, reveal a new one to replenish the tabletop).
Game End (The game concludes when any player's total points from landmark cards reach or exceed 10 and returns to their starting point).
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Divine Harem: Undies Expansion
description:
The Undies Expansion adds a new set of cards to the game, showcasing the girls in underwear and lingerie outfits, adding a new dimension and bonus rules which affect how certain actions work within the game.

Currently the Undies Expansion includes an additional 72 cards and a special beach harem game mat. With more content also available via further stretch goals.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Divine Harem: Explicit Expansion
description:
The Explicit Expansion adds a new set of cards to the game, showcasing the girls in explicit imagery/complete nude and uncensored, adding a new dimension more sexy cards and another bonus rule-set which will adjust your play-style in the game.

Currently the Explicit Expansion includes an additional 60 cards, but stretch goals can unlock even more content for this expansion and will be announced via Updates.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Divine Harem: Gamer Girls Expansion
description:
The Gamer Girls Expansion adds another set of cards to the game, showcasing artworks from our past Dharker Studios games, featuring new Harem Girls, Harem Toys and Harem Pets to play with in the game.

Thanks to our special stretch goals the Game Girls set now includes an additional 54 cards, yet more bonuses could be added to this special pack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Divine Harem: Booster Card Pack
description:
As an additional bonus, anyone who pledges at the £95 reward tier or higher will in addition to the Game Mat Expansion also receive the following bonus items too.

Booster Card Pack: (+69 Additional Cards)

Core Game Booster (An addition 36 cards)
Undies Booster (An addition 12 cards)
Gamer Girls Booster (An additional 18 cards)
Special Themed Cards (An additional 3 cards)
Card Protectors: (350 included)

A set of 350 clear card wallet protectors for all cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Preferences: The Game
description:
Preferences is a 'get to know you' party game that brings you closer by exploring each other's - you guessed it - preferences! The result? Stories shared. Connections deepened. And a**es laughed off.

It can be played in 3 easy steps:

Naughty or nice? The choice is yours! Tailor the game to your group by keeping your removing the rowdy cards. We want grandma to play too!
The starting player picks 3 preferences cards and secretly ranks them in order of most liked to least liked. In no particular order, the player will then read the cards to the group.
With their combined knowledge, the group will try to guess the player's preferred order through hilarious debates, deliberations, and ah-ha moments, testing how well the group really knows each other.


I bet you're wondering who the winner is? Well, not everything is a competition Monica, this is just for fun! BUT, if you really can't contain your competitive side, grab a sheet of paper (as your score pad) and a pen. In this version, everyone will guess the player's preferences on their own, no conversing with the group! Whoever guesses right, gets a point. Player who has the most points at the end of the game wins!

We know you're excited to play, so get ready for those "who knew?!" moments, belly laughs, and that warm and fuzzy feeling we all know and love.

Walk away with smiles that never fade, abs that never looked better, and hearts never so full.

—description from the publisher

name: Hit Send: The High Risk Game of Text Roulette
description:
This twistedly funny, ridiculous card game will bring tears of laughter to game night. Hit Send is causing message mayhem across social media and Youtube after it was co-created and played by The Sidemen: JJ (KSI), Harry (W2S), Ethan (Behzinga), Tobi (Tobjizzle), Simon (Miniminter) and Josh (Zerkaa). It's easy. Take a letter and number card, e.g. M & 3. Scroll to your 3rd contact under M in your phone (your best friend’s mom). Other players put down their most outrageous text card. The DM Don chooses which message you should send. If you send the chosen text, such as ‘Do you ever fantasise about me?’, then you win a point. If you back out, the person who put the card down wins it. Get a reply to win another point. Turn your game night into contact chaos with this high risk game of text roulette.

—description from the publisher

name: Realtree-opoly
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Masterpieces Inc. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature game animals and Realtree products.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.

name: Vin Quiz
description: A three-in-one: A wine trivia game, a 64-page booklet of wine trivia, and a wine tasting notebook.

name: Studs & Duds
description:
A fun, 2-player, head to head game. With 2 ways to play: choose a pre-made team (8 fictional teams) and the roster that comes with them OR if you have more time, I recommend the draft mode. During the draft, you draft a total of 12 players and 1 Coach. After you have your team, it’s football in a card game(with dice). Offense cards, Defense cards, and “Extra” cards, which involve penalties, injuries, and add-ons to make your players better, which are able to be bought with a shop system with the in-game currency that you acquire throughout the game. Many other interesting things that affect real-life football is also implemented, such as Status Affects(Rain,Snow,etc.) , among other things like Homefieled Advantage, or Team Chemistry can affect how you choose to draft your team.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Score-and-Reset Game, Single Loser Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Cats Doing Things
description: A game where the players each choose one of their cards to be the caption for the picture chosen by the judge. The judge then decides which caption is the funniest, and the player who played that card gets a point. In the next round, the player to the judge's right becomes the new judge. Play until you want to stop, and the player with most points wins.

name: Warp-Lancer: H23 Promo – Devourer's Plague
description:
The Devourers are a nightmarish cosmic plague that sweeps through the galaxy, leaving only desolation in their wake as they consume every civilization they encounter.

Includes:
1 new underboss card
2 new boss cards
1 new event card

name: Warp-Lancer: Promo Christmas 2023 – A Kind Universe
description:
Amidst cosmic threats and adversities, beacons of hope shine across the galaxy. Generous alien races, driven by a spirit of unity, offer their belongings to spread peace. Diverse beings unite against the darkness, embodying the enduring force of kindness in the face of lethal danger.

Includes:
2 new events
1 new pilot
1 new Augment

name: Gee Haw
description:
Gee-Haw is a solitaire game that uses a standard poker deck (with jokers) and the Gee-Haw score board and pegs. The challenge is to get all the pegs to either the red or the black side of the score board, based on the suit color of the numbered cards and the "wild card" powers of the face cards. You decide how to utilize most of the card values, but a few have unavoidable consequences. Can you accomplish the goal before the deck runs out?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Coup: Promo Burguês e Benfeitor
description:
Bourgeois and Benefactor promo cards for Coup.

The Bourgeois: Take 4 coins. Other players can also declare to influence the Bourgeois. After all declarations are made, disputes (if any) are resolved clockwise from the active player. The active player gives 1 coin for each declarer who was not successfully challenged.

The Benefactor: Take 3 coins from the player with the most coins and give them away for the player with the fewest coins. In case of a tie, the active player decides who the target is.

name: Rock Paper Scissors Royale
description:
Rock Paper Scissors Royale is a 1vs1 competitive card game where your team takes over 12 territories by winning rounds of classic Rock Paper Scissors.

Shuffle the cards and distribute them equally, place the territories face down, turning over one territory each round.
The territories have different colors to decide draws.

Each turn players will play a card from their hand at the same time. If both players play the same card, it is a draw and the cards are discarded. The player that wins takes their opponent's card and adds both cards to their win pile.

After all cards for the round have been played, the player with the most cards in the win pile, wins the round a can place their team token on the territory. Once all territories have been taken, players can challenge for the lands until 1 player occupies the whole map.

—description from the publisher

name: Colonial 1700-1800: Os Lusíadas
description:
This add-on includes a new playable faction: Portugal. This add-on contains the following components:
Portugal:
- 17 battle cards.
- 1 unique Tactic card of the faction.
- 7 cards of Portuguese colonies.
- 15 control markers.
- 15 coins.
- 1 Portuguese player board.
- 4 green dice.

The add-ons are not autoplayable. You need a copy of the base game Colonial 1700-1800 to play.

name: Colonial 1700-1800: Sideshow Bob
description:
This add-on contains a total of 20 new politicians, which allow players to customize their political board, adding almost infinite replayability: games focused on naval strategy, games focused on economics (less confrontation), games focused on weakened defenses (more confrontation), etc.

This add-on allow players to set up boundary conditions of the game looking for a positive strategy (politicians who boost you) or a negative strategy (politicans who harm the rivals).

name: Colonial 1700-1800: Carnatic Wars
description:
The Carnatic Wars scenario takes you to the struggle for hegemony in India between 1746 and 1763.
It includes a new scenario involving Great Britain and France (playable with just Colonial 1700-1800 base game, no need of Great Battles add-on). The content of this scenario is listed below:
- 8 New colonies
- 2 Scenario cards
- 3 Battle cards
- 3 Standard cards for the Political Board.

name: Colonial 1700-1800: Follower Gift Promo Cards
description:
Free for followers of the campaign.

The follower gift is made up of two (2) promo cards that will increase players' tactical options. The early bird... will allow you to burn down a colony's production buildings, causing great damage to the opponent's economy. For his part, ...catches the worm allows you to do the opposite: cancel the effects of that incursion or garrison the colony with a levy of militiamen to be better prepared for attacks.

name: Bob Moog's Dad Jokes: Holiday Edition
description:
A card game based on the collection of Christmas Themed "Dad" jokes compiled by Bob Moog.

The game ends when a player has made 8 Completed Jokes and that player is the winner.

Contents: 110 Cards (55 Jokes, 55 Punch Lines), Instructions.

name: Colonial 1700-1800: Plus Ultra
description:
This add-on includes a new playable faction: Spain. The game expands to a new theater of operations: South America. This add-on contains the following components:
Spain:

-17 battle cards.
-1 Tactic card unique to the faction.
-11 cards of Spanish colonies.
-15 control markers.
-15 coins.
-1 Spanish player board.
-4 yellow dice.
-New theater of operations in South America:
-1 secret objective card.
-15 South American colony cards for all factions (1 FR, 1 GB, 1 NL, 4 ES, 8 PT).
-5 South American Native allies battle cards for all factions.

The add-ons are not autoplayable. You need a copy of the base game Colonial 1700-1800 to play.

name: Colonial 1700-1800: Oranje Boven
description:
This add-on includes a new playable faction: Netherlands. This add-on contains the following components:

Netherlands:

17 battle cards.
1 Tactic card unique to the faction.
14 cards of Dutch colonies.
15 control markers.
15 coins.
1 Dutch player board.
4 orange dice.

name: Colonial 1700-1800: Great Battles
description:
This add-on includes a new game mode (scenario mode) and 5 historical scenarios where you can recreate the greatest colonial wars of 18th century, as well as a new playable faction: United States. This add-on contains the following components:

Historical scenarios:
-21 New colonies
-34 Battle cards
-10 Scenario cards
-1 New mini-teather: Oceania (5 Native allies cards, 3 colonies, 1 objective card).

United States:
-17 Battle cards.
-2 Tactic cards unique to the faction.
-15 Control markers.
-15 coins.
-4 dice.
-1 American player board.
The add-ons are not autoplayable. You need a copy of the base game Colonial 1700-1800 to play.

Important note: some scenarios involve factions present in other add-ons (Spain, Portugal, The Netherlands). The components of these factions are needed for playing those scenarios. To enjoy a complete experience with Great Battles add-on, we highly recommend to have the 5 factions of the game.

name: Pike & Piquet: The 30 Years War
description:
Pike & Piquet: The 30 Years War is a print and play game using the ancient French card game of Piquet to power a low complexity, sandbox-style wargame on the 30 years war. Heavily inspired by Fred Serval's A Very Civil Whist, the game utilizes trick taking to manipulate forces on the map and diplomatic maneuvering.

WEIGHT: 6/10
PLAYERS: 2
SOLITAIRE: 4/10

—description from the designer

name: Duel Shogi
description:
Duel Shogi is a mini version of Shogi. Traditional Shogi is a 9x9 spaced board and we use 20 pieces per player, playing time usually takes one hour or so. It is very difficult for beginners and those who are unfamiliar with Japanese culture and Shogi rules.
I wanted to create a shortened version of Shogi for beginners. Duel Shogi will enable anyone to learn the basic rules by simple, repeat play. Each player starts with eight pieces, each of a different type. Thus the minimum board must be composed with 4x5 spaces.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: The Wars of Louis XIV: Lace Wars Series – Volume I
description:
This the Deluxe and augmented version of “Les Guerres du Roi Soleil 1667-1713” (The Wars of the Sun King) published in 2019 by Cerigo Edition.
This the first opportunity to play, with a single set of rules, the five conflicts led by France under the reign of Louis XIV the Great and the great rebellion called “La fronde”.

La Fronde rebellion (1648-1653) – taking advantage of the weakness of royal power while Louis, the future Louis XIV, was still a minor, the parliament of Paris and the nobility revolted at different periods and to different degrees against the regency ensured by Anne of Austria (widow of Louis XIII) and Cardinal Mazarin, hated by all. This weakening of France is a boon for Spain, still at war with France, to recover territories (Catalonia, Roussillon, the North of France).
The War of Devolution (1667-1668) - Spain’s non-payment of the Infanta of Spain’s dowry at her marriage to Louis XIV was used as a pretext for a war of conquest. This was the first conflict initiated by Louis XIV against a militarily and economically weakened Spain.
The Franco-Dutch War (1672-1678) - France wants to bring the Dutch Republic to its knees. This fierce commercial competitor, too tolerant as a state, opposes France’s expansion toward the Spanish Netherlands. This war for glory pitches against each other living legends of the Thirty Years War like Turenne, Condé et Montecuccoli. As a result of this conflict, the King of France earns the nickname Louis the Great.
The War of the Reunions (1683-1684) - Spain does not accept the annexation by France of enclaves and surrounding areas in the Spanish Netherlands, stating their boundaries were poorly defined by the international treaties ending the War of Devolution and the Franco-Dutch War. Vauban recommends limiting the territorial enclaves, leaning against the mountainous area and securing the enclaves by constructing strongholds; it’s a matter of turf.
The War of the League of Augsburg (1688-1697) - The Habsburg’s victory against the Ottomans diverted the Empire’s attention on the French territorial gains following the War of the Reunions. In 1687, Louis XIV wanted to transform the Truce of Ratisbon into a permanent accord and send an ultimatum to the emperor who refused. The German princes and the great European powers form an alliance to counter France’s politics of expansionism and religious persecution. France finds itself diplomatically isolated.
The War of Spanish Succession (1701-1713) - King Charles II of Spain dies with no descendants. The two principal reigning families of Europe, the Bourbons (France) and the Habsburgs (Austria), are both related to Charles II and claim the throne. The principal stake is the domination of Europe by seizing the enormous heritage of the Spanish Habsburgs. France is confronted with its fiercest military enemies: Marlborough and Prince Eugene of Savoy.
Maximise your resource points to recruit armies, build strongholds, lead sieges and battles and win glory points.
Will you be able to vanquish Montecuccoli, Eugene of Savoy or Marlborough with Turenne, Condé, Villars and impose the Sun King’s will? Or Vauban will be the nemesis of all enemies ‘citadels?

The game includes :
• One 59 x 85 cm MOUNTED (!) map
• 324 double-sided, pre-cut counters and markers
• A scenario booklet and a rulebook
• Many player aids

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Events, Impulse Movement

name: Dragonvault: Evernight Vale
description: Dragonvault: Evernight Vale is a standalone game in the Dragonvault line and can be played alone or combined with its sister games Dragonvault and Dragonvault: Voyage of Peril. In this iteration, game play is the same as Dragonvault, though with the addition of the new freeze mechanic. eight new champions, and the dual treasure/action rune cards.

name: Dragonvault: Voyage of Peril
description: Dragonvault: Voyage of Peril is a standalone game in the Dragonvault line and can be played alone or combined with its sister games Dragonvault and Dragonvault: Evernight Vale. In this iteration, game play is the same as Dragonvault, though with the addition of an alternate win condition, eight new champions, and a new recruitable companion.

name: 西游斗妖行 (Journey to the West)
description:
Journey to the West is a cooperative adventure game designed for 2-4 players. Players can choose to embody any of the four characters from Tang Monk's entourage, collectively immersing themselves in the rich mythological narrative of the Westward journey. Utilize strategic thinking, teamwork, and individual abilities to defeat a multitude of supernatural foes and overcome the predetermined trials along the perilous pilgrimage.

Gameplay:

1.Explore:

Draw a terrain card and place it on the game board, then resolve the event depicted on the card. This represents the various encounters and challenges faced while exploring the path ahead.

2.Player Actions:

Players can choose from six different actions, each potentially consuming action points:
- Meditate: Spend one action point to randomly draw a Five Elements magic.
- Acquire Skill Cards: Spend one action point and 1-6 magic to obtain powerful skill cards.
- Move: Spend one action point and 1-6 magic to move to an adjacent location displaying a terrain with the same magic cost.
- Attack: Spend one action point to roll combat dice and attack a local demon.
- Activate Skill: Execute the effect of a skill card, discarding it afterward.
- Special Chapter Action: Each chapter features a unique action.

3.Player Action Resolution:

Resolve the chosen actions of all players.

4.Demon Actions:

The next player takes on the role of controlling all demons, initiating attacks on the players according to specific rules.

5.Demon Resolution:

Resolve demon attacks or skill effects based on dice results.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: 钱儿响叮当 (Lucky Dog)
description:
Description:

"Lucky Dog" is a charming tabletop game where players join forces to construct shops and welcome the arrival of auditors bringing fortune! This engaging board game set in the Year of the Rabbit features playful elements, including jingling bells, in a rich Chinese cultural theme. Players embark on a journey similar to Monopoly, rolling dice, building houses, and accumulating wealth. The introduction of "purchase card" actions adds an element of surprise, making the game accessible to all ages and perfect for family play.

Key Learning Objectives:

Spatial Imagination
Logical Reasoning
Planning Skills
Flexible Thinking
Concentration
Creativity

Game Components:

Game Board x1
Player Aid Cards x4
Action Cards x62
Wealth Deity Figure x1
Card Stands x4
Dice x1
Copper Coins (1 Yuan denomination) x30
Silver Bills (5 Yuan denomination) x8
Silver Bills (10 Yuan denomination) x16
House Models x40

Gameplay Overview:

Players start with 3 copper coins each and a set of 10 houses. The objective is to accumulate wealth by buying and building houses, with the Wealth Deity's progress determining the income. Players take turns rolling the dice, moving the Wealth Deity, and earning income based on the street where the deity stops. The game involves strategic choices, including buying cards and houses, and utilizing special card effects.

Victory Condition:

The first player to accumulate 50 units of currency emerges as the lucky winner in "Lucky Dog."

Additional Notes:

The game features a thematic Chinese design with elements like copper coins and a national-style audit figurine.
Gameplay involves a balance of dice rolling, resource management, and strategic decision-making.
Suitable for players of all ages, with simple rules and engaging components.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Ownership, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

There are also game ideas for indoors and outdoors! Are you ready for the questions?

In which book is Obelix given magic potion voluntarily for the first and only time? When are Goethe and Schiller quoted? Take on the ultimate quiz and puzzle your way through the various levels of difficulty. All solutions are encrypted and can only be revealed with the decoder film. name: Victorus
description:
Victorus in Latin means conqueror and now springs to life as a highly tactical medieval abstract game for up to 6 players. Each player controls a chess-style army consisting of a king, a queen, and a variety of supporting knights. The object of the game is to maneuver one of your royalty around the hexagonal board then reach the center space.

The hex board offers a variety of movement options for each type of piece and, combined with the rule that capturing an opponent's piece awards an extra turn, creates an ever expanding web of possibility. Knights are themselves promoted to royalty after their second capture and gain increased mobility with a second move every turn.
The drama increases when the royal families embark on their journeys of destiny to conquer the central territory and become MAGNA VICTORUS.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending

name: Cobble
description:
Cobble is a hidden words game for one or more players. Similar to Boggle, the game is about cobbling letters into words. It is language-independent.

There are two versions: Standalone and Scrabble add-on. The Scrabble version uses your own Scrabble tiles.

COMPONENTS:

6-inch lasercut game board with inset grid
10 arrow tiles
4 dry erase game boards
4 dry erase markers (with extra addon)
26 letter tiles or 26 of your own Scrabble tiles.


GOAL:
Make the highest scoring word each round. Have the best score after ten rounds.

 
SETUP:

Randomly layout 25 tiles face up in the grid.
Scatter the arrows face down
Pick up at least three arrows and place in their corresponding locations in the grid.
Give each player a dry erase marker and dry erase board.


GAME PLAY:
Playing simultaneously, players have one to several minutes to each “cobble” together a word. After the time limit, each player calls out their word and their score.
Mark your score on your dry erase board.
A word consists of one letter from each of the marked vertical columns and/or horizontal rows.

FORMING WORDS:
To form a word, collect one letter from each line marked with an arrow. See the examples in the images.

PLAY IN ROUNDS:
After each round, shuffle and swap at least six letter tiles. Remove the arrow tiles. Decide upon 3-6 arrows for this round and randomly select and place a new set of arrows.
Ensure that one of the lines contains a vowel.
 
ENDING THE GAME:
The game is over after ten rounds.

WINNING THE GAME:
The winner will have the most points. If there is a tie, play another round.

TIPS:
Use the space at the bottom of your dry erase board to write eligible letters. You may need to unscramble the letters.

FAQS:

Do the letters need to be in a specific order or follow the numbers 1-10? NO


—description from the publisher

name: Roll & Might
description:
Components:
1 unique, algorithmically generated 8.5” by 11” sheet only produced once
two 1d4

Explore skill trees, dart across the overworld, navigate shifting terrains, and defeat monsters with stats and abilities uniquely weighted just for your game. Play as the canonical mage, warrior, and rogue and decide what element(s) you will specialize in. Imbue and buff your player’s weapons unique to their crest. And don’t let your personality, the weather, or even time get in the way!

Loosely based on Mage Knight.

“This land was heretofore known only to the likes of orcs and necromancers. Last winter, with the final arrows of the great war flung, these beasts and undead have been beaten back over the gray mountains. However, some savages remain in the land. My kingdom needs warriors, mages, rogues - adventurers like you - to make safe the kingdom. Join me!” ~ King Rhaspiron

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up

name: Roll & Fright
description:
The Halloween edition of Roll & Might.

Components:
1 unique, algorithmically generated 8.5” by 14” sheet only produced once
two 1d4

Up your survival skills, navigate shifting landscapes, and defeat as many zombies and foes that you can, with stats and encounters unique to just your copy. Play as the librarian, the doctor, or the athlete. Mod your weapons unique to your character’s preferences. And mind your personality and even storms before the virus mutates.

“Wow, you were in a coma? This world used to be home to people and dogs, of course. Last winter, with the end virus outbreak, most have turned… into zombies, roaming the planet. However, some brave and alive humans remain in the land. My team needs anybody we can muster to help find our way back to the research center and find a cure. Join me!” ~ John Lockington, former pilot

Loosely based on Mage Knight, rethemed for zombies a la the Walking Dead.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Set Collection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up

name: Nine Men's Morris Evolution
description:
GAME 9AM is move-oriented social game for 3-5 players. It is derived by extending of popular social game 'mills'
Each player gets 9 tokens of corresponding color
Game can be divided into two phases: phase 1 - putting tokens and phase 2 - moving tokens
PHASE 1 - PUTTING TOKENS
In this phase players put tokens on the table. Token can be put on any free field
If you make a mill by putting token, a player removes one of the tokens of any other player - see 'MILL MAKING AND REMOVING OF TOKENS
PHASE 2 - MOVING TOKENS
In this phase players move their tokens from current to neighbour free field. It is allowed to move any of the tokens
If the player is left with 3 tokens, he can move any of the left tokens to any free field - 'jumping'
If no token can be moved, no moved is made, a player is stepped over and next player is to move
If a mill is made by moving a token, a player will remove one token of any other player - see paragraph below
MILL MAKING AND REMOVING OF TOKENS
A mill is made by putting or moving token and making a line of three tokens of the same color. (in 5 players game, a mill is for example 1-4-7)
Player who made a mill will obtained number of cards equivalent to number of 'neighbouring' mills
(for ex. if a player in 5 players game has tokens on fields 1,4,7,10,11,52 and 57 he will get 3 cards - because of mills 1-4-7, 7-10-57 and 52-11-57)
Also, if by removing of tokens a player is left with less then 3 tokens, a player who removed his last token is rewarded with 2 additional cards
Player that is left with 2 tokens is expelled from game (and these 2 tokens are removed, too)
After making a mill, a player has the right to remove one of the opponents' tokens
Token that is about to be removed must not be in 'mill'. If all tokens are 'in mill' no token will be removed and next player is to move
POINTS
Every player starts game with 10/15/20 points depending of game type (for 3/4/5 players respectively) - 'basic points'
Besides basic points, points are calculated as difference from average number of cards obtained
(for ex. for 5 players game and for 30 total cards obtained and 14 cards obtained for this player. Then, points number is B = 10 x (14 - 30:5) = 80 points)

name: Crossword Rummy
description:
Crossword Rummy is a word card game that appeared in 1942 or earlier. Its deck of solitaire-sized cards (2.5" x 1.75") include 55 letter cards and 3 wild cards. The rules book has roles for these games:

CROSSWORD RUMMY
During your turn you play cards that add a word to a growing crossword on the table, or draw a card. The first player to play all cards from their hand gets the points on all the cards of the other players. First to 250 points wins.

MEMORY WORDGAME
A version of Concentration. All the cards are spread out face down on the table. During your turn you reveal 4 cards, and if you can spell a 3- or 4-letter word you keep its cards and turn the rest face down. When all cards are used or no other words can be made, the player with the most cards wins.

WORD CASINO
Like Logomachy or Casino. Four cards are played face up, and 4 cards dealt to each player. On your turn you take a card from your hand and either make a word with it and cards on the table, or leave it face up on the table. When all hands are played out, deal 4 more to each player. When the deck is gone and all hands emptied, the player with the most cards wins.

WORD POKER
Five cards are dealt to each player, who may then exchange up to three of them at a cost of -10 points per card. The player who can make the longest, most-points word gets 10 points for each unused card of the other players. First to 250 wins.

WORD SOLITAIRE
Like Canfield solitaire, with 28 cards in 7 piles, and then revealing the rest one at a time. From the visible cards you can make new words and add to previous words.

name: Misty Waters: At the Edge of World – Empires
description:
This expansion introduces asymmetric capabilities for each faction, as well as ship types unique to them.
In addition, many of the cardboard tokens are replaced with wooden ones.

name: Final 5 Basketball
description:
Build your franchise over the last 5 rounds of the season by managing finances and brand value to trade for player talent and get the strategic edge at game time by hiring master coaches to bolster your playbook.

Come Game Time it all comes down to the Final 5 plays of the game and winning depends on more than just luck! You'll need a combination of strong roster stats, reliable playbook strategic options as well as good ol human player-on-player bluff and anticipation.

Final 5 let's you tailor your team. Build a 2 point scoring powerhouse, a 3 point sniper squad, a defensive juggernaut or a balanced squad of all three. A middleing team roster with great coaching and great player decision making can still win Championships.

At the end of the season, the higher your team standing, the easier your playoff progression will be. On the flip side, you are always in with a chance to have a late surge to glory!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Chunky Fighters: Ella Valtoucru
description: A carnivorous plant becomes a playable character, equipped with vines, vines, lots of vines and a giant man-eating maw.

name: Chunky Fighters: Mario Netdor
description: A golden golem is added as a playable character, having no need for weapons with its indestructible exterior, which must be peeled away to reveal the soft coppery center to be defeated.

name: Chunky Fighters: James Ussey
description: An immortal vampire becomes a playable character, equipped with various antique weapons-but a master of each.

name: Star Blazers: A Solitaire Game of the Quest for Iscandar
description:
This game is based on the highly successful anime titled "Space Battleship Yamato", which was initially broadcast in 1974. At the time of its first broadcast, the anime did not gain much popularity for various reasons, but later it became a huge hit thanks to television reruns and film screenings. This game is inspired by "Space Battleship Yamato" and puts you in the shoes of Captain Okita, commanding the Yamato. Your goal is to guide the ship to Iscandar, obtain a radiation removal device, and return to Earth before humanity is exterminated.

The original game was created in 1983 during the summer vacation of the third year of middle school as a solitaire game. This version was reposted based on my memory. At the time I had no intention of letting anyone else play it or releasing it anywhere, and the rules varied every time I played it. I hope you can face it with a great spirit.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Auto-Spel
description:
Simple Roll and Move game.
Players must get to the end of the circular track first. Move according to your die-roll. If you land on one of the illustrated spaces you must follow the instruction on that space. The list of all 11 special squares are listed at the bottom of the board.

—user summary

name: Mr. MARK
description:
Mr. MARK is a card game that offers numerous play options in a single deck. A playing card with no numbers made of 64 cards with 4 types of eyes, shapes, and colors providing various enjoyable activities.

Mr. MARK cards lack numerical values allowing for gameplay centered around recognizing "same" and "different." This feature makes it accessible for young children who may not yet grasp numbers!

name: Salad Master: Smoothie
description:
Salad Master Smoothie is a board game that allows modern individuals facing a vegetable deficiency to easily consume vegetables. Building on the previous game, "Sarada Master," it includes carefully selected vegetables.

The rules involve deducing and pointing to vegetables with the correct quantity according to a given theme. However, some vegetables are only visible by name, requiring a bit of attention.

The nutritional content of the vegetables on the cards is based on the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and Technology's Japanese Food Standard Composition Table 2020 (8th edition).

name: Shareholders
description:
Shareholders is a cooperative 4-player card game. It is played with a deck of standard playing cards and 12 additional tokens(3 'shares' per suit). Players form 2 teams of 2-players, and compete for higher scores by owning shares of more influential suits.

While proceeding with typical trick-taking format, each player has an option of taking a share from one of the suits, instead of playing a card from one's hand. Each suit is 'completed' as soon as all 4 cards with alphabets (J, Q, K, Q) are played during the game, and gives 3, 4, 5 points per share to shareholders by being completed 1st, 2nd and 3rd respectively. The game ends as soon as 3rd completion of a suit is made. The team with higher sum of scores wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Stock Holding, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Maybe Capital
description:
"The Only Game Where Nothing Is Fair"

You'll get an awesome set of cards and an artisanally designed board. You'll travel up and down the 101, earning money and investors, pitching companies, and networking with other famous VCs and founders.

You'll stop in places like Marin County, where you'll smoke pot with someone famous and collect 5 Millions Dollars! Your ultimate goal is to get to Burning Man to host a transformational VIP Disruption Camp and collect 6 Investors and 10 Millions Dollars!

When you pick up a pitch card, or land on a pitch space, you and other 6 other VC players will pitch companies based on 2 cards that you pick up.

It’s your job to make your pitch convincing to the other players because they will all be investing a certain amount of their investment cards into your company, and if you don't sound like you know what you're talking about, it'll just be ...awkward. As you move around the board, you’ll be instructed to take certain actions, according to the networking cards you pick up every turn.

You can declare you are the Winner(!) when you get your portfolio of startups to IPO, or you earn 50 Millions Dollars and declare that the bubble has popped.

name: Битвы Fantasy: Штурм каземата  (Storming the Casemate)
description:
This is an action game where both sides are trying to eliminate each other's soldiers. The game uses actual firing devices, similar to Crossbows and Catapults.

Players roll a die for actions and use them to either move pieces or fire. Any soldier that is knocked down is eliminated from the game. Players can also move their soldiers into contact with the enemy and fight melees. Players can also use magic cards to assist them.

Several versions of this game were made over the years.
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Motór GT
description:
Motór GT is not just a card and board social game. It's a nostalgic Grand Tour to the golden days of motorsport, the primacy of mechanics over electronics, and design that rubs up against art. It's a way to compete with a group of petrolhead friends and help pass on the passion to your child.

Motór GT includes:

100 cards of iconic cars
race track
wooden pawns


Such a set allows 2 modes of gameplay:
1. MOTO QUIZ
Automotive quiz will test your knowledge and allow you to learn new, unknown facts about the legendary models.
2. RACE
Classic race on an oval track will select the driver who best controls the speed, grip and condition of the car.

—description from the publisher

name: 粉碎计划：东山岛1953 (Plan Shatter: Dongshan Island, 1953)
description:
粉碎计划：东山岛1953 ("Plan Shatter: Dongshan Island，1953") is a two player wargame with the theme of the landing operation of the National Revolutionary Army(NRA) on Dongshan Island(东山岛) on July 16, 1953. One player plays the role of the People's Liberation Army(PLA), and the other plays the role of the NRA.

This is a special battle, and when the NRA landed, there was a huge disparity in strength between the two sides. NRA had an absolute advantage of about 10-1, not only in terms of sea and air superiority, but also in the presence of the first deployed special force—the paratrooper battalion. Hu Lian(胡琏) thought he had a safe chance of winning and could quickly occupy the entire island, and then use the dangerous terrain to implement defense, in order to demonstrate the strength of NRA to the United States and lay the groundwork for future counterattacks on the mainland. As a result, PLA on the island stubbornly resisted and held onto the crucial Eight Foot Gate(八尺门) Ferry. The reinforcements rushed from the mainland and entered the battlefield half a day later. At this point, the crucial role of the commander was demonstrated, and Hu Lian decided to immediately retreat. While feinting on the front line, the rear troops retreated in an orderly manner. In just one day, the already deployed troops were gathered and boarded, completing a more difficult retreat than an attack. The successful recapture of Dongshan Island by PLA has shed its former shame.

The mechanism of this game was modified based on Kinmen 1949: The Battle that Saved Taiwan.

Scale = 800 meters /hex;

time = 8 hours /GT;
size = battalion or company / unit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: テンカトリテ (Tenka Trick)
description: A must-follow trick-taking game themed around the Sengoku period. The lead player is called the "general" and the following players are called "vassals" and they aim to acquire territory by playing cards and going into battle.
publishers: 静岡テーブルゲーム工房 (Shizuoka Tabletop Game Workshop)

name: Velocity
description:
Each player gets 10 dice.

The main objective is to get all 10 of your dice to show the same number before any other player.

The set of 40 dice can be played with other other variants of dice rolling games.

name: Merch'Entice
description:
With a core design of making your table top group burst into a fit of giggles, the game of Merch'Entice has players take turns role-playing as the Hero on a quest while the remaining players become Merchants!

Each round starts with the Hero beginning their random or ridiculous quest through drawing a Quest Card; meanwhile, the Merchants, with their hands full of cards, will carefully craft an enticing item by combining two types of cards, the Enchantment Card and Item Card!

When the Merchants have finished forging their merchandise, the market opens and the Hero will be tasked with visiting each Merchant individually; browsing the merchants' wares and conversing with them to find the item that will most suit them on their Quest! Each Merchant will have a chance to entice the Hero with their goods and earn that precious coin!

Inside Merch'Entice, the three unique cards - Quests, Enchantments, and Items - will provide the means for all sorts of market themed role-playing mayhem!

—description from the publisher

name: Secure The Loot
description:
Secure The Loot is a 2-8 player point based card game where each player aims to get 50 points on the play field to obtain a loot. There is a draw pile, discard pile, and character pile. At the beginning each player chooses one of four suits: Swords, wands, coins, and cups. Each of the four have different playstyles. They then draw a character and keep it hidden until they choose to use the characters special ability. They then draw 5 cards and draw one each turn after every first turn has been completed.

One can play a single point card and action card each turn unless bypassed by another ability. There are 5 action cards within the draw pile that can be played by everyone and there are suit specific action cards such as the ace of swords, that can only be played if one chose swords as their suit at the beginning of the game.

The character you have determines how many loot you need to win the game, 2 loot win characters have weaker abilities than 3 loot win characters. But once a loot is obtained one can choose to draw a new character and shuffle their old character back into the character pile.

Instead of there being one winner everyone continues to play for placement.

—description from the designer

name: Ouistitwist
description:
A monkey-themed observational card game.
Match the turned card in the middle with the position (of the monkey) on another visible card and the colour (of the background) on another visible card.
Be the first to make the match and you lose one of your cards, make a mistake and you gain a card.
First player to get rid of all their cards, wins.

name: Hack Comics!
description:
Hack Comics! is a solo game where you experience a year in the life of a comic book company, inventing new series, drawing comic covers, writing crazy synopses, pursuing subsequent issues, and finding crossover and spinoff opportunities. (Game does not include art: you're the artist. Sorry.)

This is conceived as a free “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a deck of 50 blank index cards, which you will modify during the game. A 10 game campaign will finish out the deck, but you can always add new stacks of 50 for subsequent years!

At the end of the game, you score points based on the length of comic series, the number of crossovers, and the number of spinoffs.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Drawing, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tokyo vs Burrito: Taco vs Burrito Expansion Pack
description:
Tokyo vs Burrito Expansion Pack is an expansion pack for the popular Taco vs Burrito card game. It requires the core game to play, adding new dimensions and fun twists to your game nights.
More Players - This expansion pack allows for up to 8 players, making it a great choice for family game nights, gatherings with friends, or parties.

Additional Cards - The pack comes with 30 unique cards, providing more variety and unpredictability to your games.
Card Holders - Included are 4 additional card holders, providing convenience and organization during play.

—description from hte publisher

name: Paper Clip Warriors
description:
1v1 family orientated language-independent battle card game. With an overarching focus on inclusion and accessibility. Game play is between 2 players.

The two players set their avatars on one of the four grids on the battlefield. Two 15 card battle decks are set next to the battlefield. Three win cards aset to the left of set up. The youngest player starts the battle by flipping their first card. The action card has a picture that indicates the type of attack. Their is a black square on a four section grid that mimics the battlefield.

If the opponents avatar is located in the pictured section, the opponent takes one damage and they remove one of four paper clips. If the opponent is not located in the section pictured on the attack card the attack is a miss.The opponent successfully doges the attack. If the player pulling the action card draws a dodge card. Indicated by the card picture, they have the option of moving to the grid square pictured on the grid or they may stay in same position.

Game play continues with each player taking a turn and pulling an action card, shuffling when needed until one player removes all four paperclips. The winning player takes and retains one win card for the next battle round. The defeated player removes one win card from the board. The win card has an automatic hit or automatic dodge that can be used by interrupting game play at any time. The win card is set aside and retained to show the win of a previous round. Game play continues for three rounds or when one player collects two win cards.

-description from designer

name: Wizards & Relics: Awakening Promo Pack
description:
A Kickstarter Promo Pack released with the Wizards & Relics Awakening Kickstarter in 2023. It contains the following:

21 Cards:


3 Rules/Clarification Cards



9 Wizards:
Frank Unleashed
Fred, Finder of Fair Things
Edvard, Ancient Researcher
Professor Hans
Mr. Gryff, the Beastslayer
Mola, the Moon Mage
Undead Ed
Gourdie
Manny, the Absent Bodied Magician




9 Relics:
Staff of Silencing
Hat of Illusion
Peacemaker's Pipe
Sapphire Saber
Emerald Edge
Ruby Reckoner
Zombie Hand
Dagger of Rebirth
Brandywood Shrrom

name: Cherez Ural: Merchants in Siberia
description:
In the 16th century, Russians ventured beyond the Ural Mountains and initiated the conquest of Siberia. What attracted them to Siberia was the furs from small animals, that were crucial exports for Russia. In pursuit of these valuable pelts, Russians expanded their territories eastward.

China, a prosperous land in the east, was also important, with its highly valued products. Moreover, when fur exports to Western Europe declined, China emerged as a major alternative market.

In this game, players aim to increase their wealth by skillfully utilized, their subordinate workers. Try your best to become the most renowned merchant in Siberia!
mechanics: Events, Pick-up and Deliver, Resource to Move, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Dicey Roads Collection
description:
Dicey Roads is a collection of 3 unique roll and write games with different themes and mechanics sharing a similar approach to building the roads. The roads are the most important thing here. Each of the games have different approach to this. Also the scoring methods of all games are different.

Dicey Roads share similar game flow: Roll 2 dice, choose one to use as a color determining dice, and the other as an object determining dice. Choose an empty field on the map and draw there the roads and everything you choose in the current round. Choose one thing to write in one of the surrounding areas.

Dicey Roads Collection contains three distinct games:

Dicey Roads: Explorers

You are on the adventure on uncharted territory with expert in various fields. To maximize their success, finding diverse discoveries from their fields are crucial. Will you be the most skilled guide, tactically leading the experts through the uncharted territory?

Dicey Roads: Kingdoms

The king gave you land between existing provinces. Build roads with production buildings like windmills, sawmills, mines and quarries, and transfer their output to castles. You can build defense towers and villages all of which will earn you points in different fashion. Can you become the best lord in your kingdom?

Dicey Roads: Railways

Imagine yourself as a railroad rail designer. Build railroads to deliver goods from factories to cities. Create tricky connections between multiple sources and destinations. Deliver correct pair of goods to cities earns valuable points. Are you ready to showcase your skills and become the best railroad designer in the game?

-description from publisher
categories: Dice, Exploration, Medieval, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection

name: 僕の考えたラノベのタイトルは何かがおかしい (Boku no kangaeta ranobe no taitoru ha nanika ga okasii)
description:
僕の考えたラノベのタイトルは何かがおかしい (Boku no kangaeta ranobe no taitoru ha nanika ga okasii)is a word game from Japan. Players are compiling a long and somewhat rude title of their light novel, and the designer gives the English title as "There's something wrong with the title of the light novel I came up with".

In this game, players take turns turning up word cards. They must turn up one card, and may choose to turn up more or stop. If any card they turn up has an ▲ icon, they must turn up another. Once they stop, they can collect whichever cards they like into their hand. They must take one if a ▲ icon was turned up, but otherwise can choose to not take any that turn.

Once a player feels they have enough cards in hand to make their book title, they can declare Complete! and stop for the round. When every player has stopped, they present their titles formed from all the cards in their hands and score points if possible.

The word cards show two words, top and bottom and the player can select which word to use. The cards may also show a Restricted Number (R2, R3 and so on) because those words are a bit rude in Japan. If a player's title totals R18, they are eliminated because they made it too rude for a light novel.

Before the round starts, three theme cards are turned up and players are trying to build a title matching the theme. This includes an R number, and bonus points for matching the theme. Players score points for the total of the R numbers in their title and can also score bonus points for using tricky words (marked with stars).

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins, being able to craft the best long titles to suit the market.
description by user

Word-based party game about the long names of Japanese literary works called light novels.

Players combine different word cards, such as "different world" and "reincarnation", to create their own light novel title that fits the game-specific objectives.
Each word card has a special value called R-points. If that number is over 18 in the end, you are disqualified, but you also get extra points for the final score.

ライトノベルという日本の文学作品の名前が長いことをテーマしたワード系パーティーゲーム。

「異世界」や「転生」といったさまざまなワードカードを組み合わせて、ゲームごとの目標に合うような独自のライトノベルのタイトルを作ります。
各ワードカードにはRポイントという特殊な数値があります。最終的にその数値が18以上だと失格になるけども、最終的な追加得点にもなります。
--description by publisher
categories: Humor, Novel-based, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Das Streben nach Glück: Promo-Pack 10
description:
A Collection of different promo cards in one pack.

This mini expansion contains cards that add to the already existing Item/Activities, Projects, Community, Jobs and Experiences packs.

This pack contains:
1 Community Card
2 Item/Activities
12 Projects
1 Job
2 Experiences
1 Child Trait
1 Life Goal
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Income, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Wirkraft
description:
The game wants to simulate an alternative economy proclaimed by a community.
Roll the dice. Get income according your cards. Buy a card, if you want to and if you have enough money. Optionally invest money in the bank called Bürgschaftsbank. The more cards you have, the better the chance to get return on your investment.
The winner is the player who first collected 4 specific cards.

name: Chunky Fighters: Fabien Malaki
description: A burglar becomes a playable character, stealthily sneaking behind opponents to shiv them in the back.

name: Chunky Fighters: John Rosse
description: A Texas billionaire is added as a character, using his vast wealth to take control of other characters for one turn-if not, then he'll probably just shoot ya.

name: Chunky Fighters: Esther Minator
description: A cyborg sent back from the future to assassinate a pastry chef before he publishes a brioche recipe that will cause bread machines to take over the world, nothing can escape her laser-targeting vision, or her sig sauer machine guns.

name: Chunky Fighters: Aldebaran Tromb
description: A knight becomes a playable character, using lots of deadly medieval weaponry, he's an expert in slaying monsters.
publishers: Rob and Dave Games, Robin Red Games

name: Argent Saga
description:
A brand new trading card game experience with a rich story.

In Argent Saga, players take on the role of a Champion who leads an army of Units and casts powerful Spells to destroy their opponent’s five Towers of Power and ultimately taking over the sixth tower, the Argent Tower.

We created Argent Saga to give the power back to the community by engaging with our players on an intimate level. Between our unprecedented level of community involvement and our team’s combined experience of over 100 years in the game business, we aim to avoid the pitfalls of our predecessors and create the next big thing in card gaming.

Argent Saga: Trading Card Game is the result of countless hours of playtesting and devotion to one central idea: Let’s make a game that’s fun, easy to pick up, and that can react quickly to player feedback. We’re not a huge company with corporate overlords to please; we started small and have grown because of the community. In many ways, Argent Saga is a love letter to that community.

—description from the publisher

name: Elf: Memory Master
description:
A CARD GAME FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY: Put your memory to the ultimate test at at your next game night with this entertaining Elf card game featuring designs from the hit holiday film the whole family can enjoy. Could you be having any more fun?

MEMORIZE, SWITCH, MATCH AND WIN! Partner up and compete in a game of memory at home or on the go! - 5 minutes to learn the game - 30 minutes to play - 4 players (2 teams) - ages 6 and up - do you have what it takes to be crowned the Memory Master?
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Assault on the 105s!
description:
"...Winters, lacking a demolition kit, aimed to disable the gun. Lipton had one in his musette bag back where the attack started. Winters instructed him to retrieve it. Leaving three men to guard the first gun, Winters led five others in a charge down the trench, throwing grenades, firing rifles. They captured two wounded Germans at the first gun. The second gun's crew retreated; Easy took it with minimal casualties..."

"Assault on the 105s!" is a tiny solitaire wargame published by Joyance Games and designed by Hans Gem. The game depicts a remarkable assault carried out by soldiers of Easy Company, 2nd Battalion, 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment of the U.S. 101st Airborne Division during World War II, the assault on Brécourt Manor on June 6, 1944. This historic engagement is upheld by the U.S. Military Academy at West Point as a classic example of command artistry and assaulting fixed objectives, and it is also portrayed in the book "Band of Brothers" and its namesake TV series.

The game has a duration of approximately 30 minutes, with AI controlling the German forces and players assuming the role of U.S. Airborne. Players must strategically plan actions and equipment usage, aiming to minimize their own casualties while swiftly demolishing four 105mm LeFh howitzers in the German stronghold. The objective is to ensure these artillery pieces have minimal impact on the attacks on Utah Beach. After neutralizing the cannons, players must carefully evacuate their paratroopers from the battlefield to secure victory.

In the game, event cards influence the actions of the German soldiers and may bring positive or negative effects to the U.S. paratroopers, such as ammunition shortages, intelligence gains, or reinforcements, among others. Additionally, the MG42 machine gun position situated behind the artillery emplacement poses a significant challenge. Players face the decision of prioritizing soldier safety, gradually suppressing the German firepower, or focusing on overpowering the artillery position to expedite victory.

The power of choice lies in your hands!

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Árvores
description:
In this "Roll and Write" Game, in 12 rounds, players will plant Trees and to do so they must roll 4 Dice with colored faces and make marks in different locations on their sheet. For each Tree marked or earned with Bonuses present on the Sheet, your "Planted Tree Control" will advance.

Active player rolls 4 dice and chooses 2
Other players choose 1 dice


At the end of the round, regardless of the number of players, each player will have chosen 3 Dice and marked them on their sheet.
There is the possibility of combos, since there are several bonuses that the player can earn throughout the match, depending on where they made the mark.
Game aimed at children and school students, where we seek to highlight the importance of planting trees, which on a large scale will end up improving conditions in the medium and long term.

—description from the designer

name: Propuh
description:
A strategic survival board game inspired by local superstition and card games.
Each player draws the cards in turn and combines them with each other or with the "Grandmothers" location on the board to achieve their goal. This creates simple gameplay with lots of options for both players.

Playing as the protagonist, you must complete a series of missions to win before your time is up or the notorious "Propuh" enters your house.
Play your cards wisely because once the deck runs out, it is game over.
Move the "Grandmother" to the most critical location inside the house to complete tasks easily or gain an advantage.

As for the second player (the antagonist), those playing the immaterial "Propuh" draw from the same deck of cards and attempt to get into the house. Once the "Propuh" is inside, it wins!
In a single-player game, the "Propuh" is played by the game itself.

Note: Propuh is a crosswind (or draught) that blows through the house. It is a good thing in almost all of the world, but in some countries, it is considered a cause of many ailments.
You may not have any two windows, two doors, or a window and a door open at the same time, because it could kill you!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Lychgates
description:
“You are invited to a challenge of nerves and maneuvers in the ultimate dare! Race against your friends through a terrifying graveyard where roaming Spirits emerge from their resting place to hinder your every step. Make your way in harried haste through the misty maze of standing stones and decaying dead. Play your cards with care, speed your way past the creeping corpses, and be the first to escape the realm of wraiths through the Lychgates!”

On a game board of 121 spaces, there are 4 starting points and 4 goals (the Lychgates). There are also five points on the board which will spawn “Spirits” as the game progresses. By playing from a hand of movement cards, each player is racing across the board to one of two designated goals. Each player also has six special move-enhancing cards that they can play when they wish, and once all six have been used they are refreshed to be used again. In addition, the players can control the Spirits to hinder their opponents, blocking their way to the goals. As soon as a Spirit is moved, a new one will spawn in its place. As the game goes on, the board becomes inhabited by as many as 25 roaming spirits to be dealt with.

-description from designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Race, Take That

name: Murder at Brackley Hall
description:
Every game is different. Play over and over again!

A unique concept in murder mystery games that allows the game to be played many times. The game plays equally well with any number of players between 4 & 12. There are no "add-on" characters. The game can be played either as an informal after dinner game or as an organized murder mystery event.

-description from the back of the box

name: The Floor is Lava: Family Edition
description: You better watch out because the floor is lavaaa! Keep the couch cushions where they belong; this kid-favorite just got a BIG upgrade! With more tiles than ever, new challenges, and 10 different ways to play, the fun never has to stop! Kids and parents will have a blast stretching their legs and their imaginations while avoiding obstacles and completing challenges designed to knock players off their feet. Can you kick an imaginary soccer ball or act like you’re paddling a canoe without tipping over? Put your balance and problem-solving skills to the test, but don’t fall in because remember, THE FLOOR IS LAVAAA!

name: Hidden Ark: Deep Sea Expedition
description:
The Deep Sea Expedition expansion for Hidden Ark introduces a new expansion board, deep sea species, submarines, new opportunity tokens, a pink player color, and components to support five-player games!

—description from the publisher

name: B1-I-B2-L-E
description:
A Bible-themed Bingo game published by Chuck Taylor Enterprises. No date; the box says "Copyright Applied For." Looks like it was made in 50's or 60's.

Comes with sheets of chits, used to call out what square players may mark off. Each chit has a book of the Bible, which corresponds to squares on the cards. The top row of each card has the game's name written on it, one letter per column. Different columns have different possible books; a list in the instructions tells you valid books for each column.

—user summary

name: Casinopolis
description:
Is this where you expected Sprawlopolis to go next?

In Casinopolis, 1-4 players work together to build a new casino from the ground up. Using only 18 cards and a variable scoring system, the game is never the same twice. Each turn, players will play 1 card from their hand to the growing city, trying to score as many points as possible. Players will have to communicate and plan without revealing their own cards in order to most efficiently develop large areas in each of the 4 zone types.

The new concepts here are really cool. Thematically it’s a casino setting with blocks of all of the regular types, Rome, Egypt, and Medieval. The roads have slot machine icons and getting a jackpoint (3+ of an icon in a row) will get you positive points to offset the negative points that roads normally provide. Instead of getting points for your largest group of each block type on the map, now it needs to be your largest block type on the strip, which is your longest road. And finally the card backs have a betting element where you arrange the 3 cards in the order you would like, and they pay off based on how well you performed.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Layering, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: ROVE Jr: Results-Oriented Versatile Explorer
description:
Even the most advanced ROVE bot needs a bit of training before it can tackle a trip to outer space. Practice your skills on this course to see how far you can get!

ROVE Jr. is a standalone entry in the ROVE series. In this solo spatial puzzler, the player must complete missions by using their movement cards to align ROVE’s modules in the proper pattern. Each module has a unique one-time ability that can give ROVE a much-needed boost at a key moment. As ROVE travels further, efficient use of movement points and module abilities becomes paramount to achieve success.

ROVE Jr. provides a more casual, kid-friendly experience than the original game without removing the core elements. Players now have only 4 modules to manage, and each movement card provides unlimited movement in any one direction. Additionally, players always refill their hand at the end of a mission. With these changes as well as variable difficulty options, ROVE Jr. is a great introduction to ROVE while still remaining appealing to existing ROVE fans of all ages who just need a break from the dangers of outer space.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Battlecrest: Deadrock Base Game
description:
Year 3 of Battlecrest will start in late 2024 taking us from the Fellwoods forests and the city of Metronn to a new dusty, desolate, and savage planet named Deadrock. Expect a new map, lots of new heroes, and some new special abilities, pushing the number of unique Battlecrest matches way up there.


What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: A Nice Cuppa
description:
The most relaxing game in the Simply Solo line. You will take the steps to make a cup of tea, but deal with everyday worries along the way.

Try to eliminate worries and enjoy your tea without missing a step along the way.

name: RNSM
description: RNSM is a bit of a press your luck word game where each player will draw and contribute a consonant letter card to a growing word. But it might not be a word at all. When you play a letter it can go anywhere into the line of letters, and as you do so, you’ll think of a word. Players can bluff and players can challenge, so play with confidence (or at least with CNFDNC).

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Expansion Collection III
description:
New skull types for Skulls of Sedlec.


Archers
Farmers
Troubadours
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Ancient Realm: Leaders – Expansion Collection
description:
Ancient Realm: Leaders introduces 18 renowned leaders from major eras in history.


Ancient Realm: Leaders – Set 1
Ancient Realm: Leaders – Set 2
Ancient Realm: Leaders – Set 3
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game

name: Super Slopes: Expansion Collection
description:
Three expansions for Super Slopes.


Super Slopes: Snow Report
Super Slopes: Park Rat
Super Slopes: Black Diamond


The three we’ve been developing are Park Rat, Snow Report and Black Diamond. Park Rat adds a terrain park that you get points for if you follow the right direction as you score. Snow Report adds weather cards to mess with things. And Black Diamond brings cards 19-24 into the draft with a new ability that lets you reserve cards. And if that isn’t enough, Ted has many more in the works.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dwarven Rails
description:
Players compete in a somewhat traditional cube rails game set in a fantasy, steam punk world. In addition to the open information game of a traditional cube rails game, this game includes two modules intended to alter the gameplay significantly. The first module is the Peoples of the Dwarven Kingdom module which adds asymmetrical abilities to every player. The second module is Events. Players can choose to play with neither, one, or both modules for three different types of games.

The game borrows some mechanics and is inspired by Robin David's Luzon Rails, while departing significantly.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Events, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: The Coquette and Her Suitors
description:
Players in the game take the part of one of the title heroine's many suitors. One spins the dial but all advance along individual paths marked with the ups and downs of pursuing a lover. Several clever twists allow for advances or retreats, and the winner is the player who first reaches "Acceptation."

The Coquette or, The History of Eliza Wharton" is an epistolary novel by Hannah Webster Foster, published anonymously in 1797. The novel was one of the best-selling works of its time and it was reprinted eight times between 1824 and 1828. Still, it was not credited to Foster until 16 years after her death in 1856. A story based on real-life events, it involves a single woman who chooses not to marry immediately and is eventually scorned and ruined for her choices. The book was still recognized in 1858, when a Boston publisher brought out a board game loosely based on it.


Description above taken from the Strong Museum of Play website.

name: Scott's Land
description:
Two players compete to bring the most visitors into the theme park while drafting rides, action points, and bonuses. Additional points can be scored for matching riders to their preferred seating placement and gaining Mascot tokens. At the end of the game, players will score for their parks and also for the visitors who stuck around to watch the Fireworks Show.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Grid Coverage, Worker Placement

name: One Finger
description:
In One Finger you must compete to get the most points by typing the color requested by the dice as soon as possible with a single finger.

The objective of the game is to use a single finger and get 10 or more points by typing the colors that appeared on the dice as quickly as possible.

Competitor in “2022 1-Card PnP Design contest”.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Cactus Garden
description:
The story continues from 'Meow! The Cat Cafe'
This game is the second game of 'around the park series' which you act as a staff in cactus garden try to take cactus and item to service the customer by moving your staff token to the row that you can do actions

In a turn you can do 4 action points by doing any these actions
- take a special coin
- Move 1 Space
- Take a Cactus Card in a row
- Complete (Customer) Order or a cat

When the player encounter each other and do action in the same row. that player must pay special coin to that one which make the game must think about worthiness.

The game end when player has 9 Completed order and Cat and then scoring by the point of Set of Customer, The Majority of each type of customer, Mission Card and Cat Card.

-description from designer

name: Das inoffizielle Quiz für Potterheads
description:
The ultimate quiz for all Potterheads!

Become part of the magical universe and feel like a real sorcerer's apprentice in the world's most famous school of magic! Test your magical knowledge with 300 exciting questions and find out if you are a true Potterhead. Work your way through all seven school years alone or together with other sorcerer's apprentices. The practical game templates for the joint quiz are easy to download via QR code. With the magic house test, you can also find out which house the talking hat assigns you to. Are you ready for your test?

300 magical questions in three levels of difficulty: for young sorcerer's apprentices, advanced and professionals
Includes house test, ZAG and UTZ tests
Can be played alone and together
With decoder foil to decode the solutions
Extra: magical templates to download via QR code

Take on the ultimate quiz and puzzle your way through the various levels of difficulty. Take your ZAG and UTZ exams and prove that you are a true wizard! All solutions are encrypted and can only be revealed with the decoder foil. So cheating is out of the question! Magical puzzle fun for Potterheads and all those who want to become one.

—description from the publisher

name: Into the Godsgrave: The Forgotten Song
description:
Experience the other side of the story. Travel to the land of the Triarchy and take on the role of the followers of the Triad, the believers of the new gods. Venture into the unknown in search of lost pieces of an ancient ritual text that can bring a god back to life.

Favor of the Gods Mechanic
The Triad takes great care of their followers, and grants them numerous blessings. Throughout the story, you will be able to manipulate the world using Favor Points, which are a divine reward for those who have proven themselves worthy to the new gods.

Take On the Role of a Mysterious Executor
Explore the world as a Triarchy Executor - a mysterious emissary favored by the Triad. He is the vessel of the new gods, blessed with talents and tasked with goals beyond our understanding.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Into the Godsgrave: The Ultimate Trial
description:
Can You Defeat a Resurrected God?

In this expansion you will face an ancient deity that was killed centuries ago, now brought back to life and filled with hatred towards its former servants - the mortals. But a lot has changed in the intervening centuries, and the so-called “slaves” are ready to make a stand.

You Vs. a Single Monster Game Mode
Challenge yourself and your team to defeat a single enemy in an arena-like game mode. A map will be generated around a “godsgrave” where unimaginable perils await those who would challenge a god.

Free-For-All Gameplay
You will need all the skills you have learned while playing the base game to survive in the free-for-all mode. You will craft your starting deck using all the cards the game provides. There is no time for leveling up; you will need all your energy and focus to find the perfect strategy to defeat the awakened god and prevent the world from the return of divine tyranny.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Into the Godsgrave: Trickster Class Pack
description:
Are game rules not for you? Are luck and deception your main tools of play?

If you choose the Trickster Class, your life motto will be “all or nothing”. During tests, the Trickster bets on the results. If your bets are correct, you will get extra benefits. If not - well, quite the opposite. You will have the means to manipulate the dice to some extent, but how long before your luck runs out?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Into the Godsgrave: Noble Class Pack
description:
Very few mortals possess a relic of the gods, but you are one of them.

That puts you in a unique position - will you use your relic for the greater good, or hide it away from prying eyes? Some Nobles are helpful, while others are as insidious as the old gods used to be.
