The bigger question is, what are you doing with a bunch of swords for hire? What is your true goal?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Sword to Adventure
description:
This is an adaptation of TSATF to cover the various skirmishes and small wars of the early 20th century up through the 1930's. Most forces are armed with bolt action rifles with smokeless powder. Native forces may still be armed with black powder, single shot breech loaders and even muzzle loaders. The fierce native charge may still occur, but machine guns rule the battlefield, and light automatic weapons and grenades are making their appearance. These rules can be easily used for skirmishes as varied as East Africa WWI, RCW, NWF 1919-1938, SCW, China Between the Wars and the Banana Wars, to name a few.

Being an adaptation of Larry Brom's The Sword and The Flame Colonial rules set, for use in more modern times, on many frontiers, from Afghanistan, to Central America. The Jackson Gamers assume that you already know how to play "TSA TF". The charts below are set up as those in the "20th Anniversary Edition" of The Sword and The Flame. A copy of those rules will be necessary as the rules below are in semi-outline form.

—description from the designer

name: MiGs over Merklin
description:
In 1953 the US Air Force went toe-to-toe with the Czechs, resulting in the loss of an F-84E jet. Both sides, predictably, blamed each other and frantic diplomacy sought to cool the ardour of the two air forces.
In this free two-game mini-campaign for Wings at War: MiG Alley, players can recreate the tense engagement over the West German – Czechoslovak border and a hypothetical rematch six months later.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dealership
description: Dealership is a cool fun facts board game for 2 -6 players as you interact with car minded people. Anyone can play from the new driver to the auto expert. Its a game of chance with humor filled obstacles along the way from "The Lot" to the "Winners Circle". Start up your competitive spirit with 500 challenging questions and answers on automotive pop culture, the dealership retail experience, the factory, buying, selling, finance, service, parts, along with the history and future of the car business.

name: Mario Kart Racing Deluxe
description:
An exciting action racing game inspired by the world of Mario Kart!

Use the buttons and levers to maneuver through 6 obstacles and race to the finish line!

Be the first to complete 5 laps and become the winner! Practice your racing skills and compete for the fastest lap!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Racing, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 15
description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine brings you more hard-hitting BattleMech action from the heavy-metal wars of the 31st century and beyond—but don’t let your guard down!

No matter the situation, you can stay out of harm’s way by reviewing a most-wanted list of criminals and assassins, a roster of the Marian Hegemony’s Legion of the Dead, technical readouts, unit and planet digests, playable scenarios, a campaign set in the resource-poor wilds of the Third Succession War, and more—all by battle-hardened BattleTech authors and some new boot-camp graduates.

Giant Double-sized issue!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Holotype: Crurotarsi Mini-Expansion
description:
This is an expansion for Holotype: Mesozoic North America. Game play does not change, but new cards are added to the base game, including:

8 unique Crurotarsi specimen cards
6 new Field Expedition cards
12 new Bone Bed cards
17 new Global Objectives cards - includes new 2-3 player cards
2 new Personal Objectives
1 new Milestone Achievement
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Sheep Shuffle
description:
Sheep Shuffle is a 2-4 player tabletop game about collecting sheep tokens to build up your flock and level up your sheep. Three tiers of sheep are available with increasing ability power: Starter Sheep, Special Sheep, and Shiny Sheep. During your turn, you may do 2 of 3 possible actions, or repeat an action: Blindly draw a starter sheep, breed 2 sheep to increase its sheep tier, or shear the sheep (activating its ability). Higher sheep tiers and sheep levels have better abilities to activate.

There are 3 secret objective card decks: Easy, Medium, and Hard. Each player starts with an Easy objective. Once a player completes their Easy objective, they move onto Medium, then Hard. The first player to complete their Hard objective wins! Objectives vary from leveling up sheep, collecting a variety of sheep colors, or even stealing sheep from other players.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Negotiation, Set Collection, Take That, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Gods of War: Robert E. Lee
description:
Gods of War - Robert E. Lee is a historical wargame set in the time of the American Civil War and the second half of the 19th century. You can play battles from Bull Run to Gettysburg and from Solferino to Sedan. Thanks to our game you will become the commander in chief of an entire huge army. Do you want to equal Robert E. Lee, Ulysses S. Grant, Helmuth von Moltke or Giuseppe Garibaldi? It is possible now!

Forget about the tactics of regiments or individual brigades - you will lead entire corps and divisions. Prepare your battleplan, manage your subordinate generals, and - with a bit of luck - you will win. But be careful - fog of war is extremely important, so you will have to guess your opponent's plans and movements. The fate of the entire country is in your hands. Win and you you will become a real hero, a real strategist, a real commander-in-chief!

Are you ready to command an entire army?

—description from publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Kotobani Naranai Mojiha Iranai Game
description:
Kotobani Naranai Mojiha Iranai Game roughly translates to "I can't put it into words; I don't need letters", and that conveys the essence of the game: Try to avoid taking letters, especially when you can't put them into words.

In the game, each player has a hand of cards and four cards are placed into a column on the table. Each card features a number and one of the 48 characters in the Hiragana syllabary.

On a turn, each player chooses and reveals a card from their hand. In numerical order, each player places their card at the end of any row in which the character on their card comes later in the Hiragana syllabary than the character at the end of the row.

If you can't place your card in any row, then you must take all of the cards in a row, making your played card the first card in a new row. The cards you take are worth negative points equal to the number of red Xs on them — but if you can create a word from some or all of these cards, you discard the used cards instead of placing them in your score pile.

The player with the lowest score at the end of the game wins.

name: Alliance Correspondence: Battle Swayers
description:
Alliance Correspondence: Battle Swayers bears the Japanese title 決戦前の書状 ("Letter Before the Battle"), and by sending letters, you can invite or prevent betrayal to affect the course of battle.

Players are divided into eastern and western armies and aim to win the battle at Sekigahara, a strategic location where the Tokaido and Hokkoku side roads intersect. Each turn, you take three of the six rolled dice, then use their numbers to check your faction sheet and arrange the military commanders.

The game ends when a certain number of military commanders have lined up in their formations, and you earn victory points by comparing the strength values of each area, but you must also send letters in advance and be on the lookout for betrayal by your friends and enemies that can reverse an outcome you thought was certain.

name: Zombie Sniper
description:
In Zombie Sniper / ゾンビスナイパー, a crowd of dead people approach through the fog. You have only five bullets on hand to protect yourself. Will the zombies or humans survive?

In this game, players are divided into zombies and snipers. Each turn, all but one of the zombies approach the sniper. The sniper and the crowd must work together to identify the stationary zombies and shoot them with bullets.

If an advancing zombie reaches the final line, the zombie side wins; if the sniper can defeat three zombies before then, the sniper wins. Unfortunately, some among the crowd might be on the side of the zombies, so as a sniper, you need to think carefully about whose opinion you should listen to before acting. Your last shot can also be fired into the crowd. Will the outcome be tragedy or victory?

name: Ravaged Star
description:
Now that Lord Davicus has led his army back across the Veil, two factions have emerged as threats to Strahk’s plans for the galaxy. The steadfast Immari, dwarves who have survived tragedy without measure, must persevere against insurmountable threats. And the Gorkog, nightmarish monsters whose savage assaults are carried out with cruel precision, return once again from their long slumber. Though no allies to each other, the fate of the galaxy rests with the strengths and whims of these mighty armies.

Ravaged Star is a fast-paced, strategic, science fiction miniatures tabletop wargame. It uses ten sided dice in a system that is meant to be streamlined and quick.


Units have target numbers for attack and defense. Things such as cover and other effects add or subtract from the number needed to be rolled and rolling higher can add extra effects.
A chit pull system is used for activation of units including a number of Boost Tokens for each side that can activate units with extra abilities to be used when boosted.
Miniatures in the line are fully or mostly prebuilt, with some having options for building that require a final push-fit assembly.
Movement is done by measuring and moving the leader of a unit and moving the rest near the leader.


Gameplay is done through scenarios which may have special rules for play and may accommodate 2 players, teams, or 3 players battling it out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Patrix
description:
In Patrix, the aim is to be the first to stack colored rings in a precise order on the last of 4 wooden rods.

Of course, you can only move one ring at a time, and the first to get it right wins the round!

name: 奔跑吧！红细胞 (Run, Red Blood Cells)
description:
Explore the mysteries of the human body with "Run, Red Blood Cells"! This game assists young children in recognizing the structure of the human body. The game board and event cards offer extensive knowledge expansion, helping kids understand their bodies and instill a sense of self-protection from an early age. Learning is seamlessly blended with enjoyment in this accessible and engaging game.

Features:


Simple and easy-to-learn gameplay
Suitable for ages 4 and above
Red Blood Cells move along 5 routes to transport oxygen
Roll the dice to determine the number of steps to move
Victory is achieved by filling specified body parts on your card with nutrients


Game Components:

Game board
Event cards
Dice
Target cards

Gameplay Mechanics:

Players draw a target card and roll the dice to determine movement.
Transport nutrients to the target positions on the card.
The first player to successfully fill all specified body parts wins.

name: ควงพลิ้ว (Kuangpriw)
description:
ควงพลิ้ว ("Meatspin") is the bluffing and negotiation card game. The game show about "Pants Tugging", The great playing and pranking in Thai childhood.

While playing, Each players have to find the pants and don't be ripped off from another players. If you show the "Weenie". You will be eliminate from the round. You have to be the last one for get the Point.

This game contains the "Weenie" "Penis" "Dick" "Cock" and "Meatspin".

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Take That, Voting

name: Kamigami Battles: Rani of Jhansi Promo
description:
Promo # ACFP002

Promo warrior card released for Kamigami Battles: Avatars of Cosmic Fire.

"ACT: Remove 1 Warrior from the current Chain, then add it to the Chain after Rani of Jhansi and use one of its ACT Abilities. You may only use this Ability if the chosen Warrior could be legally played into the Chain."

name: Pitstop
description:
Pitstop is a racing game where you go around the course in one turn.
Earn points by taking the lead or overtaking the car in front of you, and the player with the most points after 20 laps wins.
In order to complete the race, you must replenish your deck by "pitting" in the middle of the game.

—description from the designer

name: Stellar Horizons 2: Galactic Frontier
description:
“The Next Leap Forward!”

Stellar Horizons 2: Galactic Frontier traces humanity’s journey into the galaxy over the coming centuries (2100-2900) by Andrew Rader. Players will control one of seven factions vying to establish an interstellar empire, each with unique advantages, drawbacks, and special abilities. Through competitive and cooperative scenarios and campaigns, each new star brings the discovery of new planet types, and new opportunities for settlement, trade, or conquest. Along the way, you’ll develop technologies and customize your ships, building a faster, stronger, and more capable starfaring fleet.

Will you focus on science vessels to probe the secrets of distant systems, mining ships to exploit their riches, or combat ships to claim them as your own? The choice is yours. Meanwhile, you’ll deploy genetic manipulations to enhance your species’ size, strength, survivability, and intelligence, or even guide its transformation into a different kind of species better suited to subterranean, aquatic, desert, low gravity, or gaseous worlds.

Product Information:
Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: 1 year/turn
Map Scale: The Solar System
Unit Scale: Manned and Robotic Starships
Players: 1 to 7
Solitaire Suitability: MEDIUM
Playing Time: 20-90 minutes for Scenarios, 6+ hours for Campaign
Campaign & Scenarios can be played competitively and cooperatively
Designer: Andrew Rader
Graphic Design: Andrew Rader

Game Components:
6 Punchboards containing 118 Ship/Vehicle Playing Pieces & over 1,100 Markers
8 Star Sector Tiles
7 Player Factions
1 Technology Tree
70 Fleet Improvement & Genetic Manipulation Cards
$1B, $5B, $10B & $20B paper money denominations
Box and Lid set

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Jonatán szállít
description:
The popular book series "Wheel Tales" is known to many and is a favorite of many young children, as the wonderful world of Anna Mechler has been expanded with countless vehicles, and almost every character has a small story attached to it.

The board game Jonatán delivers is based on the fairy tale series. In this exciting game, children can meet Jonathan the truck and his friends, who have been given an urgent delivery order. The goods are eagerly awaited in stores, so players should try. Whoever gets there first with the vehicle wins. But just be careful with your speeding, because sometimes an ambulance or a tow truck blocks the way.

name: O Dia da Caça
description:
Survive the Night or Become the Shadow.

A city is being terrorized by a monstrous threat that attacks, kills, and, worse, infects its citizens, turning them into grotesque beings.
A traditional family of extraordinary hunters arrives on the scene to try to stop the menace. They can only rely on each other and a small arsenal of special items to save the inhabitants before the day ends and it's too late.
A monstrous challenge for these supernatural hunters that can easily turn into a dog's day.
O Dia da Caça takes players into an epic confrontation between hunters and monsters, with strategic mechanics and unpredictable twists. Choose your fate, fight for survival, or plunge into the darkness as the monster haunting the city.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Role Order, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Wage Workers PAX UNPLUGGED 2023 Promo Card (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
description:
The Wage Workers is a promo card for Null Signal Games (NISEI) fan expansion for Android: Netrunner.

It is a Corporation card for the Haas-Bioroid (HB) megacorporation of type Asset. It has a install cost of 2 and a trash value of 4.

Available to any attendees who stopped by the Null Signal Games booth at PAX UNPLUGGED 2023 in Philadelphia, PA. There were 3 copies of the card given out to each visitor to the booth.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Race, Secret Unit Deployment, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Stringamajig: Promo Pack
description:
This pack contains 6 promo cards with 4 brand new words to draw on each card. That’s 24 new possible ways to make your friends look ridiculous! Each card includes a Challenge Word like the rest of the cards in the game, so get ready for even more 2-Player, Forbidden Word, and Don’t Look challenges as well. These promo cards all feature gaming-themed words to tickle your funny bone while they up the challenge.

The backs of these promo cards feature all four numbers (1,2,3,4) so when they are revealed as the top card of your deck they will allow you to choose any word from your current card.

This item contains six (6) promo cards in a zip-lock bag.

—description from the publisher

name: Essence of Eternity
description: Choose your avatar, and race to find the Essence of Eternity, the secret to eternal life. Journey through the forest wilderness and majestic mountains before risking the perils of the underworld realm to find the precious runes needed to become immortal. Battle fearsome monsters and cast powerful spells. But beware! Your opponents have powers and control monsters of their own. Are you cunning enough to outwit them? Immortality is within your grasp, but at what cost? A very uncooperative fantasy card game for 2-6 players.

name: Boardgame: The Card Game!
description:
Game box comes with instructions booklet and a set of 204 cards. Designed for up to 4 players. Game matches range from 20 minutes to 60 minutes.

The goal of the game is to build your own game board, and the first player to complete their game board, wins! Players do this by taking turns drawing Dice cards and playing them along with Assist cards. Assist cards range from as simple as adding +2 to your "roll" to as strategic as making an opponent go back the number you "rolled" instead of you going forward on your turn. Once the player has "rolled" their dice, they draw that number of Tile cards and lay them out in front of them in a grid pattern. Tile cards are square cards that resemble the spaces of a board game. Your goal is to build a 5x5 grid with Tiles. If you are the first to do this, you win!

Tiles come in three colors: Blue, Green, and Red. The last Tile you draw and place on your turn, adding it to your board, is considered the space you've "landed" on. Blue Tiles don't do anything, they are a neutral space to land on. Green and Red Tiles, when landed on, result in that player drawing a Good or Bad card. As the names suggest, Good cards help you while Bad cards hurt you. Think of them like the chance cards in traditional board games. If a player is made to move backwards, they'll discard the most recently placed Tiles on their board to represent them moving back, and when they go forward again on their next turn, it'll be all new Tile cards they'll draw, permanently changing their board from what it once was, creating endless replayability. Every time you play, it'll be a different board you're playing on and the board will constantly be changing while you play.

With over 20 unique ability cards, some powerful enough to knock the leader down to last place or position the player in the back of the pack for a quick victory, it's anyone's game until the very last second.

name: Busanga
description: This tactical family game takes you into the African savannahs to save 8 endangered animal species. Players take on the role of Maasai guides. They must each choose two animal species and lead them to parks where they will be protected. Tourists and poachers can sometimes interfere with their movements, but a few watering holes will make it easier for the guides to lead them to havens where they can reproduce.

name: Merry Christmas, Mr Sankara
description:
On Christmas Day, 1985, Mali invaded Burkina Faso over a dispute in the contested Agacher Strip. In what became known as the Agacher Strip War, two of the poorest nations on earth fought over a strip of the southern Sahara. Air operations featured prominently, but there were no air-to-air combats. By the time of the Agacher Strip War, Burkina Faso had just one MiG-17, but until a few months before the Force Aérienne de Burkina Faso (FABF) had a force of eight Libyan supplied and manned MiG-21s. Merry Christmas, Mr Sankara imagines if these had still be available during the conflict.

Merry Christmas, Mr Sankara has a background of the war and the forces involved, a full campaign system, maps and a painting guide. Players have to balance offensive and defensive operations, keep an eye on public and world opinion and avoid attrition that they can ill afford.

In a short war players will use Soviet Cold War era jets – MiG-17s and MiG-21s – for air strikes, ground attack, escort and fighter missions and Mi-4 helicopters to transport troops. In the vastness of the Sahara players will need to form a strategy to seize key road junctions. For the Burkinabe player it will be a tough proposition; the Malian forces are more numerous but the Libyan pilots are more experienced.

The campaign should provide between 5 and 8 tactical games. Though designed with Wings at War: Thud Ridge in mind, it can be used with your favourite jet-age rules.

—description from the publisher

name: Tel est pris
description:
The box actually contains "Tel est pris" and "Le Joker baladeur".

The former is a a checkers game in which you have to capture your opponent's letters in order to be the first to form a five-letter word.

In the second, a piece moves across the board, where the pieces have been placed face-up. Staying on the same row or column, the joker picks up the flipped pieces and brings them back to the player, who assembles them into a crossword puzzle.

name: Rada: A Cossack Council
description: Welcome to the world of ancient Cossack democracy! Immerse yourself in the rich history and vibrant culture of the Cossacks with Rada: A Cossack Council, a quick and engaging card game designed for 3 to 6 players. Experience the thrill of vying for the prestigious Hetman title in the Cossack army. Will you emerge victorious as the supreme leader, or will your rivals outmaneuver you in the quest for power?

name: Pass doch auf!
description:
The players take turns to roll and move all their pieces. Each has cars and trucks, which have to accomplish certain tasks to record on the control board. While moving the players have to mind the traffic rules. The first player to fulfill all tasks and returns all his cars and trucks to their starting space wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 9th Circle: Pendulum Promo Tile
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign.

One of the 8th Circle Realms.

Power:
⛧ (Favor) times, each in a different Realm:
Take one Minion belonging to each Player present in that Realm. Mix them up in one hand then blindly choose one to be Destroyed. Return the others to that Realm.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hidden Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Exploit Zero: Snitches, Glitches, and DAF Augs
description:
Snitches, Glitches, and DAF Augs is a supplement for the solo/cooperative game, Exploit Zero, Cyberpunk Espionage and Mayhem. You need that core rulebook to get the most out of this material. This is not a stand-alone game.

Inside, you'll find mission prompts, tables for generating back stories, ways to add complications to your cyberpunk dark ops, and most of all, new, bleeding edge cyber-limbs for your Agents to field test on the table top.

Of course none of this is so proprietary you can't tweak it and slot it into your favorite mirror shade future. After all, the dark chrome heart of cyberpunk is open source.

Just remember that mega-corps don't do sympathy and they definitely don't tolerate failure; you're deniable, so don't expect backup if your shiny new black market gear locks up in the middle of a mission.

Which it might.

Good luck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Catharsis Sagas: Chapter 4 – Dread
description:
Catharsis Sagas are true solo game boxes that include one character & one boss. If you own the base game, the boss plays up to five players. The game requires strategy, cooperation, and a touch of luck to succeed as the party fights through traps, monsters, and more. You will hunt down the boss while going through an epic narrative. Roll your dice to activate your powers, but be warned, your powers are also your health. You must carefully decide when it's wise to activate a power and how to resolve damage. Spend your morale wisely, or else you and your party will fall to the corruption of Verity.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dominots: Peanuts
description: Similar to dominoes with a few twists. There are 92 tiles, each with 3 images in a combination from among 6 characters (themes are SpongeBob, Peanuts, or Space Invaders). In the center of the table, 3 tiles are placed to form a square. You are given a hand of 3 tiles. On your turn you may either place a tile so at least one character matches an adjacent one, or stack a tile fully on top of an existing one. Score 1 point for each match to your newly placed tile or 2 points for each matching overlapping character. Play until a player has 25 or 50 points, or until the tile stack is depleted.

name: Leap of Faith
description:
Leap of Faith is a 2-player cooperative card game. Without having information about the partner's hand, players cooperate to achieve the highest total score possible after the game is finished. It consists of 3 rounds, each of which is again divided into 2 phases - declaration phase and realization phase. In the declaration phase, players take turns playing one of the cards from one's hand to set the 'goal' for the round. In the realization phase, players again take turns playing one card at a time to get as close as possible to the declared goal number. The score for the round is the number of cards used for declaration minus the gap between the goal number and the realized number.

—description from the publisher

name: Роботех (Robotech)
description:
Роботех ("Robotech") was Tehnolog's 2003 release for a science-fiction miniatures-based combat game based on robots.

The game mechanics involve fights between piloted and robotic machines. The rules of the game were typical of many other miniatures games, with movement and range done by measuring distances, and results rolled for by dice.

The rulebook included many different chassis, each with different pros and cons to them. Weapons were placed on the machines but were limited to the weight capacity of the chassis.

Robots were divided into heavy and light. Robots had the ability to ram, jump, crouch, fight in hand-to-hand combat, and shoot. During the course of the battle their ammunition could run out or their weapons could be destroyed.

The size of the armies varied in size from 3-5 vehicles per side.

The game did not last long, and was phased out by 2006, taking on the form of Robogear.

—user summary

name: 戦車撃破章 (Tank Destruction Badge)
description:
The "Tank destruction badge" is awarded to infantrymen who destroy a tank with a weapon they can carry.
Players carry "empty cans," "rifles," "grenades" and "Panzerfausts" to attack enemy tanks ranging from "Type 97 Medium Tank" to "Tiger I" tanks.

If the armor value of the enemy tank and the attack power of the carried weapons are equal or more, the enemy tank will be destroyed.

To prevent other players from taking the battle results, you can play a card that is actually different from the card you declare to use. Players can play different cards from the ones they declare to be used in order to prevent other players from taking their tanks.

Each player is given an order card, and if he or she achieves the order, he or she will receive a bonus.

The player who destroys the most targets wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, World War II

name: Energiewendespiel
description: The game starts with a collective energy consumption of 500 units and a collective generation of energy of 200 units. On your turn, move your pawn on a map showing districts of Baden-Württemberg to another district according to the roll of the die. You may either build a power plant or place a detective looking for energy thieves there. Then you roll another die determining if you have to draw a question or an event card. You get income from your power plants at the end of your turn. Each power plant rises the generation of energy each turn. A detective reduces the energy consumption. At the end of each 5th round, all players must pay for the difference of consumption and generation. The game ends if consumption is not higher than generation anymore. The player with the most money wins. If this is not the case at the end of the 30th round, all players lose.
mechanics: Events, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Ministerium für Umwelt, Klima und Energiewirtschaft Baden-Württemberg

name: Chyťte Bureše!
description:
This satirical game was inspired by the former Czech prime minister, Andrej Babiš, who was very controversial and got involved in many questionable adventures, often resulting in police investigations and corruption accusations. 'Bureš' is the codename he assumed when he collaborated with the former communist secret police.

Bureš is an "honest" politician who "occasionally" slips. Your goal is to gather as much evidence as you can and get him behind bars. However, Bureš is fully aware that you're after him and will do all he can to thwart your efforts. Moreover, you're not the only one trying to get him.

name: Une histoire extraordinaire
description:
Une Histoire Extraordinaire is a hilarious family game, combining aspects of memorization, observation and cooperation. A game that can help younger children with reading and grammatical construction, but which is above all a fun, atmospheric game for all ages.

Players take it in turns to play cards (noun, adjective or verb) that will make up the story to be told. Before laying down the card that will continue the story, the active player must, from memory, tell the whole story from the beginning. The other players can help, but only by miming. If he makes a mistake in the word order, the game ends immediately. The aim is to lay down as many cards as possible.

name: Sardines
description:
It's eat-or-be-eaten in this twist on Go Fish. Cast your line, reel in your catch, but beware -- reel in a sardine, and you'll be sorry! Outbluff your opponents to score the biggest catch!

In this twist on a childhood classic, you'll play Go Fish as usual. However, when giving cards to other players, you do so face-down. They must then decide whether you're being honest or bluffing -- a decision that will end with either their reward or ruin.

—description from the designer

name: Skim Waves
description:
Who is the best skimboarder? Take beach waves anywhere and see who can catch the coolest tube ever in Skim Waves!

Setup: with the measure of three boards (Card in Vertical), make a wave tubular with a hand or object.

Game: Players try to slide inside the tube. Who doesn't passing through the wave is eliminated. If more than one player passes by the wave, make a new wave with three more boards away.

Winner: The player who catch the farthest wave alone.

Solo mode: Record video of your furthest wave

—description from the publisher

name: DRA&B: Devils, Robots, Aliens & Beasts
description:
DRA&B:Devils, Robots, Aliens & Beasts is a strategic card game where four realms clash in an epic showdown. As a commander, your task is to assemble an army of five mercenaries. The game, designed for 2-5 players, unfolds in quick 15-minute battles.

Each player draws cards from a shared 60 cards deck, strategically offers cards to opponents, and - at the end - reveals their creatures. Achieve the highest score to triumph!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, I Cut, You Choose, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Битвы Fantasy: Битва за маяк (Battle for the Lighthouse)
description:
This is an introductory action game to the Fantasy Battles system. The system uses actual firing devices, similar to Crossbows and Catapults.

Players roll a die for actions and use them to either move pieces or fire. Any soldier that is knocked down is eliminated from the game. Players can also move their soldiers into contact with the enemy and fight melees. Players can also use magic cards to assist them.

The attacker can win by capturing the enemy's flag or by eliminating all soldiers. To prevent this, the defender must eliminate all the attacking soldiers.

The game comes with:

Company "Asteriscus" - 5 figures
Squad "Konung" - 5 figures
Gang "Grobag" - 5 figures
Brigade "Gulrog" - 4 figures
Assembled figure "Dragon" - 1 piece
Modular construction set - more than 100 parts
Heavy catapult "Porcupine" - 2 pieces
Assault gun "Hammer" - 2 pieces
Rules of the game "Ultra" - 1 piece
Magic cards "Ultra" - 25 pieces
Army lists - 4 pieces Artifact
Map - 4 pieces
Dice - 1 Piece
Painting Guide - 1 Piece


The game can be further expanded by adding other boxed sets and blister packs of figures.
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Битвы Fantasy: Бастион в осаде (Bastion Under Siege)
description:
This is an introductory action game to the Fantasy Battles system. The system uses actual firing devices, similar to Crossbows and Catapults.

Players roll a die for actions and use them to either move pieces or fire. Any soldier that is knocked down is eliminated from the game. Players can also move their soldiers into contact with the enemy and fight melees. Players can also use magic cards to assist them.

The attacker can win by capturing the enemy's flag or by eliminating all soldiers. To prevent this, the defender must eliminate all the attacking soldiers.

The game comes with:

Magnum Legion - 5 figures
Typhoon Legion - 6 figures
Throwing Machine "Bug" with a set of shells - 1 model
Siege Gun "Thunder" with a set of shells - 1 model
Rocket mortar "Grad" with a set of shells - 1 model
Light cannon "Bulldog" with a set of shells - 1 model
Modular constructor for assembling fortifications - more than 50 parts
Rules of the game "Ultra" - 1 pcs
Magic Cards "Ultra" - 25 pcs.
Army lists - 2 pcs
Artifact Cards - 2 pcs
Painting Instructions - 1 pc
Dice - 1 pc.


The game can be further expanded by adding more armies to the game. There are more than two dozen additional forces that can be added, as well as other boxed sets.
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Chronos' eye
description:
Players becomes a thief and play1 card from your hand per 1 round at the same time.
When thief plays the card of the “same number” or “same color” with Phantom thief, he/she can steal the gem from Phantom thief.
If you steal or save the gem at the end of the game, you will be the winner!
However, in the middle of the game, Phantom thief play the card to the Notice and save the gem, Phantom thief becomes the winner too. Let’s try to steal or save the gem and be the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: ツブシアイ (Tsubushiai)
description:
Tsubushiai is abstract game like death game.
You are aim to win the game to “escape to exit” or “make opponent immobile” or “squash opponent”.

On your turn, You do the two steps in sequence.
●“Move the your Pawn”
You can move your Pawn anywhere vertically and horizontally as long as there are no walls, cubes, or opponents.
You can escape to your exit is win before you move cubes.

●“Move the Cube”
On your turn, you must move the cube.
“Moving” the Cube means “pushing” or “pulling” a cube that is horizontally or vertically adjacent to your Pawn.
In this step, you win by either immobilizing or squashing opponent.

—description from the publisher

name: Superclub: LaLiga expansion 2023/24
description:
Scout, sign, train and manage 240 real LaLiga players. That’s 12 players from each club

Player names, images, star ratings and club crest on all player cards

Strategize your tactics with the new attacking midfielder and defensive midfielder player categories

Use the new La Liga draft board by itself or together with the Superclub components you know and love

Compatible with all other game products from the Superclub universe
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Income, Investment, Open Drafting, Ownership, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: MauMau Turbo
description:
Reaction game: the well-known card game in the Turbo version is together with the Alexa playbar or as well as independent.

Run: the cards are distributed and you are ready to go! The cards fly over the table: who first gets rid of all the cards have chances of victory.

Obstacle: but it must be careful to take care of who's not well during the game, must start again from the front.

Program: for this game requires an Alexa enabled device; the Skill is available to download from the Amazon Skill Store

Versatile games: the Noris brand develops games with fun for the whole family; age-appropriate skills are encouraged.

name: Brain Ache
description:
Brain Ache is the game where you race to identify familiar catchphrases or words represented by perplexing pictures.

Can you guess which sayings the pictures on the cards represent?

Quickest to guess wins the card so think fast and shout out the answer before anyone else. Brain Ache contains hundreds of picture puzzles that will baffle and boggle your brain.

—description from the publisher

name: Star Navy
description:
Star Navy is new solitaire game set amidst the boundless expanse of space in a distant future. Assume the commanding role of a Space Destroyer alongside its fleet of agile fighters, embarking on a series of ten diverse missions that span the spectrum of interstellar conflict. Engage in open battles, navigate critical escort duties, and strategize during intricate blockade operations. Your decisions will shape the outcome of these high-stakes missions, each offering unique challenges and requiring astute tactical prowess.

The missions are playable either as standalone challenges or as integral segments of a campaign game, that will add a strategic level to game with the introduction of maintenance duties and opportunities for ship upgrades, with an increasing level of difficulty of the missions.

In order to play the game you only need to print the Mission Maps and use some colored dice: for a more immersive game a full set of counters is also included.

—description from the designer

name: Strike, Spare, or Split
description:
How many strikes can you throw in ten frames? Can you pick up a spare? Avoid a split? Find out in this three-card nanogame of dexterity and planning that simulates a full game of bowling in under 20 minutes. Test your eyes, curse your hands, and leave the lane open for better options as you bowl your way to a high score in Strike, Spare, or Split!

In this "place-and-write" game, one player bowls ten frames, creating a path down the lane by placing one card on top of another. This path will cross a variety of icons, which can sometimes help the player, giving them upgrades and abilities, but may also cause trouble, forcing them into the gutter! While the icons are marked off with a pencil, the game continues to evolve until the 10th frame is complete!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Relative Movement, Simulation

name: 3Motion
description:
3Motion features eighteen pieces in three different shapes and colors. Your goal is to move three pieces of the same color or shape into one of the 2x2 marked squares on the game board inside of the box bottom.

When you move, however, you can't move a figure of the same color or shape as the one moved by your opponent on the previous turn.

name: Requiem
description:
Requiem takes place on Earth but this version of Earth is much different from the world you know today. About 100 years have passed since "The Event" happened and the effects of that calamity have begun to surface all over the globe. Creatures have mutated, weather patterns are different, the physical make up of the environment has fundamentally changed. Lush green forests have become lush purple forests. Mushrooms that grew a few inches tall now grow dozens of feet tall. The shell of "what was" is still here; buildings still stand but most are crumbling and overgrown. Large cities are more like literal concrete jungles at this point. It is essentially a new world. This radical change has caused the recovery of humanity to stifle and it seems fairly obvious that things will never quite return to the way they were. In spite of these setbacks, humanity has made some progress.

Accompanied by their warband, the player is out to seek their fortune in the wastelands, playing through adventures and encountering all the wild environments, creatures, and characters that await them.

Summary of mechanics...

Solo-play, skirmish level miniatures game, played in a narrative style
Miniatures agnostic...use whatever figures you like
D6 based, no other dice required
Charts for various outcomes
Simple stats and stat tests to accomplish tasks
Rules are easy to learn and don't get in the way of the story
Character advancement with skills and mutations
Settlement mode, your in charge now
Includes intro adventure "Wide Open"

—description from the publisher

name: Claw Machine
description:
The stuffed animal machines are a hit! The residents of the neighborhood want to show that they are the best by capturing the most beautiful collections of stuffed animals.

On your turn, you must manipulate the stuffed animal machine to obtain the best specimens and, in the process, make the work of the rest of the participants difficult. You must carefully spend and reload your arrows to move the machine's claw. In their turn, each participant will get more stuffed animals from the machine to their collection, which will give them points in various ways at the end of the game.

name: Bellum Fabulis
description:
2039, a grieved father tries to resurrect his daughter after finding a mysterious book talking about the powers of a strange kind of crystal. His attempt turns into a disaster, not only does he not resurrect his daughter but also he ends up unleashing thousands of spirits of fabled warriors and warlords into the world.

The earth becomes unrecognizable, factions form, and wars rage on!
Legends say Are, the god of war is behind this disaster, and delights himself at the sight of the best warriors in history clashing swords for what seems like eternity!

The goal of the game is to defeat the opposing factions by, capturing their castles. This is done by placing workers, gathering resources, placing warriors, developing new technologies, and using the spirits of some of the most famous warriors in history to your advantage.

Players move their pawns similar to chess, defeating an enemy pawn is a simple matter of placing yours on top of it. Unlike chess, if you lose a pawn you can always purchase it later, provided you have the resources necessary. Making resource management an important part of your strategy.

There are three different types of pawns (the hero, warriors, and workers) each pawn has its own particularities.

You can also build walls to defend your castles, or to attack strategically!

Some luck is also required as in order to use the spirits of famous warriors, you have to roll a die.

Multiple game modes are available, making the game very replayable!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Moving Multiple Units, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Iron Coffins: North Sea Expansion
description:
Iron Coffins: North Sea Expansion is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the German Kriegsmarine U-boat war against Allied shipping in the North Sea during World War II.

As the captain of a Type II 'duck' U-boat during 1939-1940, your ultimate goal is to locate and sink as many enemy Allied ships as possible, while at the same time bringing your U-boat and crew safely back to base after each patrol. It won’t be easy due to persistent enemy aircraft and escorts continuously hunting your U-boat, but the German people are depending on you. Don’t let the Fatherland down!

The game includes the following components:

1 Tables Book (12 pages)
1 Tables Book Cover Page
3 Game Mats (A4 / 8.5 x 11)
10 5/8 inch (16mm) counters
1 Warship Status Sheet



Two D10, one D12, and one D20 dice are required to play.
5 minute game setup and breakdown times.
A medium size table is recommended for game setup.



Total play time to complete a full campaign takes approximately 3-4 hours, with a typical patrol averaging 30 minutes.



Adjustable starting difficulty based on player's skill level.


With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with water depth rules, compressed air rules, oxygen rules, flood damage control rules, silent running rules, numerous crew skills, weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, Iron Coffins: North Sea Expansion offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you ready to serve the Fatherland and defend Germany against the onslaught of Allied shipping?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Iron Coffins: North Atlantic (Type IX) Expansion
description:
Iron Coffins: North Atlantic (Type IX) Expansion is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the German Kriegsmarine U-boat war against Allied shipping in the North Atlantic during World War II.

As the captain of a Type IX U-boat during 1940-1943, your ultimate goal is to locate and sink as many enemy Allied ships as possible, while at the same time bringing your U-boat and crew safely back to base after each patrol. It won’t be easy due to persistent enemy aircraft and escorts continuously hunting your U-boat, but the German people are depending on you. Don’t let the Fatherland down!

The game includes the following components:

1 Tables Book (12 pages)
1 Tables Book Cover Page
1 Game Mat (A4 / 8.5 x 11)
10 5/8 inch (16mm) counters



Two D10, one D12, and one D20 dice are required to play.
5 minute game setup and breakdown times.
A medium size table is recommended for game setup.



Total play time to complete a full campaign takes approximately 3-4 hours, with a typical patrol averaging 30 minutes.



Adjustable starting difficulty based on player's skill level.


With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with water depth rules, compressed air rules, oxygen rules, flood damage control rules, silent running rules, numerous crew skills, weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, Iron Coffins: North Atlantic (Type IX) Expansion offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you ready to serve the Fatherland and defend Germany against the onslaught of Allied shipping?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Iron Coffins: British Isles Expansion
description:
Iron Coffins: British Isles Expansion is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the German Kriegsmarine U-boat war against Allied shipping in the British Isles during World War II.

As the captain of a Type VII U-boat during 1939-1940, your ultimate goal is to locate and sink as many enemy Allied ships as possible, while at the same time bringing your U-boat and crew safely back to base after each patrol. It won’t be easy due to persistent enemy aircraft and escorts continuously hunting your U-boat, but the German people are depending on you. Don’t let the Fatherland down!

The game includes the following components:

1 Tables Book (12 pages)
1 Tables Book Cover Page
2 Game Mats (A4 / 8.5 x 11)
8 5/8 inch (16mm) counters
1 Warship Status Sheet



Two D10, one D12, and one D20 dice are required to play.
5 minute game setup and breakdown times.
A medium size table is recommended for game setup.



Total play time to complete a full campaign takes approximately 3-4 hours, with a typical patrol averaging 30 minutes.



Adjustable starting difficulty based on player's skill level.


With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with water depth rules, compressed air rules, oxygen rules, flood damage control rules, silent running rules, numerous crew skills, weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, Iron Coffins: British Isles Expansion offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you ready to serve the Fatherland and defend Germany against the onslaught of Allied shipping?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Iron Coffins: Caribbean / West Africa Expansion
description:
Iron Coffins: Caribbean / West Africa Expansion is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the German Kriegsmarine U-boat war against Allied shipping in the Caribbean and West Africa areas during World War II.

As the captain of a Type IX U-boat during 1941-1943, your ultimate goal is to locate and sink as many enemy Allied ships as possible, while at the same time bringing your U-boat and crew safely back to base after each patrol. It won’t be easy due to persistent enemy aircraft and escorts continuously hunting your U-boat, but the German people are depending on you. Don’t let the Fatherland down!

The game includes the following components:

1 Tables Book (12 pages)
1 Tables Book Cover Page
1 Game Mat (A4 / 8.5 x 11)



Two D10, one D12, and one D20 dice are required to play.
5 minute game setup and breakdown times.
A medium size table is recommended for game setup.



Total play time to complete a full campaign takes approximately 6-8 hours, with a typical patrol averaging 30 minutes.



Adjustable starting difficulty based on player's skill level.


With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with water depth rules, compressed air rules, oxygen rules, flood damage control rules, silent running rules, numerous crew skills, weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, Iron Coffins: Caribbean / West Africa Expansion offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you ready to serve the Fatherland and defend Germany against the onslaught of Allied shipping?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Nightmare Quest
description:
In the terrible and voracious depths of the Gnarlwood, warbands battle over ancient Realmshaper Engines – strange stone ziggurats that imbue the forest with cosmic energies. To meddle with these arcane constructs could unleash catastrophe far beyond the Ravening Ruin, but the deranged ghouls of the Royal Beastflayers believe they are on a quest to save the realm, and will devour anyone who stands in their way. It falls to the heroic Questor Soulsworn – itinerant champions of the Stormcast Eternals, guided by visions and prophecies – to defend the Seraphon relics from those who would defile them.

Warcry: Nightmare Quest brings two new warbands into the Gnarlwood – the elite Stormcast Eternals bound to the Questor Soulsworn, and the ghoulish Royal Beastflayers of the Flesh-eater Courts. The boxed set also includes a ruined and overgrown Realmshaper Engine with a host of modular Gnarlwood terrain, a double-sided game board, a book with background information, incredible artwork, and the rules for both warbands and the included terrain, plus a set of battleplan and warband cards to keep your games running smoothly.

This boxed set contains:
– 64-page softcover Warband Tome: Might and Madness – with background, artwork, rules, quests, and campaigns for both of the two warbands in the box

– Questor Soulsworn – 6 elite Stormcast Eternals, each a wandering hero brought together by fate. These multipart plastic miniatures include 6x Errant-Questors armed with a variety of weapons – two models in this versatile kit can alternatively be built as Questor Primes, and two can alternatively be built as Knight-Relictors

– Royal Beastflayers – 10 deluded cannibal ghouls who act as hunting hounds and gamekeepers for their vampiric monarchs. These multipart plastic miniatures include 1x Royal Flaymaster, 1x Beastflayer Baron, and 3x Gore-Squires with a variety of cosmetic options, as well as 2x Offal Hounds and 3x Ghoul Trackers

– Gnarlwood Scenery – 10 pieces of plastic terrain, fully compatible with existing Gnarlwood scenery kits, including 1x Realmshaper Engine, 2x Gnarloaks, 2x Rope Bridges, and 5x Obstacles such as shattered ruins, palisades, bones, and broken posts

– A double-sided 22" x 30" folding gaming board, depicting two perilous jungle floors

– 30x battleplan cards, including 12x terrain cards, 6x deployment cards, 6x victory cards, and 6x twist cards

– 17x warband cards, including 2x ability cards, 3x divider cards, 7x fighter cards for the Questor Soulsworn, and 5x fighter cards for the Royal Beastflayers

name: Figgie
description:
Figgie is a card game that was invented [by professional traders] at Jane Street in 2013. It was designed to simulate open-outcry commodities trading. Most of the skill in Figgie is in negotiating trades that benefit both the buyer and seller. Like in poker, your objective in Figgie is to make money over a series of hands.

—description from the publisher

Figgie is a turn-less, timed game of simultaneous action. Players call out offers to buy or sell and accept offers from others as they choose in an attempt to collect the most valuable cards. Chips are exchanged for cards to settle the action.

Figgie is played with a 40-card deck of four suits in an unequal distribution of 12, 10, 10, and 8 cards. An unusual feature is that the suit for each count in the distribution is unknown to players when a round begins. (In a face-to-face setting, this is managed with one or more prepared decks.) Figuring out the distribution is key, because the 12-card suit determines the payout at the end of each round.

—user summary

name: She Loves Me (Not)
description:
The theme of the game is dating based around the classic daisy picking game "She Loves Me, She Loves Me Not."

Player’s compete by creating pick-up and break-up lines for different characters. The player with the best line wins!
The Judge draws a Petal Card from the Game Board. The Judge reads the character on the Petal Card aloud.

Each player writes their best pick-up or break-up line on their Dry-Erase Board based on the character on the Petal Card. For example, if “Doctor,” is the character drawn from the Game Board and it is a whole heart, players will create a pick-up to use on the Doctor.

After all of the Dry-Erase Boards are in front of the Judge, the Judge shuffles them before reading each response out loud. The Judge picks their favorite line and gives the winning player the card. Once all Petal Cards have been selected, the winner of the game is the player who has the most cards!

—description from the publisher

name: Treasure Ten
description:
In a land where many treasures are hidden There is a legend that has been passed down among pirates. Who can possess the treasures of the four realms? Get the most value of your treasure That person will be the king of all pirates. You are a pirate who wants to be number one in this land. But where you can find treasure It is necessary to gather people in the area. To help find treasure But gathering people isn't just about gathering a lot of people. But because of the small boat used to find treasure There can only be 10 people per boat, so you have to manage people just right. and gathering people of the same kind It makes the results even better.

Game Goal
Players collect Crew Cards to exchange for Small Ship Tokens, which are used to redeem Treasure Cards in the Skull Island area. Players can exchange small ship tokens only if the sum of their crew cards is divisible by 10, such as 10, 20, 30. The value of each treasure is based on the points of the area that the treasure hints and the location hint that the treasure cards match. Players can view or switch hints. to create an advantage for yourself. The player with the highest total treasure value wins.

name: The Last Stand
description:
The Last Stand is a competitive survival game set in a post-apocalyptic world where you find undead enemies, and you are set to achieve your survival by arriving to the last known shelter, named “The Last Stand”; however it is not an easy task, as shelter´s managers care a lot about the sustainability of their site, and have some requisites to allow any foreigner to enter:

IF players manage to find “The Last Stand”, to be accepted they need to also have achieved at least 10 Victory points, the first player to achieve it is the winner and the game ends; as alternative game ending conditions, if all hex tiles are revealed (with or without the shelter found), the game immediately ends and the player with the most VP wins the game. Or, if a player is out of luck and fail to survive, they become a very thinky undead enemy, when half of the players (rounded up) become undead, game ends, and the one alive with most VP wins.

The game’s board is constructed by hex tiles, which can be set in any desired configuration face down, the players start at a marked location with a basic weapon (setup changes with the difficulty chosen) and each turn they explore the world, with any new found location many things can happen, such as finding enemies, valuable resources, and some other surprises. Characters have asymmetric abilities and all weapons have different specs.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Movement Points, Pieces as Map, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Битвы Fantasy: Битва за редут (Battle for the Redoubt)
description:
This is an introductory action game to the Fantasy Battles system. The system uses actual firing devices, similar to Crossbows and Catapults.

Players roll a die for actions and use them to either move pieces or fire. Any soldier that is knocked down is eliminated from the game. Players can also move their soldiers into contact with the enemy and fight melees. Players can also use magic cards to assist them.

The attacker can win by capturing the enemy's flag or by eliminating all soldiers. To prevent this, the defender must eliminate all the attacking soldiers.

The game comes with:

two teams of 5 soldiers each
Throwing Machine with a set of shells - 1 model
Ballista with a set of shells - 1 model
Crossbow with a set of shells - 1 model
Light cannon "Bulldog" with a set of shells - 1 model
Modular constructor for assembling fortifications - more than 50 parts
Rules of the game "Ultra" - 1 pcs
Magic Cards "Ultra" - 25 pcs.
Army lists - 2 pcs
Artifact Cards - 2 pcs
Painting Instructions - 1 pc
Dice - 1 pc.


The game can be further expanded by adding more armies to the game. There are more than two dozen additional forces that can be added, as well as other boxed sets.

name: Story Time Backgammon
description:
Story Time Backgammon is a high seas adventure that teaches kids as young as three how to play one of the world’s most popular games.

This game tells the tale of a Viking chieftain, Chompus the Great, and a swashbuckling pirate, Peglegra the Bold. Aided by magical dice and their animal companions, Wind and Wave, Chompus and Peglegra race their ships from dock to dock in search of treasure and glory!

Story Time Backgammon’s hilarious stories, unique mini-games, illustrated board, and custom pieces enable anyone to teach their youngsters the game—no backgammon experience necessary!

—description from the publisher

name: TransAmerica: China Map
description:
TransAmerica: China Map is a simple railway game. Each player has a set of five cities strung across China that need to be connected by rail. Players first place their station on an intersection on the map, then take turns placing one or two rails each turn on the lines of the map. Initially they can place only adjacent to their station or on a line that touches their station, but once their network connects with another player's, they can place anywhere along the combined network.

The game ends when the first player completes a connected route between their five cities. The player who can make the best use of the other players' networks is generally victorious.

name: Lendas e Batalhas
description:
Independent Brazilian card game about the folklore and culture of the country. The objective is to reduce the opponent's PC (Ponto de Conhecimento in Portuguese; Point of Knowledge in English) from 20 to 0.

The game is divided in 5 categories, each of them plays an important and different roll to win the match: Folklore (you must discard cards to use the effect. No ATK or DEF; no "Pontos de Conhecimento"); Historical (higher ATK/DEF. Not all of them have effects; all of them have "Pontos de Conhecimento"); Support (mid ATK/DEF; has effects. Not all of them have "Pontos de Conhecimento", since a Support card can be an "Action card"; not a character); Wild animals (large range of ATQ/DEF. All of them have effects and "Pontos de Conhecimento") and Plants (no ATK, no DEF, no "Pontos de Conhecimento". To use them/their effects, you must place you card facing down and respect the different type of activation [Waiting / Immediate / Counterattack].

To reduce your opponent's PC, you have to attack their character. A "character" is a card with ATK/DEF [All Historical, some Support; All Animals]. The "PC" of the characters is informed in the left-superior border. It represents the amount of damage you'll take on your life if you character "dies" – if their DEF goes to 0 or lower. You can also reduce your opponent's PC by attacking them directly, as long as their field is empty (no characters) or if you have an effect that allows you to attack directly.

—description from the designer

name: Blábol
description:
In Blábol, your goal is to create a grammatically correct sentence using the cards in your hand.

There are 156 cards of seven types: nouns, adjectives, pronouns, verbs, adverbs, prepositions and conjunctions. All these cards are shuffled together to form the draw deck and each player draws seven cards.

The game is played in turns and on their turn, players have to play cards from their hands to form sentences. They can also add cards to previously played sentences (including those of their opponents) to make them longer and thereby score more points.

The game ends when the draw deck is depleted. Players then score the sentences in front of them: each sentence scores the number of cards used squared (a sentence consisting of eight cards will gain 64 points). Points are then deducted for unplayed cards still in players' hands. The player with the most points becomes the master of Blábol!

name: Trivial Pursuit: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
description:
Round up the gang and go for the glory with this collectible edition of Trivial Pursuit featuring 600 questions from the hit FX show It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia.

Answer questions from across 6 categories - Episodes, Quotes, About the Gang, Friends & Enemies, What Happens at Paddy's, Schemes and Plans.

This fast-flying trivia game is officially licensed and sure to be a great collectible gift for the diehard It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia fans!

Includes: 100 Question Cards featuring 600 Trivia Questions, 1 Die, 1 portable storage Wedge, and 1 Rulebook.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Doprava 007
description:
The players become drivers who are using a die to move along the game board. The goal is to get from Prague to the cities assigned by the cards faster than the opponents.

Every player gets three destination cards and six action cards. Then in turns, players roll a die to move the car of their colour following the path of their choice. Highways offer higher speeds than local roads, but everything can change at any time if players use their action cards. Also, two cars cannot end up in the same spot. If they do, they collide which has its consequences.

The game ends when one player successfully reaches all their destinations and gets back to Prague. This player becomes the winner, but others can still compete for the second place.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Race, Track Movement

name: Sealed City
description:
Sealed City, you are mercenaries who have come to a town to rest and resupply when the local governor asks for your help. But what starts as a competition to build reputation with the town turns into a desperate fight to survive once the town gets sealed in by a magical dome.

Throughout the 13 games, you will create a unique story with the other players. Who your mercenaries are, how the town develops, and what ultimately becomes of the town are all in your hands. The first several games have you exploring several locations of the town and determining your background based on your choices while gathering food, water, and reputation

From there, mysteries will become revealed, and you'll find that what seemed like a relatively safe little hamlet is rapidly turning into anything but, putting your combat skills to the test. And you can work as cooperatively or competitively as you desire—will you work to protect the town no matter the cost, or will you make sure you stand supreme over the other mercenaries?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Legacy Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Random Production, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Ping-pong
description:
Ping-pong is a party game, where the speakers of each team try their partners to guess the secret element. The speakers give alternately give a clue.

Each team thus uses these clues and answers to the opposing team.

It's a competitive game, with 2 teams of 2 players.

Each round













The first player draws the first card and rolls the dice.
The current element (the solution) for this round is the element with the dice number.
He and his opponent (sitting next to him) read secretly the element. They are the clue givers.
Each of them will have to make their partner guess the element.
The clue givers say alternately a clue.
Afiter each clue, the partner of the clue givers Say what hé thinks is the solution.
Until a player finds the solution, the round proceeds so.
When a player finds the solution, his team scores 1 point.

Next round













The player to the left of the first player becomes the first player.

End of the game


















When a team scores 7 points, this team wins.

-description from designer

name: Reign of the Onyx King
description:
An asymmetrical, standalone expansion for Hero: Tales of the Tomes. One player controls the powerful Onyx King and up to 3 players team up to try and to take them down.

Play it on its own, or combine it with the heroes and cards from the base game. Includes 4 new heroes, 200 new cards, new mechanics, and new ways to play.

Just like the base game, all of the players play off of one shared deck. Whether it’s a free-for-all battle, or taking on the Onyx King, no prior deck building or card collecting is required to play.

name: Rock Paper Swords
description:
Rock Paper Swords is a strategy and push your luck card game designed for 2 players. Simple to learn and quick to play, with both luck and strategic decision making affecting victory. Can also be played without reading as a speed and dexterity game perfect for smaller children, inspired by card games such as condottiere and Gobbit.

RPS is played in rounds, with players simultaneously choosing an opening trio of cards hidden from view, followed by turns of ability activation, combat, and card movement. Simple rock paper scissors rules means turn order and elimination is lightning quick, but victory may just as quickly slip from your grasp.

3 wins in a row or accumulate 30 value in defeated cards to be declared victor.

Print and play PDF at https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pxggmCW4XjgmuTUvGFx3EnjV5RS...
Print on demand at https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/rock-paper-swords

Rock crushes swords cuts paper burns rock…

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory, Print & Play
mechanics: Drawing, Force Commitment, Hand Management, Take That

name: Silk Road
description:
In the echoing sounds of camel bells along the Hexi Corridor and the tumultuous waves of boundless oceans, "Silk Road Millennium" invites players to relive the grandeur of the ancient Silk Road that extended from the prosperous Chang'an. This tabletop game is a journey through history, allowing players to follow in the footsteps of ancient traders and experience the excitement and joy of traversing mountains and seas, guided by the roll of the dice.

Game Objective:

Players aim to prosper by engaging in trade between various cities, accumulating precious silver along the way.

Gameplay:

Starting with the youngest player and proceeding clockwise, each player takes turns performing four actions: rolling the dice, moving their game piece, establishing trade routes, and engaging in trade exchanges.

Game End:

The game concludes when players deplete the silver supply pile. Gameplay continues, with any subsequent silver acquisition coming from the remaining silver in the box. The game ends when the player to the right of the starting player finishes their turn. The player with the highest silver total claims victory, and in the event of a tie, the player with the most remaining goods emerges as the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Network and Route Building
publishers: Gameland 游戏大陆, Yaofish Games

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Ewige Kälte – Die Bruderfeuer
description:
Legends of Andor: The Brother Fires is a mini expansion for Legends of Andor: The Eternal Frost for legends 2-4 to aid the heroes.

At SPIEL in Essen 2023, Michael Menzel signed exclusive mini expansions! "The Brother Fires" was one of them.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Starling: etiketa hrou
description:
A family game where players aim to navigate the pitfalls of social life as best as they can and complete tasks associated with understanding the rules of decent conduct in society. The objective for each player and the pinnacle of their social career is a visit to Buckingham Palace and an audience with the queen.

The essence of the game lies in acquiring social positions and solidifying them. It is up to the player whether they decide to have more socially weaker positions or a smaller number of stronger ones. If a player wants to be strong, they can achieve this either by enhancing their own social standing or by weakening the standing of others. However, this cannot be done without knowledge of etiquette rules, combined with proper strategic decision-making.

name: Even or odd sum
description:
A little board game for 2.
Each player has 5 cards: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4.
5 rounds of play.

Round
The 2 players simultaneously place a card, face down, then reveal it.
If the sum is even, the larger one wins.
If the sum is odd, the smaller one wins.
If = nobody wins the cards.
So, each card wins and loses against 2 cards.

End of the game
Sum the numbers on the cards, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Harry Potter: Remembrall
description:
Enter the world of Remembrall, an exciting game that will put your visual memory to the test.

Carefully remember the contents of the 3 decks, each containing 30 unique cards with 2 levels of difficulty.

No need for a Pensieve: find the pairs yourself and prove your own skills!

Who will uncover the mysterious hidden pairs or triples first?

At the beginning of the game, players decide on the game mode. Place the cards for that game mode face down, then carry out the objectives on objective cards to earn as many points as possible. Be careful, you will need your memory and your audacity to find the pairs or triples.
When all the pairs or triples have been found, the player with the most wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Harry Potter: Quiz 500
description:
Dive into the world of Harry Potter and challenge your loved ones with 500 questions about the saga.
The only rule is not to use the Memory Charm against other players like Gilderoy Lockhart: "Obliviate!"
Take turns to answer one of the 5 themed questions about one of the 8 films and be the fastest to get 7 correct answers to win.

You must get 7 points as quickly as possible by answering the questions correctly. Each correct answer earns you one point. Choose the question number and try to answer it correctly.

—description from the publisher

name: Blood Throne: The Tower of Sacrifice
description:
The world of Cheol is riven by monsters thirsting for the blood and souls of the innocent. Belphegore, the Lord of Sacrifice is attempting to seize the Blood Throne and become a god in a world where the gods are dead. Your heroes come from every nation still standing to join the Last Accord in their desperate attempt to stop him.

Assemble Your Party

Manage a party of heroes with unique strengths in this cooperative fantasy board game for 1-7 players.

Battle Horrifying Monsters

Level up, gain new skills and loot while the persistent, narrative campaign unfolds with your choices.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Income, Legacy Game, Map Addition, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: OléMains!: Mini-jeu
description:
Demo version of OléMains! game.

Mini-game with the same mechanics as the basic version.

Hello bunnies!

Put a card on your forehead, and the members of your team make you guess the word written on it. As soon as the word is found you take another one. Quickly, you have 1 minute to find as many words as possible. Then next time, the other team plays on the same theme!

9 themes in total, on which each team will compete: celebrities, songs, brands, sport, there is something for everyone. You will have to mime, hum, describe... Each theme has its own rule!

So, which of your loved ones will reveal an incredible talent?

Not so fast! On each theme, each team draws a pledge card to spice up the event.

You are going to describe.. but by rapping!

Then mime... but keeping your elbows close to your body!

Ready ?

Let's go !

name: Mes Amis Sont...: Mini-Jeu
description:
Demo version of the game Mes Amis Sont...

In Mes Amis Sont... a referee reads the beginning of an Internet search, for example "How to pretend to..." and off we go: 2 teams have 40 seconds to guess the different automatic suggestions seen on the search engines . Think like the Internet and you will be rewarded!

Mes Amis Sont... is inspired by the Internet, because on the web, when you enter the start of a search, you often receive surprising ending suggestions! It's up to you to guess as many suggestions as possible from our authors to help your team win!

In Mes Amis Sont... there is a referee and two teams: the reds and the blues. The referee takes the hourglass, the six tokens and draws a card. It starts the trick by reading the start of a search, e.g. : “How to pretend to…” and presto, he turns the hourglass over!

The players then have 40 seconds to give as many suggestions as possible for the end of a sentence orally, in no imposed order. As soon as the referee hears a valid proposition - close to a suggestion on the card - he places a token in front of the player concerned. Ex: if a player says "work", he can validate because this evokes the suggestion "work".

Each token won moves the team's pawn forward as many spaces on the edge of the box. Bonus: a token won thanks to a suggestion marked with a smiley by the authors of the game, double count! The first team to reach the Victory box wins the game!

name: Poli Has Come!
description:
Poli Has Come! is a set collection game with a few special action cards. On their turn, players draw 2 cards from the deck and play sets of cards if they can. Out of turn, they can also swap cards from their hand with a public market.

There are also boss, police, and dog cards which can be played by the active player for certain effects.

The person with the most points when the deck runs out is the winner.
publishers: Studium Mundi (スタジオムンディ)
