name: Fidget
description:
A sophisticated tile placement game that uses a unique tile shape with 3 rounded sides.

Players attempt to build their asymmetrical stratgies while blocking other players attempts to work on their own. Place, stack and fidget these unique tiles to victory.

—description from the designer

name: Seikimatsu kādobatoru densetsu
description: Published by サザンクロス・マネジメント (Southern Cross Management) in 2006, alongside the release of the Fist of the North Star: The Legends of the True Savior series of movie, this collectible card game features two players representing the elders of enemy villages, recruiting characters from the series to defeat each other in a race to 5 Victory Points.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: サザンクロス・マネジメント (Southern Cross Management)

name: Christmas Tree R&W
description:
​A simple game for 2 to 6 players, that can be played in less than 30 minutes to play with the family on Christmas days.

Choose a die and place the corresponding ornament on your tree. Try to achieve the combination that gives you the most points.

Eat cookies to avoid bad luck with the dice, but not too many before you finish decorating your entire tree or you will lose possible points.

You will only need 2 dice in two colors. Each one represents a type of ornament, balls and figures. Balls can give you a lot of points by accumulating balls of the same type. The figures give more points initially and by placing your favorite or if you get all of them you will get a bonus.

The active player can choose which dice to choose, passive players will have to settle for what they are given, or eat a cookie to have more options.

—description from the designer

name: 晴れた日はダムでキャンプしよ (Camp At The Dam On A Sunny Day)
description:
The dam is filled with abundant water and is perfect for camping. Let's camp at a beautiful dam on a sunny day!

晴れた日はダムでキャンプしよ is a must-follow trick-taking game with four types of dams with various storage rates: arch type, gravity concrete type, rock fill type, and earth type. The strength of your rank will change depending on the weather, so let's predict the weather.

During a typhoon, it is better to have less water to protect yourself from flooding, and during a drought, it is better to have a lot of water. If the weather is nice, camp at a dam with a moderate amount of water. However, dum curry is always delicious no matter what the occasion.

name: ダムカードバトル FNAWIP
description: In the competitive trick-taking card game where you fight with dam cards, you can not only compete with the original dam cards from overseas that are included in the game, but you can also compete using dam cards distributed at over 1000 locations across Japan.

name: Rosting Panic
description:
一人はスプーンで自分のメニューに合わせて材料を持ってきて、残りはサイコロを転がします。
サイコロからコーヒー豆の絵が出たら、「ロースティング！」と叫びます。
そしてスプーンを取って材料を持ってきます。いつまで？誰かが「ロースティング！」と叫ぶまで。

It's a game where you have to quickly complete the menu you ordered using the only coffee machine.
Anyone can easily enjoy it with a boisterous party game.

name: Adventure Time Card Wars: Ultimate Collection
description: All 6 Adventure Time Card Wars Collector's Packs in one box! In this 1v1 trading card game, you play as your favorite Heroes, each with themed decks inspired by the TV show. Action takes place across four lanes with each player using Spells, Creatures, and Buildings to take down their opponents. Customize your decks for extra fun! And don't forget to Floop the Pig!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: JEZZ
description:
Quick hands are required in the card game JEZZ. Save the future from disaster and collect points to win. A fast-paced game that requires good eyesight and reaction.

Beim Kartenspiel JEZZ sind schnelle Hände gefragt. Bewahre die Zukunft vor Katastrophen und sammle Punkte für den Sieg. Ein schnelles Spiel, bei dem es auf gute Augen und Reaktion ankommt.

name: ペンギンの消えた足跡 (Pengin No Kieta Ashiato)
description:
The 21 penguins are now 20. Which one is the missing one?

If you organize the information about the children who are present, you may be able to find out the children who have disappeared.

Play cards according as a trick-taking game and guess the number of the child who disappeared from the numbers that gradually appear, and guess the number!

ペンギンの消えた足跡 is a trick-taking deduction game with only 21 cards.

name: Highscorer 1986
description:
Highscorer 1986 is a solo game for 3 to 99 players, where one player is playing a simulated slot machine set collection game and the other players are betting on the results. The game includes a score card which resembles the high score screen of a vintage arcade game to record the slot machine player's score; this player wins if they set the high score. The betting players are competing against each other for the high score.

The game lasts 4 rounds. In the first 3 rounds, the betting players have a limited number of bets to place on how many of each of 8 symbols will be in the slot machine player's collection at the end of the 4th round.

The slot machine player is revealing cards from a deck, and choosing to either take the highest ranked card, the lowest 2 ranked cards, or roll dice and attempt to take all cards.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Groven: The Board Game
description:
Groven is based on each player playing as a village blacksmith. Players must craft items using resources they gather from expeditions to complete local jobs to gain respect from the village. The player to first reach 5 respect wins and is crowned the most respected blacksmith of the village.

The game sees players carrying out certain actions each turn around the table until each player has exhausted all of their available "time" tokens, the primary resource of the game. When all time tokens are spent, the game moves to the next round, or "days" as they are called in-game. Each day has a specific event that happens, either the job bulletin gets refreshed so players can get new jobs, or the traveling merchant opens up so that players can trade their crafted items from their forge for money. On the seventh day players may earn up to 1 respect if they win the smithing tourney, which is dictated by some dice rolls.

Players alternate between gathering resources by going on "expeditions" underground, managing their resources either by selling them at certain events or using them to craft items at their forge, combating monster underground or bandits on the surface, or building buildings that offer communal benefits to all players, but give respect to the one who built it. Players keep deciding on what actions to carry out to try and be the first to get 5 respect.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Income, Negotiation, Passed Action Token, Trading

name: Trick-Taking Werewolf
description:
A small game that requires only 5 tricks. As the name suggests, it's a game that combines trick-taking and werewolf.

Players will be divided into werewolves and students and compete against each other. For each trick in trick-taking, the winner of the trick will nominate someone they think is a werewolf and banish them.

If the werewolf can be expelled, the students win but if the werewolf survives at the end of 5 tricks, the werewolf wins.

name: Murder Party: Blutige Kreuzfahrt auf dem Nil
description:
Liven up a party with friends with this murder mystery party game that will accompany you through an evening or even a whole weekend!

A murder is committed during a cruise on the Nile. The only possible culprits are the surviving passengers - or could a member of the crew be behind it? Now it's up to you to solve the case. Collect clues that could help you. To do this, however, you'll have to eliminate the other sleuths by enticing unknowing players to complete certain secret tasks for you!

6 different cases can be played! The scenarios can be played several times as no cards need to be folded or coloured. However, there is only one solution per story.

name: Escape Game: Baker Street – Das Vermächtnis von Sherlock Holmes
description:
It seems Sherlock needs your help to solve the ever-increasing number of crimes in London. Solve the mysteries, scour 19th century London and amaze the world's most famous private detective...

Contents:

Puzzle maps to explore Hyde Park, the Crystal Palace, Kensington Gardens and even the Albert Hall
Clue cards to progress and solve the crime
a poster to identify the guilty person!


Playable (almost) ad infinitum! Around 30 puzzles which, depending on the combination, can lead to more than 50 possible culprits.

name: Společenstvo nepozornosti
description: The expansion completely changes the style of how the game is played. It introduces roles with side quests and also units of inattention. Naturally, there are new "Pimpulové," travelers, and reaction cards.

name: Summon Legends
description:
Summon Legends is a casual and enjoyable trick-taking style game where you fight using magic cards and monster cards.

Use magic cards to control the battlefield and advance the battle to your advantage. The first player to run out of cards wins that round. The winner of each round will advance to the next round with one legendary card and the player who wins the final round (4th round) is the winner of the game.
publishers: あんきろわーくす (Ankilo Works)

name: AUKUS & CHINA
description:
AUKUS & CHINA is 2-5 player, easy to learn hard to master, asymmetric modern-day strategy wargame. Area control meets hidden resource allocation and open-choice deck building. A&C explores the fictional scenario of an escalating conflict between the USA and China and their allies.

You and your friends are the leaders of one of 5 teams on 2 sides. Red side teams: China and Russia. Blue side teams: USA, UK-AUS-FRA, JPN-KOR.
Your goal in the game is to drive down the enemy side’s morale points. Morale points represent the public’s political willingness and economic ability to continue to support the government’s war efforts. Allies will win or lose together. You can drive down the other side’s morale points by controlling sea and land areas, and winning battles.

Mechanics that Make AUKUS & CHINA Unique:

Asymmetric Gameplay: Asymmetry plays a central role across all aspects of the game, manifesting on both side-specific and team-specific levels. This asymmetry ranges from resource availability and unit deployment to strategic options and unit-specific abilities. We refer to this as 'layered asymmetry,' which simplifies the learning curve for new players, as they don't need to immediately grasp multiple unique playstyles. Instead, they can gradually understand and adapt to the nuances of each level, making it easier to think strategically and empathize with different player perspectives. Simultaneously, it offers seasoned players a thrilling challenge to put themselves in their opponents' shoes, deepening the strategic complexity and excitement of the game.
Unit special abilities: Unit special abilities are the most prominent aspect of the game's asymmetry. These abilities allow players to strategically outmaneuver and even overpower larger forces with smaller ones by using the right combination of units and their unique powers. This depth of strategic options, stemming from the diverse abilities of each unit, provides unmatched variety and replayability.
Permadeath: Units are in limited supply. Units destroyed in combat are permanently removed and placed in the destroyed section of a team's tray, with some exceptions.
Catch up: We call it 'Rallying Call'—a game mechanism that allows players to use their setbacks as a catalyst to redouble their efforts in combat. It supports the trailing side by effectively preventing any player from gaining an insurmountable lead, thereby maintaining a competitive and challenging gameplay environment.
Hidden resource allocation at both macro and micro levels: You secretly manage your resources across three main powers: Mobilization power for deploying new units, Operational power for moving units, and Intel power for using unit special abilities, tactics, and cyber warfare. Plus, you use special abilities in combat covertly.
Escalation dynamics: The game unfolds over five escalation phases, introducing new units, combat zones, and events, making it progressively engaging. This structure is ideal for beginners to learn at their own pace and for seasoned players to strategically build their approach, while also ensuring that early mistakes don't immediately jeopardize the game, allowing for a more forgiving and fun experience.


The story of AUKUS & CHINA:
It's the second decade of the third millennium. The Indo-Pacific has become the core of the global economy, fueling the unprecedented growth of China, positioning it as a rival to the United States. In response, the USA and its allies have announced the AUKUS security pact to contain the expansion of China, which aims to displace the US as the world’s pre-eminent power. Finding itself increasingly isolated, China has strengthened its alliance with Russia, united by their belief that the current international arrangements give the US too much power and their determination to change that and to create a new world order, where new institutions, ideas and power structures will better accommodate their interests. The board is set, the pieces are moving. It's your turn to shape the outcome of the great conflict of our time.

We have put considerable effort into ensuring geographical and military accuracy, in proportion to the game's level of abstraction.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Potluck Showdown
description:
Potluck Showdown is a strategic tabletop card game that combines engaging, addictive gameplay with an appreciation for delicious Asian cuisine.

The game is easy to learn, but difficult to master. Each player starts with a hand of recipe cards and must collect completed sets (i.e. 1 food, 1 drink and 1 snack) to acquire points and win. But, as you play, watch out for the action and disaster cards that can wreak havoc on your culinary creations.

With over 30 diverse Asian foods represented, there's plenty of variety to keep the game fresh and exciting. Plus, the adorable artwork on each card will make you smile no matter the occasion.

name: Crime Scene: Tokyo 2000
description:
Enter the Crime Scene… A frighteningly ordinary crime brings detectives to the financial center of Tokyo, but everything is not what it seems. Here, true power resides in the shadows.

Once you start your investigation, your life’s on the line.
Can you bring the truth to light before it’s too late?

name: Crime Scene: Berlin 1976
description:
October 5, 1976, East Berlin, Germany.
You are drawn into a web of espionage and intrigue on the East side of the Wall. Assume another identity and try to make your way to the other side. By cracking the codes, it can be done!

Enter the Crime Scene… A young woman, living in the shadow
of the Berlin Wall, receives a strange, dangerous letter that
changes her life… and maybe more than that.

name: Crime Scene: Cyber 192.168.1.1
description:
June 5, 2023, Silicon Valley, California.
You are accused of a terrible crime and have to prove your innocence. Dig deep to find out who framed you. Can you do it before you are caught and convicted?

Enter the Crime Scene… An invisible hand creates a disaster that falls on an unsuspecting man. Can he fight the cyber monster that is threatening to destroy his life – and those of others – or will he lose everything?

name: Ultimate Dungeon Showdown
description:
Worlds of fantasy, science fiction, and horror collide in Ultimate Dungeon Showdown, the game where heroes and villains from across reality must work together to win glory for you in the Dungeoneer's Guild combat arena.

Play as members of the Dungeoneering Guild, recruiting an adventuring party from across the multiverse to fight and win the title of Ultimate Dungeon Champion.

This fast-paced party game for 2-6 players includes optional rules for strategic deck-building, tournaments, and advanced adventuring scenarios. Part of the Ultimate Dungeon Game System!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Blunder: An Escape Room in an Envelope
description:
An Escape Room in an Envelope! A dinner party game.

While James was travelling through China, he made a devastating and embarrassing mistake. He sent a very private message to the wrong people and he’s in big trouble if this gets out.

How to play: Solve all nine puzzles to reveal the passcode to the online vault, break into the vault where the files are hidden and delete them all before it’s too late!

—description from the publisher

name: ÍNTIMOOS Retos en pareja
description:
120 activities, challenges and ideas for original dates as a couple. Create unforgettable moments together. The first to complete 5 challenges wins.

Choose, scratch and... let the adventure begin!

Get ready to live fun, original and memorable moments!

name: Oscacomp's Item Shop: a party game for people who like dungeons, dragons, and grammar.
description:
The players are associate salesgnomes at Lord Oscacomp's Adventuring Outfitters and Item Emporium (or, as it's more commonly known, Oscacomp's Item Shop). You have three jobs: sell, sell, sell!

On your turn, play an adjective from your hand to the left of the other cards in play. It has to be a higher rank than the leftmost card (this keeps things in grammatical order). Then read aloud the entire item description. This is very important.

If you don't have a card of higher rank, you might be able to play one of your special cards instead. The AND card lets you play a second adjective of the same rank as one already on the board; the CARET lets you insert an adjective between two ranks, and the F-BOMB, well, you can play that one anywhere.

If you can't play at all, the round is over. The last person who played a card wins the round and gets 1 point per adjective in play. First person to 20 Osca-bucks wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Das Quiz der Ringe
description:
The unofficial game for Middle-earth fans
Are you familiar with the legendary world of hobbits, orcs and elves? Then take on the ultimate challenge and face the 222 tricky quiz questions about the content from J.R.R. Tolkien's books. You can choose between two different levels of difficulty as you puzzle your way through the realm of the most famous and extensive fantasy epic in literary history. Look forward to an adventurous quiz and expand your Tolkien knowledge in a playful way.

—description from the designer

name: The Dreadheart
description:
Whispers of a legendary treasure echo through the chilling mists of the northern seas, a prize so exquisite it evades even the gaze of the gods. They call it the Dreadheart, a crystallized Titan's heart born of love's lament. Forged in agony, it promises immense wealth, power, and... a gnawing torment to its possessor.

The Dreadheart is a solo game with 18 cards in the In-Hand style. In this game, you will take command of Black Mamba or Lone Conqueror, pirate and adventurer ships, in search of an old treasure, The Dreadheart. During your journey, you will have to manage resources to explore regions and discover clues that will lead you to the treasure's whereabouts, and you will also face sinister creatures and the fury of nature.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: シン・ネコ物件 (Shin Neko Bukken)
description:
シン・ネコ物件 (Shin Neko Bukken) is a press your luck racing game from Japan with a cat and horror theme. The game is published in a DVD box, and the subtitle of the game is デレない間取り (Derenai Madori). In the game, players are trying to escape a house haunted by a ghost cat. If the player stops to pay with the cat, they get a better chance of escaping.

The game has an advanced set of rules using 10 tool cards, which are various cat toys to distract the ghost cat. And the game has a basic set of rules for an easier, faster game too.

The publisher says:
This is a press your luck racing roll & move game in which you advance by throwing chips. You have to get out of a cursed house where a ghost cat is playing with you!

When it is your turn, choose whether you want to 'run' or 'play'. If you want to run, you throw three sound chips. The sound chips have footprints written on their surface, and you can advance your piece up to the number of footprints you have made. If you advance successfully, you can continue throwing chips.

However, if two or more cats on the back of the chip appear, you are out. The ghost cat will find you. If the ghost cat finds you, you will be taken back to the cat tower in the middle of the house, and you will be far from the goal.

If you choose to play with the cat, you end your turn by turning over your piece. The person whose piece is turned over plays with the cat and is liked, and can change the front or back of one of the chips they throw once. You have a simple but important choice to make: run through the game or play to the cat's good mood.

チップを振って進むチキンレースすごろくゲームです。

手番が来たら「走る」か「遊ぶ」かを選択します。走るなら物音チップを3枚振ります。
物音チップには表面に足跡が書かれており、出た足跡の数までコマを進められます。
無事進めたら、続けてチップを振り続けることができます。

ただし、チップの裏面に描かれたネコが２枚以上出たらアウト。幽霊ネコに見つかってしまいます。見つかったらコースの途中のネコタワーまで連れて戻ることになり、ゴールから遠のいてしまいます。

遊ぶを選択した場合は、自分のコマを裏返してターンを終えます。コマが裏になっている人はネコと遊んで気に入られているので、1回だけ自分が振ったチップ1枚の表裏を変えることができます。駆け抜けるか、猫の機嫌を取るか、シンプルながら選択を迫られます、
--description by publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: パンダチン (Pandatin)
description:
パンダチン (Pandatin) is a fast word game from Japan, in which players try to avoid saying a rude word.

The publisher says:

A forbidden card game in which you lose if you say 'ding' in succession. You have two cards in your hand, which can only be of the three types "Pan", "Da" and "Chin", and you have to play one card in your hand on top of the card on the field, and read aloud the card that was on the bottom and the card that was on top. If you say Chin when it is out, you lose. It's not good Japanese to say Chin twice in a row.

連続で「チン」と言ったら負けという禁断のカードゲーム。「パン」「ダ」「チン」の3種類しかないカードを手札として2枚持ち、場に出てるカードの上に手札を1枚重ねて出し、下にあったカードと上に重ねたカードの2枚を音読するだけ。チンが出てる時にチンを出したら負け。チンを続けて2回言うのは日本語的に良くないぞ。
--description by publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: After The Dungeon
description:
アフター・ザ・ダンジョン (After The Dungeon) is a dungeon escape game from Japan. The box front artwork was created using an AI system Leonardo.ai and then modified by the illustrator Natane (なたね).

The publisher says:

Players take the role of a group of adventurers who have defeated a boss and are trying to escape from a collapsing dungeon, while collecting requested items. The game has a total of eight rounds.

On your turn, you play a card from the field or discard a card to advance your piece. If players stop at the same square, your pieces chain together and move to the next row. Based on the pieces you advance, you also get a chance to advance pieces on your individual sheet. Collecting gem pieces along the way is also an important source of points.

After eight rounds, the player with the highest score wins by adding up the score based on the rank of the pieces advanced, the score on the individual sheet and the gemstone bonus.

This is a medium-weight game that is easy and light to do on your turn, but offers a puzzle-like play experience that requires careful thought.

プレイヤーはボスを倒した冒険者一行となり、崩壊するダンジョンから依頼品を集めつつ脱出を目指します。ゲームは全8ラウンドです。

手番では場から1枚カードを出すか、捨て札にして自分の駒を進めます。
同じマスで止まると駒が連鎖して隣の列に移動していきます。
自分が進めた駒を元に、個人シート上でも駒を進めるチャンスが得られます。
また、道中で宝石駒を集めるのも重要な得点源になります。

8ラウンドの後に、駒を進めた順位に応じた得点、個人シート上での得点、宝石ボーナスを足して最も得点の多いプレイヤーが勝利します。
手番でやることは簡単で軽快ながら、じっくり考えて遊べるパズルチックなプレイ感が楽しめる中量級ゲームです。
--description by publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Racing
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

name: Matching+: Match & More
description: Matching +: Match & More is the ultimate memory game for at-home or on-the-go. The set features new ways to match - including sequence games, match 3 games, and press your luck, aside from classic play. All 40 different themed cards store easily on the case. How fast can you make a match?

name: Storm Raiders: Deadly Decisions Mini-Expansion
description:
This mini-expansion features four great game-play additions, packed with tiles and tokens. Each mode in interchangeable, so you can add one at a time, or all three at once! Also included you’ll find 3 new vehicles!

Mode #1: Rough Roads Ahead - Moving across Atlantis just got harsher! Each time the Storm moves to a new site, all adjoining white paths (not ports) gain a Hazard Marker.

Mode #2: Deadly Contracts - Reavers have attacked our beloved Stormholds. Fortunately our allies managed to get word out before it was too late. Fulfilling these Contracts can only be achieved using Weaponry.

Mode #3: Atlantean Elixir - The days are long, and the nights, longer. Carrying a flask of Atlantean Elixir can come in handy when you need a little extra pick-me-up. Give each player 1 Atlantean Elixir during Setup. Players can turn over their Atlantean Elixir Token and lose 1 Health to take any 1 Resource from their site.

New Vehicles - x1 Trike, x1 Plane, x1 Sub; all with unique abilities.

—description from the publisher;;
categories: Adventure, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Variable Player Powers

name: Dzieci kontra rodzice: Magia świąt
description:
Kids and parents have a separate decks of 20 cards with 4 questions on each card and 1 extra trap-card.
The decks are named "Kids ask parents" and "Parents ask Kids" and both contains questions designed to match with knowledge of each side of duel.
One side draws a card from opponents deck, picks a question and chooses 1 of 3 given answers. After good answer the card is given and 1 point is awarded.
In case of drawing a trap-card you loose your turn and a chance to answer a question.
Then other side can draw a card.

After 5 rounds a side with more points wins.

name: Through Hell And Back: Plane Expansion Pack 1
description:
This aircraft pack is for the game Through Hell and Back. This expansion includes 10 P-47 escorts from the 56th Fighter group from 61st and 62nd squadrons that served in the European theater.

There are 10 Enemy Aircraft cards featuring the JU-88, BF-109, and BF-110 from Zerstörergeschwader 26, a Luftwaffe heavy fighter wing that served on the Eastern front.

12 out of the 20 new Aircraft cards have a new optional mechanic for more interesting gameplay.

Included is a double-sided Ammunition card that gives new abilities, allowing less reloading. This card can be bought in-game using the crew action card point system.

As a bonus, there are two new missions for Operation Thunderclap Bombsight Cards with Dossier Cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Surf's Up! Summer Trivia
description: One player reads the question on the card. Everyone else attempts to answer the question. If answered correctly you get the card. First person to get five cards is the winner.

name: Pega-Pega! Bichos da Fazenda
description:
Great chaos is happening at the farm, and all the animals are scattered across the field! The mission now is to find the animals so they can be safe!

Pega-Pega! Bichos da Fazenda is a different memory game that can be played in cooperative or competitive mode. Have fun saving the critters from danger. But be careful, the wolf is lurking!

—description from the designer

name: Pega-Pega! Folclore
description:
Great confusion is happening in the forest, and all the Brazilian folklore characters are lost! The mission now is to find the characters so they can be safe!

Pega-Pega! Folclore is a different memory game that can be played in cooperative or competitive mode. Have fun saving the characters from danger. But be careful, the Werewolf is lurking!

—description from the designer

name: Runes of Zun: Forbidden Lands
description:
Escape the realm of Zun!

This new location card expansion will take your whole table on a journey to distant lands that change the rules while you play. It’s a new way to play the game you already know!

Each Location card has small rule changes which affect everyone while it's active
On your turn, you may move everyone to a new Location, hopefully changing the rules of play in your favor!
When you want to play a new Location, draw one from the Location deck and replace the previous Location.

name: CAPE COD OPOLY
description:
CAPE COD OPOLY is a cool, property trading board game, that features Cape Cod & the Islands. Experience all the fun of wheeling and dealing against your opponents while buying and selling property on the Cape. From the beaches on Nantucket to shopping on Martha's Vineyard, enjoy the classic gameplay. Whether you're just visiting on vacation, or living on Cape Cod, experience all the sites, landmarks and attractions Cape Cod has to offer. The National Seashore, the Hyannis Port Compound, scenic harbors and much more! Anyone can play from kids to Grandparents. It's a game of chance with adventures along the way. Build your wealth by owning inns and cottages on property from Falmouth to Provincetown. You will be entertained as you strategize to bankrupt your opponents and try to stay on the Cape!

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: RuPaul's Drag Race
description:
You better werk for the superstardom that awaits in this ultimate game for drag queen fans! MONOPOLY: RuPaul’s Drag Race puts players in the heels of the Emmy Award-winning reality show’s contestants to buy, sell, and trade iconic locations from the competition, such as Winners Circle, Judges Panel, and more! Sissy that walk across the board with runway essential tokens such as duck tape or a lipstick tube, then place Badges and Crowns to rack up Ru Dollars. Be the last player to watch all the others sashay away to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Monopoly: Britney Spears
description:
Get in the zone with the “Princess of Pop” in this chart-topping edition of the classic family game! MONOPOLY: Britney Spears takes players and fans on a musical journey through her most popular hits to buy, sell, and trade songs like “Baby One More Time”, “Toxic”, “Lucky”, and more! Tokens inspired by unforgettable music videos such as an astronaut, milkshake tray, and basketball take you around the board to rack up Gold Records and Platinum Records. Be the last one standing with hard-earned riches (until oops, you’ve bankrupted your friends again) to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading, Zone of Control

name: Via Inventor
description:
Each player represents a scientist and, simultaneously, a trader who, by moving around the game board, invents creations, ensures their legal protection, and, through licensing trades, gains additional financial resources or, conversely, pays licensing fees for the inventions of fellow players. The winner is the one who best estimates the situation, weighs risks most effectively, invests money wisely, and, of course, has a bit of luck on their side as well.

Players move their meeples along the game board according to the rolls of a die. The game board displays various inventions that players acquire (invent) and trade among themselves. Additionally, there are four spaces for patent agents, enabling the protection of individual inventions with different degrees of safeguarding. If a player lands on a space occupied by an invention owned by another player, they must pay a fee, with the amount increasing based on the level of protection for that particular invention. The goal of the game is to eliminate other players by causing them to go bankrupt.
publishers: Útvar transferu technologií VUT v Brně

name: Sunrise over the Xenocene
description:
Fae folk have emerged from their long hibernation to find the innumerable remnants of human civilizations, crumbling and covered in natural and unnatural flora. It is an archaeological wonderland of latent radioactivity, old military technology, and the descendants of the alien arthropod invasion force.

Battle robots sit hunched at their last posts, awaiting reactivation prompts. Long-dormant automated countermeasures are still relatively dangerous. Yet, the sun shines brightly on this new age of magic, music, merriment, mutation, and spirited, competitive exploration.

You represent a coach in the Fae Gauntlet League. Create your very own team of faerie daredevils and lead them through challenges and random events. Collect points for meeting dice combo challenges successfully, roll against your skill stats to avoid danger or to collect bonuses, and cross the finish line with the lowest accumulated time! Your team members can learn talents, earn team skill stat boosts, and maybe gain an animal friend... or your team could get wrecked by bugs, drones, and your own miscalculations!

We reach the Drop Zone in ten seconds. Watch out for the lurker and we'll see you at the Extraction point! Good luck, teams! ...two ...one ...GO GO GO!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Set-up

name: AttackCats
description:
Dive into a thrilling twist on the classic card game you thought you knew. Welcome to a world where Geishas, Alpha Cats, Strays, and the luxurious Fat Cats clash in a battle of wits and strategy. Are you ready to unleash your inner feline?

Features:

Four Unique Cat Clans: Geisha Clan, Alpha Cat Gang, The Strays, and the opulent Fat Cats. Each with its own special power to tip the scales in your favor!

Explosive Power-ups: From the enchanting "Female Charm" to the disruptive "Dynamite", strategize your moves and watch the tables turn!

Magic, Weapons & Creatures: Engage in epic "Rock, Paper, Scissors" showdowns with Melee Weapons, Ranged Weapons, and Creature Riders. Plus, use magic to revive discarded cards!

Play with Friends: With support for up to 10 players, gather your friends for a purr-fect game night!

Note: No actual cats were harmed in the making of this game. All "attacks" are purely fictional and meant for entertainment only.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Battle Break: Sengoku Tactics – Kawanakajima's Decisive Battle
description:
This was a special limited edition stand-alone mail order game that used the mechanics of Battle Break to recreate the 4th Battle of Kawanakajima, fought between the Uesugi and Takeda in 1561.

The game is played on a gridded map. Figures are stacked onto chips that reflect their level of power and life. The chips can also be spent to execute special moves--found under the figure bases. The round is basically split into 4 phases, and battles are resolved with a combination of movement (including flight), special moves, and dice rolls.

The game includes 20 models, two sets of chips, dice, a double-sided playmat and rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sengoku Folio 10: The Battle of Ishigakihara
description:
The Battle of Ishigakihara is a Japanese doujin (fan-made) game produced by Ludens Faber and is game 10 of his Sengoku Folio series. The game simulates the battle between the Kuroda and Otomo in 1600.

The game is a typical wargame, with movement and attack values, zones of control, a CRT for combat results, and a turn track.

The game includes a map, rules, historical guide, and mounted counters. The counters need to be cut out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Turn Order: Time Track
publishers: Dōjin Club Ludens Faber (同人会ルデンス・ファベル)

name: Apex Legends: The Board Game – Board 1 Expansion
description:
The Board I Expansion adds a second game board (62 x 62 cm) for use in Apex Legends: The Board Game, based on the industrial themes of Kings Canyon and offering new buildings and terrain features, including fences, which function as impassable obstacles, but do not block line of sight. The new board can be attached to the default one using a set of connector tiles, which effectively doubles the potential game area, creating an arena used e.g. in a new game mode: Capture the Flag. The Scenario Book included in the expansion contains detailed instructions for new setups, and a fresh batch of scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Apex Legends: The Board Game – Solo and Co-op Expansion
description:
Designed with Dávid Turczi and Radek Ignatów, the solo and co-op modes introduce the option to play Apex Legends: The Board Game in single player mode or in cooperation with two other players. With an entire set of dedicated gameplay components, these new gameplay variants pit the player-controlled Legends against a squad of automated opponents.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Catharsis Sagas: Chapter 3 – Bewildered
description: Catharsis Sagas are true solo game boxes that include one character & one boss. If you own the base game, the boss plays up to five players. The game requires strategy, cooperation, and a touch of luck to succeed as the party fights through traps, monsters, and more. You will hunt down the boss while going through an epic narrative. Roll your dice to activate your powers, but be warned, your powers are also your health. You must carefully decide when it's wise to activate a power and how to resolve damage. Spend your morale wisely, or else you and your party will fall to the corruption of Verity.
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Smart10: Astrid Lindgren
description:
Fifty new double-sided cards with a hundred new questions about the Swedish author Astrid Lindgren. The que
Also includes a Smartbox that fits 50 cards. Can be played as a stand-alone game or as an expansion to the original.
publishers: Martinex, Mindtwister AB, Peliko Oy, White Castle

name: CLUENECT
description:
CLUENECT is perfect for people who love crafting witty clues and decoding hidden messages.

A clue giver secretly chooses one of the six available picture cards and gives a one word clue. Clue receivers (everybody else) attempts to pick which picture card they think the clue refers to by placing an associated number card that refers to the picture card.

Clue receivers get points if they guess right, while the clue giver only gets points if some but not all guess their picture correctly - thus making the clue giver try to not give too easy or hard of clues.

name: Beta Earth
description:
A fast-paced sci-fi card game set in the year 2386, where humanity has relocated to an artificial world that has replaced our own. The second Great Age had been founded upon principles and hope but has since reverted to the same foils and pitfalls of greed, corruption and crime.

In this game, you control a protagonist - a central figure of prominence in the world of Beta Earth - and work to either secure your hold on its limited resources or fight to protect it from those who would see its downfall.

The game utilizes three different card types, with multiple strategies and a unique system of combat triggers that make combat feel unique and fresh. Victory is achieved by either being the first to score 20 victory points or being the last one standing - reducing all other opponent's endurance to zero.

—description from the designer

name: Das beliebte Wortspiel
description: Similar to Scrabble you have to extend existing characters by your own letters to build long words. The longer the words you build the more points you score at the end.
mechanics: Hand Management, Spelling, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Arrival Push: A Game of Vectors
description:
Dive into becoming air traffic controllers taking over airspace and airplanes from another controller. As air traffic controllers, they must vector their aircraft across their airspace, around other airplanes and nasty weather to approach control. All airplanes move every round and new events pose challenges to controllers and their airplanes. The closer the airplanes get to the airport; the more limited airspace becomes. Maneuvering quickly becomes difficult or nearly impossible without the help of neighboring controllers. Players must work together, when one player struggles, it affects everyone around them. Players score by handing-off an airplane to approach control every turn. Approach control will only take one per person per round so players must work carefully to sequence their arrivals. After 15 turns, the next controller comes back from break, whoever has the most points wins and earns the right to take a break.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Zone of Control

name: Monkey Trix
description:
Family game night just got even better! Pick your monkey, collect your blocks and turn over the top card. Be the first monkey to build the stack and take the card to win the round. Collect three cards to win the game. This game is recommended for ages six plus, but friends and family of all ages will love Monkey Trix!

This action packed board game comes with everything you need! Game includes monkey heads, cards, and blocks. Some assembly is required - but it is so simple! It comes with step by step instructions. You will be going monkey for the this game in no time!

This feverish paced game will keep family game night fun for all! Monkey Trix keeps the game play action packed and lets you create your own strategy for a thrilling victory! Play with two players or play with teams! First - put on your silly monkey head, then draw a challenge card and get ready to build. The game starts when you yell 'monkey, set go'! First to build the puzzle, wins the card. 3 cards wins! Those are the rules...But as with any game, it's always fun to make your own, too!

—description from the publisher

name: What-a Mart
description:
Shoppers at a convenience store are shocked to discover the cashier's body by the cash register. He was alive just minutes ago! Who was actually browsing the aisles as all the shoppers claim, and which one of them slipped past the cash counter to get rid of the poor victim? What motive did they have and what clues did they leave behind?

Piece together clues, uncover hidden messages, assess suspects, and catch the culprit in this murder mystery game set in the 1980s.

—description from the publisher

name: The Oddtown Post
description:
Grappling with political unrest during the 1985 mayoral election, the city of Oddtown is thrown into further chaos when the Editor-in-Chief of the local newspaper, The Oddtown Post, is found murdered in his office. The only other people on the premises were six of his coworkers. They all seem to be hiding something and may even have motive to kill the victim. The Sheriff has reached out for your help with the investigation and is sending over clues.
Piece together clues, uncover hidden messages, assess the suspects, and catch the culprit.

—description from the publisher

name: ダンゴれ！魔女子さん (Dango! Majoko-san)
description:
There is currently an unprecedented dango boom in the witch world! Identify the magic that dominates the field, and try to get as many dumplings as possible without dropping them!

ダンゴれ！魔女子さん is a trick-taking game where you're competing to collect the most 5 types of dango drawn. There is a limit to how much dango you can have, and if you exceed it you will lose points.

name: TouringMania Tokyo
description: An exciting touring card battle between bike girls and bike swamps. It's a fun party game that you'll want to play over and over again, just like playing cards. It feels good to be the only one who can play while interfering with other players!

name: Abruzzo: Forte e Gentile
description:
Just like Monopoly, players take the part of land owners, attempting to buy and then develop their land. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes.

Gameplay
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail

Puoi chiamarli arrustelle, rustelle o arrosticini, ma alla fine conta solo una cosa: chi è stata l’ultima persona del gruppo a mangiarli!
È così che inizia Abruzzo – Forte e gentile, il gioco da tavolo di contrattazione e investimento che ti farà esplorare questa meravigliosa regione stando comodamente a casa tua, con i tuoi cari o i tuoi amici, progettando, tra un lancio di dadi e l’altro, i vostri viaggi.

Corri lungo il tabellone per mare, monti e rocche, incontrando bizzarri personaggi tra storia, arte, cultura, tradizioni, buona cucina e luoghi mozzafiato.
Chi riuscirà a guadagnarsi il più grande titolo di questo territorio: forte e gentile?
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Rhum Rush
description:
Each player is a mixologist attempting to complete as many classic tiki drinks as quickly as possible to earn the most money in tips. It’s fast, fun and competitive!

In Rhum Rush, players collect ingredient cards, placing them in ordered stacks according to a drink recipe. They must be quick, though, because if another player completes that recipe first, all progress on that drink will be lost. Whoever completes the drink first will receive the drink card, collecting the tip money on the card.

Special cards are dual-use cards that players can use to gain an advantage!

The game ends when one player reaches a certain amount of money in tips, depending on player count.

name: Zahlenstraße: Addition & Subtraktion
description:
Road of numbers - children's game from 6 years to learn addition and subtraction up to 50
Math is no longer boring!
The focus is on fun combined with an effective learning process for the children, which makes "Number Street" so popular with children and parents alike.

Are you looking for an educational game for children aged 6 and over to learn how to add and subtract numbers in a fun but effective way? Then you've found the right game!
A fun math game for children aged 6 and up! Kids learn the basics of addition and subtraction in the number range up to 50 and try to deliver ten deliveries to the number line as quickly as possible by rolling the dice with a lucky hand. Whether bread, fruit, milk, meat or fish, the fresher the delivery, the happier the customer. So everyone get in the delivery cars, roll the dice and let the fun delivery service race begin.

name: It Takes Two to Mango
description: Make the silly faces to match your Mango Cards. Think another player is making the same face then shout, "MANGO!" If your cards match add them to your Ripe Mango pile. If they don't match pick up a Rotten Mango Token. The player with the most Mango Matches is the winner!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Tic Tac No
description: Advanced Tic Tac Toe (also referred to as Ultimate Tic Tac Toe) where there are nine 3x3 play areas for two players to play in. Where the last player played within any of the 3x3 spots determines where the next player needs to play. For example, if Player 1 plays in the top left spot, then Player 2 needs to play anywhere in the top left 3x3 area. It's an interesting spin on and old game, that can also be played on any metal surface as the board is magnetic.

name: Marine Goround
description:
Here is a faraway sea area. In this oceanic zone, there was a circular current that was like a eden for sea creatures.
When the current exceeds a certain speed, it stores air, takes in food, and begins to circulate. Because of its unique appearance, this ocean current is called a “MARINE GOROUND”.
Why don’t you dive into the ocean and swim with the creatures? Let’s create a paradise cooperating with marine creatures.

Marine Goround is a tile-building backgammon game in which players aim to score Victory Points as quickly as possible by freely arranging the Tiles and creating chains of them. Each creature has its own ability, and your strategy will change greatly depending on which Creature Tiles you collect.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Kitty Callers
description:
Name and find these cute cats in this naming / Go Fish game.


Check the kitten's name on the card
Call out the kittens' names and look for them
Once the kittens are found, let's go home together!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: The Transformation Game: Solo and Earth-Solo
description: A supplement to The Transformation Game. Enjoy the many benefits of The Transformation Game in a solo setting. The Solo and Earth-Solo Games provide clarity on personal issues and give you feedback on the far reaching impact of your actions, attitudes and choices. Enhance your game experience by using a meditative approach, playing at your own pace and recording your thoughts and feelings as your game progresses.

name: Gutterhead: The Fiendishly Filthy Expansion Pack
description:
FIRST EXPANSION PACK - Because what you really need is an additional 112 fiendishly filthy drawing cards to make your life complete.
NOT FOR THE FAINT HEARTED - Yup, we're pretty convinced our 'online research' for this pack has landed us on the FBI watch-list.
REQUIRES GUTTERHEAD CORE GAME - By all means buy it on its own, however, it will be about as useful as a knitted condom.
WHO KNEW WE COULD TOP THE CORE GAME? - we did, so we did.

Contains 25 Person/Place cards, 25 Object cards, 25 Action cards, 25 Feeling/Sensation cards, 12 Naughty or Nice cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Interstellar Abduction: A Card game of Capturing Humans!
description:
Interstellar Abduction! Is a fast paced resource & strategy card game where 2-4 players take control of one of four alien factions in a game of high stakes intergalactic human acquisition. Utilize your factions' different strengths and weaknesses as you outsmart your opponents to abduct earthlings, gain scientific knowledge, and avoid gaining evidence of your existence!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Automatic Resource Growth, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: När då då?: Mat och dryck
description:
In När då då?, players take turns taking cards and forming a timeline with ten different events from the beginning of the era until today. Put events, people, places or gadgets in the right order of time.

This edition of the game focusses on food and drink.

name: När då då?: Ökända Brott
description:
In När då då?, players take turns taking cards and forming a timeline with ten different events from the beginning of the era until today. Put events, people, places or gadgets in the right order of time.

This edition of the game focusses on crime.

name: När då då?: Berömda kvinnor
description:
In När då då?, players take turns taking cards and forming a timeline with ten different events from the beginning of the era until today. Put events, people, places or gadgets in the right order of time.

This edition of the game focusses on famous women.

name: Hungry Little Penguins
description:
Collect colourful fish by turning over tiles and matching them to your penguin colour, but watch out for the seal who will steal your fish. A fun penguin-themed game with 2 exciting ways to play. Choose a collaborative or competitive game. Develops matching and memory skills.

In the collaborative game, players must work together to fill the iceberg playing board with different coloured fish, before the seal gets to the middle of the iceberg! For the competitive game, players break apart the playing board to creative individual lotto boards, playing against each other to be the first to fill their board with matching coloured fish.

Designed for ages 3+, Hungry Little Penguins is Orchard Toys' first introduction to collaborative gameplay. Players will develop matching and memory skills, as well as encouraging personal and social skills.

name: Dogma
description:
Dogma is a minimalistic party game in a rich package that seems like a total overkill but at the same time very in line with the luxurious and wealthy style of the Church.

In this game, you will become corrupt and immoral cardinals who would lie and deceive to hide their filthy sins.

Hell, you can even change sacred Dogmas and transform vice into virtue if that helps you win!

In short, you are the most righteous people on the planet. But also the worst!

That’s the world of Dogma.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Religious
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Hot Potato, Negotiation, Prisoner's Dilemma, Push Your Luck, Traitor Game

name: ソクラテスラ: 神々の宴 (Sokuratesura: Kamigami no Utage)
description:
ソクラテスラ: 神々の宴 (Sokuratesura: Kamigami no Utage) is the third expansion to ソクラテスラ (SocraTesla) and introduces powerful gods from various world religions. The rules limit the number of these characters in a players hand, but they allow for more powerful chimera. For example, some gods have more than two arms, or more than one torso.

The designer advises that the expansion is fun, but does not make the game more tactical.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Religious

name: Demography: The Political Strategy Game
description:
Demography is a political strategy game. You are a candidate in the UK General Election Race. Travel hastily around the UK to win the support of voters in the regions you visit. Campaign to undecided voters or Oppose to steal voters from your opponents. If you are brave enough, Sleaze one of the other candidates to diminish their support but watch out it doesn't backfire. When you feel the moment's just right, take the express route to London and perform a Political Masterstroke to completely outmanoeuvre the other candidates!
When campaigning is over its out of your hands and down to the voters to decide. Remember anyone can emerge the winner on Election Day

name: OBON DERBY
description:
オボンダービー　精霊馬合体グランプリ (Obon Derby - Spirit Horse Combination Grand Prix) is a racing game from Japan, where players combine cards to form their spirit animal for the race.

Across Japan, the Obon Festival is celebrated with various events during the summer, to remember and honour family ancestors. These events include a significant ritual, crafting a cucumber horse and eggplant cow, known as shōryō uma (精霊馬, "spirit horse") or ushi uma (牛馬, "cow horse"), that act as a vessel for the ancestors to come back home and return, respectively.

In this game, players create these spirit animals in order to race them. By combining the Head, Body, and Tail cards from their hand (2 of each type), turning them up one by one and following the strategy written on the card, players advance their horse or cow along a linear course to aim for first place.

Cards have activation conditions, but there are some that advance you two squares at once, and others that move the animal in front of you back one square, creating a dead heat feeling in a horse race. The downside is that the order in which you reveal your cards during the race is fixed, so the first player tends to have an advantage. This tendency was especially noticeable when the number of players was small, because some of the actions require interference with the animal in front, and this could not be achieved with too few players.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: カニの行進〜遅すぎた覚醒〜 (Kani no Koushin Ososugita Kakusei)
description:
カニの行進〜遅すぎた覚醒〜 (Kani no Koushin Ososugita Kakusei) is a Pandemic style co-operative game from Japan. The game is packaged in a large styrofoam box of the kind used for seafood, and the theme is based on the annual migration of Christmas Island red crabs.

Players are crabs, smart ones that try to help the other crabs survive the migration and spawn successfully. The game features lavish components, including lots of crabs and special bridges to help the crabs get over a busy road, and spawning grounds in the sea to save the crabs from being eaten by sharks.

The crabs spawn in large numbers on one board (the land), and relentlessly march across the land by the most direct path. This relates to player number, so with four players, four crabs appear and move four places each turn. The players must collect logs of one colour, to be able to steer them across the bridges and to the other board (the beach). There, they must be guided into spawning pens, which the players build. But the pens might be damaged by storms.

To win the game, three pens must be built and collect three red crabs each. But if five red crabs are killed, on the road or in the sea, the players lose.

The game has had updated rules and suggestions from the publisher after it was released.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Set Collection, Square Grid, Trading

name: Horrible House Pets
description:
A card game variation of the classic cabo and golf games. You trade your cards and try to collect the not so horrible house pets. These provide you low points and that is what you overall want to achieve.
Interesting USP for this game is the fact that you initially do not know all of your four cards but only discover them during the course of the game.
great Fun!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Number

name: クソポンチ絵選手権 (Kuso Ponchie Senshuken)
description:
クソポンチ絵選手権 (Kuso Ponchie Senshuken) is a party game from Japan. Players must put together a fake research proposal to win grant money, using only 'punch pictures' left from a slide show. The best presentation wins the game, based upon votes.

Players are researchers, invited to present their projects to the Minister of Okura to gain huge government grants. But a rival in the ministry has sabotaged the event, infiltrating the hotel where the presentations are to be made and destroying all the research material. All that's left are some punch pictures on a slide show, dramatic images used to give punch to the presentations.

Players are dealt a series of punch images and keywords, and must put together a presentation for the group. For example, dinosaurs, Moses parting the Red Sea, penguins and drones becomes a research project about extinction of eels. Somehow. Players make their pitch to the group and the one voted most liked is the winner.
user summary

name: TopSong
description:
This fun and original quizz will reveal everybody’s musical talent!

When a sound is played, be the first player to recognise the melody of one of the 54 famous classical music masterpieces, or one of the 44 instruments, and find the corresponding illustrated token!

Chopin, Mozart or even Bizet… This game pays tribute to all the great classical music composers who’s works of art have been used in movies, adds or even in pop music.

This is the perfect game to enhance your musical culture and your reflexes!

—description from the back of the box

name: Sway the Jury
description:
Sway the Jury is a card game about the courtroom, but not as it is supposed to be. The crime and the evidence don't matter, only how well the opposing lawyers can manipulate the jury.

Gameplay is relatively simple: the Accused is drawn from the top of the character deck and placed on the game table, then Jurors are drawn from the same deck and each player may reject or accept Jurors until 12 are selected and placed in three columns (Guilty, Undecided, and Not Guilty). After this, 5 cards are dealt to each player - these are their Witnesses. Each Witness has a "Bias" that either helps or hurts either player's case. Then, as each player plays their cards onto the table, the cards played "sway" jurors one way or another, convincing them to support either the defense or the prosecution. After all Witness cards have been played, the Jury deliberates and the player with the highest point score based on the Jury's biases wins.

name: Obrázkové loto
description:
This game is similar to Bingo. Children are trying to fill their player board with image tiles.

Every player gets one board and then one by one takes an image tile from the draw bag. This tile is then placed over the same image on the player board. The player who first fills their whole board becomes the winner.

Suitable for children aged 3 and over to practice spatial orientation, attention and vocabulary.

name: マナとぴあ (manatopia)
description:
マナとぴあ (manatopia) is a game of social manners from Japan. Players try to score positive points by following ever more complex rules, and avoid negative points from their errors being spotted.

In Japan, handing over and receiving business cards carries an important social etiquette. There is a particular way to hand the card over, and a way to take it and handle it that shows respect to the other person.

In this game, players take turns handing business cards out and taking them. But the social rules change for each card, based on the colour of the card and the type of business. Players must try to follow the complex rules and not get caught out.

At the end of the game, the players' net scores are totalled up and the player with the most positive total is the winner, being the most socially adept and well-mannered.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Party Game

name: High Rise
description:
In High Rise you play the part of a construction company trying to win the contract to build City Hall. Each turn a player can use one of their six special action cards to place blocks, demolish buildings, collect rent, earn money, gain ownership of a building and ultimately win the contract to build City Hall.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Race

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic is about placing shapes to build mosaics. Each shape's style has two attributes: color and pattern. Players score points by matching the goal configurations in either one color or one pattern, or both. Completing a goal also allows the player to choose a shape to add to their own personal collection. At the end of the game, players will arrange their collected shapes into a mosaic of their own that will add to their score. The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Little Cities
description:
Little Cities is a light strategy game in which players add settlers to their city in an attempt to attract villagers to live there. Players simultaneously draw settler tiles and place them in their city, choosing a column number that will activate their ability. Two dice are then rolled and all activated settlers attract villagers, which players add to their city. The first player to fill their city is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Random Production, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Good Manors
description:
Players are attempting to build the best estate possible by meeting the requirements of lords and their servants. Begin by adding statues, trees and water features to your garden, then build upwards by adding rooms filled with paintings and fine furniture. Each card generates coins used to upgrade or add to your manor. When your manor is ready, score points by populating it with servants and lords. The first player to reach the target score wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Soror
description:
ソロル (Soror) is a shedding card game from Japan. Players are trying to shed a card from their hand each turn until they are down to a single card. The value of their last card is their score, and the winner is the player with the highest score after a few rounds.

The cards are numbered and are either black or white. The player must play a card following the value lead. If they play a white card, it must be higher, if they play a black card it must be lower. So following a 4, a player can pace a white 5 or higher or a black 3 or lower. If the player cannot follow, they are out of the round with no score.
user summary

name: ダンジョンクリエイター (Dungeon Creator)
description:
ダンジョンクリエイター (Dungeon Creator) is a co-operative game from Japan. Players work together to construct a dungeon with traps and treasures. Then they take turns to reveal the dungeon tile by tile. Their goal is to not discover their own treasure items until the very end, proving they are good dungeon creators.

Players are civil servants, learning the onerous task of making dungeons for adventurers. With traps and bombs, monsters and magic items, and treasure to be discovered, these civil servants must work hard to craft the best dungeons. By attending college at the Dungeon Academic Laboratory (DAL), aspiring dungeon creators who want to take the national magic civil service exam hone their skills.

In order to submit their summer assignments, the students collaborate with each other to create dungeons in order to find out how deeply they can hide treasures and how to confuse adventurers.

In the first phase, players get 20 tiles including tiles with traps, stairs and treasures in their own colours. Players take turns to build up the dungeon as a whole by placing tiles face down in a grid pattern.

In the second phase, each player takes turns turning up a tile to explore the dungeon. The player that can explore the most and be the last to turn up their own treasure is the winner, proving themselves best at design creation.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Spire's End: Rangitaki
description:
Spire’s End: Rangitaki is the next installment in the Spire's End series. Not unlike Hildegard, this game unveils the untold story of Rangitaki, another pivotal party member from Spire's End. Rangitaki is a solo choose-your-path card game that can be enjoyed with or without prior experience with the Spire's End games. It consists of three chapters, each composed of 100 Tarot-sized cards (300 total). There's minimal setup and no need for extensive statistics or bookkeeping. To play, you just begin at the top of the card deck and let the journey unfold!
​
Rangitaki is set in a swashbuckling fantasy world. It’s charming, beautiful, violent, and unquestionably unique. You won’t find another game like this anywhere.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: King Knolle
description:
Off to the field: The potato harvest is coming up! Collect the most potato triplets and become the new KING KNOLLE. The principle is simple: For three potatoes of the same variety, you receive a potato sack. And whoever has the specified number of potato sacks in front of them first wins the game. But be careful: both the evil potato thief and the potato beetle can spoil your harvest at any time... KING KNOLLE - a quick and fun collecting and annoyance game for young and old.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ab auf's Feld: Die Kartoffelernte steht an! Sammle die meisten Kartoffel-Drillinge und werde der neue KING KNOLLE. Das Prinzip ist einfach: Für drei Kartoffeln der gleichen Sorte erhältst du einen Kartoffelsack. Und wer zuerst die vorgegebene Anzahl an Kartoffelsäcken vor sich liegen hat, gewinnt das Spiel. Aber Vorsicht: Sowohl der böse Kartoffeldieb als auch der Kartoffelkäfer können dir jederzeit noch die Ernte versauen… KING KNOLLE – ein schnelles und lustiges Sammel- & Ärgerspiel für Jung und Alt.

—description from the publisher

name: Alter Schwede!: Woher wusstest du das?!
description:
In this game you have to answer 4 questions per round. For every right answer you get 1 point. The player with the most points is the winner.
—user summary

Alter Schwede! (~Gosh) is an exciting and entertaining game with more than 400 original and funny questions, where you could surprise and outplay the other players. Just ask questions, answer in turn, be amazed and have fun. Guaranteed without boring questions about dusty art era, physically expertise or forgotten monarchs.
What is the most popular hashtag of instagram? Do insects sleep? And may a goalkeeper in soccer execute a throw-in? It will not take long, before you could hear: “Gosh! How did you know that?
The Game is the perfect souvenir and real mood buster for parties, family celebrations or successful game nights.

–description from the publisher

name: Las Ligas de la Ñ: Las Pequeñas Eñes
description:
Las Ligas de la Ñ: Las Pequeñas Eñes (The Ñ Leagues: The Tiny Eñes) is a board game for 2 to 8 players that includes classic characters of Spanish literature characterized as children. The time has come for the little Don Quijote, Sancho Panza, Dulcinea, Lazarillo, Fortunata and Jacinta and others!

In this new Ñ game (the sixth in the series), players have to control one of the playable characters in order to score more points than their opponents (after summing up the points for final position and for eliminated elements). Each turn, the players use their cards or movement to eliminate other players (occupying their squares, as in chess) and make other actions.

The game's main source of inspiration is the Super Smash Bros. video game series and it maintains important similarities with both the Unmatched board game series and battle royale style games. And, therefore, it is a game related to Las Ligas de la Ñ: El juego de las fuerzas primigenias y existenciales.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Memory, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Square Grid, Tags, Variable Player Powers

name: Trupe
description:
In 1939 Girl Scouts of the United States of America came out with a card game called Trupe. It consisted of 89 cards, and the suits were fashioned after the four levels of Girl Scouting at that time — Brownie, Girl Scout, Senior, and Mariner.

The goal is to get rid of all 13 cards in your hand, by laying face upward on the board, 2 or 4 matching members of the same group; 3 or 4 sequences of the same group; 3 or 4 of one honor; or a series of the same group.

The highest hand to strive for is a TRUPE

name: Muster: Raise the Banners
description:
Muster is a card game where players compete to conquer five castles in the medieval kingdom of Muster.

Game is played in turns. On each turn, players start with five cards in their hands and have to perform exactly one action:

Play a card as a banner: Card is placed under one of the five castles (depending on the colour of the card) on the player's side (players form separate piles). The number of banner icons determine the conquering strength towards that particular castle and must be equal or greater than that of the card directly underneath.
Play a rainbow wizard: Rainbow wizards are played just like banner cards, but serve as a wild card and don't have to follow the same placement rules.
Move a rainbow wizard: Move one rainbow wizard card onto another castle's banner pile. Then draw one card from the deck a place it on top of a castle space (with matching colour).
Play a card on a castle: Place one card from the hand on top of the castle with matching colour.
Play a rainbow card as a rainbow bridge: Place a rainbow card on any banner pile regardless of the banner icons. Then place a banner card (following the usual rules) on top of the rainbow card.
Steal a rainbow card: A player can take a rainbow card previously played by their opponent if they can exchange it with a suitable banner card from their hand.


After playing one action, players draw cards to a hand of 5 cards. These can be drawn either from the deck, or the face-up piles on the five castle spaces (not banner piles).

The game ends when the draw deck runs out of cards. Then players compare their strength (number of banner icons) under each castle; the player with the higher value conquers that castle. The player who controls the most castles wins the whole game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Layering, Matching, Melding and Splaying

name: Cobain Affaire $$$
description:
A team of rival journalists are traveling around the world to collect "dossiers" about Kurt Cobain's suicide. With a limited amount of cash, they have to visit L.A., Rome and Seattle to interview the witnesses and collect the dossiers.
When a journalist has a dossier for every place (they're 5 in total) s/he has to return to the center to publish the article and win the game.
The dossiers are less than the players, so many dirty tricks have to be used to hinder other's job. Every trick has a price, but the price can be shared among the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quartett Gewalt
description:
カルトゲバルト (Quartett Gewalt) is a fast fighting card game from Japan, using the rock-paper-scissors mechanism (well known as Janken in Japan).

In this game, each player starts with the same 8 cards, Soldat (attacker), Zauberer (magic user), Ritter (defence), and two life crystals. In rock-paper-scissors style, Soldat beats Zauberer, who beats Ritter, who beats Soldat.

One player starts by placing a card face-down, picking an opponent, who also places a card face-down. Both cards are revealed, the combat resolved and the winner picks up the loser's card. Play continues this way until all but one are eliminated.
--description by user

The publisher says:
In a world where magic rather than science was developed, the civil war in this country was also extremely intense due to the power of magic. This is the story of four people fighting on the front lines.

The goal is to reduce the opponent's physical strength by playing 4 cards one on one: attack, magic, defence, and life crystal. Let's win this battle with your smart strategy!

You start with a total of 8 cards, 2 each of attack, magic, defence, and life crystal cards. The first player lays down one card and designates the second player, and when the second player also lays down a card, they all open their cards and play! The winner receives a card from the loser and the game continues.

If you lose two life crystals, you will be eliminated. The one who survives is the winner!

科学ではなく魔法が発達した世界、
この国の内戦も魔法の力によって
熾烈を極めていた。
これは最前線で戦火を交える４人の物語。

攻撃、魔法、防御、ライフクリスタル、４枚のカードを１対１で出して勝負し、
相手の体力を減らすことが目的。
あなたの頭脳的な采配でこの戦線に勝利しましょう！

攻撃、魔法、防御、ライフクリスタルのカードを２枚ずつ計８枚を持った状態でスタート。
先攻プレイヤーは１枚伏せて後攻プレイヤーを指名、後攻プレイヤーも伏せると、
一斉にオープンして勝負！勝った人は負けた人からカードをもらいゲームが続行します。
ライフクリスタルを２枚失うと脱落。生き残った一人が勝者です！
--description by publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: 【うたってみた！】うたかい！【かいてみた！】 (Utattemita! kaitemita!)
description:
【うたってみた！】うたかい！【かいてみた！】 (Utattemita! kaitemita!) is a party game from Japan, with a players trying to interpret lyrics as drawings. The title translates as something like "I tried singing it!" "I tried drawing it!".

One player is the singer, and improvises a song based on the keywords they are dealt. The other players try to draw what they think the song is about. Then the artists name their work and explain its merits, and everyone votes on their favourite. the most popular artist is the winner.

For struggling artists, the lyric cards also have simple drawings to help inspire creativity.
user summary

name: Crazy Cat Lady
description:
In Crazy Cat Lady players must fill the void in their life and cross the threshold into becoming a Crazy Cat Lady! While trying to acquire cats players must balance multiple jobs, renovate their home, and deal with general cat maintenance. lord-chub.png The entire game is represented by a deck of only 18 double-sided poker-sized cards. Players draw cards using a set amount of points each turn, based on their current job. By acquiring and playing these cards you can put them in to play to apply for more jobs, gaining more points per turn - renovate your home to house more cats - and, of course, acquire more cats! But beware - based on that same hand of cards, at the end of every turn you draw a game-changing event card that adds cat complications to your life. Can you manipulate your hand to prepare for such events, while not losing the cards you need to win? Clever hand management and forward-thinking strategy are required to win!

The game uses double-sided card system that serves multiple purposes.
