On one side of every card are various events, but once these events occur the card is flipped, revealing a new cat, renovation, or job card, and is made available for the player to gain into their hand either instantly or for a price, depending on the scenario of the event. The order of the events change up the game, allowing it to feel like a new challenge each play-through!

Plays in 5-10 minutes. Play Solo or Co-operative 2-player!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Events, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Vallée des dinosaures
description:
The players (up to 4) need to find their way to the hidden temple and bring back the precious stones back to their bases.
They will have to avoid the temple keepers, the dinosaurs and the lava from the volcano.

The winner of the game is the player with at least one explorer alive and the most precious stones in his/her backpack.
Every turn, a player can move one of his explorer (from 3 to 6 depending the number of players) 1,2 or 3 spaces on the board, then he draws an event card and follow instructions on the card (usually odd event that needs to react).
Once the only card "volcano" is drawn, no more explorers can enter the valley.

name: Polyheduel
description:
Ascendant mages from all across the known realms gather in a duel of wizardry. In their possession are the ancient Runestones of Fate, the key to victory. Harness their energy to unleash powerful spells and become a renown wizard of legends.

In Polyheduel, players will draft cards and dice in an attempt to cast the most powerful spells. When you choose your cards you will receive the corresponding polyhedral die. Carefully choose which die you'll be dueling with each round. But beware, each loss gives your opponent a chance to re-roll one of their dice, or if they're bold enough, one of yours!

name: Campus Galli
description:
On Campus Galli, a construction site near Meßkirch, Germany, a medieval monastery complex is being built using old craft techniques. The basis for this is the St. Gallen monastery plan, an organizational chart of a monastery from the 9th century. This historical basis is the foundation for Campus Galli, a game about building a monastery, either co-operatively or in competition against each other.

—description from the publisher

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Radioactive Robots Booster Deck
description:
While emitting the alpha and beta type, these brave bunny bots are worth the hype. The Killer Bunnies Radioactive Robots Booster Deck adds quite a bit (110111 cards) to your existing set plus 16 Radiation Markers, and 6 small cards!

It's the player's choice, if you decide, Robot bunnies protect those inside! In a single direction she will go, beware the devastation of pyroclastic Flo! A Neutronium Barrier destroys cards that roam, but they’ll be no groans after playing Bunny Of Thrones!

If Casting goes bad, then you’ll be glad with the appearance of a Hanging Chad. Whether you’re playing at home, or on your yacht, you’ll enjoy the protective powers of a bot! With a crushing grip and a microchip, this booster deck is quite a trip!

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Edizione Brescia
description:
Monopoly Edizione Brescia, this edition takes in the Italian city of Brescia in Lombardy.
The board shows the toponymy of Brescia: places such as Piazza della Loggia, Castello, Piazza Vittoria or Val Camonica.

name: Spoils
description:
A partnership trick-taking game designed for the video game Saltsea Chronicles.

Over the course of three hands, each team tries to collect the most points in their score pile. Gameplay is similar to other trick-takers with the following twists:

Each card rank is worth a different amount of points, from 0 to 11.
Hands start with a bidding round, where players each reveal a card, to share information with partner and determine what the Sweeper (trump) suit is.
The winner of the trick gets to collect the other 3 cards, while the loser gets to collect the winning card.
At the end of the hand, if a team collects 100 or more points, they get 0 points, and the opposing team gets a 100 points - hoarding is discouraged!


Each island community in Saltsea Chronicles has developed its own variant, which reflects their ideals.

name: Custom Football
description:
Playing football on street or take your team on grass pitch and win Championship and Legendary League.
All that by team that you create, from players jersey and club logo.
Game contains solo play with player who start on street and won Street cup, then take your first club to win Championship and L.L.
Beware you can buy and sell players through transfer window, and even train them to gain better skill, but game could end for you if you End season in minus on the club account.
Game can be played in various ways 1on1 2on2 3on3 or 6 players in same time on 3 different pitch.
Including Tournaments for 4 or 6 players.

—description from the designer

name: Belle en het Beest
description:
The players try to get Beauty, the Beast, Maurice and Mrs Potts together to celebrate the wedding in the castle. But Gaston tries to prevent this. And if the last rose petal falls, everyone loses.

The players have to collect the cards that match their mission card. To do that, they trade cards with each other or pile of cards.

name: Royal Turmoil
description:
Simple and strategic 2-5 player card game for all ages. With three Kingdoms and 24 Royals, your goal is to: Claim, Steal, Defend, Settle, and Unite as many Royals as you can and claim the most points to win the game.

Each Royal is categorized within one of three kingdoms:
the Drivel Kingdom, the Malarky Kingdom, and the Twaddle Kingdom; and each Royal has a specific point value, depending on how many resources are needed to "Settle" or complete Him or Her.

Place resources on the Royals in your possession, or play a single resource on another player's Royal to attempt to steal it. The Possessing player can defend the Royal by playing an additional resource card or slam your attempt down by playing one of the dreaded Wizard cards.

The game is fast-paced, wild and crazy and full of twists and turns. Roughly takes 30-40 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher

name: Pino Postino
description:
Oh dear! Pino Postino, the messenger falcon of the Forest Kingdom, has broken its wing. Not only is he fast and reliable, he is also often entrusted with secret missions for the royal couple. A replacement must be found quickly. Anyone who can move quickly and inconspicuously through the country is exactly the right animal here, so the stag, wild boar, rabbit, fox, and bear enter the competition: Who will be allowed to take on this important task until Pino is healthy again?

At the start of Pino Postino, everyone is given a secret animal identity. The five animal messengers are moved on their way through the various landscapes of the land by using cards. Who will behave nimbly and with foresight in the terrain? Who will be able to unmask the identities of the others and win extra points?

—description from the publisher

name: Wargo
description:
Wargo is a battle themed card game in which 2-4 players can compete for victory.

Players can build armies to attack their opponents and defences to defend those armies from incoming attacks.

When a player gathers enough complete armies he is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: GeoQuest Vol 1: An Interactive Quest Game for Family
description:
GeoQuest Vol. 1 is an Interactive Quest Game about World Nations. A fun and education focused family game suitable for all ages.
It's all about exploring the world.
With a whopping 200 countries across 6 continents, divided into 4 volumes. Each Volume comes with 100 Cards | 4 Card Sets | 50 Card Pairs.

GeoQuest encourages you to engage, discover, and match nations, fostering a fun and educational experience.

Surprise! Experience it through TWO UNIQUE GAME PLAY LAYOUT.

Why?

We wanted to innovate the classic memory game by adding interactive features that will make it more engaging and enjoyable with rich information. That's why we came up with the idea of O-BYE Quest Games, an interactive quest game that allows players to ask questions before matching the right card.

GeoQuest is among our dozens of games in the O-BYE Quest Games lineup.
All game cards follow color, shape, or number themes. In GeoQuest, each card is color-themed based on its respective country flag.

Unlike the traditional memory game where cards are facing down, our interactive quest game presents the cards facing up.
This way, players can already start familiarizing themselves with the information or images on the cards, and have a better chance of retaining them in their memory.

What's in the Game?

In each round of the game, you will need 50 cards to get started, with 25 cards for each player.

The best part? You determine game duration by opponent's cards for victory.

Each Card includes the following info: Country, Capital, Continent, Demonym, Language, Dialing Code, Flag, Map, Landmass, and Alpha 2/3 codes.

The game Layouts:
GeoQuest offers a versatile gaming experience with two distinct play layouts.

Layout 1: This is designed for compact spaces, eliminating the need for a playmat. This layout requires only the GAME CARD SETS to initiate your gaming experience.

Layout 2: This layout necessitates the use of the giant playmat for an immersive game play session. This layout enables you to seamlessly engage in all three playing modes using a single play mat.

—description from the designer

name: Witchstone Kids
description:
Little witches and wizards take to the cauldron in Witchstone Kids, but before they can brew potions, they must find the ingredients first. They are well hidden and must be revealed to match the right recipe.

Witchstone Kids is a co-operative memory game in which the position of the potion ingredients you have to find changes during the game. If you still manage to find all the ingredients for a potion recipe, you can unlock valuable bonus effects — but only when all potions have been brewed will everyone win together!

—description from the publisher

name: Dark Romance
description:
Discover "Dark Romance": Unveil Love and Danger

Embark on a journey into the captivating universe of "Dark Romance", a shadowy Victorian realm teeming with love and nocturnal creatures.

Intriguing World

Dive into a world steeped in Victorian elegance and enigmatic allure, where players embody the roles of nine distinct characters, each in pursuit of profound love or unsuspecting prey.

Players and Duration

Tailored for ages 16 and above, "Dark Romance" delivers immersive gameplay for 2 players, expandable to 3-4 players with the combination of two sets. With game sessions lasting 15-45 minutes, prepare for riveting and dynamic encounters.

Courting and Consequences

Navigate a series of dates to unravel the mysteries of your counterparts, exercising keen judgment to avoid dire consequences. Every decision carries weight, potentially sealing the fate of both love and life.

The Essence of the Game

Central to the experience are the role and scene cards, serving as your guide through romantic encounters while unveiling hidden objectives and intentions. These elements lay the groundwork for compelling narratives and strategic choices.

"Dark Romance" promises a whirlwind of emotions, blending suspense, romance, and peril. Test your tactical acumen and indulge in a singular gaming adventure, guaranteed to be a cherished addition to your collection!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Race, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Flag Break
description:
Flag Break is a tabletop game that combines the strategy of chess and the thrill of capture the flag.

The goal is to capture the other team's flag and return it to your side. If your player is caught on the opponent's territory, they go to jail and will need rescuing.

Like chess, Flag Break takes minutes to learn, but has infinite game play options.

—description from the designer

name: Rolling Tricks
description:
Rolling Tricks is a 4-Player trick-taking game designed for the Dice Deck from We Heart Games. Players will use the custom deck to determine trump for the round and play a must-follow trick-taking game with teams.

Teams help balance out the card RNG and card passing introduces from fun twists for passing to teammates and opponents.

name: Last Christmas
description:
Be as naughty or nice as you want as you fill in the blank on a card. After that, take a turn guessing who wrote what, choosing a random card from the pile or picking one someone else already guessed wrong. Whoever guesses the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Remember to disguise your handwriting. The point of the family game is to be anonymous, making it difficult for the other players to guess who wrote what.

Whether at the office holiday party, or spending time with friends & family, this card game is guaranteed to bring up fond memories while creating new ones.

name: Axé
description:
In Axé, you control a group of "Pais de Santo" (a type of Candomblé priest), trying to create the largest group of your color.
Each card has 4 quadrants with different colors of "Pais de Santo" in each. In your turn you must always place one card partially covering cards already in place on the table, trying to hide rival Pais de Santo and leaving yours visible.

name: Knights of the Real Estate
description:
You and other knights scheme to be the best knight by selling homes to the locals in the area. Show them different beautiful properties that they might like or modify the property to fit what they want. Be careful though! The other knights can go behind your back and modify your property, talk about you to the client, or even outright sell to the client from underneath you.
In this game, you and your friend(s) will draw client cards and utilize different actions cards and your character's abilities to modify the property cards you have to make or stop the sale of a property to prove you are the best knight in the kingdom.
This game comes with 3 sets of cards and trackers. The main deck will contain action and property cards. The client deck will have your clients that you sell to. Lastly you will have your character cards, or knights that you will play as.
publishers: Coalition of Gamers Geeks and Nerds

name: Frontier
description:
It’s the year 1865 and the American Frontier is full of opportunity, but you’re not the only one hoping to stake their claim. Will you farm the land and earn an honest wage? Form a gang of ruthless outlaws? Bet everything on a gold rush? Gamble your fortune? Become the fastest gun in the west? It will take a solid strategy, nerves of steel, and a little luck to survive.

No matter how you choose to earn your money - the objective is the same: Build all four of your buildings and hire the Sheriff to win.

—description from the designer

name: Fundraiser
description:
Will your reluctant donations create a charity disparity? Set ambitious goals, but be careful - if you can't raise the funds, you'll get nothing done!

—description from the book, Random Fun Generator 2

The first player will set X dice (based on player count) to create any total goal they wish to try to reach. Then all players roll their dice to see what their totals are (there is subtraction involved). If the total of all the dice (including the subtracted dice) is equal to or greater than the total goal, the first player scores points equal to the goal. The next player sets their goal and repeats the process. First player to score 30 points wins.

name: Play to Save Venezia
description: A trivia game about the history of Venice. Can be played as a card game or a board game. The trivia is in six categories: Gran Turismo, Acqua Alta, Moto Ondoso, Gondola, Vogalonga, and Storia

name: Elemente
description:
Use the original draft format to acquire cards of spirits consisting of 4 attributes and build a 24-card deck.!

Battle by combining spirit cards! The player who captures 5 of the opponent's cards wins.!

There are 60 spirit cards in total! 32 types of newly drawn illustrations! Tarot card size of 120 x 70 mm!

This is a product distributed at "Game Market 2023 Spring"。

name: Doomscroll
description:
Welcome to your first day at Doomscroll, rookie! We're an up-and-coming social media company set in a fantasy, steampunk world, and your job is to curate a feed of posts addicting enough to sell ads. The first advertising imp to sell three ads wins!

To play Doomscroll, play various Post cards to your feed to generate enough interest in one of the four topics - politics, entertainment, hobbies, and sports. Once you've got the feed full of juicy content, drop an Ad card with the same topic in there to make the sale to the user!

In addition to playing Post and Ad cards, players can use their AI (Advertising Imp) cards to either compromise their opponents' feeds or improve their own. Players can also recruit Influencers to their feeds, bringing them game-long bonuses that make it easier to sell Ads or abilities that help them boost their feeds' addicting nature.

Alright, rookie, time to shine. Let's see if you're cut out for Doomscroll!

—description from the publisher

name: Stakeout
description:
Stakeout is a light, noir detective themed game for 2-4 players.

Players are competing detectives, using their resources and wiles to successfully investigate Locations, Suspects, and Evidence. Players take turns rolling dice and committing them to Investigation cards. This represents the detectives spending time and resources to explore locations, question suspects, and examine evidence. When the dice requirement for an Investigation card has been met, the player claims that card, earns the associated points, and a bonus (based on the card type).

Players can also spend dice to go on a Stakeout or Wiretap.

Stakeout: Sometimes gathering a little intel can make all the difference. To go on a Stakeout, players discard dice to move their marker up (from 1 to 6) on the Stakeout track. On a subsequent turn, the marker can be removed to add a die of that value or lower to their dice pool.

To Wiretap, players spend 2 dice to draw 3 Investigation cards from the deck and choose 1 to keep as a Personal Lead. No other player may investigate this card.

Hot Tip cards provide opportunities for dice manipulation.

Motive cards provide end-game bonuses.

Vintage photographic art enhances the noir theme.

The game end is triggered when a player reaches 25 points. All players have one final turn and then points, including those from Motive cards, are totaled. The player with the most points is the winner.

name: Escape Game: Knight Templars
description:
The secret organization Eye in the Sky has ordered you to retrieve the lost treasure of the Temple from an old notebook belonging to Georges de Laprée.
To prevent the holy relics from falling into evil hands, you decide to start in Jerusalem.
However, this is not an "entrance exam" in the evil elevator, this is an organizational mission.
Show the organization that you're smart once again!

name: cluck-peep!
description:
Easy and gorgeous with cute frames! Amidakuji is a game that everyone knows, can be played in a small space, and the rules are simple.

If you play the road tiles in order and collect a certain number of chicks, the Amidakuji game begins. The chicks on your path will follow you, thinking you are their parent. Guide the path well and collect as many chicks as possible!

If you're not careful, the chicks you collect will fall into holes, so it's a simple party game where you have to shape the road into a convenient shape.

name: Build & Destroy: Barrinium Dawn
description:
In the dynamic realm of modern tabletop gaming, Build & Destroy ingeniously combines the strategic battles inspired by Risk, enriches the dynamic landscapes reminiscent of Catan, and infuses production elements akin to Monopoly & Hotel. These classic elements have been seamlessly updated to meet modern tabletop gaming standards, all within a thrilling universe reminiscent of the strategic depth found in Command & Conquer.

Envision players skillfully navigating ever-changing terrains, strategically building empires with a unique hidden but cheat-proof production queue, several upgrade options for units & buildings and engaging in intense battles to secure the coveted Barrinium crystals. Additionally, several expansions elevate the gameplay experience.

Expansion 1: “Innovations of War” introduces new strategies involving electricity, remote bases, storage options and additional defenses, adding layers of complexity and intrigue to the battlefield.

Expansion 2: “Uncharted Waters” takes the adventure beyond known realms, introducing boats for added strategic depth. Players can now explore uncharted territories both on land and sea, unlocking new possibilities for expansion and domination.

Expansion 3: “B75 Intellectus Unleashed” introduces a non-human player, enabling solo play against one or more non-human opponents. Face challenges that test your strategic prowess in the face of artificial intelligence.

Expansion 4: “Fresh Blood” expands the player count, allowing for a thrilling game with up to six players. Gather more allies, form new alliances, and witness the chaos unfold in an even more expansive and competitive arena.

Build & Destroy isn’t just a game; it’s a dynamic universe where strategic thinking reigns supreme. Designed for ease of learning, the game employs symbols on dashboards instead of text, ensuring a language-free experience for all players. The game strikes a perfect balance—easy to learn, yet with strategic options that make it hard to master. Are you ready to command, conquer, and expand your dominion in this modern tabletop experience?

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Exploration, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Income, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Warline: Dragons War
description:
In this solo / two-player-cooperative expansion for Warline: Maneuver Strategy & Tactics, command your army in an against-all-odds struggle versus supermassive Lesser Dragons. Dragons War features the core game's "Strategicraft" setup-is-gameplay systems and rich battlefield mechanics — and adds a quick, easy to operate Lesser Dragon "automa". As you command your army successfully, the Lesser Dragon's life is depleted, but the dragon's power grows. Gameplay is tense, strategic, tactical, and brain burning.

Also included in Dragons War are two new kingdoms (factions): the Kingdom of Blud ("Blood") and the Kingdom of Goyld ("Gold"). These kingdoms expand the mastery ceiling of Warline with their own new asymmetric abilities and play styles. The Blud kingdom sacrifices its own units to build tremendous power. The Goyld kingdom exerts its infinite wealth to hire on an endless swarm of unscrupulous mercenary troops. Blud and Goyld can be played in both the Dragons War expansion and the base game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Cooperative Game, Map Deformation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Scare BnB
description:
Scare Bnb is a microgame played by two to four players. It is a simple game based on bluffing, take-that, and memory mechanics. In this game, the players set up each other's BnBs and then try to get all their guests out first. However, if any player finds the exit before finding the key, the building rearranges itself.

This game is designed for ages five and above and is a fast, light game that everyone in the family can enjoy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Take That

name: Activity: Das gibt's ja gar nicht
description:
This is a party game from Piatnik played in teams with at least 2 players each.

The teams draw cards and have to explain up to three phrases. A phrase could be something as "sparkling water melons" which most of the time cannot be found in a dictionary whereas the pair of first two words and the last pair could. This is specifically the case in languages such as German which combines single words to much more lengthy words.

Depending on the category of field indicated beside each phrase, one player has to act (pantomime) or to describe or to paint the phrase given on a card. The team scores depending on the difficulty of the phrases. The team which gets 25 scores at first wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Communication Limits, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: SuperEchelon
description: A trick taking card game with a bicycle racing flavor. The object is to play several Grand Tours, where each hand represents a stage, and to combine the scores to win the overall classification for the series.

name: UNO Marvel Captain Marvel
description:
It's the classic matching card game you know, now with a thrilling Captain Marvel theme!

Based on the action-packed film, this UNO deck features cards with images of fan-favorite Captain Marvel characters.

Includes a special rule! The Cosmic Crush card forces opponents to replace their entire hand with new cards from the deck!

name: Guess in 10: Disney
description:
Bring home the most exciting game of questions! Ask up to 10 questions to guess the Disney character on the Game Card! Is the character an animal? Can this character fly? Does this character wear a blue gown? Think hard, ask intelligent questions, use your clue cards wisely, and be the first player to win 7 Game Cards!

—description from the publisher

name: JACK x BEANSTALK
description:
Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack. He happened to get a magic bean, and grew higher up to the sky, where he got "Gold Egg", a treasure in the sky.
Several hundred years have passed. How descendants happen to have the magic bean. They try to grow a beanstalk to reach an "Gold Egg".
Let's see who will win the egg.

name: Sau-Bande!
description:
Sau-Bande! is a smaller reimplementation of its older sibling by the same name. Once the included timer is started, the active player flips cards over from the top of the deck until a mudball card is revealed. The player then throws a cardboard mudball token to another player of their choice, who repeats the process. When the timer runs out, the active player receives a "wash yourself" token. The game ends when one player has three "wash yourself" tokens, and whoever has the fewest such tokens is the winner.

This game comes in a much smaller box than Sau-Bande! (2014). While nearly identical thematically, the bigger version comes with a board, a plastic ball, and paddles, and is more dexterity focused.

—description from the publisher

name: Streamer Standoff
description:
In Streamer Standoff, 2-4 players take on the role of budding influencers in a race to 20 million subscribers. Combine content to match current trends, building your channel and gaining subscribers. The first to reach 20M subs wins!

Each turn, play Content Cards to combine ideas into videos, attempting to match the current hot Trends in the middle of the table. Are Comedy and Gaming both significant right now? Combine your “Sibling Pranks…” card with your “...In Fortnite” card to release the perfect video and rake in subscribers.

But watch out, other players are racing to cash in on the same trends. Wait too long, and another streamer may seize your opportunity, or the winds of popular culture may shift, and what’s hot today may be over by tomorrow.

Build up your channel’s reputation and become known for certain types of content to make it easier to capture that kind of audience in the future, and snag valuable Collab Opportunities with top brands.

And don’t assume your fellow streamers will always play nice! Gain secret Influence Tokens that let you take special actions, such as sabotaging a trend, stealing a card, or hitting another player’s video with a DMCA Takedown!

Use each turn wisely and be the first to transition from internet obscurity to streamer greatness!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Drunken Battle Monster
description:
Drunken Battle Monster is the first strategic battle card game with drinking elements.

The monster and spell cards are designed in fantasy style and include graphic elements such as beer bottles, wine glasses and more. The names of the cards are also based on well-known drinks.

The goal of the game is to strengthen your own monsters and defeat your opponents' monsters with the help of these and the magic cards you hold in your hand.

As soon as all of a player's monster cards have been defeated, they lose the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Hogwarts Trivia Quiz
description: Test your Hogwarts knowledge with 200 questions.

name: 新幕 桜降る代に決闘を 新劇拡張:神座桜縁起 後篇 (A Duel for Falling Cherry Blossoms: New Act – 9th Expansion)
description:
For the standard duel, the 9th expansion provides the new Megami "Misora", new variants Historian Renri and Vanishing Oboro, redesigned versions of Second Chapter Saine and Bard Tokoyo, and balance adjustments for many other characters. The parts of the out of print season 6-2 update kit which are still in use in Season 9 have also been reprinted and included, marking the first time those components have been available with a boxed expansion.

Additionally, the expansion includes a new six-player legacy game mode (without component destruction) "Kanza Sakura Enki: Conclusion" which brings the web novel story "Kanza Sakura Enki" to its end and the tabletop RPG "Sakura Furu Yo no Mikoto-tachi" (The Mikoto of Sakura Furu Yo), which is designed with casual event play in mind.







レガシー風ストーリーモード『神座桜縁起 完結篇』
　６人プレイ推奨の協力型レガシー風ゲームです。初見で困難へと挑み、協力して対処することを第一に設計していますのでレガシー風と銘打っておりますが、コンポーネントへの不可逆的な操作はなく、リプレイも可能です。物語の集大成であり、全メガミの個別シナリオとエンディングがございます。通しでのプレイ時間は6-8時間程度。中断も可能です。
　
ライブRPG風キャンペーンモード『桜降る代のミコトたち』
　１～５回の対戦を行う形で進み、途中参加や途中離脱も可能なカジュアルなゲームモードです。プレイイベントで遊ばれることを想定しております。自分を表すキャラクターを成長させ、普段の桜花決闘では味わえないようなクレイジーな決闘で祭を盛り上げましょう。
　
標準桜花決闘
　従来の桜花決闘では新たなメガミ・ミソラ、新たなアナザー版メガミ『歴史家』レンリ、『消失』オボロ、リワークされたアナザー版メガミ『第二章』サイネ、『旅芸人』トコヨが参戦します。
　
カード更新パック
　シーズン8から更新されるすべてのカードに加え、絶版である『幕間：風花晴天』に収録されていた中で今も必要な全カードが収録されております。
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Relative Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Závod barev
description:
Závod barev is a fast-paced game in which children will have to match the colors on a picture card. They then flip the card over to a black and white picture and have to colour it according to the colours as they remember them. They get points for getting the right colours in the right place.

There are a total of 55 picture cards in the game, so there's no need to worry about boredom or repetition. Color Race also includes 6 colored markers with an erasable sponge for easy and repeated use of the picture cards.

name: Dragon Chess
description: Dragon Chess Dragon Chess is a new 3D strategy game with simple rules that can be quickly mastered by young and old, while challenging even the most serious thinkers. The true 3D gaming experience develops spatial awareness as well as strategic thinking. Players can shape the random dice squares of the board into their own kite territory by making moves, collecting points to win. The player who chooses the best path and thus has the most fields is the winner. Each of the four elements has an equal chance of winning, and each time they can take a different path to gain control of the larger field.

name: Chess Territorial
description:
Chess Territorial is a game designed as one of the chess variants. It can be played with a regular chess set, but unlike orthodox chess, there is no piece-movement nor capturing, and the goal is to occupy more territory than the opponent. No advanced chess skills are required to play, you only need to know the types of chess pieces.

RULES IN BRIEF

The game begins by placing each player's king on the board edge. Thereafter, each player on his turn places one of his/her pieces on the board.

If the piece to be placed is a high piece (non-pawn), it can be placed at any point from where it can reach any of his/her pieces on the board according to chess rules.

If the piece to be placed is a pawn, it can be placed at any point to where your high piece on the board can be moved according to the chess rules.

Once all the pieces have been placed, the score is calculated. Your score is the sum of the square on which your piece is placed and the empty square of your color adjacent to your piece. However, the score is doubled for territories containing your king and territories containing your queen.

name: Blanc Manger Coco Junior: La Maîtresse en maillot de bain
description:
Coco Rido Junior. All'arrembaggio is a family implementation of Cards Against Humanity.

The lead player in turn chooses a question with a blank space, other players must choose an answer that must be funny.

name: Conquestia
description:
Welcome to Conquestia, the ultimate battlefield where war strategy meets deck-building mastery! Engage in epic clashes, aiming to capture the flag and claim victory. With diverse theme decks featuring unique and rare cards, every game unfolds into a dynamic and strategic showdown. Prepare for a thrilling journey through the realms of Conquestia, where cunning tactics and currency management determine the victor!

In this captivating board game, participants strategically position their flags anywhere on their side of the playfield, initiating a battle of wits and tactics. Determining the first player becomes a crucial decision, setting the stage for the game by boosting their INF counter with an additional +5. Drawing a card introduces an element of unpredictability, empowering players to strategically deploy character cards on the starting line or construct buildings on their designated half of the playfield.

To further disrupt their opponent's plans, players can play Universe cards, introducing unpredictable elements that tip the balance of the game. The real excitement unfolds as players spend their characters' MB (Move Points) to navigate the field, strategically employing their unique abilities to outmaneuver and outsmart their opponents.

The ultimate goal is to capture the flag and bring it to your side of the playfield, securing victory. With a blend of strategy, resource management, and unexpected twists, this board game promises an engaging and competitive experience for players of all skill levels.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Economic, Print & Play
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Income, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards

name: The Road to Oz
description:
Choose from an extensive roster of iconic characters from the beloved tale, each vying for dominance in the ever-evolving landscape. As Oz faces new challenges, assemble your deck strategically, navigate vibrant realms, and engage with familiar faces in this enchanting adventure. Discover the secrets of Oz, harness the power of magic, and compete against friends in a quest for victory, where up to four players can experience the whimsical world and its multitude of playable characters.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Monopoly: Disney Mickey and Friends
description:
Celebrate beloved cartoon memories with the Monopoly: Disney Mickey and Friends Edition game! Great for Disney collectors, the game includes 7 exclusive pins and a beautifully designed collector's rulebook. Players go around the Monopoly board with one of the Disney character tokens: Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, Daisy Duck, Goofy, Pluto, and Chip & Dale. But watch out for the Pete token who stomps around the board and can make players pay! It also features Mickey and Friends-themed game elements, including animated short color sets, Mickey and Friends vehicles as railroads, and iconic Mickey accessories as utilities. Friendship and Magic Moments cards feature fan-favorite cartoon moments and trivia. To rack up more rent, place Little Mickey and Big Mickey markers on cartoon-themed property spaces, such as How to Fish and Get a Horse. This Monopoly game is a great gift for Disney collectors and Mickey Mouse fans, ages 8+.


MONOPOLY DISNEY MICKEY AND FRIENDS EDITION: With this Monopoly board game, Disney fans can imagine favorite cartoon memories with Mickey Mouse and all his friends
GREAT FOR DISNEY COLLECTORS: Disney fans will love the 7 exclusive pins and collector's rule book! And the board features artwork of beloved animated shorts, Mickey and Friends vehicles, and iconic accessories
DISNEY CHARACTERS: Travel the gameboard as one of 7 fun Monopoly tokens: Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, Daisy Duck, Goofy, Pluto, and Chip & Dale
BUILD LITTLE MICKEY AND BIG MICKEY MARKERS ON PROPERTY SPACES: Collect more rent by placing markers on Mickey and Friends cartoon-themed properties, such as Steamboat Willie and The Band Concert
WATCH OUT FOR THE PETE TOKEN: With each roll, players also roll the blue Pete die to move his token. Beware as he stomps around the board -- get stuck on the same space and he’ll make the player pay


—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: WARZAG WWII
description:
In WARZAG WWII step into the shoes of the most important leaders of the Second World War!
Gather resources, create your army and lead it to the conquest of enemy bases and territories. Carry out your expansionist aims until you have achieved your goal, or you have subjugated your enemies. A highly strategic game, based on turns, yet one with simple mechanics, in which the best at conquering
territory, defending their bases and managing their resources will be the winner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Catch the Leader, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Turn Order: Pass Order, Zone of Control

name: El Hombre Araña
description: A family card game featuring Spider-Man licensed by Cromy, an Argentinian Publisher. The game is a new theme for their Match 4 series, which seems to be a simplified version of Uno. The object is to avoid being the losing player -- the player who scores 100 points over consecutive games by having cards left in their hand when another player goes out.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Paradoxical
description:
Paradoxes are situations that have inexplicable or contradictory aspects. They are captivating logical mysteries. They can be situations that seem contradictory but are nonetheless true. Parrondo's paradox is one of the four key paradoxes in game theory. It was discovered by Juan Parrondo in 1996 describing a paradoxical situation where a combination of losing strategies becomes a winning strategy. This Tech Deck game exemplifies Parrondo’s Paradox. The players juggles cards from losing decks to find a winning combination, to discover a paradox. Paradoxical is the embodiment of a game theory mystery called Parrondo’s Paradox. In Paradoxical, players race to discover two Parrondo Paradoxes. Clever use of Tech Deck card effects can give a player the narrow advantage that they need to reveal a Parrondo Paradox. Put on your thinking cap and start the race!

OBJECTIVE – The objective of Paradoxical is to discover two paradoxes.
GAME PLAY – Each turn, players try to discover a paradox from two decks of cards that individually produce losing outcomes; but when combined allows for the possibility of a winning strategy.
GAME END AND WINNING – The player who uncovers two paradoxes wins.
THEME – Paradoxes in Game Theory

—description from the designer

name: Zombicide: Mission A2 – Roundabout
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A2 is an easy difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: Zombicide: Mission A3 – Wandas Revenge
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A3 is an medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: Zombicide: Mission A4 – Dougs Dream
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A4 is an medium difficulty exploration mission for the original Zombicide.

name: Zombicide: Mission A5 – Phil's Birthday
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A5 is a hard difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: Zombicide: Mission A6 – Trick or T(h)reat
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A6 is an hard difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: Zombicide: Mission A7 – House Cleaning
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A7 is an easy difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: 1855: Iron Roads in the North of Spain
description:
An economic game of investment in railway companies that operated in the Northwest of Spain throughout the 19th century, based on the “18xx” series and more specifically in 1817.

Although 1855 inherits practically all the financial mechanics of 1817 (short sales, conversions, mergers, -hostile and friendly- acquisitions and liquidations), it presents very innovative variations that break some common patterns in the 18xx. They stand out above others:


The deconstruction of the OR where trains are purchased before running, and in addition, all companies run their trains simultaneously!!!.




In the 18xx, the profit per route is independent of the size of the company, so that the profit per share reduces as the number of shares per company increases. In this game, route profits grow with the size of the company, and earnings per share remain the same.




Fixed interest Loan System based on real life mortages. Five banks offer loans at interest rates 6%, 13%, 20%, 40% and 50% and you have to return them in 6 fixed installments, but the sooner you (partially) return it, the less final interest you end up paying. (Maybe the only game implementing this realistic mechanic).



Other great changes in common 18xx are:

Players start with no money (they ask for loans and pay interest as companies)
No private companies. Every company has different initial bonuses associated with its historic location.
Pass-based player turn order for SR (instead of Priority Deal)
Non-predictable Round scheme: SR + OR + [ CR + OR ] + MR. The second [CR +OR] is not played if a phase change within the first OR; else, a train is exported.
Incremental cost of construction, and cost in border hex (1882-like)
Parallelized and simplified auctions, for presidents in foundations and buying companies. Bid based on market. Only 1 round per OR for buy/sell all converted/merged companies together.
Tiles: no asymmetric. Upgradable towns with crosses. Plain tiles without crosses.
(experimental) 2 player mode and play by teams.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Loans, Market, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Stock Holding, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Viking Route
description:
In the co-operative game Viking Route, your heroes sail a magical Drakkar to the World's Edge and beyond. Influenced by magical ravens sent by Odin to steer your course, and by the winds of Fate, you will face powerful and monstrous creatures out of the Norse mythos to fulfill your quests and prepare you for the final challenge to defeat the greatest enemy of the Gods and prevent Ragnarok!

Viking Route uses a brilliant compass-and-magnets movement mechanism first introduced by co-designer Martino Chiacchiera in his game The Faceless. The main game piece — the Drakkar — is represented by a compass, and multiple magnets (representing ravens and wind) are manipulated by players to steer the course of their ship.

This mechanism is only one of the elements under control of the players, who also have to manage the resources of the Drakkar and their hand of cards to face opponents and achieve the goals of their quests. Multiple quests, using different board layouts, are included in the game; quests can be played either independently, or as a continuing campaign, ending in a final climactic confrontation to avoid Ragnarok.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: New Forest Edition
description: The standard Monopoly game overlaid onto the New Forest National Park highlighting local landmarks and places of interest. Contains six bespoke metal tokens representing local features: pony, ice cream, tent, pig, bike, and boots.

name: Corre Simpson ...Que no Llegas!!
description: A Simpson board game made for the Spanish market in early 90's. Players take turns rolling a dice, which decide how many spaces they move and which direction they turn if they get into a plaza. The first player to arrive wins, and gets the best spot on the sofa to watch The Simpsons.

name: Boite de Ouf by Odah et Dako
description:
This box contains four different games:


"Fantastic Hot potato": Each in turn, everybody say something about original themes until one player can’t anymore.
"Fantastic Pitch": describe a movie using imposed words without getting caught.
"Fantastic Scattergories": find answers for each of the funny categories
"Fantastic Mythos": Each player has a controversial theme except 1, who must make illusion in the debate.

name: Fort Boyard: Escape Game
description:
An Escape Game in the Boyard Fort !

Two extraordinary stories (“The Key to the Fort” and “The Forbidden Room”) which will lead to a third digital investigation.

To have more clues, you can download a free app. You'll have to think, to search, and to take funny pledges !

name: X Bomber board game
description:
A Japanese board game derived from the TV series "X Bomber (Ｘボンバー, Ekkusu Bonbā)", renamed "Star Fleet" in English.

In 2300 AD, the Third Interstellar War ended, and the solar system was surrounded by peaceful days. However, suddenly the Germa army led by the alien Bradimari invaded. The Earth Defense Force intercepts it. After fierce battles, Lamia, an X-Bomber member, was taken hostage. In order to rescue Lamia, the X-Bomber pursues the Germa army.

On their turn, players spin the roulette wheel and move from the start square towards the goal square (Germa Empire). Along the way, the X-Bomber's path is obstructed by a sea of methane, a meteor shower, the Germa army, and a black hole. Also, once you enter the battle zone, you will have to fight using X Bomber cards to continue your journey. The player who successfully enters and attacks the Germa Empire wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Narcose
description:
Welcome to Narcose, the only psychotropic-themed deckbuilding game that promises fast, intense gameplay.
The concept is simple: you're two drug dealers desperate to keep control of their territory. Buy an arsenal of drugs on the darknet, make your riskiest mixes and send your opponent into a chemical hell. There are only two ways out: clinical death or the psychiatric hospital.

Dealers will take turns using the cryptocurrency provided in their base deck to buy as many drugs as they want (at least, as long as they can afford them). In addition to drug cards, there are also various perks and harm reduction cards that will be available during your games. The game ends when one of the players' life points reaches 0, or when a player manages to play 5 hallucinogens during their turn.

Bienvenue dans Narcose, le seul jeu de deckbuilding sur le thème des psychotropes, qui vous promet des parties rapides et intenses.
Le concept est simple : vous êtes deux dealers prêts à tout pour garder le contrôle de leur territoire. Achetez un arsenal de drogues sur le darknet, réalisez vos mélanges les plus risqués et faites sombrer votre adversaire dans un enfer chimique. Il n’y a que deux échappatoires : la mort clinique ou l’hôpital psychiatrique.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mafia, Mature / Adult, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination

name: Goddess
description:
Embody a lady of legend. Seek the Legendary Ambrosia Nectar to become a Goddess as you traverse the game board, collecting weapons, powers, and of course, the Legendary Ambrosia while dodging the targeted attacks of the Gods and their Titans '1-4 VS 1' from the Pantheon.

As the Goddesses, each character has different abilities to take on the challenge, that may also help your fellow teammates. But will your fellow Goddesses help you rule all, or will they want all the power to themselves?

As the opposing player, the Gods/Titans, you must use all your might to prevent the Goddesses from overthrowing your rule. You have limited Titan minions to traverse across the map to try and stop them, and an occasional god power you can send down from your pantheon to attack them as well. But once they reach the pantheon, it's a head to head battle with your deity vs theirs.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Catch the Leader, Kill Steal, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Thalara: Clash Pack Canto
description:
Clash Pack containing the characters

Canto
Myrja
Dejaren


You will be able to play Thalara as a 2 player game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: The New Game of British Empire or Trading with the Colonies
description:
Following one of three trade routes, use a steamship to deliver British goods to colonial ports while picking up goods from the colonies to bring back to London.

As each player arrives back in London they total the points earned for the goods picked up during the voyage (amount for each type of good varies) and they deduct 2 points for each of the nine starting British goods that went undelivered. First steamship back to London earns an additional 10 points.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Victory Points as a Resource

name: 戦略級三国志英雄伝説 (Heroes of the Three Kingdoms Legend)
description:
Each general can command three types of units: crossbowmen, infantry, and cavalry, and can freely organize his army according to his own personalities.
Each player places the units on the tactical display and then resolves battles. A general who is supported by a "Strategist" has a real advantage.
The player who takes the first turn chooses whether to move one row and attack, or move two rows without attacking.

Crossbowmen can attack at long range, but they can only hit at a total of 10 or more. So if a general with a high attack modifier commands them, he can hit the enemy army unilaterally at long range, except if the enemy general's defense modifier is high.
Cavalry can only attack at a short distance, but it can hit at a total value of 6 or more. If the enemy general's attack modifier is high, there is a danger of being hit unilaterally while the fighting distance is still far away. However, if a general with a high defense modifier is able to close the distance before taking damage, he can inflict a heavy blow on the enemy force at once.
Infantry can attack at medium range and have a total hit value of 8 or more, so they can play a role in any battle, making them easy to use even for unexperienced players.

Each player must organize his army while keeping an eye on the characteristics of the enemy generals and their army formations.
Most military commanders are randomly drawn from the cup each turn.

Contents
* 198 counters
* 1 full map

Game Period: between Cao Cao's promotion of the Emperor and Liu Bei's entry into Shu

Playing time: 2 to 3 hours
Number of Players: 2
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest): 3

(translated and adapted from publisher's description)


戦略級
三国 three kingdoms
志英雄伝説

name: Czółko: Drużyny
description:
Czółko: Drużyny is the team version of the party game Czółko.

Before the game, divide the players into two teams. Each team chooses its Captain. Every Captain's job is to help their team guess the slogan from the card and make sure they beat the other team at doing so. Captains draw a card with a category and 3 slogans. Then, each gives a clue - either by saying a sentence, singing, gestures, or pantomime. The opposing team always guesses first, and the team of the active Captain goes second. After guessing the password by any team member, its Captain receives 1 Victory Point. The team with the most points is the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Anou (アノウ)
description:
In the age of provincial wars, there used to be a group of experts called Anou who are all true masters of masonry. Their speciality was laying the fieldstones to form a stonewall for a castle. “Listen to the voice of the stone, and follow them”. Only a few who could master the art of masonry were considered to be a part of it.

Anou is a trick taking game. Players become a member of Anou, laying stones in front of themselves to form a stonewall. You don’t want your wall to be too high nor too low, go precisely as you planned or else you will get a penalty. Whoever scores the most by the end of the game becomes a master builder of Anou.

name: Foffa Miljøagent
description:
Foffa Miljøagent is an easy family game for ages 5+. Players move around in Foldvik Familiepark (a Norwegian theme park) and help pick up litter. They gain tokens for throwing the trash in the correct bins, placed around the board.

Players can take a ride on "Tøffen Tog", a train going through the theme park or they can use the water slides to get faster to other locations.

The winner of the game is the player that has the most points on their tokens when all the litter is picked up.

Foffa Miljøagent is a fun game for everyone and will teach children about recycling.

—description from the designer

name: Das große Verkehrsspiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. Each player constantly drives with 3 vehicle symbols on a three-lane road like in normal traffic. The driving speed is determined by rolling dice. Vehicles driving too fast or too slow will be fined. The player has the opportunity to earn amounts of money through skillful driving and answering questions about traffic rules.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zombicide: Switch City Campaign
description: Switch City is a 6-Mission campaign meant to be played with the Zombicide Kickstarter Abomination pack, available as print and play.

name: Superfight: NYCC 2016 Exclusive Promo Pack
description:
A mini expansion of Superfight cards from New York Comic-Con 2016. Total of 18 cards.

Card List:

Characters:

The Amazing Spider _____ (Draw a random character card)
All the Rats in New York
All the Tourists in Times Square
Giant Albino Sewer Alligator
The Mets
The Yankees
The Cast of Hamilton
Donald Trump (As he sees Himself)
New Jersey

Attributes:

Wearing Armor made of Porcupines
Can Fly... But only at the speed of New York Traffic
Riding in a Taxi
Has Cobras instead of Arms
Armed with a Honey Badger on a Stick
Armed with Infinite Dollar Pizza Slices
Armed with a cannon that shoots big apples
Anything they touch turns to turns to bagles (Yes, this is how it's actually written. Actual card should be: "Anything they touch turns to bagels")
Piloting a flying robotic _____ (Draw a random character card)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Zombicide: Mission A8 – A Sea of Tents
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A8 is an medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: Zombicide: Mission A9 – A Stupid Bet
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A9 is an medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: Zombicide: Mission C1 – Apartment Assault
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C1 is a Hard difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by Billy Hayes

name: Zombicide: Mission C2 – Under Siege
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C2 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by STANISLAS GAYOT

name: Zombicide: Mission C3 – Car Wash
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C3 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by CHRISTOPHE MÜLLER DE SCHONGOR

name: Zombicide: Mission C4 – Save the Cheerleader
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C4 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by RÉGIS LUTTER

name: Zombicide: Mission C5 – Rescuing Samantha
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C5 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by MARC DECLAIS

name: Zombicide: Mission C6 – Shortcut
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

Designed by RAFAEL ROCA

name: Zombicide: Mission C8 – Belly of the Beast
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C8 is a hard difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by MARCUS POLHMANN

name: Madorite
description: Madorite is a must follow trick-taking game themed around architectural design. It is broken into two phases -- architecture and contract. In the architecture phase, players play a hand of tricks to win cards with floor plans of rooms on them. In the contract phase, players try to use these plans to win contracts with clients. The player who won the best contracts wins

name: Quiet House
description:
The wandering ghosts in search of refuge discovered an abandoned mansion. Inside the old and cozy mansion, the ghosts were all content, but they had different ideas about the arrangement of five statues scattered throughout the grand hall. To place the statues to their liking, the ghosts began moving them around at random. Can they find a placement that satisfies everyone before daybreak?

Quiet House is a co-operative game in which players take turns moving statues to create arrangements that meet the goals. At the start of the game, goal tiles are assigned, indicating how the statues should be placed for a victory. However, players have only partial information about these goals and cannot communicate with each other regarding them. Success in the game relies on careful observation of others' moves, making guesses about the goals they know, and collaborating effectively to achieve the correct arrangement promptly.

—description from the publisher

name: Whispering Woods
description:
Forests are magical places where different spirit animals live...

In Whispering Woods, you have to build trails for your spirit animals and thus complete missions that will benefit you with victory points. On each turn, you can collect two landscape tiles for your forest, or one quest tile with a particular path to be able to score in the future. You will also be able to complete several chain rides with your animals, which allows you to obtain career goals that will benefit you even more.

Grow your forest, and walk its trails with your spirit animals. Good planning will allow you to hike several trails consecutively — but take care as a planning mistake can cost you dearly.

Whispering Woods includes a mode for solo play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Chaining, Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Table Top Miniatures Game – Martell Spearmen
description:
In the spectrum of armor versus mobility, House Martell has gone to one extreme. Though lightly armored for line-of-battle troops, House Martell's Spearmen are fleet-of-foot and trained in mutual support tactics. Their signature spears stop enemy charges cold, and their superior numbers allow them to form the bulk of a Martell battle line. This makes for a unit that can, with sufficient numbers, hold the line and rapidly react to events unfolding on the battlefield. That said, a commander would do well to keep them supported at all times, allowing them to do their best work.

Plastic components.

Approximate Height:
Bannerman: 56mm
Captain: 50mm
Spearman: 40mm

Contents:
13 Miniatures
‣ 1 Bannerman
‣ 1 Captain
‣ 11 Spearmen
1 Attachment Card
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Dreadfort Archers
description:
While some soldiers in House Bolton would prefer to get up close and personal with their enemies, able to deal out their devastating wounds where they can see the carnage, an army without ranged support is a sitting duck.

Dreadfort Archers aim to inflict maximum terror and damage, as they loose their arrows on the enemy, even when they're engaged in close-combat with allied forces. The ensuing ruthless volley can be truly devastating as opponents must defend against both the Bolton forces in front of them and the arrows raining down. If a few allies get hit, well, that's just the price one pays out on the battlefield.

Plastic components.

Approximate Height:
Archer A: 38mm
Archer B: 47mm
Archer C: 38mm
Archer D: 45mm

Contents:
12 Miniatures (30mm Bases)
‣ 12 Archers (4 Sculpts)
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game –  Dreadfort Spearmen
description:
House Bolton's main troops, their Spearmen, are all indoctrinated in the House's combat ethic of causing fear and panic among enemy ranks at every opportunity. Though not heavily armed or armored, they are still a fearsome unit on the battlefield. Their helmets and shields have spikes welded to them which are designed less for raw combat and advantage and more to sow fear among enemy ranks as row upon row of spiked horrors bear down upon them.

Spearmen train to aim for points on enemies to inflict terrible wounds but not necessarily kill their opponent, leaving many prisoners for the House to exercise their cruel sports upon.
Plastic components.

Approximate Height:
Bannerman: 56mm
Spearman A: 59mm
Spearman B: 42mm
Spearman C: 52mm
Spearman D: 38mm

Contents:
12 Miniatures (30mm Bases)
‣ 11 Spearmen
‣ 1 Bannerman
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and pre-assembled.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Pat Gonu
description:
This game is one of many traditional “Gonu” or “Kono” - small board games from Korea. Pat Gonu is often referred to as “Hobak Gonu” which means “Pumpkin Game.” This is probably due to the round shape in the center of the board.
The origins of the game are unknown, but there are artifacts that go back to the tenth century in North Korea, and further references from the 14th century in the southern part of the peninsula. The name “Pumpkin Gonu” is a more recent name for the game - only about 500 years old.

The Components and Setup —
In addition to the board, each player gets three pegs of a unique color. Our version includes black and yellow pegs. These three pegs begin the game on the straight lines nearest the player.

The Objective:
By moving your pegs around the pattern of holes on the board, you attempt to trap your opponent so they cannot move.
Choose a first player any way you like.
Each peg moves one space per turn following the lines.
Once a piece has left the starting row - the straight line of three spaces - the peg cannot return to that row.
NOTE 1: Some rules do not include this rule. Players should agree on this before the game starts.
NOTE 2: Some also prohibit entering your opponent’s starting row, which is generally pointless anyway except to prolong the game.
The last player to move a peg is the winner!

name: Bell Towers
description:
Stack your bells to build the most impressive towers, but you will only score big by following the logic cards on the table and finding efficient stacking combinations. Lay four cards on the table and try to stack your bells according to the rules on at least three of the cards. Play quickly but carefully as mistakes will benefit your opponent!

The variable difficulty levels make the game great for the whole family or players of different ages.

name: Too Many Kisses & Too Many Hugs
description:
A Yahtzee style dice game in which players take on the role of an agent whose mission it is to counter bad mood with a ton of affection.

Victims find themselves in the most dishearteningly mundane situations, just wishing they were anywhere but there! Intercept their frustration with affection before it is too late and they FLIP OUT going rampage on unsuspecting bystanders.

On your turn you roll regular d6 together with special d6 and you have to set at least one die aside after each roll, until you run out of dice. If you match the current challenge you can dump kisses & hugs on the current victim to turn around their foul mood.

Special dice have different effects that allow agents to either manipulate their pip-dice, or to collect more love tokens they can then shower the person with that is their current mission.

You can also use you your tactics officer's ability or your equipment for a limited number of times to get back-up and improve your rolls.

If things get really tough! Try triggering a Love-Burst to reset your equipment and boost your agent's charm!

Who's the most caring and loving agent at your table?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hot Potato, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Variable Player Powers

name: Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Heroes 1
description:
The cruelty and sadism exhibited by House Bolton is not only reserved for their enemies. The leaders of their troops can be just as harsh to their own subordinates as they are to captured soldiers. Steelshanks Walton, Skinner, and Sour Alyn all have their own special forms of cruelty they inflict on others.

Ben Bones, Tybald, and Damon Dance-for-me perform their atrocities with sadistic glee. However, even they must cautious, for if they ever gain the ire of those above them, they would not be safe from having their own brutal technique unleashed upon themselves. Life in House Bolton is always on a knife edge, sometimes literally so.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Shady Business
description:
The Shady & Cutthroat Side of Beach Umbrella Rental.

It's your last summer before university, and you spend the sunny days working in the Umbrella Rental Hut at the local beach. One day, you boss announces a contest for you and your coworkers: "Whoever rents out the most umbrellas, with me as the judge," she adds, "wins some big bonuses!" You're the best umbrella rental agent on this entire coast, and it's going to be a big payday for sure!

Shady Business is a 1-4 player game where players bid to cordon-off sections of the beach, and while they do they can also sneak an umbrella of their color into that section too!

Tiles show cordoned-off ropes to mark different sections of beach. When a section is completely closed, the boss will judge the section and give bonuses (points) to the player, or players, that have the most umbrellas in that section.

However she also gives a bonus to the player who closes the section, based on the number of unique beachgoers in there; the more unique, the more money earned!

The tiles that you place also are used for bidding. Each has a number going from 1-15. The highest number bidder goes first, placing their tiles and adding an umbrella. The beach begins to fill with umbrellas, and you must follow the rule: You cannot place an umbrella in a section already with at least one umbrella... but if you can set it to the side, and then sneakily connect it to an already existing section... NO, that would be SHADY!

Or wait... do you know what would be even shadier?! If you bid the highest, you instead can move one of your umbrellas into a section, even if there are umbrellas there. OR HOW ABOUT... if you bid the lowest, you can decide to put up to two umbrellas on your tile.

Score as many bonuses before the day is out, then you'll have enough money to buy at least one textbox for classes this fall!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Bids As Wagers, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Forklift Frenzy
description:
Start the round by drawing a card. Your goal is to stack the barrels to match the challenge card and then place that stack on your platform first using ONLY one of the two toy forklifts. Can you win the most cards AND keep your warehouse accident-free? Classic vehicle play becomes a thrilling stack-and-match challenge with Forklift Frenzy - no forklift license required!

Forklift Frenzy
Game of stacking barrels with toy forklifts
Encourages fine motor skills, spatial reasoning, sequencing skills, problem-solving
Use the toy forklifts to stack the barrels so they match the challenge card
Press down on the forklift to lower the forks, release to lift barrels
Forklifts roll on free-rolling wheels
First to create a matching stack and place it on their platform wins the challenge card
Win the most cards to win the game!
Includes 2 forklifts, 2 platforms, 12 barrels, 40 challenge cards
mechanics: Race, Real-Time, Stacking and Balancing, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Grab that Donut
description:
Serve up some yummy fine motor fun!

Pile all the donuts onto the table, set out the spinner, and give each player a pair of tongs and an order card. Order up! - It's time to play!

On each turn, players spin the spinner to choose a donut shape and color. Next, they have to find a donut that matches the spinner. Then, if that donut matches a donut on their order card, they get to grab it with the tongs and place it on their card.

The first player to completely fill their order card wins the game!

Motor and matching skills will grow fast with the Grab That Donut Fine Motor Game.

Grab That Donut Fine Motor Game
Game of grabbing and sorting donuts
Encourages fine motor skills, matching skills, logic, imaginative play
Spin the spinner to decide on a donut shape and color
Find a donut that matches the spinner
If the donut matches one on your card, grab it with the tongs and place it on your card
First player to completely fill their order card wins the game!
Includes 24 mini donuts, 4 sets of tongs, 10 order cards, donut spinner
Instructions included
Packaged in a sturdy storage box
High-quality materials - Exceptional play-and-learn experience

name: Hot Pot
description:
An unpredictable and intense game of skill, where speed in picking out ingredients is the most important. Sounds simple? Think again. You can use only tongs and your nimble hands!


Grab the tongs in your favorite color.
Put the pasta and ingredients into the bowl.
Draw a card and check which ingredients you need.
Fish them out of the bowl as quickly as you can. Everyone plays simultaneously.
Be the first to grab the ingredients from 5 cards to win!

name: Murder at the Atelier
description:
The New Year's Eve party at Atelier Augustin was a grand celebration, until famed Creative Director Ace Augustin turned up dead!

Murder at the Atelier is an escape room style puzzle game. Across the 18 tarot cards are 10 puzzles that can be solved in any order. Work together to solve the puzzles and catch Ace's killer.

Extra material: We recommend that you have pens, a notepad, and scissors on hand when you play the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Viking Chess
description:
Viking Chess is a smaller version of the game "Hneftafl". You can play multiplayer with 2-3 players. The objective is to get all your pawns out of your base and to the middle valhalla. Odin in base is +5, enemy in base is +2 and having your own viking is +1. Everybody is control of Odin who is in the center.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Legacy Game, Player Elimination

name: Big Monster: Big Mama
description:
The Big Mama expansion contains 16 tiles and allows the player to create the Big Mama Monster in as many tiles as desired and score the visible points.

4 x Big Mama Head
4 x Big Mama Body
4 x Big Mama Tail
4 x Baby Monster
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Big Monster: Giraffe
description: The Giraffe expansion contains 12 giraffe tiles. Players can assemble two giraffe tiles and create different pairs of scoring conditions.

name: Big Monster: Ice Expansion
description: The Ice Expansion contains 37 tiles and allows new mutations (which could be a 3-headed bear!).

name: Feral State Chapter 2
description:
Feral State Chapter 2 continues what Feral State started, only this time you can also play cooperativly.
Again your mission is to reach the basement of the house and eliminate the Zombies all over the postapocalyptic town. On your way down you will fight zombies using unique battle system, which involves both luck and skill.

Feral State Ch. 2 is a two-page PnP dice game. You roll a D6 to attack and the choose which body part you want to hit on a "pizza wheel", where you can choose the rolled number or the opposite side of the "pizza wheel" and do damage to.

You can also get additional rolls to defeat each zombie. You can also collect items like weapons and medikits in order to better overcome the zombies and survive for the boss battle in the basement.

name: Empire Builder: Europe
description:
Empire Builder: Europe invites you to embark on a strategic rail-building journey across the European continent.

The game board unfolds to reveal a map of Europe, segmented into dots. Armed with grease pencils, players strategically connect these dots, constructing an intricate network of railways that spans mountains, rivers, and cities.

Dive into the challenge of managing your cash as you deliver commodity-laden trains across the continent. A stack of demand cards dictates the values of transporting specific goods to their designated cities. The farther the distance traveled, the greater the financial rewards. Choose your routes wisely, balancing the demands of efficiency and profitability.

As your rail empire grows, so does your earning potential. Expand your network, link major cities, and adapt your strategy to the dynamic market demands. Will you focus on high-yield cargo over long distances, or opt for shorter, more frequent deliveries to build a steady income? Watch out for disasters that might hit—floods, storms, strikes, and more await in the demand deck.

Empire Builder: Europe combines the excitement of strategic planning with the dynamic challenges of economic development. The ultimate goal is to amass a predetermined fortune and successfully connect almost all the major cities, solidifying your status as a rail tycoon.
mechanics: Connections, Crayon Rail System, Events, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Monopoly: Brasil
description: The time has come for you to show off your entrepreneurial and negotiating skills in Brazil. Monopoly Brazil has a special design that will provide exciting and surprising moments with friends and family. Travel from Roraima to Porto Alegre and earn money by investing in tourism and hotels. But be careful, because the dice and the cards can bring you face to face with some unforeseen events and disrupt your business, after all, only one will end the game successfully. Analyze the opportunities, make the right choices and take the risk to win!
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Zombicide: Mission C9 – Gauntlet / Extraction
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C9 is a two-part medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by ARND FELTEN

name: Zombicide: Mission C10 – Moving On
description:
