Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C10 is a medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by TROY MACKAWAY

name: Zombicide: Mission C11 – Flooded with zombies
description:
Designed by players for the Kyoko mission contest, and later published by the original studio, C missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

C11 is a hard difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

Designed by MATT HIBBARD

name: زیرخاکی (Zirkhaki)
description:
In Zirkhaki everyone acts as diggers, digging for treasures and trying to gain wealth by collecting as much treasure as possible. It works for 2 - 4 players, but combining two sets of cards can extend that from 5 - 8 players. First, the players will make a "discard" pile by removing the lowest value card from each type and putting them aside. Then they will shuffle all the rest of the cards and put them on the other side of the table, creating a "dig pile". The distance between the dig pile and the discard pile is the "dig site".

Then each player will start their turn by flipping a card from the dig pile onto the dig site. Each card has a special power that can help the player, or make it harder for them. The player then keeps on flipping cards and exacting their powers for as long as they can, or want. If a similar card is flipped up (for example if a coin card has been flipped earlier onto the dig site and then another coin card is flipped), their turn is over and they have to put everything in the dig site onto the discard pile. If they stop before getting a similar card, they will gather the cards in the dig site and put them in front of themselves, creating their "treasure pile".

The game ends when the dig pile is emptied. Then each player will calculate their scores by counting the highest number of each card that they own, and the player with the highest point wins. After a few plays, when players are a bit more advanced, they can use "special cards". They will shuffle the cards and give each player a card. Each card has a power that corresponds with an item, and they can use those powers in combination of those items.

name: Tudefjæs
description: Played while watching a football match on tv. You are placing bets on the outcome in the match. Gaining points when your bets come true. Most points win.

name: Word 4 Word
description:
The deck of letter cards is evenly dealt among the players. On their turn a player reveals the top card of their deck, and either leaves it face up on the table, or uses it with one or more cards already on the table to make and keep a word.

When all cards have been played, players total the points on the cards they kept, and the highest total wins.

name: Florilegium
description:
Florilegium is a card game that showcases the botanically accurate illustrations of Elaine Shimwell. Players are artists building their collection of botanical art over the year.

Players draw a card from either the draw deck or the discard pile and then play a card to the correct season.

At the end of the game, the player who has the lowest total value in points across both the seasons and the remainder of their hand is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection

name: Zone of Distrust
description:
Your country was always hanging by a thread, perpetually at war with neighbouring regions. Now the age of resisting has ended, it's time to end the disagreements once and for all... only one must remain.

In Zone of Distrust, 2 players will compete for control over the Contested Territory; the first player to enter the opponent's homebase wins.

The game is played in turns, where each player will be able to take up to 3 actions, which vary from enlisting new troops to building supply depots to rallying foreign support.

The main resource, supplies, doubles as research indicators: when researching an upgrade, the cube on the player mat will be removed, now able to be used as a resource! Also, each mat has different upgrade spaces.

All of this, coupled with simple dice combat, 3 different maps and intuitive graphic design will make for a great gaming experience for you and your friends. Have fun!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: ATO Annual: Stalingrad – VoV
description:
Reprint of earlier boxed game on the city fight in Stalingrad.

This page is for the re-print that ATO is doing of the OOP game from Last Stand Games.

We set the page up in the hopes of getting BGG to 'notice' it and include it on their "Kickstarters ending this week" listing.

Failed.

There is plenty of good material and discussions at the original page, and I believe continued stuff should keep on living there.

You will find the original game (and much content) here:

https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/154472/stalingrad-verdun...

AND YOU CAN PRE-ORDER THE GAME FROM ATO HERE:

https://www.atomagazine.com/Details.cfm?ProdID=194

name: Age of Pericles
description:
Embark on a new epoch of ancient Greek history with Age of Pericles, the gripping continuation of Pillars of Heracles. In this strategic board game, set against the backdrop of the Classical Period, you'll navigate the intricacies of political and military dominance as you vie for supremacy in Hellas.

Forge alliances, lead your city-state through political upheavals, and deploy military tactics to secure your legacy. Featuring innovative gameplay blending area control, deckbuilding, and political maneuvering, Age of Pericles offers a rich tableau of strategic choices and historical immersion.

Will you emerge as a statesman of wisdom or a master tactician of war? The fate of your city-state rests in your hands as you shape the destiny of the ancient world. Delve into the age of Pericles, where every decision resonates through history, and leaves an indelible mark on the pillars of power.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Network and Route Building, Rondel, Variable Player Powers

name: Sons of Heracles
description:
Unveil the grand tapestry of Hellenistic history in Sons of Heracles, a standalone board game rooted in the mechanics of Pillars of Heracles. Forge the path of the Argead dynasty, chart the epic conquests of Alexander the Great, and navigate the complex web of successor states. From the rise of Macedon to the sprawling Hellenistic period, this strategic experience immerses you in the dynamic interplay of empire-building, diplomacy, and war. Craft your legacy, encounter historical figures, and lead your civilization to greatness in this captivating journey through one of antiquity's most transformative epochs.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rondel, Variable Player Powers

name: Cthulhu Rises!!
description:
CTHULHU RISES!!

It's been centuries since the Cultist's first attempted to open a portal to bring Cthulhu into Our World. Their first attempt thwarted by the Witches Council long since unheard from after years of persecution. The punishment for their failure has left their families cursed with lycanthropy. The rituals have finally been rediscovered and the families have dispersed around the world in an attempt to open portals for Cthulhu to rise up, claim this world, and end their curse. But the Council has not forgotten and once again they set out to end the Cultist's nefarious plan.

In this game you will take on the role of either superstitious peasants fearful of the supernatural, a member of the Witches Council pledged to protect Our World, Cultists bent on watching the world go mad under the rule of Cthulhu, or Cthulhu ushering the group through the games events.

Each round the cultists will perform their rituals attempting to succumb peasants to Cthulhu. The witch will then attempt to thwart their treacherous schemes. Finally the peasants will attempt to ferret out the traitor.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Subterfuge: The Board Game
description:
In the depths of the ocean tensions are rising. Neptunium, a rare new element with unprecedented uses, has been found in abundance under the ocean floor. In a frenzy, industrial superpowers race to the depths, sparking a fierce competition for control, development, and resources. Limited in what each individual has access to alone, these industry leaders forge strategies and pacts, each hoping to be the first to collect enough Neptunium.

In Subterfuge, players control Industry superpowers competing for Neptunium (Np) by drilling new mines across the ocean floor, and by stealing existing mines of other players by force. Balance control of generators, providing you with electrical output, and factories, which produce your units used for combat. Excellent strategy will set you ahead of the pack, but diplomacy is where the game is truly won. Form alliances with other players, negotiate trades, and when the time is right, break all ties to shoot ahead for a victory!

Subterfuge is based off of the hit mobile game of the same name (which already plays like a tabletop game). Like the mobile game, turns are taken simultaneously for all players and actions play out in real time! Each player will also be hiring random specialists throughout the game to alter the gameplay and give special abilities.

The game features incredible artwork based directly off the game's minimalist style, giving players a truly authentic experience!

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Negotiation, Real-time, Territory Building
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Negotiation, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Ludo Launch
description:
This is budget company Games Hub's version of Sorry Sliders.

It's a dexterity game where you try to get your pawns home by shooting ball bearing loaded disks at a scoring field.

name: A Town Called Despair: Zombies Expansion
description:
Add zombies to your Wild West experience in A Town Called Despair! The Zombies expansion adds a whole new macabre dimension and new play modes to A Town Called Despair! Comes complete with 16 zombie miniatures in a variety of poses, 4 new zombie cards, the three-storied town church, the town cemetery, illustrated rule book, and terrain assembly guide.

Zombies can be played in Hoard Mode where the zombies are controlled by a different player each turn, or in Player Mode where the zombies are controlled by a single player for the entire game.

Zombies move slower then their living counterparts, are easy to hit, but hard to kill. And each time another outlaw dies, another zombie takes his place. If you're wounded and they surround you, it might be better to take the easy way out.

—description from the designer
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Horde of Monsters
description: Each player gets four 7x7 maps: Castle, Forest, Desert, Dungeon (in ascending difficulty), a pair of d6, and a hero token. Ten cards are randomly taken from a poker deck to create the Treasure pile. Each round, a treasure card is drawn, and everyone rolls their dice, assigning one to hero movement and the other to a chart of polyominoes that will be drawn on the map to try to collect treasures or kill monsters. After ten rounds, everyone adds up their bonuses to see who has the highest score.

name: Assassin's Creed: Das letzte Geheimnis
description:
REVEAL LEONARDO DA VINCI'S LAST SECRET WITH EZIO AUDITORE! Amboise, 1519: Leonardo da Vinci writes his Last Will and Testament on his deathbed. And it concerns you! Take on the role of Ezio Auditore and his students and follow the clues left behind by the famous artist and inventor throughout Europe. Will you succeed in finding all the Assassins' hidden hideouts?

In this box:
3 repeatable tasks with 9 possible variations
9 cities to explore and travel through Europe
200 puzzle cards that bring you closer to the story and the solution to the puzzles
2 booklets to accompany your adventures

The scenarios can be played several times as no cards need to be folded or painted. However, there is only one solution per adventure.

—description from the publisher (translated)

LÜFTET MIT EZIO AUDITORE DAS LETZTE GEHEIMNIS VON LEONARDO DA VINCI! Amboise, 1519. Auf dem Totenbett verfasst Leonardo da Vinci seine Letzten Willen. Und der betrifft euch! Schlüpft in die Rolle von Ezio Auditore und seinen Schülern und folgt den Hinweisen, die der berühmte Künstler und Erfinden in ganz Europa hinterlassen hat. Wird es euch gelingen, alle versteckten Zufluchtsorte der Assassinen zu finden?

In dieser Box:
3 wiederholbare Aufgaben mit 9 möglichen Varianten
9 Städte erkunden und durch Europa reisen
200 Rätselkarten, die euch der Geschichte und der Lösung der Rätsel näherbringen
2 Hefte zur Begleitung eurer Abenteuer

Die Szenarien können mehrfach gespielt werden, da keine Karten geknickt oder bemalt werden müssen. Es gibt jedoch nur einen Lösungsweg pro Abenteuer.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Video Game Theme

name: Der Schatz der Templer
description:
ESCAPE GAME: THE TREASURE OF THE TEMPLARS

900 years after the founding of the Order of the Knights Templar in 1129, a notebook is found in Midlothian, Scotland. It was written by Georges de Laprée, one of the last knights of the order, and it begins with the following words: "Rosslyn, 1341. I, Georges de Laprée, have traveled the world to protect the treasure of the Templars from envious and wicked men, according to the orders I received at the beginning of the year 1307. It is neither a lie nor excessive pride to write here that the treasure cannot be recovered by anyone other than a knight of the Order."

It is your task to find the Templar treasure before it falls into the wrong hands. Your search begins in Jerusalem. Good luck!

Contents: - 99 puzzle and clue cards - a ruler and a yardstick to determine your route - a map to show you the way - the notebook of the last knight of the order, Georges de Laprée

—description from the publisher (translated)

ESCAPE GAME: DER SCHATZ DER TEMPLER

900 Jahre nach der Gründung des Ordens der Templer im Jahre 1129 wird im schottischen Midlothian ein Notizbuch gefunden. Es wurde von Georges de Laprée verfasst, einem der letzten Ritter des Ordens, und es beginnt mit folgenden Worten: „Rosslyn, 1341. Ich, Georges de Laprée, habe die Welt bereist, um den Schatz der Templer vor Neidern und Gottlosen zu bewahren, gemäß den Befehlen, die ich zu Beginn des Jahres 1307 erhielt. Es ist weder eine Lüge noch übermäßiger Stolz, hier schriftlich niederzulegen, dass der Schatz von niemand anderem als einem Ritter des Ordens wiedergefunden werden kann.“

Es ist eure Aufgabe, den Schatz der Templer zu finden, bevor er in falsche Hände fällt. Eure Suche beginnt in Jerusalem. Viel Erfolg!

Inhalt: - 99 Rätsel- und Hinweiskarten - Lineal und Gradmesser, um eure Route festzulegen - eine Karte, um euch den Weg zu weisen - das Notizbuch des letzten Ordensritters Georges de Laprée

—description from the publisher

name: Normandy Invasion: Standard Modern Wargame
description:
Standard Modern Wargame (諾曼第登陸戰:標準現代戰棋) is associated with the publication of Reader's Digest "World War 2 Record" in 1982.

The battle system depends on the strength and lifespan of each chess piece. And the weather and terrain also have a significant influence.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Bio Bay: The Biomagnification Game
description: In Bio Bay, students play as tuna and anchovies trying to collect as many tokens (food) as possible. There are plentiful zooplanktons for the anchovies, but you might get caught by a tuna! And anyone could get caught by the Fishing Boat (the teacher) at any time! How long can you survive? Can you collect the most tokens?

name: Richterskala
description:
Richterskala is a game of creating structures and seeing how well they withstand earthquakes. Game is played between two people (or two teams). Each team has a set of cards (0,0,1,1,2,2,3,4,5,6,7,8) and chooses 11 blocks. There is also a wooden "robot" for each team.

Rounds alternate between teams. On their "turn", a team lays down 1 or 2 cards facedown and chooses a number of bricks for the build. Each team then builds a structure with the stated number of bricks. The box is placed on the board blocking view of the building. The robot may be added in addition to the bricks. The team with the tallest structure before the earthquake gets a point. The card(s) are revealed, determining the strength of the earthquake. The rubber band mechanism is wound and released. The team with the tallest structure after the earthquake gets 3 points. If there is no clear difference in height, neither team scores. The other team then becomes the active team and you repeat.

Game continues until both sides run out of cards. It is possible for one team to be out of cards, thus leaving the other team to continue taking turns without alternating.

The game was apparently originally presented to a local geology group for demonstration purposes.

name: Video Club
description:
After the battle between the VHS system and the BETA and with the victory of the former, a new business model began to spread: the VIDEO CLUB. 1999, video stores are at their peak. Titles of dubious quality and the most diverse flood the shelves and customers rush to rent the latest bizarre B movies. Gamers are one of those customers who eagerly await the latest novelty.

Take your voucher, rent without stopping and watch as many movies as you can... and those you can't.... prepare to pay the late fee.

—description from the designer

Tras la batalla entre el sistema VHS y el BETA y con la victoria del primero empezó a extenderse un nuevo modelo de negocio: el VIDEO CLUB. 1999, los videoclubs están en su apogeo. Títulos de dudosa calidad y de los más variopintos, inundan las estanterías y los clientes corren prestos a alquilar la última bizarrada de serie B. Los jugadores son unos de esos clientes que esperan con anhelo la última novedad.

Toma tu bono, alquila sin parar y visualiza cuantas más películas puedas... y las que no.... prepárate para pagar la multa por demora.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Mutts, Moles and Magpies
description:
Moving-target game, played on a hex grid, where you play as a dog, with the goal of accumulating "treasure" in your hand or buried on the board, where it's worth more points. Your treasure is never safe in the game, as other players can steal from your hand, using their magpie, or dig it up from the board, which creates fun tension, and just a bit of push-your-luck. But it's not all up for grabs, as there are mitigation mechanisms to keep your treasure safer.
Treasure and (extra) actions are drawn from a bag, which also acts as a timer - when the bag is empty, the game-end triggers.

Gameplay
Your goal is to accumulate the most treasure (bones and toys), by having them in your hand or buried on the board.
Each player controls two pawns: Your Mutt can bury and dig out treasure. Your magpie’s goal is to annoy other mutts to steal their tiles. Additionally, there are 3 moles that can be controlled by any player, unearthing things on the board.
Tiles that you acquire during gameplay will give you the bones and toys, but also the actions you can use. You start the game with 7 tiles in your hand and 8 buried on the board, and can get more by:

having less than 7 tiles in your hand at the start or at the end of your turn,
picking other players’ Xs up, or
poking other players’ mutts.


The best and safest way to get more tiles is by clearing space in your hand, so you should use your actions and bury your tiles often. Any tiles you bury under your Xs are still yours, and will make you more points at the end of the game, but only if other players do not steal them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: #TellMe Challenge
description:
Tell me you're a board game fanatic without telling me you're a board game fanatic! We'll go first We made a game out of the poular #tellmechallenge on social media.


TellMeChallenge, also known as "Tell Me Without Telling Me," is a fun trend where social media users ask others to share personal opinions and beliefs without outright saying what they are talking about.


On TikTok and other social media platforms the challenge has gone viral with millions of views! Bring home this great party game and jump on the trend with competitive, cooperative, and remote play rules included.

—description from the box

name: エイジオブウィル 拡張：インフ城の反乱 (Age of Will Expansion: Inf Castle Rebellion)
description:
Architecture, once again.

The king thought he could retire after his previous work. However, his abdication was postponed due to signs of rebellion. The decision was made to lead his army to subdue the rebels.

The reluctant king is always thinking about architecture, even when he is nodding off in his saddle from exhaustion.

"I'm concerned about the capital's cathedral...I wonder if it will be completed before I die...

Yes. Let's build a small house near the rebel's fortress and take command from there. This battle will probably take a month or two. That doesn't seem so long..."

There are 32 cards, same as in the base set. Shuffle them together. The deck has doubled so now up to five people can play without any problems.

The 'Legion' icon has been added as a new element. It's a symbol that usually doesn't matter but, depending on the effect of the building, it can give you huge points - or it can just be a decorative icon. It brings various advantages (and, sometimes, disadvantages).

By combining over 60 cards (including the base set), you can enjoy more diverse developments!

It's a drafting game that can be finished in 15 minutes! A game will make you feel like you've played it in your spare time.

After drafting, you only need to build once! You can play as many games as you want by changing buildings.
publishers: Southern Cross Games (サザンクロスゲームズ)

name: Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone – Arasaka
description:
In the time of the Red, every city has a Combat Zone: an area of the city where the law doesn't reach and cyber-enhanced gangs fight for control over the streets.

The Arasaka Corporation is a worldwide megacorporation dealing in corporate security, banking, and manufacturing. The Arasaka Corporation maintains the largest and most powerful armed forces of any corporation in the world!

This box set includes all the miniatures and cards you need to field a complete Arasaka starter gang in your games of Combat Zone!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Escape Game Spécial Famille: Mystères et Secrets de la Pyramide
description: Your group of explorers finds themselves locked in a sacred pyramid. You have 60 minutes to unravel the mystery of the Egyptian god and escape from his cursed grave.

name: Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone – Lawmen
description:
In the time of the Red, every city has a Combat Zone: an area of the city where the law doesn't reach and cyber-enhanced gangs fight for control over the streets.

When the Law has to enter the Combat Zone, they try to hit hard and get out fast. Well-organized and well-armed, the Lawmen are a force to be reckoned with!

This box set includes all the miniatures and cards you need to field a complete Lawmen starter gang in your games of Combat Zone!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone – Bozos
description:
In the time of the Red, every city has a Combat Zone: an area of the city where the law doesn't reach and cyber-enhanced gangs fight for control over the streets.

The Bozo gang are bio-sculpted nightmares, surgically altered to look like twisted versions of old circus clowns, complete with actual bulbous red noses, outrageous hair, and long flat feet. This killer clown gang delights in sadistic and deadly pranks, twisting their victims fears into cruel traps!

This box set includes all the miniatures and cards you need to field a complete Bozos starter gang in your games of Combat Zone!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: La Toupie Voyageuse
description:
La Toupie Voyageuse is a solo or cooperative game for all ages from 6 upwards.
Each mission represents a journey that players must complete with a spinning top, moving it from one board to another. They represent 8 marvelous worlds in relief, with several targets. At the start of each mission, players identify together the targets to be reached and divide up the boards among them.
The first player launches the spinning top with the help of the thruster, and moves it by tilting his or her tray towards the target. Once the target has been reached, the player guides the spinning top towards the exit and onto the board held by the next player. The relay between players continues until the mission is completed. Challenges progressively increase in difficulty (narrow passages, obstacle jumps, etc.). Trophy stickers validate each successful mission!

—description from the publisher (translated)

La Toupie Voyageuse est un jeu solo ou coopératif pour tout âge dès 6 ans.
Chaque mission représente un parcours que les joueurs vont devoir effectuer avec une toupie en la passant d’un plateau à un autre. Ils représentent 8 mondes merveilleux en relief avec plusieurs cibles. Au début de chaque mission, les joueurs identifient ensemble les cibles à atteindre et se répartissent les plateaux indiqués.
Le premier joueur lance la toupie avec l’aide du propulseur et la déplace en inclinant son plateau pour la diriger vers sa cible. Une fois la cible atteinte, le joueur guide la toupie vers la sortie pour la faire passer sur le plateau tenu par le joueur suivant. La dynamique de relais entre les joueurs se poursuit ainsi jusqu’à la réalisation complète de la mission. La difficulté des défis s’accroit progressivement (passages étroits, sauts d’obstacles…). Des trophées autocollants permettent de valider chaque mission réussie !

—description from the publisher

name: Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone – Generation RED
description:
In the time of the Red, every city has a Combat Zone: an area of the city where the law doesn't reach and cyber-enhanced gangs fight for control over the streets.

It’s one thing to live through the time of the RED – it’s another to be born into it… In parts of the city where the adults have fled, the youth run the streets!

This box set includes all the miniatures and cards you need to field a complete Generation RED starter gang in your games of Combat Zone!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Psiechadzka
description: Psiechadzka is simple a game about dogs and people. The mechanics is based on the evergreen Snakes and Ladders: players choose whether they want to perceive the world from the dogs' or the owners' perspective. As they walk their dogs - or owners - they throw dice to move along the board and learn how to interact with each other, avoid dangers and have fun together. The first to return safely and happily from the walk wins.

name: Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone – Danger Gals
description:
In the time of the Red, every city has a Combat Zone: an area of the city where the law doesn't reach and cyber-enhanced gangs fight for control over the streets.

Danger Gal is a private investigation, bodyguard, and security company. They sport tactical and exotic cat outfits in the field!

This box set includes all the miniatures and cards you need to field a complete Danger Gals starter gang in your games of Combat Zone!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone – Zoners
description:
In the time of the Red, every city has a Combat Zone: an area of the city where the law doesn't reach and cyber-enhanced gangs fight for control over the streets.

Scrappy, natives of the Combat Zone, the Zoners are always ready to throw down!

This box set includes all the miniatures and cards you need to field a complete Zoners starter gang in your games of Combat Zone!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Planetary Defence System
description:
A game made for the Dice Deck by We Heart Games.

In this solo deckbuilder, a large group of meteors are heading straight for earth! Build up your defence system to ward them off before they strike.

Use white cards to buy new cards from the row, and red cards to damage the black meteor cards in the row. After every turn, new cards cover any cards remaining in the row, so you need to keep up to prevent those meteors from getting buried!

There are also a few default actions you "buy" at any time during your turn, like drawing a card, scrapping a card from your hand, and moving a card in the row left or right.

—description from the designer

name: Threeport Shipping
description:
Designed for the Dice Deck by We Heart Games.

Rival captains pilot their ships between three islands, picking up and selling cargo for the best rates.

Move your boat between three coloured islands to pick up various cargo, then sell it at an island matching its colour. Islands can be upgraded to make each sale worth more; race to get the best price for the highest-value cargo!

—description from the designer

name: Set 7
description:
Designed for the Dice Deck by We Heart Games.

A Blackjack-style push-your-luck game.

With a deck of cards from 1-6, start with two cards. Each turn you can choose to be dealt another card from the deck. Your goal is to create as many sets of cards that total 7 as possible... but if you get 2 cards of each color, or 4 cards of any one color, you bust!

Each set is worth one point; the first player to 7 points wins.

—description from the designer

name: Pirate Dice
description:
From rule sheet:
This classic dice game is all about who can bluff the best about what numbers they roll. Perfect for playing on the go.

Each player starts with 5 dice. After rolling all their dice, each player keeps their results hidden and, in succession, makes a “bid” about how many of a particular result they think all players have in total OR challenge the previous bid. Each bid must be “bigger” than the last (a higher result or a higher number of the result in the previous bid.

All dice are revealed when a challenge is made. If the total results meet or exceed the challenged bid, the bidder wins! If not, the challenger wins!

Losing bids result in lost dice, so you can only lose 5 times before you’re out of the game.

name: The Five Clans of Tresibra
description:
The Five Clans of Tresibra: Bloodshed by Spencer Walters is an engaging and strategic tabletop game that combines elements of adventure, strategy, and chance. With a recommended age of 10 and above and a quick learning curve of 10 minutes or less, it's accessible to a wide audience.

The game accommodates 2 to 6 players, each representing a warrior from one of the five clans or the formidable antagonist, Gummosis, the evil King of the Crowns. Players embark on a journey by drawing and strategically placing field cards, creating a dynamic battlefield. The game's adaptability allows for variations in difficulty, with the option to adjust the number of participating clan members.

The turn-based structure adds an element of anticipation and strategy to each move. The inclusion of special attributes for each clan member, such as Drutt's unique ability to roll a die for health increases, adds depth and diversity to the gameplay. These special attributes contribute to the overall strategy, making each clan member's turn crucial in the battle against Gummosis and his forces.

The battle rules are straightforward, ensuring that even new players can quickly grasp the flow of the game. The use of health cards for clan members and the strategic placement of cards on the field create a dynamic and evolving battlefield. The introduction of Tunnel cards adds an interesting twist, transporting players to a new location where they face challenges and strategic decisions.

The variety of field cards, each with its own effects, keeps the game engaging. Whether navigating obstacles like water or mountains, encountering helpful features like healing peaches or traps, or facing off against Crown Gall squads and wild beasts, players must adapt their strategies to survive and progress.

The inclusion of individualized clan member cards with unique stats and abilities adds a layer of personalization and strategy. The careful selection of cards and the use of special attributes can turn the tides of battle, making each playthrough unique.

Overall, The Five Clans of Tresibra: Bloodshed is a well-crafted and immersive tabletop game that offers a balance of strategy, chance, and storytelling. With its quick setup, accessible rules, and dynamic gameplay, it's sure to provide hours of entertainment for players seeking an engaging and strategic gaming experience.

The tabletop is based on the hit fantasy novel "The five clans of Tresibra".

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Dominator: Conquering Europe Ironically
description:
Get ready for BALKAN DOMINATOR. A new boardgame where you can fight for supremacy over the Balkans. Gather your armies and conquer your friends in an effort to recreate the most famous Balkan empires and kingdoms! A satirical look at area control and, more generally, war, Dominator is an area control game with secret objectives. Each player chooses a color and with that color tanks tries to conquer as much of eastern Europe as you can. Which tanks start in which territories are randomized at the beginning of the game. With four different ways to win, no two games are ever the same.

—description from the publisher

name: Torre de Papel
description:
Dexterity game of building a vertical house of cards.
The box contains 13 ceilings (the size of thick standard playing cards) and 26 walls (smaller illustrated cards which can be folded into an L shape).
On your turn, bend two walls and place them on edge to build a new level, then add a ceiling on top. If the tower doesn't fall, score one point per level.

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Institute Core Box
description:
The Institute are an enigma to most in the Wasteland – are they the synthetic future of humankind, or robotic bogeymen waiting to replace you when you sleep? Few ever find out the true nature of this shadowy organisation, and fewer still live to tell the tale.

What is known is that the Institute utilise the highest levels of technology to achieve their aims, and even have the power to emulate humans exactly. With stiletto sharp precision they infiltrate and eradicate high value targets. With force of numbers they can overwhelm strongpoints with waves of Gen 1 synths. They are the everywhere and nowhere, and paranoia follows in their wake.

This boxed set contains eight 32mm scale multi-part high quality resin Institute miniatures, each with unique scenic bases, to allow players to expand their Fallout: Wasteland Warfare games.

Contents:

4x gen 1 Synths
2x gen 2 Synths
1x Institute Scientist
1x Institute Courser

NOTE: Players will need the Institute Wave Card Expansion Pack to use the contents of this box. The pack can be DL for free from Modiphius.

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – The Commonwealth Rules
description:
Welcome to the Commonwealth, the largest expansion yet for Fallout: Wasteland Warfare! It’s packed with new rules, cards, guides, and scenarios to bring more factions and units to your tabletop.

The Commonwealth spans the rolling hills and scorched forests of the north to the broken coast and its rusting industry in the east. It sweeps through the decaying urban sprawl of Boston and out into the irradiated wasteland of the glowing sea.

The Commonwealth is home to a wide variety of groups, new factions, and additions to existing factions, including:

The Gunners are the most organised mercenary group in the Commonwealth, and they’ve garnered a reputation as bloodthirsty, unscrupulous fighters. They claim to be soldiers for hire, but much of the Commonwealth views them as little better than raiders, a militarized gang of thugs with delusions of grandeur.

The secretive Railroad fight to protect synths and attempt to spirit them away from the Institute, who the Railroad view as nothing more than slavers. Synths, to the Railroad, are the equal of humans and deserve to live freely.

RobCo is responsible for many of the Robots encountered throughout the Wasteland. From ruggedly built and hard-working Protectrons to the various military and medical support models of Mr Handy, you are never far from the chirpy robotic voices of these indispensable metallic helpers.

The Wasteland itself is home to all manner of irradiated Creatures. All the fauna, from domesticated livestock to roaming packs of fierce predators bring risk to any unwary traveller.

This expansion contains new rules for clashes within the Commonwealth, 171 punch-out cards, and an array of new scenarios both linked and standalone featuring the denizens of this varied area. Also included are strategy guides and painting guides to help you get your models ready for battle in the post-apocalyptic world of Fallout.

Contents:

A 65-page booklet with rules for expanding your wasteland denizens, including the Children of the Atom, the Gunners, the Railroad, new Creatures, and the Super Mutant’s terrifying Behemoth, Swan.
171 new cards: 35 unit and 33 AI cards, 1 equipment card, 16 leader cards, 5 mod cards, 17 perk cards, 3 power armor cards, 14 quest cards, 5 reference cards, 42 weapon cards
Painting guides for Survivors, the Brotherhood of Steel, and Super Mutants. A gallery of painted models featuring every release in the Commonwealth wave.
Scenarios for playing in the Commonwealth. Rules for Wasteland Warfare terrain. Unique region rules for locations within the Commonwealth. Strategy guides for playing numerous Wasteland Warfare factions.

name: Rioniversal: The Diamonds' World
description:
Rioniversal: The Diamonds' World is a board game for 2 to 9 players that features fantasy characters such as gnomes and trolls. Which team are you going to choose? Each player must move, as directed by the dice, through the various worlds that make up the board. The board is organized around a central and fixed space where three trolls reside, and it includes different scenarios such as a volcanic world, a forest world, the candy country... In these worlds, six gnomes engage in mischievous activities as players navigate through this captivating adventure.

Organized into two teams, players must acquire as many diamonds as possible. To achieve this, they can use various items such as a dragon scale, magical shoes, troll mucus... By activating these items, either alone or in combination, players can gain different powers to reach their goal, unless the opposing team uses them first!

The first character to collect five diamonds leads his/her team to victory. However, careful strategic thinking is essential, as individual victories are also possible if a player accumulates the most diamonds in the game. Are you willing to sacrifice yourself for the collective triumph of your teammates?

The Diamonds' World is a game within the Rioniversal saga, where the battle for diamonds requires both young and old to make strategic decisions to secure the greatest number of these precious stones.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Maze, Mythology, Party Game
publishers: La Ciudad de las Damas, MusiChess

name: Make (us) Believe
description:
A small-box card game with heavy roleplay elements. Players take turns describing the actions of their character cards in order to overcome the various challenges presented to them through each scenario they face. The game ends when the last objective of the scenario has been completed.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Feministime: La Espiral del Tiempo Feminista
description:
Feministime: La Espiral del Tiempo Feminista is a board game based on the Timeline. The dynamic consists of chronologically ordering the cards to collectively create a timeline (or spiral) formed by relevant events of the feminist genealogy and, in this way, build collective memory.

Feministime is made up of a deck of 128 cards. Each card represents a historical event and includes an illustration originally created for the game by one of the 50 artists who have joined this spiral of time of their own. One side also includes the date on which the event occurred.

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Robots: Assaultrons & Protectrons
description:
The ruins, bunkers and factories of the Wasteland often remain under the watchful gaze of those left behind to guard them.

Box Contents:

3 x Assaultrons
2 x Protectrons
5 x Scenic bases

The Protectron was designed to fill a variety of roles and may be found patrolling long forgotten shops and facilities, waiting for an emergency call out that will never come or attending on customers long rotted away. While not intended for combat they may catch the unwary off guard.

Deployed to support the US military forces, Assaultrons were left to roam after the bombs fell and can often be found still patrolling the checkpoints and convoys they were assigned to. One of the fastest and most deadly adversaries you might stumble across, their powerful melee attacks and head mounted lasers make short work of anything they perceive as a threat.

This boxed set contains five 32mm scale multi-part high quality resin Robot miniatures, each with unique scenic bases, to allow players to expand their Fallout: Wasteland Warfare games.

NOTE: This set does not contain cards. The cards may either be downloaded from Modiphius for free, or you can purchase the Raiders Wave Expansion card pack. This pack includes all the cards for Wave 2 releases (all three Raiders sets, Assaultrons & Protectrons, Wasteland Vermin (Molerats & Rad Roaches), Deathclaw, Sentry Bot, X0-1 & Armoured Dogmeat and Ghouls).

name: Ubuntu
description:
A collaborative board game to play in teams, based on the Ubuntu philosophy, which focuses on environmental education to value natural wealth and social diversity, in order to move towards more sustainable societies that address the climate emergency that haunts us, as well as social inequalities, and achieve the goals set out in the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda.

UBUNTU directly and indirectly addresses the 17 SDGs through its questions, as well as being part of the game cards and game board.

UBUNTU has been created with the aim of becoming an attractive and interesting tool with which to transmit basic knowledge about nature, ecology, sociology, food, technology, meteorology, environmental impacts, etc. and, above all, with which to spread the respect and love that its creators have for life on this planet and the culture of sustainability in general.

name: Salt of Sea
description:
Take the Helm!
Raise the sails and gather your crew! In Salt of Sea pirate captains fight to build their fleet of ships and galleons to rule the seas. Players can build, steal, and dig for cards to gain advantage. Upgrade your ships to galleons for more strength and shoot cannons to sink your opponents.

On your turn you can take any two actions (even two of the same action) you can draw a card, exchange cards, build, or play cards from your hand. You need a timber, rope, and canvas card to build a ship. You can upgrade a ship to a galleon with a cannon and treasure card. Cannon cards can also be used to sink other player's ships. The first pirate captain to build their fleet to one Galleon and two Ships wins the game!

Be a pirate Captain and lead your fleet to Victory!

—description from the designer

name: Rock'n'Troll
description: In Rock'n'Troll each player manages a Troll band, with which they will have to challenge their opponents in a tour of 5 concerts and obtain more Fame points than their opponents! During the game you will be able to hire new musicians and instruments. But you will have to balance your performances between Technique and Scenic Presence, to obtain Fame and Coins. Furthermore, Beer, Dice and Events will make the outcome of each Concert different!

name: A la huelga
description:
Choose side. Choose conflict. Choose strategy cards. Have fun while learning about the history of the labour movement. Choose which side to take in this struggle and learn about the experiences of the struggle named on the cards with the reference dossier included in the game.

Whether the bosses get their way or have to obey the workforce depends on your conditions and strategies. Get ready to experience a workers' conflict at home.
STRIKE!

name: Button Kingdoms
description:
Button Kingdoms is a bribery based deck building game, with simultaneous actions where players take on the role of child commanders of their own fantasy stuffed animal armies.

The goal of the game is to build up your kingdom of fluffy fighters by collecting currency in the form of buttons, and to seize the thrones of other players… while staying true to your character's own secret motivations.

During the Button Bazaar phase, players place bribe offers in the hopes of adding fluffy fighters to their deck, and accept the bribes of their opponents to acquire those precious buttons which become victory points at the end of the game. After this market phase is resolved, players turn their newly acquired cards against their opponents in the goal of seizing another throne to add to their dominion.

Victory will rest on three separate pillars: total BUTTONS, THRONES in your possession, and how well your deck of cards measures up to your champion’s IDEALS. Even if you fall behind in the combat aspect of the game, with skillful deck building and solid deal-making, you could still net the win.

Do you have what it takes to conquer the Button Kingdoms?
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Bribery, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Income, Kill Steal, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Marco vs Polo
description:
Play as Marco and Polo, two explorers in search of El Dorado
Marco thinks it is quicker to reach it by sea and Polo by land. But the map becomes distorted as our disoriented adventurers progress and the familiar shores recede. To reach the end of the world, they will have to cross to the other side of the map.

Their journeys are made on twenty carefully drawn triangles, in homage to the beautiful medieval maps. This map, in which geographers will recognize an icosahedral projection, has the property of being able to be arranged in 43,380 different ways. So, while our two explorers run and sail to the antipodes, their world is recomposed like an infinite puzzle.

name: Zoomino
description:
In Zoomino, you want to frame as many animals as possible to display them in your zoo.

To set up, take eight frames in a single color, shuffle the dominoes face down on the table, then give each player two dominoes.

Each turn, each player places one domino in their play area and another face down in front of the player to their left. They then draw a domino from the table to have two in hand again.

You must place dominoes in your area horizontally and adjacent to other tiles to form at least one animal. If you create a real animal, frame it! If both backgrounds on the tile match the player color, use the solid side of the frame, which is worth 2 points; otherwise, use the multi-colored side worth 1 point.

When the draw pile is empty or someone has placed their eighth frame, the game ends. Players tally their points to see who wins, with a tie being broken in favor of the player with the most imaginary animals on a background of their color.

name: Monster Kit 2
description:
The great sorcerer Mórlat has run out of monsters to terrorize the world and needs your help again.

This expansion contains new cards with reversed syllables, locked syllables and symphonies with which to create new monsters.

With 3 new different game modes!

You need the base game for some game modes.

--

El gran hechicero Mórlat se ha quedado sin monstruos para aterrorizar al mundo y necesita vuestra ayuda otra vez.

Esta expansión contiene nuevas cartas con sílabas inversas, trabadas y sinfones con las que crear nuevos monstruos.

¡Con 3 nuevos modos de juego diferentes!

Necesitas el juego base para algunos modos de juego.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Craftsmen Roll and Write
description:
Do you have what it takes to become the most successful entrepreneur in the kingdom? In this roll and write game, you will build your own production chain of buildings. You will collect the raw materials and process them to half-finished goods and finished products. You will also transport your products to the city, where you can sell them to various customers, from various places such as the shipyard, the tavern, the stronghold, and the monastery. But be careful, because you will have to compete with other players which are also sending goods to the same city as you and only the first players who manage to deliver needed goods will gain the victory points for them!

Craftsmen Roll and Write is a game for 1-4 players, designed for heavy gamers who enjoy strategic and economic challenges. Each game lasts about 60 minutes, and in each round you will do various things: acquire raw resources, build and upgrade your buildings like woodworks, blacksmith, bakery, process the materials to make goods and final products from various ingredients and sending them to customers in the city. Game consist of two kind of game boards, one shared between players from where they can acquire raw material and send products to, and one private one where they manage the resources, build and upgrade their buildings, and process materials to make various products.

The game ends after a fixed number of rounds. The player with the most Victory Points wins the game. Craftsmen Roll and Write is a game of planning, optimization, and adaptation. Will you become the richest and most influential entrepreneur in the kingdom?

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Resource to Move, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Ranking Top
description:
Welcome to the most frenetic and fun music career! At the Policarpo Top Top Awards there is only one goal: to be the first person to complete its Ranking Top, from the 5th position to the coveted 1st.

In Ranking Top you will try to be the first person to complete their music ranking. To do this, you must have played a sequence of cards in front of you with songs ranging from number 5 to number 1. On your turn, you will have to play a card as an action, or as a song for your ranking. But beware! Your opponents will try to hinder your goal. They will be able to block the card played with a card of the same value or with the classic Top Top Top card that can be hidden in the hand of a participant. That's why you'll need to be prepared to react to your envious opponents.

Conquering the musical podium is everyone's desire, but be careful, because in this race the competition is fierce. Are you ready to become music legends? Play until the chords of victory sound!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Racing
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Race, Take That

name: BLEAK
description:
A competitive, narrative-driven game for 1-4 players, in which players take on the roles of the Fates guiding a lowly Waif through a dark, primitive-fantasy world of many dangers and few hopes. But the world itself is not the only threat to the Waif, for the Fates each have their own Desires - their personal, secret plans for this Truthless Self, and will do all they can to see them realised before the journey's end.

Utilising an original, unique branching-narrative system, players choose from a handful of secret objectives during setup, detailing the type of Self they wish this Waif to become by the end of the session. Telling one collective, central story, the Fates spend their Influence tokens to vote on every action the Waif takes, pushing it towards their own goals and revealing new futures for it to overcome. With over 300 entirely individual cards, no two stories will ever be the same, no matter the number of playthroughs.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: The Great American Music Tour
description:
This game is an experience you need to indulge in. Take a journey across America solving questions about your favorite songs!

With 9 different genres and over 100 songs, no game will be the same! From rap to jazz, country to club, there's a genre for everyone!

Start by placing your piece on start, roll the dice and move the specified amount. Depending on where you land, your genre will be chosen. Draw a card from your designated genre and the difficulty you'd like. If you answer the trivia question on the card correctly, you will be awarded points based on the difficulty. The game is over after a player crosses the board 3 times, points will then be added together and whoever has the most points wins. 5 points will be awarded to the first person to make 3 laps around the board, afterwards the game will end.

The point is as follows:
Hard - 3
Medium - 2
Easy - 1
First to do 3 Laps - 5

name: Mimir's Challenge
description: Play as one of the Gods in Norse mythology and try to outwit your opponents in this strategic challenge of warfare. Each player controls identical armies and takes turn placing their army tokens in each of the nine realms. The tokens are placed face down until all players have placed 7 tokens. This is followed by an action phase, where some of the army tokens can remove key tokens from other players. The player with majority in each realm earns treasure. Treasure and army tokens taken from other players counts as points in the end of the game. The game is played over three rounds, and the God with most points at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hidden Victory Points, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Ancient Construct
description:
Part of Storyline Organized Play Pack 1.

Includes:

A set of ancient construct parts (6 heads, 5 arms, 3 back accessories, 1 shield, 1 torso, 1 legs, 1 clear base)
Complete set of cards (1 double sided spin card, 3 double sided variant cards)
1 set of punch out tokens
1 Orientation sheet with all the rules for using this character in D&D Onslaught
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Zero Day War
description:
The year is 2461, mankind has expanded beyond Earth and colonized Venus, Mars and Titan.

For over 200 years, all communication and commerce between our four worlds has been conducted through the SysNet, a completely secure information and communication network. That is until yesterday…

Our sun erupted into activity, volatile solar storms raged across our star’s surface while massive solar flares bombard our system, causing havoc with our technologies and knocking down the security protocols of the SysNet.

With the SysNet’s defenses down,hackers and government agencies alike descend upon the vulnerable data files like Locusts, stealing everything they can before the security protocols engage and once again locks the system down.

The system is yours for the taking… Zero Day War has begun.

Zero Day War is a 2-4 player card game. Players take the roles of hackers from different planets who are taking advantage of a security malfunction in the SysNet.

Use Exploit cards to program future actions and Hack files. A unique count down mechanic is used to activate all the programs at once at the end of the round. Players steal files, complete contracts and cause havoc for other players in the game. The hacker with the most files & contracts filled wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Action/Event, Contracts, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warp & Weft
description:
The art of weaving has been essential to the development of almost every culture in the world. The colors, embroideries and patterns have hundreds of folkloric meanings that make many of the hand-woven garments unique.

In Warp & Weft you will play four rounds, trying to weave different colored threads on your Loom to form attractive patterns.

In each round, you'll collect four threads, in a simultaneous draft, that you'll need to make your design. You will then weave them onto your Loom board and commit to a specific pattern that will grant you a certain amount of victory points depending on how many times that pattern is present on your Loom.

Whoever earns the most Victory Points at the end of the game will win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Sumo Fight
description:
Sumo Fight is a game for 1-4 players featuring 16 Sumo Wrestlers, each with their own unique 7 card deck of Sumo Action cards. The cards drive the action on the Dohyo game board where the Sumo Wrestler game Pieces interact in a contest to jettison one another from the Dohyo or to throw one another down onto the clay.

Sumo Fight offers a variety of ways to play, starting with best of 7 practice matches, while also offering the opportunity to build a sumo stable and compete against other players while adapting your wrestlers and customizing your decks using cards included in the base game! For die hard sumo fans, there is also a tournament mode, which may be played solo or with up to 4 players. Compete to claim the emperor's cup against 15 other sumo wrestlers!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Deck Construction, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Measurement Movement, Minimap Resolution, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Relative Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Wong Promo Cards
description: A set of Super Hero ID card + Enemy Super Hero card for Wong (Marvel Zombies – A Zombicide Game) given out at San Diego Comic Con 2023.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: DCeased: Unkillables
description:
As the Anti-Life virus spread all over the world, Vandal Savage gathered a group of the most ruthless mercenaries, vigilantes, and assassins, comparing them to tree lobsters for their ability to do anything they have to do to survive against insurmountable odds. The goodie-two-shoes heroes don’t stand a chance against the Anti-Life, but these villains just might have what it takes to survive this ordeal.

Unkillables is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion, bringing a group of ruthless characters to the battle against Anti-Life. Some of them have fallen to the virus, but the rest are ready to fight back by any means necessary in order to survive the 4 new Missions included in this set. With unique new Super Heroes, Zombie Heroes, Bystanders, and Equipment cards, this expansion shows that only the good die young.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Harry Potter: Who is it?
description: Card game to guess the Harry Potter character. It is similar to Guess Who, but only uses cards.

name: DCeased: Gotham Knights
description:
Gotham City has always been besieged by crime and violence. From daring criminals to the Court of Owls secret society ruling from the shadows, danger has ever lurked behind every corner. The Bat-family alone has stood against them, fighting to bring safety and justice to its citizens. But in its darkest hour, Batman and many of the Gotham Knights have fallen prey to the Anti-Life virus, joining in the carnage with the rest of the hordes. It’s up to the few surviving heroes to keep the beacon of hope lit on Gotham City’s night skies.

Gotham Knights is an expansion that brings the battle against the Anti-Life to the mean streets of Gotham City, up to the Wayne Manor, and all the way down to the Batcave. Batman, his allies, and his enemies, have been scattered between both sides of this deadly conflict. Not even an arsenal of Bat-gadgets might be enough to succeed in your missions, with a horde of unliving Talons hunting you from the shadows!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: DCeased: Green Lantern Corpse
description:
The Green Lantern Corps, an intergalactic peacekeeping force using their willpower to wield the might of their Power Rings, should be the universe’s greatest hope in stopping the spread of the Anti-Life virus. However, even these bastions of heroism are not immune to it and must stand together against the wave of fear that threatens the galaxy.

Green Lantern Corpse is an expansion, bringing the full power (and terror) of the Green Lantern Corps. Including 4 new Missions to explore all the gameplay possibilities of wielding Power Rings in the battle against Anti-Life, whether in brightest day or in blackest night.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: DCeased: Shadowpact
description:
As the Anti-Life virus spreads across the world, the only hope for humanity may lie in the occult. Enter the Shadowpact, a group of supernatural heroes wielding mystic powers against the Anti-Living hordes. When things go from bad to worse with the appearance of the demon Trigon, hellbent on collecting the souls of both the living and unliving, it will take some kind of magic to stop him.

Shadowpact is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion, bringing a group of supernatural characters to the battle against Anti-Life. From sorcerers to demons, these Super Heroes bring all sorts of unique magic powers to bear against the hordes over the course of 4 new Missions. But the biggest threat of all is the gigantic Trigon. Spreading deadly Hellfire across the board and collecting the souls of the fallen to empower himself, this will certainly be a hell of a challenge!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: DCeased: Undead Gods
description:
Hailing from a realm outside normal time and space, the inhabitants of New Genesis and Apokolips are so superior to human beings as to be called the New Gods. Among them, Darkseid has always been a tyrannic threat to the universe, seeking the Anti-Life Equation to dominate all of existence. In this pursuit, he inadvertently unleashed the Anti-Life Virus upon the galaxy. Succumbing to the virus himself, the undead Darkseid now leads the Anti-Life Army, followed by his zombie Parademons and Female Furies. Stopping them will take a divine intervention from the surviving New Gods.

Undead Gods is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that brings the cosmic power and threat of the New Gods into the Anti-Life crisis. Take the role of these superhuman entities and stand against the undead Apokoliptian onslaught over the course of 4 new Missions. As Boom Tubes start opening all over the board, the swarms of undead Parademons herald the coming of zombie Darkseid and his Female Furies. This box contains the mother of all battles!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Spire's End: Rangitaki – Salt & Sea
description: The Salt & Sea Micro Expansion is a small, non-essential pack of cards that provides a touch of variety to Rangitaki. It will include new illustrations by Diego Frias and Charlie Potter.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Global Reserve
description:
Take the power back with Global Reserve! Wield one of the world’s most recognized currencies, jockey for influence, forge alliances, and reign supreme as the world’s next Global Reserve Currency. Can you build a monetary empire? Or will you gamble your future in a high-stakes bid for global domination?

Global Reserve is both a fun and educational way to learn about money’s role in world politics. For better or worse, players now have the chance to step into the role of a world superpower and learn firsthand how money plays a role in shaping the world we live in. While in pursuit of monetary domination, players will learn historic facts about money with each territory captured. After claiming victory, the winner will then announce what will happen to the world now that their currency reigns supreme!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kingsters
description:
The completed trilogy to Checkers and Chess. The perfect median is on the market. Kingsters is simple to understand like Checkers, while being layered with strategy like Chess. Players jump their own piece to move across the board to take their opponents pieces. A piece is able to move in any four directions. The game is over when you've taken or lost all six pieces.

—description from the designer

name: Men of War: OMNIBUS – Modules 1-2-3
description:
The Men of War - Solitaire Tactical Book Wargame is an old-school hex and counter tactical wargaming system for the Men of War game modules focusing on modern low-intensity conflicts. Men of War is an infantry-centric game that aims to mimic the nuances of modern small units, leadership, fire, and maneuver, primarily team and squad-based formations with emphasis on the “Shoot-Move-Communicate” doctrine of infantry training and combat. The scale is at the tactical level with each hex grid representing a few meters and turns representing approximately five minutes. Each counter is an infantry unit identified as a Fireteam, individual leaders, and squad weapons. Gameplay occurs in hexagonal maps with varied terrain where the player maneuvers units. Everything needed to play all three games is included in this book minus the dice and a marker. Players will need at least one D10 and one D6 dice. A total of 34 missions/scenarios including 4 Bonus Missions, 12 hex-maps (x4 Each Module with extras), all unit counters, markers, mission sheets, charts, and player aids are included. Players mark units represented by letters and numbers from a Mission Sheet directly onto the map, and track movement using symbolic marks. Preferably, the player may use the included counter sheet which can be cut and mounted to be used as traditional wargame counters. 
OMNIBUS Volume I, includes the first three games in the Men of War series:

Men of War Solitaire Tactical Wargame System Module 1:
Rhodesian Bush War-Forward Together
Players control Rhodesian security forces attempting to eradicate an ever-threatening insurgency backed by communist superpowers. A dynamic enemy artificial intelligence bot keeps players guessing enemy disposition on every turn.
‘Pamwe Chete’

Men of War Solitaire Tactical Wargame System Module 2:
Indochina 1946-1954-French Foreign Legion
The player controls infantry, paratroopers and ad hoc German WWII veteran units from the famed French Foreign Legion. Fighting a desperate low low-intensity and brutal war against the Viet Minh; a disciplined and dedicated communist insurgency. Foreign Legion units must navigate and engage a cunning enemy over difficult terrain in ten historically inspired missions.
‘Vive la mort, vive la guerre, vive la Legion Etrangere’

Men of War Solitaire Tactical Wargame System Module 3:
Central America, Nicaragua 1979-1990-Contras
In this third module of the Men of War Solitaire Tactical Wargame Book series, players switch roles and play as the CONTRA insurgents backed by the United States government against the Nicaraguan FSLN. This module continues the series providing players with small-unit tactical combat in situations where planning and patrolling are just as important as reaching objectives and fulfilling victory conditions.
‘CONTRArrevolución’

—description from the designer

name: Lights Out
description:
Theme:
Lights Out offers an electrifying experience where players strive to keep their lights on while strategically turning off opponents' lights. The modern design and sleek components contribute to the immersive theme.

Gameplay:
Easy to learn and endlessly replayable, Lights Out utilizes a deck of 26 Blue Lights Off Cards, 26 Yellow Lights On Cards, and 2 Master Electrician Cards. Players strategically manipulate lights, adding a dynamic and interactive element suitable for family game nights or social gatherings.

Goal:
The goal is simple yet challenging: finish the game with the most lights on. Players navigate the balance between offense and defense, requiring strategic decisions and adaptability to outsmart opponents. Lights Out is a competitive and engaging experience for both casual and experienced board gamers.

—description from the publisher

name: Pitch Your Dish
description:
Pitch Your Dish is a card game released by Buswell in 2022 that centers around culinary creativity and hilarity. In the game, players find themselves in the role of a chef with a limited selection of ingredients, challenged to pitch imaginative and often outrageous dishes for various meals. The game includes 336 food cards and 50 meal cards, providing a wide range of combinations for players to use in their culinary creations.

To play, participants draw food cards with three associated foods in different colors. The judge, chosen from the players, selects a meal card and designates a color (yellow, red, or blue). Players then choose three cards from their hand that match the designated color to pitch their dish to the judge. Each player takes turns presenting their creations, and the judge awards the meal card to the player with the most convincing or entertaining pitch. The first player to accumulate a set number of meal cards wins the game, with the required number depending on the total number of players.

Overall, Pitch Your Dish is a light-hearted and competitive game that combines strategy, creativity, and humor as players strive to concoct the most appealing or absurd meals in the quest for victory.

—description from the publisher

name: Trash Bandits
description:
Trash Bandits is a strategy card game where players take on the role of homeowners trying to protect their property from mischievous raccoons. The game is designed for players aged 8 and above and has a duration of 30-45 minutes. The theme revolves around raccoons invading your yard, and players must employ strategy and determination to keep these trash-loving critters away.

The game includes 144 cards, featuring basic bandits numbered 0 through 10 and special bandits with unique abilities. Players aim to build sets of raccoons in their yards while using special cards like Steal, Trash, Swap, and more to hinder opponents or enhance their own positions. The goal is to accumulate the fewest raccoons by the end of the game, with each round totaling the raccoon count in players' yards. The player with the least number of raccoons, or in case of a tie, the one with the lowest count in a single round, emerges as the winner. The game combines elements of strategy, card management, and a touch of humor in dealing with the raccoon invasion.

—description from the publisher

name: Silver: Big Box Collector's Edition
description:
Your village has been overrun by savage werewolves, which are represented by the number on each of the cards that make up your village. To get rid of these fanged fiends faster than the neighboring villages, use your residents' special abilities and your powerful secret weapons: a silver amulet, a silver bullet, a silver coin, and more.

Call for a vote when you think you have the fewest werewolves, but be careful; everyone else gets one more turn to save their own village first...

In any of the iterations of Silver, everyone starts the game with five face-down cards, with everyone being able to see two cards of their choice. Cards are numbered 0-13, with the number showing how many werewolves the character on that card attracts, and each character (number) has a different special power.

On a turn, you draw the top card of the deck or discard pile, then either discard it to use the power of the card (but only if it came from the deck), discard it without using the power (ditto), or replace one or more of your face-down cards with this card; you can replace multiple cards only if they bear the same number, and you must reveal the cards to prove this, being penalized if you're wrong.

Silver: Big Box Collector's Edition collects all six standalone Silver games in one box, along with playmats and "collector's edition" cards with new artwork. To play, you can use all the cards of a number from any game, mixing-and-matching the different Silver games as you desire, such as the 0s and 3s from Silver; the 4s, 8s and 10s from Silver Bullet; and so on.

Some versions of this Big Box Collector's Edition contain components for up to six players, while others have components for only 2-4 players.

name: Razorhurst: Blood Alley
description:
Sydney, Australia in the 1920s and 30s is a hotbed of crime and vice. The inner city suburbs of Darlinghurst and Surrey Hills are a battleground between warring gangs led by former prostitute Tilly Devine and sly grog queen Kate Leigh. And in the middle of it all is you, a detective for the New South Wales Police, just trying to solve the crimes and bring the perpetrators to justice.

Razorhurst: Blood Alley is a story-driven detective game similar to Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective. You will interview suspects, follow leads, and use your abilities for observation, persuasion and force. Razorhurst uses a unique clock mechanic for affecting the player's abilities. But the main difference with other detective games is that here everything is real. You will be investigating actual crimes, tracking down historical evidence, and bringing real killers to justice. Based on exhaustive research, Razorhurst allows the player to step back in time to one of the most heady and deadly places in history.

The Blood Alley case takes place in May 1929, when a street brawl in a darkened alley led to unexpected and bloody consequences for one of Sydney's criminal kingpins. Can you solve the case and bring justice to the murky world of Razorhurst?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Whiskers in the Dark
description:
Whiskers in the Dark is a tense game of cat and mouse! One player is a mouse hunting cheese in an apartment. The other player is a cat trying to catch that mouse! Each player must make use of their particular skills to get the upper hand. If the mouse can eat enough cheese before running out of time or being caught by the cat, they win! All the cat has to do is chow down on the mouse... if they can find it!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Hidden Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Point to Point Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Mad Millionaire
description:
Race around the city in a mad dash for cash. It's your chance to live the ultimate 'rags-to-riches' story! Starting with almost nothing, the first player to turn their luck around and make a million dollars wins!

Buy or lease businesses in the best locations on the board, then complete crazy publicity stunts and let the profits roll in! Sabotage the competition by taking over their most valuable assets, or gamble on the property market and sell everything you own for a profit!

It's simple and easy to learn, and your chance to win is fair. You'll need some luck, a bit of cunning and madness if you dare. For when the final dice is rolled ... there's only one Mad Millionaire!

—description from the publisher

name: Ape Town
description:
Since the apes have taken over, the atmosphere in the southern coastal town has been harsh. Gangs armed with bananas roam the dark alleys in search of attractive trading points. At the same time, new primates flock to the city, laying claim to the most promising territories.
