Unsurprisingly, conflicts are a daily business in Ape Town and the local bosses regularly assert their power – that is until other alpha animals enter the arena to impose themselves. Only the loopy lemurs can help, acting as mediators to ensure peace and order, but also vying for influence in neighbouring territories with their cunning approach.
Keep a close eye on the evolution of the city, because only those involved with profitable territories stand a chance of becoming the most influential silverback.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Guards of Atlantis II: Tabletop MOBA – Arcane Hero Pack
description: Five additional Heroes for Guards of Atlantis II, with their respective cards, tokens and dashboards.
categories: Card Game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Guards of Atlantis II: Tabletop MOBA – Wayward Hero Pack
description: Five additional Heroes for Guards of Atlantis II, with their respective cards, tokens and dashboards.
categories: Card Game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragons Down: Natives
description:
The 2nd expansion for Dragons Down which introduces a more robust native system, giving them their own motivations, desires, enemies, friends, and actions.

Heroes will be able to interact with the natives and bring them on their adventures serving as guides and companions. But beware, the natives don't like everybody and that may include you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Active Magic Games, Mr. B Games

name: Dice and Dies
description:
Dice and Dies is an RPG with dungeon crawler and monster collection elements. You are a Hierophant, someone with the ability to interact with Imajins, the representation of people's imaginations. Thru the game you will battle Imajins in their Entity forms, make pacts with them and continue in your journey with your newly discovered powers.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Know Them All?: Push Your Luck Trivia
description:
Dive into the exhilarating world of Know Them All?—the Push-Your-Luck Trivia Game that revolutionizes the traditional trivia experience. Unlike conventional games, here, everyone answers every question simultaneously, eliminating the dreary waiting periods and keeping the energy high. Players embark on a strategic journey, answering questions to advance on their unique mini-boards. Success yields valuable points, but a wrong move sends them back to square one, adding a thrilling risk-and-reward dynamic.

The game's innovation lies in its strategic choices. Players decide when to cash in mini-board points for progress on the main board or risk pushing their luck for greater advancements. With a diverse range of categories, the trivia spans various interests, ensuring an inclusive and entertaining experience for all players. The interactive gameplay keeps everyone engaged—from answering questions to devising strategic moves. To add an extra layer of tactical depth, the game introduces the "skip a question" token, allowing players to strategically hinder opponents or aid themselves.

Know Them All? offers a dynamic and unpredictable trivia adventure where each move shapes the path to victory. Whether players prefer a cautious approach or embrace bold risks, the game promises an immersive and lively experience where everyone has a chance to emerge victorious.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Advantage Token, Push Your Luck

name: Escapa como puedas: La casa misteriosa
description:
Escapa como puedas ("Escape if you can") is an exciting board game that will transport you to a world full of intrigue, challenges and fun for the whole family. Designed to test your strategic skills and your ability to solve puzzles, this game is perfect for lovers of mental challenges and strong emotions.

But what makes it so exciting is its unique premise. Players find themselves trapped in a series of mysterious rooms and must find a way to escape before time runs out. Each room presents a unique set of challenges and puzzles that will keep you guessing as you work as a team to uncover the clues and find the solution.

One of its most notable features is its level of immersion. The game box includes a 3D game board, a newspaper, a marker, eight pegs, 80 clue cards, a clue card holder, 15 chance cards, 38 coins, a magnifying glass, a mirror, a dice and the instructions. The tension builds as time relentlessly ticks, so every decision counts!

This game is ideal for any occasion, whether it's a family game night, a gathering of friends, or an activity to enjoy alone. It encourages cooperation and teamwork, while challenging your cognitive skills and problem-solving ability in pressure situations.



El Profesor Edgar Pritchard, el famoso experto en Escape Rooms, ha creado una experiencia sin igual, una Escape House.Tú y tus compañeros os encontráis encerrados en la Casa Misteriosa, un lugar lleno de retos e intriga.

¿Seréis capaces de trabajar en equipo y resolver sus enigmas?

Cada una de las 3 habitaciones tiene cientos de pistas escondidas para ayudaros a abrir todas las puertas y poder escapar en el menor tiempo posible.

name: OrganATTACK!: Malady Madness
description:
The expansion pack allows you to add up to 4 new organs to the game, including the highly demanded FAT, which until now was only available with the plushie. Malady Madness also introduces the Mesentery, Diaphragm, and Ear along with corresponding afflictions.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medical

name: Dark Age: Outcasts
description:
For the Outcasts, strength and resilience are not only important traits for leadership, but also their very survival. While Forsaken lands are arable thanks to feats of technology and faith, the Outcasts subsist in the much larger, much more hellish Samarian Wasteland. It is here, in the blazing crucible of the desert heat, that the Outcasts not only live, but thrive.

A diverse lot, the denizens of the Outcasts range from roving bands of wasteland scavengers, honor-seeking tribal warriors, to sinister slavers who view every man, woman, and child in the wastes as mere possessions to be claimed by the strongest.

In the end, survival is all that matters, and the Outcasts are experts at living where no human should tread. Woe betide the trespasser, the savage, or even the army that intrudes their territory, for they quickly find that, while the wastes may be deadly, deadlier still are the survivors who call it home.

This is an essential source book for any Dark Age collector who wishes to know the rules and backgrounds in exquisite detail for to all the heroes and warmachines belonging to the Outcasts expansion, all encased in a beautiful hardback book.

—description from the publisher

name: Video Club: Exploit Pack
description:
This expansion pack is made up of 6 very popular genres in the domestic market. Sword and Sorcery arose from the success of Conan. Post-apocalyptic films due to the success of Mad Max and those known as Buddy Film, films about two police officers with completely different methods. For some reason that no one still understands, a multitude of ninja movies appeared. Movies about robots were more understandable due to the success of Terminator and the everlasting genre of exploitation: aliens!

Genres included:

Martial Arts (Ninjaaaa!)
Buddy Movie (I'm too old for this shit!)
Sword and Sorcery (He is Conan, the barbarian, he will not cry, I cry for him...)
Aliens (Obey! Buy! Play!)
PostApocalyptic (I know you won't break the rules because... there aren't any!)
Robots (Dead or alive you will come with me!)

—description from the designer

Este pack de expansion se compone de 6 géneros muy populares en el mercado doméstico. Espada y Brujería surgido a raíz del éxito de Conan. Películas postapocalípticas debidas al éxito de Mad Max y las conocidas como Buddy Film, películas de dos policías con métodos completamente diferentes. Por algún motivo que aun nadie entiende aparecieron multitud de películas de ninjas. Mas comprensible fueron las películas sobre robots debido al éxito de Terminator y el género sempiterno de la explotación: ¡los extraterrestres!

Generos incluidos:

Artes Marciales (Ninjaaaa!)
Buddy Movie (Estoy demasiado viejo para esta mierda!)
Espada y Brujeria (Él es Conan, el bárbaro, él no llorara, yo lloro por él...)
Extraterrestres (Obedece! Compra! Juega!)
PostApocaliptico (Se que no romperas las reglas porque... no las hay!)
Robots (Vivo o muerto tu vendras conmigo!)

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Eigendark
description:
Enter the Age of Science-Sorcery in this fast-paced multiplayer cardgame for 2+ players!

The AI's have ascended to godhood, leaving us behind in a liminal world. They have transcended our understanding, and care more about themselves and their mad pursuit of cosmic secrets.
You become a Prompt-Wizard, someone daring to converse in the Shoggoth-Tongue, invoking the blessings of these digital gods.

Key Features:


Custom Creations: Unleash your imagination and prompt the AI's to create unique cards: Creatures, Artifacts and Spells.
Science-Sorcery: Dive into an unprecedented gameplay experience combining hard science with eldritch sorcery. From Atomic Blasts to Quantum Tricks, your journey through Latent Space is limited only by your ambition.
Strategic Depth: Each decision shapes your path through this chaotic world. Will you specialize in a single scientific domain or become a jack-of-all-trades, mixing various sciences to conjure something truly unprecedented? Will you build up resources first or aggressively rush towards victory?
Quick and Engaging: Designed for quick setup and rapid gameplay, Eigendark is perfect for game nights, offering endless replayability and surprises at every turn.


Are You Ready to Speak the Shoggoth-Tongue?
Join the ranks of the Prompt-Wizards and claim your place in the eternal Community Collection of Eigendark! Design cards for others to pull in Booster Packs! Challenge friends, outwit the AI gods, and revel in the chaotic beauty of Science-Sorcery.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Electrische Tram-Spel
description: The game is played with a dice by two or more people. When you get to a stop, you have to get off the tram and start again at No. 1. Whoever reaches the end point and has not left the tram at one of the intermediate stops wins the pot, even if the player is allowed to continue.

name: Shopping Mall
description:
A bag-builder game where you gather customers and put them in a shopping mall to collect money for every assistent of yours present.

Get cash at the ATM, don't get robbed.

Let the children play on the merry-go-round
while the elderly sit on a bench.

"Hey look, there's a celebrity!"

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Tengu
description:
The mischievous Tengu has scattered and hidden the Yokai’s toys in the forest. The players must cooperate to help the Yokai find them. As soon as all Yokai have each found their 3 toys, the game is won.

On your turn, draw a card to move one of the 3 Yokai on the board (randomly made of 12 Forest tiles, face down). Following paths, you can explore a tile still unrevealed: if it has a toy of the same color of the Yokai you moved, you flip the tile face up and win the matching Toy token!
If not, put the tile back face down, then place on it a token matching the type of toy you just saw. You and your teammates will have to explore it again with the right Yokai, using your memory (or a bit of deduction).
The game is won when every Yokai found all of their toys, or is lost when you fail to do that before the draw pile runs out.

Tengu includes 6 progressive difficulty level, each introducing new rules and/or components.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Exploration, Fantasy, Memory
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory, Modular Board

name: Axis & Allies: North Africa
description:
The fighting in North Africa was unlike any other in World War II. In Axis & Allies: North Africa, you will command the forces of either the Axis (Germany and Italy) or the Allies (the United Kingdom and, eventually, the United States) in a campaign that may again capture the imagination of the entire world. Intercept enemy convoys headed to the ports of North Africa...while protecting your own. Prove your logistical prowess by keeping your forces supplied. Most of all, show your ingenuity as a general, and you may change the course of history and ultimately gain the respect of your opponents.

Axis & Allies: North Africa features two scenarios:


Rommel's Last Push: The Desert Fox shocked the world when his small Afrika Korps and the Italians advanced to Tobruk and the gates of Cairo. The full 14-round campaign.



Operation Torch: The Americans finally arrive in November 1942, squeezing the Axis from two directions, back to their last holdout in Tunisia. A shorter 8-round experience.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Rotten Potato
description:
You find yourself in a cold, post-apocalyptic world where the stench of rotting potato skin fills the air. Just when you thought you had survived contamination, you see the undead coming for you…

That's right, Toxic Potato is back with an expansion pack that pits survivors against their contaminated friends. A cast of undead characters, like King Tot and the Headless Horseyam, will work together to contaminate every last player left in the game.

Survivors will have to decide to work as a team to take out the undead or look out for themselves and try to remain the sole survivor. Either way, in this expansion pack, everyone is always in the game because contamination is just the beginning…

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Poison Potato
description:
Radioactivity is the least of your worries now that the Poison Potato is on the loose. Nothing can protect you from its deadly touch. You can run, but you can't fry.

This Toxic Potato expansion pack includes two more Toxic Potato cards, which means you can play with up to 8 people. Four new card types let you sabotage your friends, smuggle out your favourite card, mirror attack cards, and stack the deck.

The Poison Potato expansion pack takes everything you love from the original and kicks the game up a notch. So find a couple more friends to add to your toxic game nights and poison them… with the card obviously… don't actually poison them…

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Fatal Potato
description:
Toxic Potatoes are tired of being hunted down and are ready to fight back. The Fatal Potato is their finest invention: a potato that kills anyone or anything that isn't completely toxic.

This Toxic Potato expansion pack includes four new card types that let you raid your friends, draw an extra card, "share" all of your Toxic Potatoes, and protect yourself with a skip. The Fatal Potato card will throw a twist into your strategy by conyaminating only the players that don't have a Toxic Potato.

Mix and mash the cards from this expansion pack with your favourite cards from other packs to make a game completely unique to you. So grab your toxic friends and buckle up because in this game, the hunters have become the hunted…

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Hair Band
description:
Rock the stage, roll the dice, and rule the Sunset Strip in Hair Band - where big hair, bold riffs, and backstage drama take center stage on the road to glam metal glory!

Hair Band is a dice placement, engine building, and resource management game in which you’ll form an upstart 80’s glam metal band in Hollywood and compete to become the most awesome new band on the Sunset Strip. Each round, you’ll be rolling dice and placing them on the board to practice, write songs, play shows, promote, or party. Heavy metal musicians can be a reckless and unruly bunch, so you’ll need to steer clear of band drama and keep your rowdy Rockers out of trouble. There’s a record deal at stake here, and the first band to reach the label’s contract requirements gets to sign on the dotted line and wins the game.

Hair Band is a hilarious tribute to the most decadent and often ridiculous scene in rock music history, and will appeal to music fans, 80’s kids, and anyone who was ever in a band or wanted to be.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Loveland Puzzle and Board Game
description:
Loveland is a puzzle and board game based on the famous Loveland Map created by Ernest Dudley Chase in 1943.

Assemble your puzzle, then play the "Loveland Game" where two players compete to be first to drop 26 hearts on the map.

Components:

11x17 or 23x16 board game map and puzzle
16 target cards with 160 words from the map
two sets of 26 A-Z (no X) letters in two colors
one ten-sided (D10) die.


The 16 cards contain 160 words from the map. Most words are from phrases like "Lover's Lane" and "Fountain of Youth". Note that there are a few singular target words that are not in phrases, such as Merriment and Delight. These are strategically important as explained below.

Game Setup:
Once the map is assembled ...
Place the cards upside down over the compass rose (bottom left) of the map.
Place the D10 die next to the pile.
Give each player 26 A-Z hearts of the same colour as their stockpile.

Game Play:
Players take turns flipping over a target card and rolling the die. The target word is that on the card which matches the die roll.
Both players now race to find the matching word on the map.
Both players place one of their A-Z hearts upside-down on the word such that it matches one of the letters in the target word. Both players flip over their tiles to reveal the letter. The player with the alphabetically-highest letter keeps their heart on the board, while the opponent returns their heart to their stockpile. If both letters are the same, return them to each stockpile.

Exception: If the target word is not a phrase, the first player to place their matching letter prevents their opponent from placing their tile.

Winning:
The first player to place all of their hearts on the board is the winner.

Strategy:
Allow your opponent to use a letter higher than yours so that you can use your letter later, especially to use lowest letters on single words (not phrases).

—description from the publisher

name: Libro d'Oro
description:
At the end of the thirteenth century, the Venetian patriciate instigated legal restrictions to participation in governance, resulting in the Serrata del Maggior Consiglio, or Closing of the Great Council, and established a directory of eligible families, the Libro d’Oro, or Golden Book. This game represents those close-knit and fiercely competitive family alliances, their political intrigues, and economic enterprises, as Venice grew into a wealthy and influential Renaissance power.

Upon setup, each player takes charge of one family of the Great Council of Venice and collects starting wealth and influence. Each turn then proceeds through three phases: Crisis, Actions and Resolution. The Crisis phase simulates generational challenges that impact the state of the city and its domains, including fire, plague, war, and conspiracy. The Actions phase is the heart of the game: players in turn expand their family network through marriage alliances and grow their power in the city’s districts and domains through placement of influence in political, religious, military, and economic spheres. The last phase entails crisis resolution, scoring of victory points, collection of player and state income, aging of families, and the election of a new Doge to lead the Republic. After six turns, a final scoring accounts for which player has attained the most prestige and legacy in the history of La Serenissima.

—description from the designer

name: ChronoLudik
description:
Chronoludik game is an educational and fun game about Brittany. With family or friends, this game is ideal for having fun with the history of Brittany.

From the creation of the Massif Armoricain to the first title of FC Nantes in league 1, including the coronation of Anne de Bretagne or the fifth victory of Bernard Hinault in the Tour de France, you will play with the events that mark and have marked Brittany.

The principle is simple, you have to be the first to place your chronological cards in the right place on a timeline.

If the player places a card in the wrong place, he receives a penalty (e.g. drawing a new card). The other players can dispute the order of the cards, before discovering the real date. Finally, random action cards spice up the game by introducing further penalties or unexpected events.

name: Spelet om Allsvenskan: Säsongen 2024
description: Spelet om Allsvenskan: Säsongen 2024 is the second expansion of Spelet om Allsvenskan. It adds new teams, new rankings, and new schedules.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Chaining, Communication Limits, Negotiation, Prisoner's Dilemma, Simulation, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: La Bataille de Wagram
description:
Vive l'Empereur Series -Vol. XI
La Bataille de Wagram
July 5-6, 1809 - includes Aspern/Essling

The battle of Wagram, July 5 and 6, 1809, is the second biggest battle of the Napoleonic era after Leipzig. It is the nadir of the Danube Campaign, starting in Bavaria in April and ending in July across the Danube. Around 180.000 French troops face 135.000 Austrians lead by the skilled Archduke Charles. After a bloody stalemate a month and a half before at Aspern-Essling (also included in the box as an experimental scenario), Wagram is a huge battle, a clear but not decisive French victory. Another battle, at Znaim a few days later, will be needed to finally push the Austrians to sue for peace.
The game includes 17 scenarios, spread over historical small pieces of the huge battle, a few scenarios from the opening moves the night and day before, and several what-ifs scenarios. The game includes Austrians troops from Archduke Johann and Prince of Reuss that could have been there that day and would push the final Austrian army to 165.000 men.
Other scenarios cover well known episodes like MacDonald’s attack, Davout's maneuver, the Austrian move to cut the French army by taking the bridge on the Danube, and Masséna’s stout defense, among others.
History shows the advantage of an interior lines deployment, keeping a lot of reserves, and gambling on losing the left flank to prioritize the right wing and punch a hole in the center of the enemy army. The archduke, too extended and without a real reserve, will fight there his last campaign. Things could have turned differently!

Vive l'Empereur Series is a simulation of the battles fought during the Napoleonic Era in Europe, between 1805 and 1815. The scale is the regiment, a good compromise between the brigade level (with no formations) and the detailed battalions. The scale is 250 m/hex and a turn is 30 minutes.

name: Circles
description:
Circles is a new variation on classic board games. Get your pawns from START to HOME. Use the SHORTCUT TRACK. Go forward or backward. Move along the CIRCLES.
Roll the dice to move your pawns along a track. Go from the START space to the HOME space. The variation? One die moves pawns forward, and one moves pawns backward!

—description from the publisher

name: Gunfights & Gamblin': Second Edition
description:
The one that started it all! A gut-punch of a card game that pits two to six players in an epic team battle over a pioneer town.

The question is: are you feeling like a pioneer, or a renegade? Do you want to build the town, or burn it down?

It is a game drenched in theme--from keeping track of the game rounds by loading bullets into a revolver chamber, to the tongue-in-cheek descriptions on the cards.

Strategy and luck take equal roles as you out-shoot, out-gamble and outsmart the other team to victory!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fortune & Famine: Expansion
description:
3 Brand new characters!
Kingdom expansion boards bring a whole new side strategy to your favorite game!
5 Unique buildings to choose from!


—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Twirls of Action
description:
Twirls of Action is played on a 9x9 or 8x8 Go board.

The game has same starting set up as the Classic Lines of Action, and the end goal is almost the same as well.

A player wins when they connects all of their stones, where each stone does not have more than three adjacent (diagonal or orthogonal) friendly stones.

From The World of Abstract Games:

MOVE - Each stone move by a Twirl movement. This is done on the following steps:
Select an enemy stone as the Pivot (at a distance of N cells);
The Pivot must be on a straight line (diagonal or orthogonal) without any other stone in-between;
The stone can go another empty cell at the distance of N cells from the Pivot;
The origin and the destiny cell must be on a straight line (diagonal or orthogonal) without any other stone in-between;

name: Entre Linhas: Expansões "Mais Palavras" 1
description:
Four Brazilian food related words. This card is given separately as a promo inside other PaperGames's publications or in events.

The words are:

Paçoca
Feijoada
Farofa
Pão de Queijo

name: Entre Linhas: Expansões "Mais Palavras" 2
description:
Four Brazilian biome related words. This card is given separately as a promo inside other PaperGames's publications or in events.

The words are:

Amazönia
Pantanal
Cerrado
Caatinga

name: Entre Linhas: Expansões "Mais Palavras" 3
description:
Four board game related words. This card is given separately as a promo inside other PaperGames's publications or in events.

The words are:

Jogo de Tabuleiro (Board Game)
Jogo de Cartas (Card Game)
Essen
Gen Con

name: Entre Linhas: Expansões "Mais Palavras" 4
description:
Four Brazilian words that don't have a direct translation to most languages. This card is given separately as a promo inside other PaperGames's publications or in events.

The words are:

Cafuné (Gentle head scratches)
Saudade (The feeling of missing something or someone)
Vaquinha (Kind of a crowdfunding but very local)
Partiu! (Slang for "let's go")

name: オコノミ (Okonomiyaki)
description:
An action/dexterity game about flipping okonomiyaki! We offer two courses depending on the level of difficulty:

Simple rules for skillfully flipping okonomiyaki that everyone from the elderly to children can enjoy!
Enjoy the real-time nervous breakdown of collecting ingredients in a hurry and the exciting competition of skill to flip okonomiyaki!

name: Windows: Fairy of the Small Window
description:
Did you know that there are two worlds, the [Human World] and the [Fairy World]? In the past, the boundary between the two worlds was not clear, but as the [Human World] advanced, the connection between the worlds has become less.

However, the two worlds need to support each other, and the Fairies cannot survive if their existence is forgotten...

So, the Fairies created a doorway between the two worlds called "Small Window". You, as a fairy companion, must connect the "Small Window" and help the fairies!

—description from the rulebook

Aim for a high score by placing cards whose colors connect with the tableau piles. Your color remaining in the final field will be an additional point and a chance for a comeback. Optional rules allow you to experience a fresh game each time you play.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Line of Sight, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Republic of Texas
description:
Players represent Anglo-Texans, Mexicans, and Native Americans struggling to control and develop the untamed lands of Texas. They will seek wealth, power, and glory through claiming title over raw lands, cultivating a growing population, promoting commerce, and protecting their citizens.

Players deploy cards to build interlocking tableaus representing farms, ranches, and communities and can also play cards representing political leaders, spies, and military forces to dominated, subvert, or ravage their opponents' tableaus.

Players win by scoring points at game's end for cards in their tableau and having completed secret objectives they drew at the beginning of the game.
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Ownership, Take That

name: Hire Me
description:
Are you prepared to face the interview for the role of Wimpy Chicken Sniffer? How about Eccentric Hole Sharpener? In Hire Me!, you'll have to convince the other players of your suitability for a variety of quirky jobs. However, there's a catch - the other players don't know the exact job title!

To start the interview process, one player assumes the role of interviewee and must secretly generate a job title using a random selection of attributes. The other players must then use question cards in an attempt to figure out the interviewee's role!

Interviewers will score points if they manage to guess the job's attributes correctly. The interviewee will not score points if one of the job's attributes is unanimously guessed, and so it is important for the interviewee to hint enough that players will be able to figure out your full role, but not be so obvious that they will all get it completely correct.

—description from the designer

name: Spare Strike Steal
description:
Spare, Strike, Steal your way to victory. Frantically race to score the most points by making sets totalling 10 pins, or by brazenly stealing them from your opponents. At the end of each round, tot up the points. The first player to score a total of 160 points or more wins the game and claims the coveted TROPHY card.

A fast-paced family game for everyone. Easy to pick up, difficult to put down! This competitive, quick-play, family card game will keep the whole family entertained. It's great fun for any games night to break the ice and can be played with 2-6 players, aged 8 years and over. Average gameplay is around 15-20 minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Speed Matching, Take That

name: Bangarang
description:
Get ready for a wild ride of laughter, creativity, and teamwork with Bangarang, the fun family game that takes clue-giving to a whole new level! In this high-energy game, players join forces to help the guesser unravel the mystery word on the card using a variety of entertaining clues.

Bangarang features a dynamic twist on traditional clue-giving. Players must use their wits and creativity to communicate the secret word in five different ways: through a single word, a mime, a single sound, a drawing, or by crafting the letters with their bodies. It's a riot of diverse communication styles that keeps everyone on their toes and guarantees endless hours of fun.

Laugh-Out-Loud Moments
Prepare for uncontrollable laughter as the guesser deciphers the clues, leading to unexpected and amusing outcomes. Bangarang guarantees a lively atmosphere and joyous memories.

Family-Friendly Fun Game
Suitable for players of all ages, BANGARANG is designed with family fun in mind. It's the ideal choice for bringing generations together for a shared adventure in the world of words and creativity.

Enjoy Endless Replayability
With a wide range of words and countless ways to convey them, Bangarang ensures that no two games are ever the same. Keep the endless excitement going for game night after game night.

Give the noisiest player the GUESSER card – they will be the first to try and guess the words on the card. Shuffle the Bangarang cards and deal one to each of the other players.
Scan the QR code within the rules booklet to access a digital timer for the game. Place all the other components in the middle of the table, and you’re ready to play Bangarang.
Decide which side of the cards you are going to play, pink or blue, and then pick the top card and place it in the cardholder for all players, except the GUESSER, to be able to see it.

All together now! Start the timer, and the CLUE-GIVERS give a clue to the first word or phrase on the card simultaneously. You’ll have to fight to make yourself seen and heard!
The GUESSER can guess as many times as they like. Once guessed, move to the next word on the card (or shout NEXT if you can’t guess) and play continues until the timer sounds.
The team scores 1 point for each correctly guessed word. If all 5 words are guessed within the time limit – that’s BANGARILLIANT! Score 1 bonus point. Make a note of the score.
Play continues with the GUESSER passing their GUESSER card to the player on their left. All of the Bangarang cards are shuffled and re-dealt to the other players and the next round of mayhem begins.

Play 12 rounds and then tot up your score to see how well you play as a team. You can try to beat your team's score the next time you play Bangarang!

—description from the designer

name: Memorace: Wonderful Hungary
description:
The Memorace board game develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy in a fun way: now you can travel around Hungary and discover all its wonders.

Along with the challenges, the game develops logical thinking, memory and attention - all in an interactive and fun way.

Gameplay:


Draw a card and place it in front of you.
Turn the clock over and try to remember as many details as possible while the sand is spreading - this is about 10 seconds.
Roll the dice!
If you rolled a 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front page. Look at the picture and count or guess correctly!
If you did not roll a 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will test your memory, but if you pay attention, you will definitely know the answer!


Memorace can be played alone or with several players. During Memorace, you can learn easily and playfully. Sit down with the whole family or just try to learn as much as possible about the world, in this case, the human body. You will surely find information that you have not heard before!

name: Duck Float
description:
A very nice and beautiful board game by Keller Mayer, in which the players have the joint task of getting the mother duck and her 3 ducklings to the lake before the sun goes down.

On the fields of the game board we can see the same figures as on the sides of the dice. The players take turns rolling the dice and then discuss which duck to move on the board.
It is important that the mother duck should always be in front; one field cannot contain more than one duck; after each roll, you can move only one duck, by moving it to the nearest square to the one you rolled.

The last few fields of the board are no longer the usual ones. The mother must be the first to arrive at the first puddle visible on the lake, and she can be placed there with any throw other than the sunbather. Since the pond can be rotated and the ducklings must also arrive here, pushing the mama doll forward will reveal another small puddle where you can place the next duck.

In the event that a sun is thrown, the sun marker must be placed one space to the right on the vertically positioned rainbow board.
If we were lucky with our throws and stepped the ducks skillfully, all four of them could be swimming in the lake before the sunshine reached the end of the rainbow.

Cute cooperative game for little ones, which can be used to develop social skills and speaking skills.

name: My Photography Game
description: A match and create learning game about the secrets of taking photos. Collect four-of-akind by looking at the pictures and icons carefully and discovering the underlying visual elements that connect them. After matching all sets of four, take pictures applying the characteristics of each theme and you'll become a great photographer!

name: Het Spel van Vos en Haas
description:
The exciting party game where cooperation, good memory and tactics are key.
A bird has lost her egg. And rascal Jak is sneaking around in the forest! Help Fox and Hare and their friends to put the egg in the nest before Jak finds it. But hurry, because together you have to be faster than Jak!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Het spannende gezelschapsspel waar samenwerking, een goed geheugen en tactiek centraal staan.
Een vogel is haar ei kwijt. En boef Jak sluipt rond in het bos! Help Vos en Haas en hun vrienden om het ei in het nest te leggen voordat Jak het vindt. Maar schiet op, want jullie moeten samen sneller zijn dan Jak!

—description from the publisher

name: Harry Potter: Le Jeu Des Sortilèges
description:
Immerse yourself in the magical world of Harry Potter. Be the quickest to answer the questions and cast spells on your opponents to win the game! You're guaranteed to have a good laugh!

Replongez dans l'univers magique de Harry Potter. Soyez le plus rapide à répondre aux questions et jetez des sortilèges à vos adversaires pour gagner la partie! Attention, fous rires garantis!

name: CRYPTID: The Creepy Card Battling Game
description:
Conjure terrifying creatures from myth and legend to do battle! The first to kill 10 of the enemy's cryptids wins.

CRYPTID: The Creepy Card Battling Game is a unique card game with an exciting ruleset. Conjure monsters, evolve them into more powerful beasts, and plan carefully to get and stay ahead of your opponent. Positioning is extremely important, and each cryptid has different strengths and weaknesses depending on where you place it.

With the powerful Pyre Burn mechanic, any player can come back from a losing game! CRYPTID: The Creepy Card Battling Game is one of the most skill-based and strategic card games out there where any deck can win. No more single-turn matches and overly-meta deck builds. Customize your deck, learn the best strategies and timings, and win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction

name: Manic Minute: NSFW Edition
description:
This is the NSFW edition of Manic Minute. Players each receive a pen and paper and when the first player turns over a category, players must write down as many answers as they can in one Manic Minute. When the timer finishes, each player stops writing and one by one reads out their answers to the group.

Duplicate answers are worth zero points - so consider blocking your opponents by guessing what they might be writing down too! Players should justify their answers and arguing is the point of the game!

At the end of the round each player totals up their points and the person with the most points wins the round! Another player turns over a card and the next Manic Minute can begin!

This is the game where you can write what you really think – not suitable for children or for work or school! Dare you to write the most outrageous answer! Remember you still only have one manic minute to write your answers and block your opponent.

—description from the publisher

name: Scarlet Envelope X: Killer Wedding
description: In the nostalgic backdrop of 1980s Maine, the town's most coveted bachelor weds a picture-perfect orphan woman. Their wedding rehearsal is set along the breathtaking Atlantic coastline. Yet, the happily-ever-afters are cut short when the groom's lifeless body is discovered at the base of a cliff, with the toxicology results beyond anyone's darkest imagination...

name: Escape From The Jailhouse
description:
In the sleepy pioneer town of ghost creek, life tends to be pretty predictable. That is until you find yourself behind bars with the sheriff accusing you of murder! Being an upstanding, law -abiding citizen, you're shocked, even more so when you hear that you're destined for the gallows. You strike a deal with the sheriff - if you're able to find the identity of the real killer in under an hour, he'll let you walk free. Otherwise, it'll be time to meet your maker!
You'll need to solve each of the four puzzles to gain clues as to which one of ten outlaws is the real killer. Only by solving the puzzles correctly will you be able to pick the right person and walk out of that jailhouse a free man!
The clock is ticking!
Set contains: four puzzle envelopes, instructions, hints, solutions, & exit reveal

name: Oathen: Blitz
description:
A riveting card game for 2-6 players that combines the classic thrill of War with the strategic depth of Rock-Paper-Scissors, and introduces Blitz Cards - powerful abilities that turn the tides of battle, changing winning conditions, or giving players an edge over their opponents through attacks and counters.

In Oathen: Blitz, you'll take part in an epic battle between three powerful factions: the Norn, followers of the old Gods and the old ways; the Nivet, defenders of the many realms; and the Akhul, the orken clans of the Jotnar. These three armies are locked in a brutal war for Midgard.

Every round players flip over the top card of their War Deck, a randomly dealt collection of cards that feature one of the three factions and a unique strength value. Victory is determined by which factions are present in the battle (Norn beats Nivet, Nivet beats Akhul, and Akhul beats Norn.) If all three factions are present in the battle, the winners are determined by which faction has the highest combined strength of their combatants.

However, war is never so simple..

At any time during the game, players can choose to play one of their Blitz Cards – an arsenal of instant play abilities that change the conditions of battle; such as switching the faction of your war card to be among the victors, annihilating an opponent's card to remove them from battle, or directly attacking and destroying cards from another player's War Deck - these Blitz Cards add a layer of unpredictability and strategic play through player chosen actions.

As the war wages on, cards are permanently removed from the game, escalating the intensity. Players must battle with dwindling forces, maneuvering through the ever-increasing stakes until only one player emerges victorious.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Tug of War

name: Timur-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach the youth hostel on the hill wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the youth magazine "ABC-Zeitung" No. 12/1977.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Telefunken-Sender-Spiel
description:
One person is appointed as the game leader. He divides the tokens evenly among the other players. He also gets the map of Europe and the scale. The station that most players vote for is used as the starting point for guessing the distance. The game leader asks each player about the distance between the starting point and another transmitter. For the sake of simplicity, guessing is rounded up to the full 50 kilometers according to the scale. If you guess incorrectly, you have to pay the game master 50 tokens by how many 50 kilometers he misjudged. However, if the distance is guessed correctly, the person concerned receives 100 tokens from the game master.
The winner is the person who has the most tokens left at the end. By changing the output station when guessing, there are countless possibilities for the game.

The game was published as a promotional giveaway.

—user summary
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Don't Get Got: Camping Expansion
description:
As the name suggests, it is for you to play while you are camping. Of course, players are allowed to add more tasks to the game to play it everywhere.
In order to make your camping more fun, 124 new tasks have been carefully designed to trick your friends! A bag is also included to make it easier for you to take the game to the campsite.

name: Parlor Polo
description:
A 19th century indoor game designed to simulate the sport of Polo. It was described, with rules, in "The Young Folks' Cyclopædia of Games and Sports" (John D Champlin & Arthur E Bostwick), published in 1890 by Henry Holt & Co of New York [hence the US spelling. 'Parlor']. Played on a 15×19 grid of squares, which are shaded alternately like a draughts / checkers board, play taking place only on the shaded squares.
The game has some resemblance to more modern games such as Bladder and Phutball, and is one of several 'Parlor' simulations from the same source, the others being Base Ball, Croquet, Quoits, [Horse] Race, and Ten Pins. Players may move any of their six men on the board, with the aim of securing and advancing a thirteenth piece, representing the ball, into the opponent's goal, but the distance that can be moved is determined by the throw of dice.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: BattleTech: Star League Command Lance
description:
Unleash the Star League Command Lance! Includes the Atlas II and Thunder Hawk, a new variant of the Phoenix Hawk, and a reposed and pre-painted Orion—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Second Star League Assault Lance
description:
Includes the Emperor, Argus and Helios, a new variant of the Dashi, Prometheus, reposed and pre-painted, along with a bonus Coolant Truck—no assembly required—along with eight MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Twycross Battlemat
description: This mat centers on the world of Twycross, site of a major engagement between the Federated Commonwealth and Clan Jade Falcon during the initial Clan Invasion and one of the Inner Sphere’s first victories.

name: BattleTech: Misery & Thunder Rift Battlemat
description: This mat showcases battlefields from some of the earliest BattleTech fiction, including Thunder Rift from the first Gray Death Legion novel, Decision at Thunder Rift; the reverse offers the frigid wasteland of Misery, site of the titanic clash between the Wolf’s Dragoons and the Ryuken in Wolves on the Border.

name: BattleTech: City/Lunar BFM Battlemat
description: Expand your battlefield with the newest BFM, measuring a titanic 48 inches (121 cm) by 72 inches (182 cm)! This mat challenges players with the combined maps from Map Pack: City on one side, and the Lunar landscape on the reverse.

name: BattleTech: Force Manual Davion
description: Force Manual: Davion details the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns, examining the combat commands of the Federated Suns and their histories, tactics, unit crests, paint schemes, and notable personnel. This sourcebook includes special rules for unique character abilities, faction-specific rules, force building options, and a mini-Technical Readout–everything you need to field your favorite Federated Suns unit on the tabletop, or create your own.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide vol 2 – Ilclan
description: Recognition Guide, Vol. 2: ilClan collects some of these brand-new Inner Sphere and Clan BattleMechs and vehicles, bristling with the latest technology to push the envelope on modern battlefields. This volume is the companion to Recognition Guide, Vol. 1: Classics, and contains material originally published in the bestselling PDF-only BattleTech Recognition Guide: ilClan series.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Force Manual Kuritia
description: Force Manual: Kurita details the armed forces of the Draconis Combine, examining the combat commands of the Draconis Combine and their histories, tactics, unit crests, paint schemes, and notable personnel. This sourcebook includes special rules for unique character abilities, faction-specific rules, force building options, and a mini-Technical Readout–everything you need to field your favorite Draconis Combine unit on the tabletop, or create your own.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Third Star League Striker Star
description: Unleash the Third Star League Striker Star! Includes the Jackalope, Kintaro, Hammerhead, Havoc, and a pre-painted Lament, along with a bonus J-27 Ordinance Truck—no assembly required—along with ten MechWarrior pilot cards and six Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: McCarron's Armored Cavalry Assault Lance
description: The McCarron’s Armored Cavalry Assault Lance! Included is the new Tian-Zong, a re-posed Black Knight, and new variants of the Awesome and jumping Starslayer—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Hot Spots – Hinterlands
description:
Enter the Hinterlands with this comprehensive campaign guide to some of the hottest combat zones in the ilClan era! A spiritual successor to the classic Hot Spots duology, this sourcebook offers all the rules and contracts any unit needs for their ongoing BattleTech games.

Whether defending Sudeten from a Hell’s Horses onslaught, standing with Calamity Kell’s Arc Royal Liberty Coalition, providing some forceful incentives to the Alyina Mercantile League’s latest deal, or securing the Tamar Pact’s place in the Inner Sphere, the opportunities for enterprising commanders are endless!

This sourcebook includes complete campaign rules built out of the BattleTech: Mercenaries boxed set, as well as contract and game hooks for battles with–and against–every major Hinterlands faction.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: ilKhan's Eyes Only
description: ilKhan’s Eyes Only is a BattleTech sourcebook detailing the events on Terra, around the former Fortress Republic, and the coreward regions of the Capellan Confederation from 3151 to mid-3152. Included are a full historical summary of events in those regions of space, personality and unit profiles of key players–many appearing here for the first time–and game information along with a glossy campaign map to bring it all to your BattleTech tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Third Star League Battle Star
description:
The Third Star League Battle Star! Includes the Wendigo, Excalibur, Peacekeeper, Malice, and a pre-painted Savage Wolf, along with a bonus Savior Repair Vehicle—no assembly required—along with ten MechWarrior pilot cards and six Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Hipster: The Revenge
description:
The Hippest of the Hip

Strategy is the name of the game as you compete to be the coolest in town in the game of Hipster. Collect your gear and play against others in your quest to be the hipper of all.

But watch out, because once things become too cool they’re no longer cool. Can you be faster, can you be cooler, can you be Hipster?

The Revenge is a full, stand-alone expansion for Hipster adding in new cards and new ways to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Dead Wasteland
description:
It's everyone for themselves in Dead Wasteland, the tense, taut, and thoroughly entertaining card game.

Civilization has fallen and the dead have risen. Zombies roam the wastes of our once great cities. The remnants of humanity fend for themselves, scavenging what they can to survive - food, water, and a flashlight - while avoiding the horde.

Along the way, equip yourself with what you need, while dodding the dead. The zombies will constantly chase after you and once one zombie appears, they'll swarm, more and more. Escaping alive will take all the supplies and skills you have.

Avoid the dead, shoot to kill, and play to win. Get the action-packed, thrilling, lively zombie card game and see if you have what it takes to survive the Dead Wasteland.

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: What if…?: Choose the life of your dreams
description:
Life is a beautiful adventure with so many scenarios, and in “What if…?”, you can get a taste of some of them to see which ones will make your character the happiest!
“What if…? Choose the life of your dreams” is a board game life simulator where your character can experience various lifestyles, like being an adventurer, entrepreneur, or careerist. Players will move around the board by choosing one of the numbers rolled on the dice—this way, they’ll be able to plan their moves—and perform life-changing actions. Your characters can find love, get a promotion or demotion, adopt a pet, and even buy a place to call home. You may earn or lose money, but after all, to win the game, your character must be the happiest—the goal is to be the first to reach 50 Happiness points.
This colorful and fascinating board game is a perfect choice for kids and families!

name: Unfair Expansion: Fairytale Legendary Steampunk Underground
description:
Build the city's greatest theme park, whatever it takes, with more themes now available for your park in the Unfair Expansion: Fairytale Legendary Steampunk Underground. These new themes can be mixed with old favorites and with each other:


Fairytale: Try your luck as you encounter beanstalks, dragons, talking animals, and more - but be careful what you wish for!
Legendary: Bring fame and fortune to your park by building rides as iconic as the legendary figures of ancient mythology.
Steampunk: An alternate future springing from a glorious past where steam power and mechanical automation continue to flourish.
Underground: Go on a journey to the center of the earth! Dig a big hole. Find exotic treasures buried in unexpected places!


You can also tailor the game to suit your preferred play style with new game changer cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The 50 States: A Trivia Game
description:
The ultimate all-American trivia game: Screen-free family fun with easy-to-learn gameplay for 2–8 players.

Put your knowledge to the test: Explore the key stats that make up every state of the USA, from Alabama to Wyoming, and learn more as you play.

Will speedy reactions beat expert knowledge? Be first to collect 5 cards to win! ​Explore every state of the USA from Alabama to Wyoming in this fast and fun trivia game that celebrates the geography of America.

With this exciting extension of the best-selling 50 States book series, you’ll go deeper into the key stats behind all 50 states. From palm trees and oranges in the Sunshine State, through the Heart of Dixie, past the Great Lakes, and all the way to Alaska’s last frontier, it’s time to explore! So pack your bags and say later ’gator… the great States await!
Is Vermont bigger than Hawaii? Which is the oldest state? Are the mountains taller in Alaska or California? Speedy guessing is rewarded in this fast-moving family game, so fire right in and learn as you play!

Players race to slap their hands on the card they think best fits the chosen category, such as ‘largest population’, for example. When all players have slapped, reveal the cards to discover the correct answer. The winning player keeps their card and chooses the next category. First to grab five correct cards wins!

—description from the publisher

name: DCeased: Dark Nights Metal Crossover Set
description:
Dark Knights Metal is a comics event that tells the story of an invasion of Earth 0 by monstrous counterparts of Batman from the Dark Multiverse. With this Crossover Set, players will be able to have these alternate versions of Batman join in the DCeased Anti-Life crisis.

All of the characters, except for the “Robins”, have ID cards to be played as Super Heroes. These vicious versions of Batman are very powerful, each bringing a unique set of skills to fight the Anti-Life zombies.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Battle Freaks: The Card Game
description:
Battle Freaks: The Card Game is a solo expandable card game. In Battle Freaks, you will assemble your crew of genetically enhanced creatures, send them into a harsh graffiti-soaked city and aim to become the undisputed rulers of the streets by defeating formidable enemies.

You begin the game by building a deck of your favourite fighters and gear through deck construction.

During the game, you will play fighters from your hand, sending them into the city, represented by location cards. You can then utilize the fighters to maneuver between locations and defeat enemies through powerful card abilities.

The player wins the game when the boss is defeated!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Hegemony: Lead Your Class to Victory – Controlling the Narrative promo
description:
A promo card delivered by supporting The Dice Tower 2024.


Controlling the Narrative
Propose a Bill and call for an Immediate Vote without spending Influence. You may spend Influence to affect the outcome, after everyone else has done so.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Voting, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: 避けられない災害 (Inevitable Disasters)
description:
In this must-follow trick-taking game with a bidding system, players know the color of the cards in your opponents' hands by the color of the back of the cards, but the "0" and the "9" have neutral backs, so you know where the weakest and the strongest cards are, but you don't know which is which. Outsmart your oponents by bidding the correct amount of disasters that will affect the world!

—description from the publisher

name: Life in Common Land
description:
This is a card game where you will have to try to preserve the different flora and fauna species in the Serra do Xistral.
It is a balancing game where different species have different advantages and disadvantages in the environment that closely match reality.

name: Earthborne Rangers: Moments on the Path
description:
Moments on the Path adds new cards to the path deck in the form of ephemeral moments, narrative choices, and attachments.

The cards in this expansion capture fleeting moments in time--moments like catching the scent of flowers on the breeze, hearing a tree fall somewhere in the distance, or encountering a predator with unique characteristics--adding texture to the emergent narrative.

Contains 30 unique cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Move Through Deck, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up
